English: Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the River Chebar, that the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm pêng-jĭt, năr pơđăm khei puăn, kơplah inh oei hơdai hăm lu bơnă tơ krong Kêbar, lu plĕnh tơpơih păng inh lăng đei tơdrong tơ'bôh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: On the fifth day of the month, which was in the fifth year of King Jehoiachin’s captivity
Bahnar: Năr pơđăm khei noh lăm sơnăm mă pơđăm, đơ̆ng năr pơtao Jêhôiachin đe rôp.

English: the word of the LORD came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the River Chebar; and the hand of the LORD was upon him there.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan tơ'bôh kơ Êsêkiên, kon drŏ-nglo 'bok soi Busi, kơplah sư oei lăm char Kalđê jih đak krong Kêbar; tơ noh Kră Yang dan ti kơpal sư.

English: Then I looked, and behold, a whirlwind was coming out of the north, a great cloud with raging fire engulfing itself; and brightness was all around it and radiating out of its midst like the color of amber, out of the midst of the fire.
Bahnar: Inh lăng 'bôh kial hơbŭt lĕch đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m, đei hơmơ̆l tih dêh đei ŭnh hơdah jum dăr, păng tŏk-bŏk sư, inh 'bôh nhen thoi đei bơsei rang hơdah lăm ŭnh.

English: Also from within it came the likeness of four living creatures. And this was their appearance: they had the likeness of a man.
Bahnar: Păng tŏk-bŏk ŭnh 'bôh puăn tŏ kon sem arih, hơbŏ rup thoi kon bơngai.

English: Each one had four faces, and each one had four wings.
Bahnar: Rim kơ lu sư đei puăn tŏ muh măt păng puăn tŏ pơnăr.

English: Their legs were straight, and the soles of their feet were like the soles of calves’ feet. They sparkled like the color of burnished bronze.
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng lu sư tơpăt, tơpang jơ̆ng thoi kơchôp kon rơmo, hơdah 'brŭng thoi kong rang rơgoh.

English: The hands of a man were under their wings on their four sides; and each of the four had faces and wings.
Bahnar: Ala kơ pơnăr, puăn pah đei ti bơngai, rim tŏ kon sem đei puăn tŏ muh măt păng puăn tŏ pơnăr.

English: Their wings touched one another. The creatures did not turn when they went, but each one went straight forward.
Bahnar: Pơnăr lu sư tơ'bưh dih băl. Rim kơ lu sư năm tơpăt anăp kiơ̆ kơ muh măt, akâu ưh kơ weh-woh.

English: As for the likeness of their faces, each had the face of a man; each of the four had the face of a lion on the right side, each of the four had the face of an ox on the left side, and each of the four had the face of an eagle.
Bahnar: Muh măt lu sư thoi âu: Rim kơ lăm puăn tŏ noh đei muh măt thoi kon bơngai, rim lăm puăn tŏ noh đei muh măt dăm-brang gah 'ma; rim lăm puăn tŏ noh đei muh măt rơmo gah 'ngiĕo; păng rim lăm puăn tŏ noh đei muh măt sem klang.

English: Thus were their faces. Their wings stretched upward; two wings of each one touched one another, and two covered their bodies.
Bahnar: Muh măt lu sư thoi noh. Pơnăr tưk kơjung rim lu sư đei 'bar 'bar hlak pơnăr lu sư bơyar tơ'bưh băl păng 'bar hlak pơnăr to pĕng akâu.

English: And each one went straight forward; they went wherever the spirit wanted to go, and they did not turn when they went.
Bahnar: Rim kơ lu sem arih năm tơpăt tơ anăp kiơ̆ kơ Yang Bơhngol năm, mưh wă năm ưh kơ weh-woh ôh.

English: As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire, like the appearance of torches going back and forth among the living creatures. The fire was bright, and out of the fire went lightning.
Bahnar: Akâu lu kon sem arih noh nhen thoi ngar ŭnh khơ̆ng thoi hơchô̆ 'long ŭnh khơ̆ng năm rŏng anăp tŏk-bŏk lu kon sem arih noh; ŭnh hơdah păng đei kơmlat đơ̆ng ŭnh lĕch hơdah

English: And the living creatures ran back and forth, in appearance like a flash of lightning.
Bahnar: Lu kon sem arih noh năm wơ̆t wih rŏng anăp thoi kơmlat.

English: Now as I looked at the living creatures, behold, a wheel was on the earth beside each living creature with its four faces.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh lăng lu kon sem arih noh, inh 'bôh đei tang-wang gre tơ teh cheng lu kon sem arih, tang-wang gre noh 'bơ̆t cheng rim kơ kon sem arih puăn tŏ muh măt.

English: The appearance of the wheels and their workings was like the color of beryl, and all four had the same likeness. The appearance of their workings was, as it were, a wheel in the middle of a wheel.
Bahnar: Rup păng hơbŏ lu tang-wang gre nhen thoi tơmo rang; đĭ-đăng puăn tŏ tang-wang gre lei-lăi, rup păng hơbŏ thoi minh pôm tang-wang gre oei tơ lăm minh tang-wang gre nai.

English: When they moved, they went toward any one of four directions; they did not turn aside when they went.
Bahnar: Mưh lu sư năm, puăn pah lu tang-wang dăr năm minh trong tơpăt noh ưh kơ weh tơ 'ma, tơ 'ngiĕo.

English: As for their rims, they were so high they were awesome; and their rims were full of eyes, all around the four of them.
Bahnar: Gơwang tang-wang gre kơjung krưp tơpă; păng puăn tŏ gơwang tang-wang gre đei 'bĕnh kơ măt tăp dăr.

English: When the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them; and when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon sem arih noh năm, lu tang-wang gre kư̆m năm hơdai 'bơ̆t cheng. Na mưh lu kon sem arih hiŏng tŏk tơ kơpal lu tang-wang kư̆m hơdai hiŏng tŏk kiơ̆ thoi noh.

English: Wherever the spirit wanted to go, they went, because there the spirit went; and the wheels were lifted together with them, for the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
Bahnar: Yang bơhngol wă năm tơ yơ, lu kon sem arih kư̆m năm tơ noh; păng lu tang-wang gre kư̆m hiŏng đơ̆ng teh năm kiơ̆ cheng, yua kơ yang bơhngol lu kon sem arih noh oei lăm tang-wang gre.

English: When those went, these went; when those stood, these stood; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up together with them, for the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
Bahnar: Lu kon sem arih năm, lu tang-wang gre kư̆m năm; lu kon sem arih dơ̆ng lu tang-wang gre kư̆m dơ̆ng păng lu kon sem arih hiŏng kơpal kơ teh lu tang-wang gre hiŏng hơdai, yua kơ yang bơhngol lu kon sem arih oei lăm tang-wang gre.

English: The likeness of the firmament above the heads of the living creatures was like the color of an awesome crystal, stretched out over their heads.
Bahnar: Kơpal kơ kơ̆l lu kon sem arih, 'bôh đei gơwang tơ rơwơ̆ng nhen thoi getchai rang krưp, 'bĕnh ‘bang kơpal kơ kơ̆l lu sư.

English: And under the firmament their wings spread out straight, one toward another. Each one had two which covered one side, and each one had two which covered the other side of the body.
Bahnar: Ala kơ gơwang noh, pơnăr lu sư bơyar tơpăt, lu pơnăr âu tơklă tơ pơnăr to, lu kon sem arih đei 'bar hlak pơnăr pĕng akâu gah âu păng gah to.

English: When they went, I heard the noise of their wings, like the noise of many waters, like the voice of the Almighty, a tumult like the noise of an army; and when they stood still, they let down their wings.
Bahnar: Mưh lu kon sem arih wă năm, inh kơtơ̆ng pơnăr lu sư re thoi jơwa đak chơkơi, thoi nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh; re ơ-ôs thoi lu linh lơ yak, Mưh pơdơh, lu sư tơjruh pơnăr.

English: A voice came from above the firmament that was over their heads; whenever they stood, they let down their wings.
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r pơma lĕch đơ̆ng kơpal gơwang tơ rơwơ̆ng kơpal kơ̆l lu kon sem arih. Mưh lu sư dơ̆ng pơnăr lu sư tơjruh.

English: And above the firmament over their heads was the likeness of a throne, in appearance like a sapphire stone; on the likeness of the throne was a likeness with the appearance of a man high above it.
Bahnar: Kơpal gơwang tơ rơwơ̆ng kơpal kơ̆l lu kon sem arih đei rup kiơ noh nhen thoi tang-dŏ pơtao pơm păng tơmo rang; kơpal tang-dŏ noh đei rup hơbŏ thoi bơngai.

English: Also from the appearance of His waist and upward I saw, as it were, the color of amber with the appearance of fire all around within it; and from the appearance of His waist and downward I saw, as it were, the appearance of fire with brightness all around.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh đơ̆ng kơiĕng sư tơ kơpal hơdah thoi mam kong hlơ-hlŏng thoi ŭnh tăp dăr păng đơ̆ng kơiĕng tơ ala, inh 'bôh thoi ŭnh hơdah rang jum dăr kơ Sư.

English: Like the appearance of a rainbow in a cloud on a rainy day, so was the appearance of the brightness all around it. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the LORD. So when I saw it, I fell on my face, and I heard a voice of One speaking.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh hơdah rang tăp dăr thoi plĕnh chro tơ hơmơ̆l wă 'mi. Tơdrong noh thoi 'lơ̆ng rŏ rang mơnhal Kră Yang. Lăp inh 'bôh inh kŭp muh măt tơ teh păng kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r minh 'nu pơma khan.

English: And He said to me, “Son of man, stand on your feet, and I will speak to you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, dơ̆ng bĕ 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng ih, Inh gô khan kơ ih.

English: Then the Spirit entered me when He spoke to me, and set me on my feet; and I heard Him who spoke to me.
Bahnar: Lăp Sư pơma hăm inh, Yang Bơhngol mơ̆t lăm inh tơiung inh dơ̆ng hăm jơ̆ng inh, inh kơtơ̆ng Sư khan kơ inh.”

English: And He said to me: “Son of man, I am sending you to the children of Israel, to a rebellious nation that has rebelled against Me; they and their fathers have transgressed against Me to this very day.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Ơ kon bơngai Inh wơh ih năm tơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael, truh tơ kon pơlei mă ayăt kơ Inh; lu sư păng lu yă 'bok lu sư pơm yoch ayăt hăm Inh mă truh dang ei

English: For they are impudent and stubborn children. I am sending you to them, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD.’
Bahnar: noh adrĕch adrung kơchu păng arăng kơ̆l, Inh wơh ih năm tơ lu sư, khan kơ lu sư: ‘Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu:’

English: As for them, whether they hear or whether they refuse—for they are a rebellious house—yet they will know that a prophet has been among them.
Bahnar: Mă lu sư mơ̆ng dah ưh, yua kơ lu sư adrĕch adrung ayăt kơ Inh, lu sư kư̆m gô băt, lăm lu sư đei boih 'bok khan lê̆ adrol.

English: “And you, son of man, do not be afraid of them nor be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns are with you and you dwell among scorpions; do not be afraid of their words or dismayed by their looks, though they are a rebellious house.
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, 'nĕ kơ hli kơ lu sư păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hli nơ̆r lu sư pơma; 'nĕ kơ hli mă khan lu sư thoi jơla suĕng tăp dăr kơ ih păng mă ih oei tŏk-bŏk lu sư thoi hơguăt. 'Nĕ hli kơ nơ̆r lu sư pơma, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hli tơrơ kơ muh măt krưp lu sư yua kơ lu sư adrĕch adrung ayăt.

English: You shall speak My words to them, whether they hear or whether they refuse, for they are rebellious.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan nơ̆r Inh âu kơ lu sư, mă lu sư mơ̆ng dah ưh, yua kơ lu sư jing adrĕch adrung ayăt.

English: But you, son of man, hear what I say to you. Do not be rebellious like that rebellious house; open your mouth and eat what I give you.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei ih, ơ kon bơngai, mơ̆ng bĕ Inh khan kơ ih; 'nĕ kơ ayăt thoi lu adrĕch adrung noh, ha bĕ 'bơ̆r ih păng sa tơdrong kiơ mă Inh ăn kơ ih.”

English: Now when I looked, there was a hand stretched out to me; and behold, a scroll of a book was in it.
Bahnar: Na inh lăng, inh 'bôh ti chro truh tơ inh; lăm ti đei minh sơnôm hla bơar.

English: Then He spread it before me; and there was writing on the inside and on the outside, and written on it were lamentations and mourning and woe.
Bahnar: Sơnôm hla bơar noh bơlang 'bơ̆t anăp inh, đei chih, lăm păng đaih, noh đei chih lu tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon păng tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: Moreover He said to me, “Son of man, eat what you find; eat this scroll, and go, speak to the house of Israel.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, sa bĕ tơmam mă ih 'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp; sa bĕ sơnôm hla bơar âu păng năm, khan kơ adrĕch Isơrael.”

English: So I opened my mouth, and He caused me to eat that scroll.
Bahnar: Na inh ha 'bơ̆r, Sư ăn kơ inh sa sơnôm hla bơar noh.

English: And He said to me, “Son of man, feed your belly, and fill your stomach with this scroll that I give you.” So I ate, and it was in my mouth like honey in sweetness.
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, iŏk sa bĕ sơnôm hla bơar Inh ăn kơ ih sa mă phĭ 'bĕnh kơ klak.” Thoi noh inh sa, 'băt 'ngam thoi đak sut lăm 'bơ̆r inh.

English: Then He said to me: “Son of man, go to the house of Israel and speak with My words to them.
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, năm bĕ tơ adrĕch Isơrael, năm roi nơ̆r Inh kơ lu sư.

English: For you are not sent to a people of unfamiliar speech and of hard language, but to the house of Israel
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ Inh wơh ih năm tơ kon pơlei tơmoi mă pơma nơ̆r anat kơ hlôh ôh, mă-lei năm tơ adrĕch Isơrael.

English: not to many people of unfamiliar speech and of hard language, whose words you cannot understand. Surely, had I sent you to them, they would have listened to you.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ Inh wơh ih năm tơ lu kon pơlei tơmoi wă pơma nơ̆r anat kơ hlôh, nơ̆r pơma lu sư noh ih ưh kơ hlôh ôh, tơpă tơdah Inh wơh ih truh tơ lu sư, lu sư gô mơ̆ng ih.

English: But the house of Israel will not listen to you, because they will not listen to Me; for all the house of Israel are impudent and hard-hearted.
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung Isơrael ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ih, yua kơ lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Inh. Đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung Isơrael ưh kơ chu, lu sư arăng kơ̆l.

English: Behold, I have made your face strong against their faces, and your forehead strong against their foreheads.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ măt ih arăng kơ̆l thoi măt lu sư păng klĕng ih arăng thoi klĕng lu sư.

English: Like adamant stone, harder than flint, I have made your forehead; do not be afraid of them, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ kơ̆l ih arăng thoi jơmŏng, arăng hloh kơ tơmo. 'Nĕ hli kơ lu sư păng 'nĕ tơrơ, yua kơ 'bơ̆t anăp măt lu sư yua kơ lu sư jing adrĕch adrung ayăt kơ Inh.”

English: Moreover He said to me: “Son of man, receive into your heart all My words that I speak to you, and hear with your ears.
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, mơ̆ng bĕ mă nhen, iŏk bĕ lăm jơhngơ̆m dôm nơ̆r Inh pơma khan kơ ih.

English: And go, get to the captives, to the children of your people, and speak to them and tell them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD,’ whether they hear, or whether they refuse.”
Bahnar: Năm bĕ tơ lu bơngai mă đe puh boih lăm lu kon pơlei ih pơm bơnă, khan kơ lu sư 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan, mă lu sư mơ̆ng dah ưh.”

English: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a great thunderous voice: “Blessed is the glory of the LORD from His place!”
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol hơtŏk inh tơ kơpal păng inh kơtơ̆ng re jơwa tih tơ rŏng inh. Kơkuh bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang lăm anih Sư oei.

English: I also heard the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels beside them, and a great thunderous noise.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m kơtơ̆ng re đơ̆ng pơnăr lu kon sem arih tơtuh hơtŭt băl păng re jơwa lu tang-wang gre rơ̆m răm 'bơ̆t cheng lu sư.

English: So the Spirit lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol hơtŏk inh tơ kơpal păng anhăk inh năm, inh năm hăm jơhngơ̆m chhŭr nuih blĕk dêh tơpang ti Kră Yang kơtĭt kơpal inh trăp dêh.

English: Then I came to the captives at Tel Abib, who dwelt by the River Chebar; and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.
Bahnar: Inh năm truh tơ anih lu bơngai đe pơpuh oei tơ pơlei Têlabip, jê̆ tơ đak krong Kêbar inh dơ̆ng lăm anih lu sư oei păng inh oei hơdai lu sư tơpơh năr hăm jơhngơ̆m sơ'ngon hơwơ̆l hơwang.

English: Now it came to pass at the end of seven days that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Hlôi kơ tơpơh năr đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; therefore hear a word from My mouth, and give them warning from Me
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, Inh ăn kơ ih jing bơngai wei-lăng lu adrĕch Isơrael; mưh ih kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh khan, ih athei năm roi tơbăt kơ lu sư nơ̆r mă Inh pơkă kơ lu sư athei kơchăng.

English: When I say to the wicked, ‘You shall surely die,’ and you give him no warning, nor speak to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life, that same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood I will require at your hand.
Bahnar: Layơ mă Inh khan kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆! ‘Sĭt ih gô lôch,’ mă-lei ih ưh kơ khan tơbăt kơ sư păng ưh kơ pơma khă sư athei hŭt lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ wă kơ sư gơh arih, bơngai pơm kơnê̆ noh gô lôch lăm tơdrong yoch sư. Mă-lei Inh gô tơpŭ pham sư lăm tơpang ti ih.

English: Yet, if you warn the wicked, and he does not turn from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but you have delivered your soul.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah ih khă tơbăt boih kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ noh, dah lu sư ưh kơ hŭt lê̆ trong pơm kơnê̆ kơdih, lu sư gô lôch lăm tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih, mă-lei ih gô klaih huay pă pŭ.

English: “Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, and I lay a stumbling block before him, he shall die; because you did not give him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he has done shall not be remembered; but his blood I will require at your hand.
Bahnar: Tơpă, dah minh 'nu bơngai tơpăt lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt sư na pơm yoch, Inh gô ăn đei tơdrong pơgăn 'bơ̆t anăp sư păng sư gô lôch yua kơ pơm yoch, mă-lei yua kơ ih ưh kơ khan khă bơngai noh, thoi noh sư gô lôch lăm tơdrong yoch sư, Inh ưh pă 'blŏk dôm tơdrong tơpăt mă sư đei pơm, mă-lei pham sư oei jô̆ lăm ti ih.

English: Nevertheless if you warn the righteous man that the righteous should not sin, and he does not sin, he shall surely live because he took warning; also you will have delivered your soul.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah ih đei khan tơbăt kơ bơngai tơpăt bơih, 'nĕ pă pơm yoch, sư ưh pă pơm yoch, na gô arih, yua kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ih khă, lei ih gơh klaih huay kơ jô̆.”

English: Then the hand of the LORD was upon me there, and He said to me, “Arise, go out into the plain, and there I shall talk with you.”
Bahnar: Tơ noh ti Kră Yang dan kơpal inh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Iung bĕ năm tơ teh thŭng dơnă Inh gô khan kơ ih tơ noh.”

English: So I arose and went out into the plain, and behold, the glory of the LORD stood there, like the glory which I saw by the River Chebar; and I fell on my face.
Bahnar: Na inh iung năm tơ teh thŭng dơnă; tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang oei tơ noh thoi ư-ang rang mơnhal mă inh đei 'bôh tơ đak krong Kêbar, păng inh kŭp muh măt tơ teh.

English: Then the Spirit entered me and set me on my feet, and spoke with me and said to me: “Go, shut yourself inside your house.
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol mơ̆t lăm inh tơiung inh dơ̆ng kơtă 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng inh, Kră Yang pơma hăm inh păng khan: “Năm mơ̆t lăm hnam, chĭt ih kơdih.

English: And you, O son of man, surely they will put ropes on you and bind you with them, so that you cannot go out among them.
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, âu, đe gô chô̆ ih hăm tơlei păng ih ưh pă gơh năm tơ lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: I will make your tongue cling to the roof of your mouth, so that you shall be mute and not be one to rebuke them, for they are a rebellious house.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ hơpiĕt ih klep tơ păk-'ngơk, ih gô kơmlo, ưh kơ gơh chrih kơ lu sư; lu sư jing bơngai ayăt.

English: But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD.’ He who hears, let him hear; and he who refuses, let him refuse; for they are a rebellious house.
Bahnar: Mă-lei mưh Inh khan kơ ih, Inh pơih 'bơ̆r ih păng Ih gô khan kơ lu sư, Kră Yang tih hloh khan thoi âu: Bu mơ̆ng athei mơ̆ng bĕ, bu sơngah kuă kơ mơ̆ng, lê̆ sư sơngah yua kơ lu sư adrĕch adrung ayăt plơ̆.

English: “You also, son of man, take a clay tablet and lay it before you, and portray on it a city, Jerusalem.
Bahnar: “Na ơ kon bơngai, iŏk minh hlak gŏch, dan gŏch noh 'bơ̆t anăp ih păng chhơ̆ rup pơlei Jêrusalem kơpal gŏch noh.

English: Lay siege against it, build a siege wall against it, and heap up a mound against it; set camps against it also, and place battering rams against it all around.
Bahnar: Ih wang tăp pơlei noh; man pơdơ̆ng dur, pơm kơđông linh, blah pơlei noh păng dan tơroi tŭl dur jum dăr pơlei wă pơrăm sư.

English: Moreover take for yourself an iron plate, and set it as an iron wall between you and the city. Set your face against it, and it shall be besieged, and you shall lay siege against it. This will be a sign to the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk minh hlak gŏ bơsei, pơdơ̆ng pơm thoi dur bơsei sơlam ih păng pơlei; na ih tơwih muh măt gah pơlei noh ih pơm thoi đe oei wang tăp kơ pơlei noh. Noh tơdrong tơdra kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: “Lie also on your left side, and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it. According to the number of the days that you lie on it, you shall bear their iniquity.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, ih athei 'bĭch cheng gah 'ngiĕo păng Inh gô dan tơdrong yoch bơngai Isơrael tơ kơpal ih. Ih 'bĭch thoi noh hơdôm năr, pŭ chĕp tơdrong yoch lu sư kư̆m dang noh.

English: For I have laid on you the years of their iniquity, according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days; so you shall bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Inh đei hơgăt kơ ih kơsô̆ năr dang ăi hăm kơsô̆ sơnăm tơdrong yoch lu sư, jing pêng-hrĕng tơsĭn-jĭt năr, ih gô pŭ tơdrong yoch bơngai Isơrael.

English: And when you have completed them, lie again on your right side; then you shall bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days. I have laid on you a day for each year.
Bahnar: Mưh lăm năr noh đĭ hlôi boih ih 'bĭch cheng gah 'ma păng pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch bơngai Juđa, lăm puăn-jĭt năr, Inh hơgăt kơ ih minh năr thoi lăm minh sơnăm.

English: “Therefore you shall set your face toward the siege of Jerusalem; your arm shall be uncovered, and you shall prophesy against it.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh ih athei oei tơwih muh măt ih tơ gah tơdrong wang pơlei Jêrusalem; păng sơk ti hoh hăm nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol wă blah plơ̆ sư.

English: And surely I will restrain you so that you cannot turn from one side to another till you have ended the days of your siege.
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk tơlei chô̆ ih, wă kơ ih ưh kơ gơh pơdăr gah to, gah âu, truh tơ đĭ năr ih wang pơlei.

English: “Also take for yourself wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt; put them into one vessel, and make bread of them for yourself. During the number of days that you lie on your side, three hundred and ninety days, you shall eat it.
Bahnar: Iŏk 'ba mi, 'ba tơ'bâu, tơh, tơh dreng, trơwơ păng 'ba mi kiĕng, tah lê̆ lăm ge, hrâu pơm 'bĕng ih sa 'bĭch cheng hơdôm năr, ih gô sa 'bĕng noh hơdôm năr, ih gô sa 'bĕng noh lăm pêng-hrĕng tơsĭn-jĭt năr.

English: And your food which you eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day; from time to time you shall eat it.
Bahnar: Tơmam ih wă sa rim năr 'bar-jĭt sekơl,a ih sa kiơ̆ kơ jơ hơgăt rim năr.

English: You shall also drink water by measure, one-sixth of a hin; from time to time you shall drink.
Bahnar: Đak nhă ih kư̆m gô kŏng, minh lăm tơdrâu hin,b ih nhă kiơ̆ kơ jơ đei hơgăt rim năr.

English: And you shall eat it as barley cakes; and bake it using fuel of human waste in their sight.”
Bahnar: Ih gô sa 'bĕng 'ba tơ'bâu 'buh hơbĭ hăm ĭch bơngai 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei.”

English: Then the LORD said, “So shall the children of Israel eat their defiled bread among the Gentiles, where I will drive them.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lei-lăi thoi noh adrĕch adrung Isơrael gô sa 'bĕng kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach tơ lăm teh đak mă Inh pơpuh lu sư tơ noh.”

English: So I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! Indeed I have never defiled myself from my youth till now; I have never eaten what died of itself or was torn by beasts, nor has abominable flesh ever come into my mouth.”
Bahnar: Na inh khan: “Ơ! Kră Yang Tih Hloh; inh ưh kơ layơ pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơdih akâu đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p mă truh dang ei, inh kư̆m ưh kơ layơ sa tơmam lôch kơmăp dah đơ̆ng sem bri châu; păng ưh kơ đei 'nhĕm 'mê̆-'mach ayơ mă đei tah sa lăm 'bơ̆r inh.”

English: Then He said to me, “See, I am giving you cow dung instead of human waste, and you shall prepare your bread over it.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Inh ăn kơ ih iŏk ĭch rơmo tơplih kơ ĭch bơngai wă 'buh 'bĕng.”

English: Moreover He said to me, “Son of man, surely I will cut off the supply of bread in Jerusalem; they shall eat bread by weight and with anxiety, and shall drink water by measure and with dread
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh dơ̆ng: “Ơ kon bơngai, Inh gô pơhrŏ tơjur lê̆ 'bĕng sa lăm Jêrusalem, lu sư gô sa 'bĕng kiơ̆ kơ kŏng hơgăt lê̆ păng gô sa hăm tơdrong hli, lu sư gô nhă đak kư̆m hơgăt lê̆ păng nhă hăm tơdrong hli krê.

English: that they may lack bread and water, and be dismayed with one another, and waste away because of their iniquity.
Bahnar: Thoi noh đak nhă păng 'bĕng sa khăi ưh kơmah, lu sư tơlăng băl hli tơrơ păng lôch hiong yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm.”

English: “And you, son of man, take a sharp sword, take it as a barber’s razor, and pass it over your head and your beard; then take scales to weigh and divide the hair.
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, iŏk bĕ đao han, yua sư pơm săng hơkôih, hơkôih bĕ sŏk kơ̆l păng sŏk kang ih, iŏk 'long kŏng, na kŏng klah asong sŏk ih.

English: You shall burn with fire one-third in the midst of the city, when the days of the siege are finished; then you shall take one-third and strike around it with the sword, and one-third you shall scatter in the wind: I will draw out a sword after them.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă wang pơlei đĭ boih, ih soh minh lăm pêng sŏk noh lăm pơlei tih noh. Ih iŏk minh lăm pêng chơ̆ng hăm đao tơ tăp dăr kơ pơlei păng minh lăm pêng oei oei noh ih săi tơ kial yua kơ Inh gô iŏk đao gưm druh lu sư đơ̆ng rŏng.

English: You shall also take a small number of them and bind them in the edge of your garment.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m iŏk minh 'bar ioi đơ̆ng sŏk noh chô̆ sư 'bơ̆t ao ih.

English: Then take some of them again and throw them into the midst of the fire, and burn them in the fire. From there a fire will go out into all the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sŏk chô̆ 'bơ̆t ao ih noh, ih iŏk lu sŏk mơ'nah đơ̆ng lăm sŏk noh na soh lăm ŭnh. Na ŭnh gô sa pla khơ̆ng truh tơ đĭ dêh char Isơrael.

English: “Thus says the Lord GOD: ‘This is Jerusalem; I have set her in the midst of the nations and the countries all around her.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Âu pơlei Jêrusalem, Inh dan sư tŏk-bŏk lu dêh char păng lu teh đak jum dăr kơ sư.

English: She has rebelled against My judgments by doing wickedness more than the nations, and against My statutes more than the countries that are all around her; for they have refused My judgments, and they have not walked in My statutes.’
Bahnar: Isơrael ưh kơ chu blah plơ̆ khôi juăt păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă pơm kơnê̆ hloh kơ lu bơngai nai păng lu dêh char jum dăr kơ sư. Sư sơngah kơ khôi juăt Inh păng ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă.”

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Because you have multiplied disobedience more than the nations that are all around you, have not walked in My statutes nor kept My judgments, nor even done according to the judgments of the nations that are all around you’
Bahnar: Lei na, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Ih pơm kơnê̆ hloh kơ lu dêh char jum dăr kơ ih, ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă, ưh kơ wei khôi juăt Inh. Ih kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt lu dêh char jum dăr kơ ih

English: therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Indeed I, even I, am against you and will execute judgments in your midst in the sight of the nations.
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Âu, Inh kơdih akâu Inh blah ih păng Inh gô phak ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu dêh char.

English: And I will do among you what I have never done, and the like of which I will never do again, because of all your abominations.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp ih, na Inh gô pơm kơ ih minh tơdrong mă Inh ưh tam mă pơm đơ̆ng sơ̆ păng ning-mônh Inh ưh pă pơm dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore fathers shall eat their sons in your midst, and sons shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments among you, and all of you who remain I will scatter to all the winds.
Bahnar: Na lăm ih mĕ 'bă gô 'buh sa kon lu sư păng lu kon sư gô 'buh sa mĕ 'bă lu sư. Inh gô sek tơlang ih păng lu bơngai mă oei oei, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh.

English: ‘Therefore, as I live,’ says the Lord GOD, ‘surely, because you have defiled My sanctuary with all your detestable things and with all your abominations, therefore I will also diminish you; My eye will not spare, nor will I have any pity.
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Tơpă thoi Inh oei arih, yua kơ ih pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lăm anih rơgoh Inh hăm pơm kơnê̆ krưp, mă Inh areh dêh. Thoi noh na Inh pơrăm ih, măt Inh ưh kơ wă lăng păng ưh pă mơnat.

English: One-third of you shall die of the pestilence, and be consumed with famine in your midst; and one-third shall fall by the sword all around you; and I will scatter another third to all the winds, and I will draw out a sword after them.
Bahnar: Minh lăm pêng lăm lu khŭl ih gô lôch hơbuh păng gô lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt minh lăm pêng gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao hơlă tăp dăr kơ ih; mă minh lăm pêng dơ̆ng Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh păng Inh gô toh đao druh 'moi lu sư.

English: ‘Thus shall My anger be spent, and I will cause My fury to rest upon them, and I will be avenged; and they shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken it in My zeal, when I have spent My fury upon them.
Bahnar: Inh gô tuh tơdrong Inh hil păng Inh gô hil mĭl truh kơ lu sư, na tơdrong blĕk Inh hrăp; păng kơplah Inh pơm keh tơdrong hil kơ lu sư, lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, hlôi khan kơ lu sư Inh gar. Lăm tơdrong inh hil mĭl kơ lu sư.

English: Moreover I will make you a waste and a reproach among the nations that are all around you, in the sight of all who pass by.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ ih pơchah pơchek păng đe che bơle lăm teh đak jum dăr păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai chă yak brih găn.

English: ‘So it shall be a reproach, a taunt, a lesson, and an astonishment to the nations that are all around you, when I execute judgments among you in anger and in fury and in furious rebukes. I, the LORD, have spoken.
Bahnar: Ih gô jing tơmam đe pơjăm, đe che bơle hiĕk ăr, pơm kơ lu dêh char jum dăr kơ ih hli tơrơ, mưh Inh đei hil mĭl. Păng phak bơtho trăp tơpă. Inh boih Kră Yang mă đei khan thoi noh!

English: When I send against them the terrible arrows of famine which shall be for destruction, which I will send to destroy you, I will increase the famine upon you and cut off your supply of bread.
Bahnar: Layơ Inh prah 'brơ̆m tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt păng tơdrong lôch rŭng, wă prah pơrăm lu bơngai mă trŏ kơ pơlôch; Inh prah wă pơrăm ih, Inh gô pơthim tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt kơ ih păng gô pơrăm lê̆ trong tơmam sa ih.

English: So I will send against you famine and wild beasts, and they will bereave you. Pestilence and blood shall pass through you, and I will bring the sword against you. I, the LORD, have spoken.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt păng ăn sem bri wă pơrăm lu kon hơ'lơ̆p ih jing pă đei tơdrong lôch hơbuh păng tơdrong tơblah truh tơ pham gô ro truh tơ ih, Inh gô iŏk đao gưm pơrăm ih. Inh boih Kră Yang mă đei khan thoi noh!”

English: Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu

English: “Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, athei tơwih muh măt ih tơklă tơ lu kông Isơrael păng khan lê̆ adrol blah plơ̆ lu sư

English: and say, ‘O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus says the Lord GOD to the mountains, to the hills, to the ravines, and to the valleys: “Indeed I, even I, will bring a sword against you, and I will destroy your high places.
Bahnar: Păng khan: Ơ lu kông Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan kơ lu kông, lu groi, lu thong păng lu thŭng dơnă: Âu, Inh gô iŏk đao hơlă blah lu iĕm păng Inh gô pơrăm anih kơjung lu iĕm.

English: Then your altars shall be desolate, your incense altars shall be broken, and I will cast down your slain men before your idols.
Bahnar: Gô pơrăm đĭ lu chơnang soi iĕm, rup yang măt 'năr lu iĕm gô teh pơchah, Inh gô klơ̆m hŭt lu bơngai mă lôch, 'bơ̆t anăp lu rup yang mă iĕm kơkuh.

English: And I will lay the corpses of the children of Israel before their idols, and I will scatter your bones all around your altars.
Bahnar: Inh gô dan akâu lu bơngai lôch kon pơlei Isơrael 'bơ̆t anăp rup yang lu sư păng săi kơting lu sư jum dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: In all your dwelling places the cities shall be laid waste, and the high places shall be desolate, so that your altars may be laid waste and made desolate, your idols may be broken and made to cease, your incense altars may be cut down, and your works may be abolished.
Bahnar: Mă anih ayơ lu iĕm oei, mă pơlei lu iĕm oei kư̆m gô pơrăm, lu anih kơjung lu iĕm juăt kơkuh gô păk. Chơnang soi kư̆m gô pơrăm pă đei, rup yang lu iĕm kư̆m teh pơchah ưh pă đei, gơ̆ng lu iĕm kơkuh kơ rup yang măt 'năr pơchah hơlih, dôm tơdrong jang lu iĕm pơm gô răm đĭ.

English: The slain shall fall in your midst, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch lăm lu iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch păng lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang!

English: “Yet I will leave a remnant, so that you may have some who escape the sword among the nations, when you are scattered through the countries.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, kơplah lu iĕm tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ teh đak, Inh oei đei ăn mơ'nah oei arih, klaih đơ̆ng đao hơlă lu teh đak blah iĕm.

English: Then those of you who escape will remember Me among the nations where they are carried captive, because I was crushed by their adulterous heart which has departed from Me, and by their eyes which play the harlot after their idols; they will loathe themselves for the evils which they committed in all their abominations.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lăm lu sư mă đei klaih noh oei tơ lăm teh đak mă lu sư oei, đe rôp pơm bơnă. Lu sư 'blŏk kơ jơhngơ̆m Inh đei pơchah, chhŭr nuih bơih, yua kơ tơdrong lu sư, pơm kư̆ kă weh đơ̆ng Inh păng măt lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă kiơ̆ kơ lu yang kơnê̆. Kơplah noh lu sư kơdih gô lăng krưp areh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆, yua kơ tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư đei pơm krưp tơpă.

English: And they shall know that I am the LORD; I have not said in vain that I would bring this calamity upon them.”
Bahnar: Lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang păng nơ̆r Inh pơma ưh kơ đei hiong đĕch ôh, tơdrong mă Inh pơm truh kơ lu sư 'nâu.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Pound your fists and stamp your feet, and say, ‘Alas, for all the evil abominations of the house of Israel! For they shall fall by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: Athei tap ti kơtrơ̆m jơ̆ng păng krao ôr! Ơu kah! Gah dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp adrĕch adrung Isơrael, lu sư gô lôch kơ đao hơlă pơngot rơwĕt păng jĭ lôch hơbuh.

English: He who is far off shall die by the pestilence, he who is near shall fall by the sword, and he who remains and is besieged shall die by the famine. Thus will I spend My fury upon them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei ataih gô lôch kơ jĭ hơbuh. Lu bơngai oei jê̆ gô pơ̆k răm kơ đao, lu bơngai oei arih, gô lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt Thoi noh Inh gô ăn truh tơdrong Inh hil mĭl kơ lu sư.

English: Then you shall know that I am the LORD, when their slain are among their idols all around their altars, on every high hill, on all the mountaintops, under every green tree, and under every thick oak, wherever they offered sweet incense to all their idols.
Bahnar: Đĭ lu iĕm gô băt, Inh boih Kră Yang, kơplah lu bơngai lăm lu iĕm lôch tơ'bĭch 'bơ̆t hơdai rup yang lu iĕm, jum dăr kơ chơnang soi, tơ kơpal kông groi, kơpal kơ̆l kông, ala hơmŭl 'long hơdrih păng lăm rơ̆m 'long kôih, jơ̆p kơ anih mă lu sư pơyơ̆r pơgang 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anih kơkuh kơ lu rup yang lu sư.

English: So I will stretch out My hand against them and make the land desolate, yes, more desolate than the wilderness toward Diblah, in all their dwelling places. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.’ ” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô yơ̆r ti Inh wă blah lu sư; Inh gô pơm kơ teh đak, anih lu sư oei gô jing juơ; Inh gô pơrăm đơ̆ng char glă truh tơ pơlei Dibla. Thoi noh na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “And you, son of man, thus says the Lord GOD to the land of Israel: ‘An end! The end has come upon the four corners of the land.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan kơ dêh char Isơrael: 'Nâu tơdrong tôch truh bơih! Tơdrong răm truh boih tơ puăn pah mum kơ dêh char.

English: Now the end has come upon you, And I will send My anger against you; I will judge you according to your ways, And I will repay you for all your abominations.
Bahnar: Dang ei tơdrong ih truh bơih. Inh gô tuh tơdrong Inh hil tơ ih, Inh gô sek tơlang phak ih kiơ̆ kơ trong ih yak, hăm Inh gô pơm tơwih kơ ih kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă ih đei pơm.

English: My eye will not spare you, Nor will I have pity; But I will repay your ways, And your abominations will be in your midst; Then you shall know that I am the LORD!’
Bahnar: Măt Inh ưh pă lăng 'mêm mơnat kơ ih păng ưh pă đei dŏng ih; Inh gô phak ih tơpă yua kơ lu tơdrong ih yak kiơ̆ păng tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lăm ih. Na ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “Thus says the Lord GOD: ‘A disaster, a singular disaster; Behold, it has come!
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Tơdrong truh 'nâu, đei dơ̆ng tơdrong truh nai âu sư truh boih.

English: An end has come, The end has come; It has dawned for you; Behold, it has come!
Bahnar: Tơdrong răm tuch-luch truh boih, tơdrong răm truh tuch-luch truh boih, tơdrong truh kơ ih boih.

English: Doom has come to you, you who dwell in the land; The time has come, A day of trouble is near, And not of rejoicing in the mountains.
Bahnar: Ơ lu kon pơlei oei lăm dêh char âu, tơdrong răm tih truh kơ lu iĕm boih, truh jơ 'năr boih, wă jê̆ năr boih noh năr hli tơrơ, ưh kơ trŏ năr chơt hiôk tơ kơpal kông.

English: Now upon you I will soon pour out My fury, And spend My anger upon you; I will judge you according to your ways, And I will repay you for all your abominations.
Bahnar: Âu Inh wă tuh tơdrong Inh hil tơ ih păng wă pơhrăp tơdrong Inh hil blĕk kơ ih, Inh gô sek tơlang phak ih kiơ̆ kơ trong ih yak păng gô pơm tơwih kơ ih kiơ̆ kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă ih đei pơm.

English: ‘My eye will not spare, Nor will I have pity; I will repay you according to your ways, And your abominations will be in your midst. Then you shall know that I am the LORD who strikes.
Bahnar: Măt Inh ưh pă lăng mơnat kơ ih, Inh kư̆m ưh pă dŏng ih, Inh gô phak kiơ̆ kơ trong ih yak kiơ̆ păng tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lăm ih. Na ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă đei phak ih.

English: ‘Behold, the day! Behold, it has come! Doom has gone out; The rod has blossomed, Pride has budded.
Bahnar: Âu, năr 'nâu! Sư truh boih. Tơdrong răm truh kơ ih boih, tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ rai krưp thoi 'long bluh pơkao, tơdrong pơang rai tih thoi 'long bluh tơmơ̆ng.

English: Violence has risen up into a rod of wickedness; None of them shall remain, None of their multitude, None of them; Nor shall there be wailing for them.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ rai dêh jing tơdrong kơnê̆ lơ hloh; lăm lu sư pă đei bu oei đei, mŭk tơmam pă đei, tơdrong mơdrŏng lu sư kư̆m pă đei, lăm lu sư ưh pă đei bu đe pơyom.

English: The time has come, The day draws near. ‘Let not the buyer rejoice, Nor the seller mourn, For wrath is on their whole multitude.
Bahnar: Jơ trŏ boih, 'năr truh boih! Bơngai răt 'nĕ kơ chơt hiôk, bơngai tĕch kư̆m 'nĕ kơ ơh sơ'ngon, yua kơ tơdrong truh kơ đĭ-đăng.

English: For the seller shall not return to what has been sold, Though he may still be alive; For the vision concerns the whole multitude, And it shall not turn back; No one will strengthen himself Who lives in iniquity.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tĕch ưh pă đei wơ̆t huai iŏk dơ̆ng tơmam mă hlôi tĕch; kơplah bre sư oei arih ră, yua kơ tơdrong truh đei tơ'bôh tơ bơngai tơpôl ưh pă gơh pơdrâu dơ̆ng. Yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih; Ưh kơ đei bu gơh bơwei tơdrong arih kơdih.

English: ‘They have blown the trumpet and made everyone ready, But no one goes to battle; For My wrath is on all their multitude.
Bahnar: Mă lu sư hlôm keng boih păng tôm tơdrong hơmet lê̆ bơih, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu lĕch năm tơblah yua kơ tơdrong Inh hil tuh tơ kơpal đĭ-đăng lu sư bơih.

English: The sword is outside, And the pestilence and famine within. Whoever is in the field Will die by the sword; And whoever is in the city, Famine and pestilence will devour him.
Bahnar: Tơ 'nguaih đei đao hơlă, tơ lăm đei lôch hơbuh păng pơngot rơwĕt. Lu bơngai oei tơ 'nguaih chŭn gô lôch kơ đao hơlă, lu bơngai oei tơ lăm pơlei, gô lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt păng lôch kơ jĭ hơbuh đĭ.

English: ‘Those who survive will escape and be on the mountains Like doves of the valleys, All of them mourning, Each for his iniquity.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai ayơ klaih oei arih gô oei tơ kơpal kông nhơ̆m hmoi thoi sem kơtơp lăm pŭng-lŭng, đĭ-đăng lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơdih.

English: Every hand will be feeble, And every knee will be as weak as water.
Bahnar: Rim tơpang ti gô rơdu ưh pă jăng, dôm lu kŭl-tăng rơdu rơmuăn thoi đak.

English: They will also be girded with sackcloth; Horror will cover them; Shame will be on every face, Baldness on all their heads.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô hrŭk ao 'bi păng đei tơdrong hli krưp gom lu sư thoi ao. Rim kơ muh măt lu sư hơ'nhŭk oei mơlâu. Lu sư hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch đĭ yua kơ sơ'ngon.

English: ‘They will throw their silver into the streets, And their gold will be like refuse; Their silver and their gold will not be able to deliver them In the day of the wrath of the LORD; They will not satisfy their souls, Nor fill their stomachs, Because it became their stumbling block of iniquity.
Bahnar: Lu sư hŭt lê̆ hu tơ trong, maih lu sư jing thoi tơmam kơnê̆. Maih, hu ưh kơ gơh pơklaih lu sư kơplah năr Kră Yang hil. Kŭm ưh kơ đei pơm kơ lu sư huay kơ pơngot, kư̆m ưh kơ pơm kơ lu sư phĭ klak, tơmam noh pơm kơ lu sư pơ̆k lăm tơdrong yoch.

English: ‘As for the beauty of his ornaments, He set it in majesty; But they made from it The images of their abominations— Their detestable things; Therefore I have made it Like refuse to them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu tơmam drŏ-kăn pơguăng 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă lu sư pơang kơdih; lu sư yua tơmam noh pơm rup yang kơkuh kơnê̆ krưp. Lei na Inh gô pơm kơ tơmam noh jing tơmam 'mê̆-'mach kơ lu sư!

English: I will give it as plunder Into the hands of strangers, And to the wicked of the earth as spoil; And they shall defile it.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjao tơmam noh kơ bơngai tơmoi, thoi tơmam tơtông tơgar ăn kơ lu bơngai ala teh âu thoi tơmam iŏk đơ̆ng tơblah jei; lu sư gô pơm 'mê̆-'mach.

English: I will turn My face from them, And they will defile My secret place; For robbers shall enter it and defile it.
Bahnar: Inh gô weh ataih muh măt Inh đơ̆ng lu sư, lu sư gô pơm kơnê̆ anih gĭt kăl Inh; lu bơngai tơtông gô mơ̆t tơ noh pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach dêh.

English: ‘Make a chain, For the land is filled with crimes of blood, And the city is full of violence.
Bahnar: Hơmet lê̆ glang yua kơ lăm teh đak âu 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong pơm yoch kơnê̆ 'bet pơlôch băl păng lăm pơlei âu 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong pơrăm băl.

English: Therefore I will bring the worst of the Gentiles, And they will possess their houses; I will cause the pomp of the strong to cease, And their holy places shall be defiled.
Bahnar: Inh gô anhăk ba lu bơngai đơ̆ng dêh tơmoi pơm kơnê̆ tih hloh năm blah iŏk hnam lu sư; Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong pơang lu bơngai kră păng pơm kơ anih rơgoh lu sư jing 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Destruction comes; They will seek peace, but there shall be none.
Bahnar: Mưh tơdrong pơmat-tat hli krưp truh; lu sư chă tơdrong hiôk-hian, mă-lei ưh kơ đei.

English: Disaster will come upon disaster, And rumor will be upon rumor. Then they will seek a vision from a prophet; But the law will perish from the priest, And counsel from the elders.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gleh răm âu truh kư̆m đei dơ̆ng tơdrong gleh răm nai truh; kơtơ̆ng ang đei tơdrong âu kư̆m đei kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong nai hai dơ̆ng. Lu sư chă tơdrong tơ'bôh đơ̆ng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol; tơdrong bơtho tơ'bôh khôi juăt đơ̆ng 'bok soi hăm đơ̆ng lu kră tă kơ hiong tôch đĭ bơih.

English: ‘The king will mourn, The prince will be clothed with desolation, And the hands of the common people will tremble. I will do to them according to their way, And according to what they deserve I will judge them; Then they shall know that I am the LORD!’ ”
Bahnar: Pơtao gô nhơ̆m hmoi. Lu kon pơtao gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong răm, pă hơmĕng tơpang ti lu kon pơlei pơla gô hli tơtey. Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư kiơ̆ kơ trong lu sư, oei arih sa thoi yơ Inh gô sek tơlang thoi noh. Lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.”

English: And it came to pass in the sixth year, in the sixth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I sat in my house with the elders of Judah sitting before me, that the hand of the Lord GOD fell upon me there.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm tăl mă tơdrâu, năr pơđăm khei tơdrâu, kơplah inh oei hơ-oei lăm hnam, lu kră pơlei Juđa, oei 'bơ̆t anăp inh, tơpang ti Kră Yang tih hloh tơ'bôh kơ inh.

English: Then I looked, and there was a likeness, like the appearance of fire—from the appearance of His waist and downward, fire; and from His waist and upward, like the appearance of brightness, like the color of amber.
Bahnar: Inh lăng 'bôh nhen hơbŏ thoi bơngai, đơ̆ng kơiĕng tơ ala thoi ŭnh, păng đơ̆ng kơiĕng tơ kơpal hơdah rang mơnhal thoi kong đe pơiel.

English: He stretched out the form of a hand, and took me by a lock of my hair; and the Spirit lifted me up between earth and heaven, and brought me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the door of the north gate of the inner court, where the seat of the image of jealousy was, which provokes to jealousy.
Bahnar: Sư yơ̆r kiơ noh thoi tơpang ti, rôp sŏk tơ kơpal kơ̆l inh. Yang Bơhngol pôk hơtŏk inh tŏk-bŏk teh hăm plĕnh, păng lăm tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bôh sư ba inh mơ̆t tơ pơlei Jêrusalem tơ trong 'măng jang gah yă-nơ̆m kơ cham gah lăm, anih mă đe dan rup yang areh wă khan rup yang mă pơm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei areh.

English: And behold, the glory of the God of Israel was there, like the vision that I saw in the plain.
Bahnar: Păng inh 'bôh tơdrong rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tơ noh thoi inh đei 'bôh tơ anih thŭng dơnă.

English: Then He said to me, “Son of man, lift your eyes now toward the north.” So I lifted my eyes toward the north, and there, north of the altar gate, was this image of jealousy in the entrance.
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, ngơk măt lăng tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.” Na inh ngơk măt lăng tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, to tơ gah yă-nơ̆m 'măng jang chơnang soi đei rup yang areh 'bơ̆t trong mơ̆t.

English: Furthermore He said to me, “Son of man, do you see what they are doing, the great abominations that the house of Israel commits here, to make Me go far away from My sanctuary? Now turn again, you will see greater abominations.”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ inh dơ̆ng: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih hăm 'bôh dôm tơdrong lu sư oei pơm, lu tơdrong krưp kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach tih dêh mă adrĕch Isơrael pơm wă puh Inh ataih đơ̆ng anih rơgoh Inh? Tơpă ih gô 'bôh lơ tơdrong krưp kơnê̆ tih hloh dơ̆ng.”

English: So He brought me to the door of the court; and when I looked, there was a hole in the wall.
Bahnar: Na Sư ba inh tơ 'măng mơ̆t tơ cham, inh lăng 'bôh đei minh bơlôh tơ dur.

English: Then He said to me, “Son of man, dig into the wall”; and when I dug into the wall, there was a door.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, bŏk dur đei bơlôh noh bĕ.” Inh bŏk dur noh na 'bôh minh pôm 'măng mơ̆t tơ noh.

English: And He said to me, “Go in, and see the wicked abominations which they are doing there.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Mơ̆t lăng bĕ lu tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă lu sư đei pơm tơ âu.”

English: So I went in and saw, and there—every sort of creeping thing, abominable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, portrayed all around on the walls.
Bahnar: Na inh mơ̆t lăng 'bôh tơ noh đei tôm kơ rup man kon sem krưp, kơep lep-ler, dôm rup yang man đơ̆ng adrĕch Isơrael đei chhơ̆ jum dăr kơ tơnăr dur.

English: And there stood before them seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel, and in their midst stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan. Each man had a censer in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense went up.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp rup inh 'bôh thoi đei tơpơh-jĭt 'nu kră pơlei adrĕch Isơrael oei dơ̆ng hơdai hăm Jaasania kon drŏ-nglo Saphan. Rim 'nu lu sư chĕp get pơgang 'bâu phu 'nhui pơgang 'bâu phu đông jơ̆p-jang.

English: Then He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen what the elders of the house of Israel do in the dark, every man in the room of his idols? For they say, ‘The LORD does not see us, the LORD has forsaken the land.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih hăm 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ lu kră pơlei adrĕch Isơrael pơm lăm măng mu ưh, rim 'nu lu sư lăm anih rup yang sư kơdih? Lu sư đei khan: ‘Kră Yang ưh kơ 'bôh lu bơ̆n ôh; Kră Yang achăng lê̆ boih teh đak âu.’ ”

English: And He said to me, “Turn again, and you will see greater abominations that they are doing.”
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng: “Ih gô 'bôh tơdrong krưp tih hloh phara kơ noh dơ̆ng mă lu sư oei pơm.”

English: So He brought me to the door of the north gate of the LORD’s house; and to my dismay, women were sitting there weeping for Tammuz.
Bahnar: Na Sư chông ba inh mơ̆t tơ hnam Kră Yang, rok 'măng jang gah yă-nơ̆m; tơ noh Inh 'bôh lu drŏ-kăn nhơ̆m hmoi kơ Tamus.

English: Then He said to me, “Have you seen this, O son of man? Turn again, you will see greater abominations than these.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, hăm 'bôh ưh? Ih gô 'bôh tơdrong krưp tih hloh kơ tơdrong 'nâu dơ̆ng”

English: So He brought me into the inner court of the LORD’s house; and there, at the door of the temple of the LORD, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty-five men with their backs toward the temple of the LORD and their faces toward the east, and they were worshiping the sun toward the east.
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang Sư ba inh mơ̆t tơ cham hnam Kră Yang; păng tơ noh trong mơ̆t tơ hnam kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, tŏk-bŏk kơdeng 'măng păng chơnang soi, inh 'bôh đei dang 'bar-jĭt pơđăm 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, rŏng tơwih kơ hnam Kră Yang păng muh măt lu sư tơwih gah hơlĕch, drap kơkuh kơ măt 'năr đơ̆ng hơlĕch.

English: And He said to me, “Have you seen this, O son of man? Is it a trivial thing to the house of Judah to commit the abominations which they commit here? For they have filled the land with violence; then they have returned to provoke Me to anger. Indeed they put the branch to their nose.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih hăm 'bôh ưh? Noh adrĕch Juđa oei đei pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ krưp, hăm trŏ tơdrong iĕ dah liơ? Lu sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bĕnh lăm teh đak âu, păng tơblĕk Inh ling-lang dơ̆ng. Âu, lăng bĕ lu sư tah 'long lăm trôm muh wă tơblĕk Inh!

English: Therefore I also will act in fury. My eye will not spare nor will I have pity; and though they cry in My ears with a loud voice, I will not hear them.”
Bahnar: Na Inh kư̆m gô blĕk areh dêh; măt Inh pă lăng mơnat kơ lu sư boih, mă lu sư krao ôr 'bĕnh kơ đon Inh, Inh kư̆m ưh pă mơ̆ng lu sư.”

English: Then He called out in my hearing with a loud voice, saying, “Let those who have charge over the city draw near, each with a deadly weapon in his hand.”
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng Kră Yang krao re 'bơ̆t đon inh khan kơ đe: “Năm jê̆ tơ âu bĕ lu iĕm mă wei-lăng pơlei, rim 'nu athei chĕp đao hơlă wă pơrăm đe.”

English: And suddenly six men came from the direction of the upper gate, which faces north, each with his battle-ax in his hand. One man among them was clothed with linen and had a writer’s inkhorn at his side. They went in and stood beside the bronze altar.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh đei tơdrâu 'nu năm đơ̆ng gah 'măng kơpal tơ gah yă-nơ̆m. Rim 'nu ti chĕp 'long tơnôn. Lăm lu sư đei minh 'nu bơngai hrŭk ao che 'bui se kok, bĕng ba kơdŭng 'long chih đak mơ̆k. Lu sư mơ̆t păng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng chơnang soi kong.

English: Now the glory of the God of Israel had gone up from the cherub, where it had been, to the threshold of the temple. And He called to the man clothed with linen, who had the writer’s inkhorn at his side
Bahnar: Na tơdrong rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tŏk đơ̆ng chêrubim, đơ̆ng anih Sư oei, năm truh 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam akŭm. Na Kră Yang krao bơngai hrŭk ao che 'bui mă bĕng kơdŭng 'long chih đak mơ̆k

English: and the LORD said to him, “Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who sigh and cry over all the abominations that are done within it.”
Bahnar: na khan kơ sư: “Năm bĕ tơ jơ̆p lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, chih 'bơ̆t klĕng rim 'nu bơngai bu nhơ̆m hmoi kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ krưp mă đei pơm boih lăm pơlei.”

English: To the others He said in my hearing, “Go after him through the city and kill; do not let your eye spare, nor have any pity.
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng Kră Yang khan kơ lu bơngai nai: “Athei năm kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng bơngai noh, năm pơlôch jơ̆p pơlei, iĕm 'nĕ lăng mơnat.

English: Utterly slay old and young men, maidens and little children and women; but do not come near anyone on whom is the mark; and begin at My sanctuary.” So they began with the elders who were before the temple.
Bahnar: Athei pơlôch đĭ lu kră, lu hơmuh hơmŏng, lu hơdruh, lu hơ'lơ̆p, lu drŏ-kăn, mă-lei 'nĕ kơ pơlôch lu bơngai bu mă đei chih 'bơ̆t klĕng sư. Năm iŏk đơ̆ng Anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh.” Thoi noh lu sư pơtơm pơlôch iŏk đơ̆ng lu kră đơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp hnam akŭm.

English: Then He said to them, “Defile the temple, and fill the courts with the slain. Go out!” And they went out and killed in the city.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ lu sư: “Pơm bĕ kơ hnam akŭm jing 'mê̆-'mach. Tuh tơ cham hnam akŭm 'bĕnh kơ bơngai lôch. Năm bĕ!” Na lu sư lĕch năm pơlôch đe lăm pơlei.

English: So it was, that while they were killing them, I was left alone; and I fell on my face and cried out, and said, “Ah, Lord GOD! Will You destroy all the remnant of Israel in pouring out Your fury on Jerusalem?”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư năm pơlôch đe, inh oei minh 'nu. Inh bon muh măt tơ teh ôr krao: “Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Ih hil mĭl kơ pơlei Jêrusalem, Ih wă pơlôch đĭ lu kon pơlei Isơrael hă?”

English: Then He said to me, “The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceedingly great, and the land is full of bloodshed, and the city full of perversity; for they say, ‘The LORD has forsaken the land, and the LORD does not see!’
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơl inh: “Tơdrong yoch lăm adrĕch Isơrael păng Juđa tih dêh tơpă; teh 'bĕnh kơ pham pơlôch băl, lăm pơlei 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ pơrăm băl. Lu sư khan: ‘Kră Yang achăng lê̆ boih teh âu, Kră Yang ưh kơ 'bôh.’

English: And as for Me also, My eye will neither spare, nor will I have pity, but I will recompense their deeds on their own head.”
Bahnar: Gah Inh, măt Inh lăng kư̆m pă mơnat păng Inh kư̆m pă đei lê̆ lu sư oei arih; Inh gô tuh tơ kơ̆l lu sư dôm tơdrong mă lu sư đei pơm.”

English: Just then, the man clothed with linen, who had the inkhorn at his side, reported back and said, “I have done as You commanded me.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơngai hrŭk ao che 'bui, bĕng 'long chih đak mơ̆k, brŏk roi thoi âu: “Inh đei pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Ih tơtă.”

English: And I looked, and there in the firmament that was above the head of the cherubim, there appeared something like a sapphire stone, having the appearance of the likeness of a throne.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh tơ rơwơ̆ng mă tơ kơpal kơ̆l chêrubim đei kiơ noh rang nhen thoi tơmo gĭt lăng hơbŏ thoi tang-dŏ pơtao.

English: Then He spoke to the man clothed with linen, and said, “Go in among the wheels, under the cherub, fill your hands with coals of fire from among the cherubim, and scatter them over the city.” And he went in as I watched.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ bơngai hrŭk ao che 'bui: “Mơ̆t bĕ tơ sơlam tang-wang gre ala kơ chêrubim iŏk ngar ŭnh 'bĕnh kơ tơpang ti ih, đơ̆ng sơlam lu chêrubim na săi jơ̆p kơ pơlei noh”. Bơngai noh mơ̆t tơm măt inh.

English: Now the cherubim were standing on the south side of the temple when the man went in, and the cloud filled the inner court.
Bahnar: Kơplah bơngai noh mơ̆t, lu chêrubim dơ̆ng gah gơal kơ hnam akŭm păng hơmơ̆l 'bĕnh kơ cham gah lăm.

English: Then the glory of the LORD went up from the cherub, and paused over the threshold of the temple; and the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was full of the brightness of the LORD’s glory.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang tŏk đơ̆ng chêrubim, tơ anăp 'măng hnam akŭm tơm. Na hnam akŭm tơm 'bĕnh kơ hơmơ̆l păng tơ cham hnam 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong hơdah ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang.

English: And the sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard even in the outer court, like the voice of Almighty God when He speaks.
Bahnar: Re jơwa đơ̆ng pơnăr chêrubim tơtuh đe kơtơ̆ng truh tơ cham 'nguaih, re thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh pơma.

English: Then it happened, when He commanded the man clothed in linen, saying, “Take fire from among the wheels, from among the cherubim,” that he went in and stood beside the wheels.
Bahnar: Kơplah Sư tơtă khan kơ bơngai hrŭk ao che 'bui: “Iŏk ŭnh đơ̆ng sơlam tang-wang gre lu chêrubim,” bơngai noh mơ̆t dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng tang-wang gre.

English: And the cherub stretched out his hand from among the cherubim to the fire that was among the cherubim, and took some of it and put it into the hands of the man clothed with linen, who took it and went out.
Bahnar: Minh pôm chêrubim chro ti iŏk ŭnh đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lu chêrubim, dan 'bơ̆t ti bơngai hrŭk ao che 'bui; bơngai âu iŏk đơ̆ng noh lĕch năm hloi.

English: The cherubim appeared to have the form of a man’s hand under their wings.
Bahnar: Ala kơ pơnăr chêrubim, đei yă kiơ noh nhen thoi ti bơngai.

English: And when I looked, there were four wheels by the cherubim, one wheel by one cherub and another wheel by each other cherub; the wheels appeared to have the color of a beryl stone.
Bahnar: Inh lăng, 'bôh đei puăn tŏ tang-wang gre dan cheng chêrubim, rim kơ minh pôm lăm lu tang-wang gre dan 'bơ̆t cheng rim kơ chêrubim; rup tang-wang gre noh hơbŏ rang thoi tơmo gĭt.

English: As for their appearance, all four looked alike—as it were, a wheel in the middle of a wheel.
Bahnar: Rup tang-wang gre noh puăn tŏ lei-lăi, tang-wang gre âu tah tơ lăm tang-wang gre noh mă-lei dăr phara.

English: When they went, they went toward any of their four directions; they did not turn aside when they went, but followed in the direction the head was facing. They did not turn aside when they went.
Bahnar: Dah lu sư wă năm lu sư năm kiơ̆ kơ minh lăm puăn pah, dah năm ưh kơ gơh pơdăr pơkuĕch tơ 'ma 'ngiĕo. Kiơ̆ kơ tang-wang kơ̆l anăp gah yơ na lu chêrubim năm kiơ̆ gah noh, ưh kơ kăl dăr pơkuĕch 'ma 'ngiĕo

English: And their whole body, with their back, their hands, their wings, and the wheels that the four had, were full of eyes all around.
Bahnar: Đĭ akâu lu chêrubim, rŏng, ti, pơnăr, tang-wang gre, lu tang-wang gre lăm puăn tŏ kon sem noh tă kơ đei măt tăp dăr.

English: As for the wheels, they were called in my hearing, “Wheel.”
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng đe krao. “Lu tang-wang gre pơdăr.”

English: Each one had four faces: the first face was the face of a cherub, the second face the face of a man, the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.
Bahnar: Rim kơ chêrubim đei puăn tŏ muh măt; mă minh muh măt chêrubim, mă 'bar muh măt bơngai, mă pêng muh măt dăm-brang, mă puăn muh măt sem klang.

English: And the cherubim were lifted up. This was the living creature I saw by the River Chebar.
Bahnar: Lu chêrubim păr tŏk. Noh lu kon sem arih mă inh đei 'bôh 'bơ̆t krong Kêbar.

English: When the cherubim went, the wheels went beside them; and when the cherubim lifted their wings to mount up from the earth, the same wheels also did not turn from beside them.
Bahnar: Mưh lu chêrubim năm, lu tang-wang gre kư̆m năm kiơ̆ cheng; mưh lu chêrubim bơyar pơnăr păr đơ̆ng teh tơ kơpal, lu tang-wang gre ưh kơ dăr weh đơ̆ng cheng lu sư ôh.

English: When the cherubim stood still, the wheels stood still, and when one was lifted up, the other lifted itself up, for the spirit of the living creature was in them.
Bahnar: Tơdah kơplah lu chêrubim dơ̆ng, lu tang-wang gre kư̆m dơ̆ng; tơdah chêrubim iung păr, tang-wang gre kư̆m iung, yua kơ yang bơhngol kon sem arih noh oei lăm lu sư.

English: Then the glory of the LORD departed from the threshold of the temple and stood over the cherubim.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang lĕch đơ̆ng anăp 'măng hnam akŭm na dơ̆ng tơ kơpal lu chêrubim.

English: And the cherubim lifted their wings and mounted up from the earth in my sight. When they went out, the wheels were beside them; and they stood at the door of the east gate of the LORD’s house, and the glory of the God of Israel was above them.
Bahnar: Lu chêrubim bơyar pơnăr păr tơ kơpal hloi đơ̆ng teh 'bơ̆t anăp inh; lu tang-wang gre kư̆m năm hơdai 'bơ̆t cheng lu sư. Lu sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng mơ̆t gah hơlĕch hnam Kră Yang, tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael oei kơpal lu sư.

English: This is the living creature I saw under the God of Israel by the River Chebar, and I knew they were cherubim.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon sem arih mă inh 'bôh tơ ala kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tơ krong Kêbar, păng inh băt tơpă noh lu chêrubim.

English: Each one had four faces and each one four wings, and the likeness of the hands of a man was under their wings.
Bahnar: Rim chêrubim đei puăn pah muh măt păng puăn pah pơnăr, ala kơ lu pơnăr đei hơbŏ thoi ti kon bơngai.

English: And the likeness of their faces was the same as the faces which I had seen by the River Chebar, their appearance and their persons. They each went straight forward.
Bahnar: Muh măt lu sư noh jơ̆ muh măt mă inh đei 'bôh tơ krong Kêbar. Rim kơ kon sem arih noh năm tơpăt tơ anăp.

English: Then the Spirit lifted me up and brought me to the East Gate of the LORD’s house, which faces eastward; and there at the door of the gate were twenty-five men, among whom I saw Jaazaniah the son of Azzur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol hơtŏk inh tơ kơpal păng 'nhăk ba inh tơ 'măng jang hnam Kră Yang gah hơlĕch. 'Bơ̆t trong mơ̆t tơ 'măng jang noh đei 'bar-jĭt pơđăm 'nu drŏ-nglo; lăm lu sư inh 'bôh Jaasania kon drŏ-nglo Asur, păng Phêlatia kon drŏ-nglo Bênaia, kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei.

English: And He said to me: “Son of man, these are the men who devise iniquity and give wicked counsel in this city
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, noh lu bơngai pơđâu pơm tơdrong yoch, chă đon pơm kơnê̆ păng pơđâu kơnê̆ kơ bơngai lăm pơlei 'nâu.

English: who say, ‘The time is not near to build houses; this city is the caldron, and we are the meat.’
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: ‘Dang ei trŏ kơ man hnam. Pơlei âu jing gŏ 'bŭng, lu bơ̆n jing thoi 'nhĕm sĕch.’

English: Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh khan lê̆ adrol bĕ wă blah lu sư, ơ kon bơngai khan lê̆ adrol bĕ.”

English: Then the Spirit of the LORD fell upon me, and said to me, “Speak! ‘Thus says the LORD: “Thus you have said, O house of Israel; for I know the things that come into your mind.
Bahnar: Đei Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang jur tơ inh. Sư khan kơ inh; “'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu tơdrong lu iĕm tơchĕng, ơ kon pơlei Isơrael, Inh băt tơdrong jơhngơ̆m đon lu iĕm tơchĕng.

English: You have multiplied your slain in this city, and you have filled its streets with the slain.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei pơlôch lơ bơngai boih lăm pơlei âu, tơ rok trong lăm pơlei 'bĕnh lơ bơngai lôch.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Your slain whom you have laid in its midst, they are the meat, and this city is the caldron; but I shall bring you out of the midst of it.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: Lu akâu bơngai lôch mă lu iĕm hŭt lê̆ lăm pơlei âu jing 'nhĕm păng pơlei jing gŏ 'bŭng; mă-lei lu iĕm Inh gô pơpuh lê̆ tơ 'nguaih kơ pơlei.

English: You have feared the sword; and I will bring a sword upon you,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm hli kơ đao hơlă, na Inh gô ăn đao hơlă blah lu iĕm, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “And I will bring you out of its midst, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and execute judgments on you.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơpuh lê̆ lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei âu, gô pơjao lu iĕm lăm tơpang ti lu bơngai tơmoi păng sek phak lu iĕm.

English: You shall fall by the sword. I will judge you at the border of Israel. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch yua kơ đao; Inh gô sek tơlang phak lu iĕm tơ hơdral char Isơrael. Lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: This city shall not be your caldron, nor shall you be the meat in its midst. I will judge you at the border of Israel.
Bahnar: Pơlei âu ưh kơ sĭ kơ gŏ lu iĕm; lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ sĭ 'nhĕm lăm noh; Inh gô sek tơlang lu iĕm 'bơ̆t hơdral char Isơrael.

English: And you shall know that I am the LORD; for you have not walked in My statutes nor executed My judgments, but have done according to the customs of the Gentiles which are all around you.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, ưh kơ wei răk tơdrong Inh tơtă, mă-lei pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt teh đak jum dăr kơ iĕm.”

English: Now it happened, while I was prophesying, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then I fell on my face and cried with a loud voice, and said, “Ah, Lord GOD! Will You make a complete end of the remnant of Israel?”
Bahnar: Kơplah inh khan lê̆ adrol, Phêlatia kon drŏ-nglo Bênaia lôch; inh drap muh măt tơ teh păng krao ôr re: “Ơ, Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Ih wă pơlôch đĭ bơngai Isơrael mă oei arih dah kiơ?”

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Nơ̆r âu truh tơ inh đơ̆ng Kră Yang

English: “Son of man, your brethren, your relatives, your countrymen, and all the house of Israel in its entirety, are those about whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, ‘Get far away from the LORD; this land has been given to us as a possession.’
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, kon pơlei Jêrusalem khan boih gah lu 'nhŏng oh ih, noh 'nhŏng oh ih kơdih, adrĕch adrung ih păng đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch Isơrael mă oei bơnă đe: ‘Lu sư ataih đơ̆ng Kră Yang; teh âu Sư ăn boih kơ bơ̆n bơ̆jang sa.’

English: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Although I have cast them far off among the Gentiles, and although I have scattered them among the countries, yet I shall be a little sanctuary for them in the countries where they have gone.” ’
Bahnar: Thoi noh, khan bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Mă Inh đei ăn kơ lu sư năm tơ lu dêh char nai, tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p lăm lu teh đak, mă-lei Inh oei 'măn anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ lu sư tơ lăm lu char mă lu sư oei ưh kơ đunh tŏ noh.’

English: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will gather you from the peoples, assemble you from the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.” ’
Bahnar: Thoi noh khan bĕ: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Inh gô akŭm lu iĕm đơ̆ng lu pơlei tơmoi, păng Inh gô iŏk lu iĕm đơ̆ng lu teh đak mă lu iĕm oei tơklah tơklang păng gô ăn teh đak Isơrael kơ lu iĕm dơ̆ng.’

English: And they will go there, and they will take away all its detestable things and all its abominations from there.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô brŏk truh tơ teh đak lu sư păng hŭt lê̆ dôm tơdrong mă Inh areh păng dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach krưp đơ̆ng anih noh.

English: Then I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within them, and take the stony heart out of their flesh, and give them a heart of flesh
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư minh jơhngơ̆m, minh đon 'nao; Inh gô iŏk lê̆ jơhngơ̆m arăng thoi tơmo đơ̆ng akâu lu sư păng ăn kơ lu sư jơhngơ̆m rơmuăn wă chu kiơ̆ Kră Yang.

English: that they may walk in My statutes and keep My judgments and do them; and they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư chu kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, wei răk păng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă, lu sư kon pơlei Inh păng Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: But as for those whose hearts follow the desire for their detestable things and their abominations, I will recompense their deeds on their own heads,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, lu mơ'nah đei jơhngơ̆m 'maih kiơ̆ tơdrong Inh areh păng tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp, Inh gô pơm tơwih tơdrong lu sư pơm tuh tơ kơ̆l lu sư, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.”

English: So the cherubim lifted up their wings, with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was high above them.
Bahnar: Lu chêrubim hăm tang-wang gre 'bơ̆t cheng lu sư iung bơyar pơnăr. Tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael oei kơpal lu sư.

English: And the glory of the LORD went up from the midst of the city and stood on the mountain, which is on the east side of the city.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang tŏk tơ kơpal đơ̆ng lăm pơlei tih păng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t kơpal kông gah hơlĕch kơ pơlei.

English: Then the Spirit took me up and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to those in captivity. And the vision that I had seen went up from me.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Yang Bơhngol hiŏng inh tơ kơpal, păng chông anhăk ba inh truh tơ anih lu bơngai mă đe pơpuh tơ Kalđê. Na tơdrong tơ'bôh weh đơ̆ng inh.

English: So I spoke to those in captivity of all the things the LORD had shown me.
Bahnar: Inh roi ăn kơ lu bơngai đe pơpuh tôm tơdrong đơ̆ng Kră Yang tơ'bôh tơbăt kơ inh.

English: Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang truh tơ inh

English: “Son of man, you dwell in the midst of a rebellious house, which has eyes to see but does not see, and ears to hear but does not hear; for they are a rebellious house.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih oei lăm kon pơlei juăt kơ iung blah plơ̆; lu sư đei măt mă ưh kơ 'bôh, đei đon mă ưh kơtơ̆ng, yua kơ lu sư kon pơlei juăt kơ iung blah plơ̆.

English: “Therefore, son of man, prepare your belongings for captivity, and go into captivity by day in their sight. You shall go from your place into captivity to another place in their sight. It may be that they will consider, though they are a rebellious house.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ơ kon bơngai, ih athei hơmet tơmam chă jăk păng jăk weh yak kơ'năr 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, ih athei jăk weh đơ̆ng anih ih oei na jăk tơ nai 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư. Lu sư gô 'bôh bưh. Rŏ lăng lu sư hlôh mă khan lu sư kon pơlei juăt kơ iung blah plơ̆.

English: By day you shall bring out your belongings in their sight, as though going into captivity; and at evening you shall go in their sight, like those who go into captivity.
Bahnar: Chĕp ba tơmam ih kơdih thoi đe pơpuh tơjăk kơ'năr 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư; wă kơ lu sư 'bôh; kơsơ̆ ih lĕch yak 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư wă lu sư lăng, ih lĕch yak nơnăm thoi lu bơngai đe pơpuh.

English: Dig through the wall in their sight, and carry your belongings out through it.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp lu sư, oei lăng ih athei bŏk dur, chĕp tơmam ih lĕch yak rok bơlôh noh.

English: In their sight you shall bear them on your shoulders and carry them out at twilight; you shall cover your face, so that you cannot see the ground, for I have made you a sign to the house of Israel.”
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t lu sư oei lăng ih athei tôi tơmam ih kơpal hơngiĕng, na yak năm lăm kơsơ̆ măng. Athei gom lê̆ muh măt ih wă huay kơ 'bôh teh đak âu yua kơ Inh pơm kơ ih jing tơdra kơ lu adrĕch Isơrael.”

English: So I did as I was commanded. I brought out my belongings by day, as though going into captivity, and at evening I dug through the wall with my hand. I brought them out at twilight, and I bore them on my shoulder in their sight.
Bahnar: Inh pơm kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơkă. Inh chĕp tơmam yak tŏk-bŏk kơ'năr thoi lu bơngai weh jăk. Truh kơsơ̆ măng inh bŏk dur hăm ti. Inh tôi tơmam tơ hơngiĕng jăk yak kơsơ̆ măng 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: And in the morning the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ pơgê đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said to you, ‘What are you doing?’
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, adrĕch Isơrael jing adrĕch mă 'maih iung tơblah hăm đei jet ih: ‘Ih pơm kiơ thoi noh?’

English: Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “This burden concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the house of Israel who are among them.” ’
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Nơ̆r tơjur âu pơma gah kon pơtao oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng đĭ-đăng kơ adrĕch Isơrael mă oei tơ noh.’

English: Say, ‘I am a sign to you. As I have done, so shall it be done to them; they shall be carried away into captivity.’
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘Inh boih jing tơdra kơ lu iĕm. Inh pơm thoi yơ boih, lu sư gô tơ'bơ̆p thoi noh. Đe gô rôp ba lu sư pơm bơnă.

English: And the prince who is among them shall bear his belongings on his shoulder at twilight and go out. They shall dig through the wall to carry them out through it. He shall cover his face, so that he cannot see the ground with his eyes.
Bahnar: Kon pơtao lăm lu sư gô tôi tơmam tơ hơngiĕng kơdih yak kơmăng. Lu sư bŏk bơlôh dur, sư gô lĕch trong noh. Sư gô gom muh măt wă ưh kơ 'bôh teh đak âu.

English: I will also spread My net over him, and he shall be caught in My snare. I will bring him to Babylon, to the land of the Chaldeans; yet he shall not see it, though he shall die there.
Bahnar: Inh gô dăng hơnhuăl kơ sư, sư gô 'leh hơđong Inh, păng Inh gô chông ba sư tơ Babilôn, teh đak Kalđê. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ 'bôh teh đak noh ôh, sư gô lôch tơ noh.

English: I will scatter to every wind all who are around him to help him, and all his troops; and I will draw out the sword after them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei jum dăr kơ sư păng lu linh sư, inh gô pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ puăn pah, păng Inh gô chĕp đao druh 'moi lu sư.

English: “Then they shall know that I am the LORD, when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang kơplah Inh pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang oei tơ lăm lu adrĕch adrung jơ̆p lăm tơring char păng jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: But I will spare a few of their men from the sword, from famine, and from pestilence, that they may declare all their abominations among the Gentiles wherever they go. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei oei đei bơngai mă Inh ăn klaih đơ̆ng đao, đơ̆ng pơngot, đơ̆ng lôch hơbuh, wă kơ lu sư roi tôm tơdrong krưp kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lu sư kơdih tơ lăm pơlei mă lu sư wă oei; păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, eat your bread with quaking, and drink your water with trembling and anxiety.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih sa bĕ tơmam lăm tơdrong hli krưp, nhă đak lăm tơdrong hli tơrơ.

English: And say to the people of the land, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the land of Israel: “They shall eat their bread with anxiety, and drink their water with dread, so that her land may be emptied of all who are in it, because of the violence of all those who dwell in it.
Bahnar: Athei khan kơ kon pơlei lăm noh: 'Nâu nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan kơ kon pơlei Jêrusalem lăm teh đak Isơrael: Lu sư gô sŏng sa lăm tơdrong hli păng nhă đak lăm tơdrong tơrơ, yua kơ đe gô blah tơgar iŏk đĭ tơmam đơ̆ng lăm char lu sư yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ pơrăm lu kon pơlei mă oei lăm noh đei pơm.

English: Then the cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste, and the land shall become desolate; and you shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lu pơlei gô đei lơ bơngai đe pơlôch pơrăm, na teh đak jing juơ rơhiăng, na lu sư gô băt inh boih Kră Yang.’ ”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, what is this proverb that you people have about the land of Israel, which says, ‘The days are prolonged, and every vision fails’?
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, đei nơ̆r pơđơ̆k lăm teh đak Isơrael thoi âu: “Khei 'năr đĭ hloh, thoi noh tơdrong tơ'bôh ưh pă sĭt! Nơ̆r noh wă khan kiơ?”

English: Tell them therefore, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will lay this proverb to rest, and they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel.” ’ But say to them, ‘ “The days are at hand, and the fulfillment of every vision.
Bahnar: Lei na, athei khan kơ lu sư: ‘Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: Inh gô tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong pơđơ̆k âu, ưh pă đei bu gơh yua nơ̆r pơđơ̆k dơ̆ng lăm teh đak Isơrael,’ khan kơ lu sư: ‘'Năr wă jê̆ truh, dôm tơdrong tơ'bôh gô pơsĭt.

English: For no more shall there be any false vision or flattering divination within the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Tơpă ưh pă đei tơdrong tơ'bôh hơlĕnh, dah tơdrong tơwir ayơ mă đei dơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isơrael.

English: For I am the LORD. I speak, and the word which I speak will come to pass; it will no more be postponed; for in your days, O rebellious house, I will say the word and perform it,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh gô pơma păng nơ̆r Inh pơma gô jing, ưh pă gơh lê̆ đunh. Ơ lu adrĕch ayăt 'maih tơblah plơ̆! Noh trŏ kơ năr lu iĕm, Inh khan hăm nơ̆r Inh sư gô pơsĭt, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.’ ”

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, look, the house of Israel is saying, ‘The vision that he sees is for many days from now, and he prophesies of times far off.’
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, to adrĕch Isơrael đei pơma khan: ‘Tơdrong tơ'bôh mă sư đei 'bôh noh tơ'bôh lê̆ kơ đunh năr đơ̆ng rŏng ning-mônh; păng sư khan lê̆ adrol oei ataih tơ anăp kơnh.

English: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “None of My words will be postponed any more, but the word which I speak will be done,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, athei khan kơ lu sư; 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Nơ̆r Inh pơma ưh pă lê̆ đunh boih, mă-lei nơ̆r Inh pơma gô pơsĭt, Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei khan thoi noh.’ ”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy, and say to those who prophesy out of their own heart, ‘Hear the word of the LORD!’ ”
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ wă kơ plơ̆ ayăt kơ lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol bơngai Isơrael mă oei khan lê̆ adrol kiơ̆ kơ lu sư tơchĕng kơdih. Khan kơ lu sư: ‘Athei mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang!

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Woe to the foolish prophets, who follow their own spirit and have seen nothing!
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Răm-'băm kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kơwao kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m kơdih, ưh kơ đei 'bôh yă kiơ?

English: O Israel, your prophets are like foxes in the deserts.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Isơrael, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol iĕm ưh kơ yua kơ kiơ nhen thoi mơja oei lăm anih pơchah pơchek.

English: You have not gone up into the gaps to build a wall for the house of Israel to stand in battle on the day of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ đei năm tơ anih dur pơlei đe pơrăm pơchah hĕch wă hơmet ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael, wă kơ oei dơ̆ng kơjăp lăm tơdrong tơblah lăm năr Kră Yang.

English: They have envisioned futility and false divination, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD!’ But the LORD has not sent them; yet they hope that the word may be confirmed.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh hơlĕnh păng pơm pơjâu tơwir ưh kơ trŏ; lu sư khan Kră Yang khan thoi âu, mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei wơh lu sư; na lu sư hơpơi wă kơ nơ̆r lu sư khan noh gô đei sĭt.

English: Have you not seen a futile vision, and have you not spoken false divination? You say, ‘The LORD says,’ but I have not spoken.”
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ iĕm tơ'bôh boih tơdrong hơlĕnh păng pơm pơjâu, tơwir khan ưh kơ trŏ, na iĕm khan: “Kră Yang khan,” mă tơpă Inh ưh kơ đei pơma khan ôh.
