English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Because you have spoken nonsense and envisioned lies, therefore I am indeed against you,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Yua kơ lu iĕm pơma hơlĕnh, 'bôh tơdrong ưh kơ trŏ, âu Inh blah plơ̆ lu iĕm, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “My hand will be against the prophets who envision futility and who divine lies; they shall not be in the assembly of My people, nor be written in the record of the house of Israel, nor shall they enter into the land of Israel. Then you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Ti Inh gô tơblah plơ̆ kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh hơlĕnh, pơm pơjâu ưh kơ trŏ. Lu sư ưh pă oei lăm kon pơlei Inh dơ̆ng, lu sư ưh pă đei anăn lăm sơ̆p hla bơar adrĕch Isơrael; păng ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t tơ lăm teh đak Isơrael; lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang tih hloh.

English: “Because, indeed, because they have seduced My people, saying, ‘Peace!’ when there is no peace—and one builds a wall, and they plaster it with untempered mortar
Bahnar: Lu sư hơlĕnh pơm kơ kon pơlei Inh wơ̆l jrok hăm nơ̆r sư khan, “Hiôk-hian,” mă-lei ưh kơ đei hiôk-hian. To, kon pơlei Inh man dur ưh kơ kơjăp, âu lu sư hơlĕnh bah hăm chŭr kok.

English: say to those who plaster it with untempered mortar, that it will fall. There will be flooding rain, and you, O great hailstones, shall fall; and a stormy wind shall tear it down.
Bahnar: Na khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai bah chŭr tơ dur, dur noh gô hơlih. 'Mi tih gô lơ̆p, 'mi prĕl gô jur; păng kial hơbŭt gô truh.

English: Surely, when the wall has fallen, will it not be said to you, ‘Where is the mortar with which you plastered it?’ ”
Bahnar: Mưh dur hơlih, đe ưh kơ jet lu iĕm hă: “Tơ yơ chŭr mă lu iĕm bah tơ dur noh?”

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “I will cause a stormy wind to break forth in My fury; and there shall be a flooding rain in My anger, and great hailstones in fury to consume it.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lăm tơdrong Inh hil Inh gô ăn kial hơbŭt truh, lăm tơdrong Inh mĭl Inh gô ăn 'mi tih đak lơ̆p păng 'mi prĕl gô pơrăm.

English: So I will break down the wall you have plastered with untempered mortar, and bring it down to the ground, so that its foundation will be uncovered; it will fall, and you shall be consumed in the midst of it. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm dur mă lu iĕm bah chŭr, dur gô hơlih păk tơ teh, jơ̆ng sư prưk tơ 'nguaih mưh dur păk hơlih, lu iĕm gô lôch răm hơdai lăm noh; na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: “Thus will I accomplish My wrath on the wall and on those who have plastered it with untempered mortar; and I will say to you, ‘The wall is no more, nor those who plastered it
Bahnar: Inh gô tuh tơdrong hil mĭl kơ dur păng hil mĭl kơ lu bơngai mă bah chŭr kok. Inh gô khan tơbăt kơ lu iĕm: ‘Dur pă đei boih, mă bơngai bah chŭr kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: that is, the prophets of Israel who prophesy concerning Jerusalem, and who see visions of peace for her when there is no peace,’ ” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Noh lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol Isơrael đei khan lê̆ adrol kơ pơlei Jêrusalem 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh hiôk-hian, mă ưh kơ đei hiôk-hian kiơ, Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei khan thoi noh.’ ”

English: “Likewise, son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people, who prophesy out of their own heart; prophesy against them
Bahnar: Bĭ ih, ơ kon bơngai, tơwih muh măt blah plơ̆ lu kon drŏ-kăn pơlei iĕm, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ blah lu sư. Lu sư khan lê̆ adrol kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m đon kơdih.

English: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Woe to the women who sew magic charms on their sleeves and make veils for the heads of people of every height to hunt souls! Will you hunt the souls of My people, and keep yourselves alive?
Bahnar: Na khan kơ lu sư: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Răm-'băm kơ lu drŏ-kăn mă kơ̆t che tơwir rơhưch tơ ti păng pơm khăn che tôm tĕch să iĕ gom tơ kơ̆l đe wă chă rôp bơhngol. Lu iĕm wă chă rôp bơhngol kon pơlei Inh, mă-lei wă rong bơhngol iĕm hiôk hă?

English: And will you profane Me among My people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, killing people who should not die, and keeping people alive who should not live, by your lying to My people who listen to lies?”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ Inh lăm lu kon pơlei Inh, wă kơ đei minh chup 'ba tơ'bâu păng minh tơpei 'bĕng, pơma hơlĕnh kơ kon pơlei Inh, lu sư mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r hơlĕnh lu iĕm, na pơlôch bơngai mă ưh kơ trŏ kơ lôch, păng rong bơngai mă ưh kơ trŏ wă rong arih.

English: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I am against your magic charms by which you hunt souls there like birds. I will tear them from your arms, and let the souls go, the souls you hunt like birds.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Inh blah plơ̆ lu bơngai chă tơwir hơlĕnh wă chă lua rôp bơhngol bơngai nhen thoi chă lua rôp sem; Inh gô hek lê̆ che tơwir đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm, păng plôh achăng lê̆ bơhngol mă lu iĕm đei rôp thoi sem.

English: I will also tear off your veils and deliver My people out of your hand, and they shall no longer be as prey in your hand. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk hek lê̆ che gom lu iĕm, na pơklaih kon pơlei Inh đơ̆ng tơpang ti lu iĕm, lu sư ưh pă jing tơmam lăm tơpang ti lu iĕm, chă lua rôp dơ̆ng, na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “Because with lies you have made the heart of the righteous sad, whom I have not made sad; and you have strengthened the hands of the wicked, so that he does not turn from his wicked way to save his life.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu iĕm iŏk tơdrong hơlĕnh pơm kơ lu bơngai tơpăt rơdu sơ'ngon mă Inh tam pơm kơ lu sư rơdu sơ'ngon ôh, păng yua kơ lu iĕm pơhlŭ lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă kơ lu sư ưh kơ tơbral lê̆ trong kơnê̆, na gơh đei arih

English: Therefore you shall no longer envision futility nor practice divination; for I will deliver My people out of your hand, and you shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: yua kơ tơdrong noh, lu iĕm gô ưh pă đei 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh hơlĕnh, păng ưh pă tơwir dơ̆ng. Inh gô pơklaih kon pơlei Inh rơngei đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm, na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.’ ”

English: Now some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat before me.
Bahnar: Đei lu kră pơlei Isơrael truh tơ inh, hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anăp inh

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Na đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, these men have set up their idols in their hearts, and put before them that which causes them to stumble into iniquity. Should I let Myself be inquired of at all by them?
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, lu bơngai âu 'măn boih rup yang lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư păng dan tơdrong yoch 'bơ̆t anăp muh măt wă pơm kơ lu sư kơtơih. Inh wă lê̆ kơ lu sư krao apinh Inh ưh?

English: “Therefore speak to them, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Everyone of the house of Israel who sets up his idols in his heart, and puts before him what causes him to stumble into iniquity, and then comes to the prophet, I the LORD will answer him who comes, according to the multitude of his idols
Bahnar: Na ih athei khan tơbăt kơ lu sư: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Bơngai bu lăm adrĕch Isơrael 'măn rup yang lăm jơhngơ̆m sư, păng dan tơdrong yoch wă pơm kơ kơtơih pơ̆k 'bơ̆t anăp muh măt lu sư, na năm tơ'bơ̆p bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, Inh boih Kră Yang gô tơl tơwih kơ lu sư trŏ thoi lơ rup yang lu sư.

English: that I may seize the house of Israel by their heart, because they are all estranged from Me by their idols.” ’
Bahnar: Inh pơm thoi noh wă kơ Inh iŏk dơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m Isơrael, lu bơngai mă yua kơ đơ̆ng rup yang na weh tơklah đơ̆ng Inh.

English: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Repent, turn away from your idols, and turn your faces away from all your abominations.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, khan bĕ kơ adrĕch Isơrael: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Wih brŏk tơbral bĕ! Lê̆ rup yang lu iĕm, tơbral weh đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: For anyone of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell in Israel, who separates himself from Me and sets up his idols in his heart and puts before him what causes him to stumble into iniquity, then comes to a prophet to inquire of him concerning Me, I the LORD will answer him by Myself.
Bahnar: Khan kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm adrĕch Isơrael păng đĭ-đăng tơmoi mă oei lăm Isơrael: Bơngai bu mă weh ataih đơ̆ng Inh, mă oei 'măn rup yang lăm jơhngơ̆m păng dan 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư tơdrong kơnê̆ yoch, wă pơm kơ đe kơtơih pơ̆k, na năm tơ'bơ̆p bơngai khan lê̆ adrol wă krao apinh Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang gô tơl tơwih kơ sư.

English: I will set My face against that man and make him a sign and a proverb, and I will cut him off from the midst of My people. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô blah plơ̆ bơngai noh, wă pơm kơ sư jing tơdra, minh tơdrong wă kơ đe đei nơ̆r hơmoch. Inh gô pơpuh lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei Inh. Na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “And if the prophet is induced to speak anything, I the LORD have induced that prophet, and I will stretch out My hand against him and destroy him from among My people Israel.
Bahnar: “Tơdah đe pơhlŭ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol na sư khan lê̆ adrol pơma minh nơ̆r ayơ noh, Inh boih Kră Yang lê̆ kơ đe pơhlŭ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh, păng Inh gô yơ̆r ti pơm plơ̆ kơ sư păng pơlôch pơrăm lê̆ sư đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei Isơrael Inh.

English: And they shall bear their iniquity; the punishment of the prophet shall be the same as the punishment of the one who inquired
Bahnar: Lu sư mă pơhlŭ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gô pŭ tơdrong phak lu sư kơdih; Inh phak bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lei-lăi kơ phak bơngai pơhlŭ.

English: that the house of Israel may no longer stray from Me, nor be profaned anymore with all their transgressions, but that they may be My people and I may be their God,“ says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh adrĕch Isơrael huay pă jrok weh ataih đơ̆ng Inh păng huay pă pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơdih hăm lơ tơdrong glăi nai dơ̆ng, na lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, păng Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.’”

English: The word of the LORD came again to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh.

English: “Son of man, when a land sins against Me by persistent unfaithfulness, I will stretch out My hand against it; I will cut off its supply of bread, send famine on it, and cut off man and beast from it.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai dah char ayơ pơm yoch hăm Inh, ưh kơ tơnăp tơnen hăm Inh, Inh yơ̆r ti phak lu sư pơrăm lê̆ hnam mong tơmam lu sư, ăn tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt truh păng pơlôch đĭ bơngai hăm sem dơrong lu sư.

English: Even if these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they would deliver only themselves by their righteousness,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Dah mă đei pêng 'nu drŏ-nglo âu: Nôê, Đaniel, hăm Jop oei lăm char ei, lei lăp lu sư đĕch gơh klaih oei arih, yua kơ tơdrong tơpăt lu sư kơdih. Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “If I cause wild beasts to pass through the land, and they empty it, and make it so desolate that no man may pass through because of the beasts
Bahnar: Dah Inh ăn lu sem bri năm pơrăm char noh, pơlôch lu bơngai; păng char noh jing juơ, ưh pă đei bu yak rok noh dơ̆ng, yua kơ lu sem bri oei tơ noh.

English: even though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters; only they would be delivered, and the land would be desolate.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan, tơpă thoi Inh mă arih ling-lang, mă khan đei pêng 'nu drŏ-nglo noh oei lăm char noh, lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơklaih kon drŏ-nglo dah kon drŏ-kăn, lăp gơh pơklaih kơdih akâu lu sư đĕch; char noh jing bri juơ tơtŭng.

English: “Or if I bring a sword on that land, and say, ‘Sword, go through the land,’ and I cut off man and beast from it
Bahnar: Dah mă Inh ăn đei tơdrong tơblah hăm char noh păng khan: ‘Athei ăn kơ đe iŏk đao hơlă tơblah lăm char’ păng pơlôch pơrăm đĭ kon bơngai păng lu sem dơrong

English: even though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan tơpă thoi Inh mă arih ling-lang, mă khan đei pêng 'nu drŏ-nglo noh oei lăm char noh, lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơklaih kon drŏ-nglo dah kon drŏ-kăn lu sư ôh, lu sư lăp gơh pơklaih kơdih akâu sư đĕch.

English: “Or if I send a pestilence into that land and pour out My fury on it in blood, and cut off from it man and beast
Bahnar: Dah Inh ăn tơdrong lôch hơbuh truh lăm char noh, Inh tuh tơdrong hil hăm pham lĕch, wă pơlôch pơrăm đĭ bơngai hăm lu sem dơrong

English: even though Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither son nor daughter; they would deliver only themselves by their righteousness.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan, tơpă thoi mă Inh arih ling-lang, mă khan đei Nôê, Đaniel hăm Jop oei lăm char noh, lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơklaih kon drŏ-nglo dah kon drŏ-kăn lu sư ôh, lu sư lăp gơh pơklaih kơdih akâu sư đĕch yua kơ tơdrong tơpăt lu sư kơdih.

English: For thus says the Lord GOD: “How much more it shall be when I send My four severe judgments on Jerusalem—the sword and famine and wild beasts and pestilence—to cut off man and beast from it?
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Rai krưp kơnê̆ hloh dơ̆ng mưh Inh ăn puăn tơdrong sek tơlang trăp; tơdrong đao hơlă tơblah, tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt, tơdrong sem bri pơrăm păng tơdrong lôch hơbuh truh tơ Jêrusalem wă pơlôch đĭ bơngai păng sem dơrong.

English: Yet behold, there shall be left in it a remnant who will be brought out, both sons and daughters; surely they will come out to you, and you will see their ways and their doings. Then you will be comforted concerning the disaster that I have brought upon Jerusalem, all that I have brought upon it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei lu bơngai mơ'nah klaih oei arih, lu kon drŏ-nglo hăm kon drŏ-kăn lu sư mă Inh gô chông lĕch đơ̆ng noh. Lu sư gô năm tơ ih; ih gô 'bôh tôm tơdrong lu sư pơm păng tơdrong arih sa lu sư, na ih gô hiôk, đei tơdrong pơlung yua kơ tơdrong truh mă Inh ăn tơ Jêrusalem, tôm tơdrong Inh đei ăn kơ char noh.

English: And they will comfort you, when you see their ways and their doings; and you shall know that I have done nothing without cause that I have done in it,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơlung ih, ih gô 'bôh tôm tơdrong arih sa lu sư, ih gô băt tôm tơdrong Inh hlôi pơm hăm lu sư ưh kơ sĭ tơdrong kơđei ôh mă Inh đei pơm boih hăm lu sư. Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.”

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, how is the wood of the vine better than any other wood, the vine branch which is among the trees of the forest?
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, 'long hơmu sư hăm yua hloh kơ lu dơng tơ'bla 'long nai tơ lăm bri ưh?

English: Is wood taken from it to make any object? Or can men make a peg from it to hang any vessel on?
Bahnar: Đe hăm gơh yua 'long noh wă pơm kiơ? Hăm wă gơh yua pơm 'long hơtol tơ'băk tơmam?

English: Instead, it is thrown into the fire for fuel; the fire devours both ends of it, and its middle is burned. Is it useful for any work?
Bahnar: Tơdah đe iŏk klơ̆m lăm ŭnh pơm 'long ŭnh, dah ŭnh sa 'bar pah tơm kơnhŏng, tŏk-bŏk sư jing ngar, hăm gơh yua pơm kiơ dơ̆ng?

English: Indeed, when it was whole, no object could be made from it. How much less will it be useful for any work when the fire has devoured it, and it is burned?
Bahnar: Tơdah ŭnh ưh tam mă sa sư oei 'lơ̆ng kư̆m ưh kơ đei gơh yua pơm kiơ; tơma khan ŭnh hloh sa boih, đĭ jing ngar rơnok wă gơh yua pơm kiơ dơ̆ng?”

English: “Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Like the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so I will give up the inhabitants of Jerusalem
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Thoi Inh đei iŏk 'long hơmu đơ̆ng lăm bri pơm 'long ŭnh tơkuh, Inh kư̆m gô pơm kơ kon pơlei Jêrusalem thoi noh.

English: and I will set My face against them. They will go out from one fire, but another fire shall devour them. Then you shall know that I am the LORD, when I set My face against them.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơwih muh măt blah plơ̆ lu sư, mă khan lu sư klaih dơ̆ng ŭnh boih ră, ŭnh gô sa lu sư; na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Thus I will make the land desolate, because they have persisted in unfaithfulness,’ says the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ char âu jing juơ rơhiăng, yua kơ lu sư pơm yoch ưh kơ wă chu, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.”

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, cause Jerusalem to know her abominations
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, athei tơbăt kơ Jêrusalem tơdrong lu sư pơm kơnê̆ krưp.

English: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD to Jerusalem: “Your birth and your nativity are from the land of Canaan; your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: ‘Khan bĕ kơ Jêrusalem thoi âu: Anih tơm rơh tơpŭ kơ ih đơ̆ng dêh char Kanaan, 'bă ih bơngai Amôrit, mĕ ih bơngai Hêtit.

English: As for your nativity, on the day you were born your navel cord was not cut, nor were you washed in water to cleanse you; you were not rubbed with salt nor wrapped in swaddling cloths.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpŭ kơ ih thoi âu, lăm năr 'nao tơpŭ kơ ih, tơlei klŏk ih tam mă kăt, tam mă tơhum ih rơgoh, tam mă pung lơlĭ hăm 'boh, tam mă pôn hăm che.

English: No eye pitied you, to do any of these things for you, to have compassion on you; but you were thrown out into the open field, when you yourself were loathed on the day you were born.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu lăng păng mơnat kơ ih, pơm tôm tơdrong noh kơ ih; đe klơ̆m tŭk ih tơ 'nguaih bri brah, yua kơ lăng ih krưp dêh năr 'nao tơpŭ kơ ih.

English: “And when I passed by you and saw you struggling in your own blood, I said to you in your blood, ‘Live!’ Yes, I said to you in your blood, ‘Live!’
Bahnar: Inh năm rok noh 'bôh ih pơpơ̆ lăm pham ih; Inh khan kơ ih mă oei lăm pham, “Arih bĕ!” Tơpă Inh khan kơ ih “mă oei lăm pham, “Arih bĕ.”

English: I made you thrive like a plant in the field; and you grew, matured, and became very beautiful. Your breasts were formed, your hair grew, but you were naked and bare.
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ ih wơ̆ tih thoi 'long lăm mir, wơ̆ tih kơjung. Truh ih iung adruh wơ̆ 'lŏ, sŏk ih bluh kơjung, kơtơh ih rai tih mă-lei ih oei hang-hông koh hoh.

English: “When I passed by you again and looked upon you, indeed your time was the time of love; so I spread My wing over you and covered your nakedness. Yes, I swore an oath to you and entered into a covenant with you, and you became Mine,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh năm brih lăng 'bôh ih, sơnăm ih 'lŏ trŏ kơ sơnăm băt kơ hưch wă; Inh iŏk tơdrơi ao Inh tơsu kơ ih, klơ̆p tơdrong koh hoh ih. Inh pơkă păng pơgơ̆p hăm ih, ih jing gah Inh bơih, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Then I washed you in water; yes, I thoroughly washed off your blood, and I anointed you with oil.
Bahnar: Inh tơhum hơrao ih hăm đak, ôp rơgoh pham đơ̆ng akâu ih, păng pung kơ ih pơgang.

English: I clothed you in embroidered cloth and gave you sandals of badger skin; I clothed you with fine linen and covered you with silk.
Bahnar: Inh pơhrŭk ăn kơ ih ao dônh, tơ'bot ăn kơ ih chơkhŏ chuă păng akar, tơ̆n ăn kơ ih ao che 'bui, tơsu ăn kơ ih ao che tơpu hơdrông.

English: I adorned you with ornaments, put bracelets on your wrists, and a chain on your neck.
Bahnar: Inh iŏk tơmam pơguăng pơhrôp ăn kơ ih, tơ'bot ăn kong tơ ti, tơ'băk ăn kơ ih rơbưn tơ hơko.

English: And I put a jewel in your nose, earrings in your ears, and a beautiful crown on your head.
Bahnar: Đoh ăn gŏp tơ muh, đoh ăn maih tơ đon, pơyơ̆l ăn hơgăl pơkao tơ kơ̆l ih.

English: Thus you were adorned with gold and silver, and your clothing was of fine linen, silk, and embroidered cloth. You ate pastry of fine flour, honey, and oil. You were exceedingly beautiful, and succeeded to royalty.
Bahnar: Ih pơguăng hăm maih, hu, hrŭk ao tai che 'bui tanh hăm brai se, che tơpu hơdrông păng che dônh sĭt. Ih sa tơpŭng 'lơ̆ng hăm đak sut, đak rơmă ôliwơ. Ih jing 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ trŏ lăp thoi pơtao drŏ-kăn.

English: Your fame went out among the nations because of your beauty, for it was perfect through My splendor which I had bestowed on you,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ ih jing ư-ang jơ̆p kơ lu dêh char, yua kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ hơbŏ liĕm, mă Inh 'măn kơ ih, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “But you trusted in your own beauty, played the harlot because of your fame, and poured out your harlotry on everyone passing by who would have it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ih gơnang kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng liĕm kơdih akâu, yua kơ tơdrong đe ư-ang kơ ih, na ih jing pơm pơyô kư̆ kă chă pơjao akâu kơdih 'bĭch hăm lu bơngai chă năm rok brih găn.

English: You took some of your garments and adorned multicolored high places for yourself, and played the harlot on them. Such things should not happen, nor be.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk ao tai wă pơrŏ pơm anih kơjung kơdih wă kơkuh pơyom, pơm pơyô kư̆ kă tơ noh. Tơdrong noh ưh kơ đei layơ trŏ lăp, ưh kơ layơ wă đei.

English: You have also taken your beautiful jewelry from My gold and My silver, which I had given you, and made for yourself male images and played the harlot with them.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m iŏk tơmam pơhrôp pơm hăm maih, hu, mă Inh ăn kơ ih boih; ih pơm lu rup akâu drŏ-nglo, na pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu noh.

English: You took your embroidered garments and covered them, and you set My oil and My incense before them.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk ao sĭt dônh tơsu kơ lu rup noh, iŏk đak rơmă ôliwơ, iŏk pơgang 'bâu phu Inh, na 'măn 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: Also My food which I gave you—the pastry of fine flour, oil, and honey which I fed you—you set it before them as sweet incense; and so it was,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Tơmam sa mă Inh ăn kơ ih noh, tơpŭng 'lơ̆ng, đak rơmă ôliwơ, đak sut, Inh wă 'me rong ih, na ih chĕp pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi soh 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp lu rup noh; noh tơdrong lu iĕm pơm, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Moreover you took your sons and your daughters, whom you bore to Me, and these you sacrificed to them to be devoured. Were your acts of harlotry a small matter
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m rôp lu kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn ih, mă ih tơpŭ kơ Inh, năm pơyơ̆r ăn kơ lu rup yang noh sa. Dôm tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă bơih, noh ưh tam mă tôm mă

English: that you have slain My children and offered them up to them by causing them to pass through the fire?
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m pơlôch lu kon Inh, pơm tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ rup yang noh hă?

English: And in all your abominations and acts of harlotry you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, struggling in your blood.
Bahnar: Lăm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp, tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, ih ưh kơ 'blŏk ôh kơplah năr oei nge, oei koh hoh, pơpơ̆ lăm pham kơdih.

English: “Then it was so, after all your wickedness—‘Woe, woe to you!’ says the Lord GOD
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Răm-'băm, răm-'băm tơpă kơ ih, kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach ih đei pơm.

English: that you also built for yourself a shrine, and made a high place for yourself in every street.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m đei man pơjing kơ ih kơdih anih kơjung, pơdơ̆ng kơ ih anih kơjung lăm rim anih pơlei akŭm pơđâu.

English: You built your high places at the head of every road, and made your beauty to be abhorred. You offered yourself to everyone who passed by, and multiplied your acts of harlotry.
Bahnar: Tơ rim kơ̆l trong tih ih đei pơjing anih kơjung kơ ih, hăm lăng ưh kơ gĭt tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ ih, tĕch mơdro akâu ih tơ noh, pơyơ̆r akâu kơ lu bơngai yak brih găn pơm kư̆ kă.

English: You also committed harlotry with the Egyptians, your very fleshly neighbors, and increased your acts of harlotry to provoke Me to anger.
Bahnar: Ih đei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu bơngai Êyiptơ, lu bơngai mă oei jê̆ ih 'bĕnh hăm tơdrong kư̆ kă; ih kư̆m pơm pơyô kư̆ kă lơ tơdrong wă pơm tơblĕk Inh.

English: “Behold, therefore, I stretched out My hand against you, diminished your allotment, and gave you up to the will of those who hate you, the daughters of the Philistines, who were ashamed of your lewd behavior.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh yơ̆r ti blah ih, iŏk lê̆ tơmam đơ̆ng ăn kơ ih păng pơjao ih kơ lu bơngai ayăt areh kơ ih, lu kon drŏ-kăn Philistin, lu bơngai mă kơdơ̆ mơlâu yua kơ tơdrong ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: You also played the harlot with the Assyrians, because you were insatiable; indeed you played the harlot with them and still were not satisfied.
Bahnar: Ih đei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu bơngai Asiri, yua kơ ih ưh kơ hrăp. Tơpă ih đei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu sư boih, mă-lei tam mă hrăp.

English: Moreover you multiplied your acts of harlotry as far as the land of the trader, Chaldea; and even then you were not satisfied.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m đei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu bơngai Kalđê char mơdro sa, mă-lei kư̆m ưh kơ hrăp.

English: “How degenerate is your heart!” says the Lord GOD, “seeing you do all these things, the deeds of a brazen harlot.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Liơ jơhngơ̆m ih 'maih dêh ưh kơ kĕ kơ gơ̆t, ih đei pơm dôm tơdrong noh, ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă thoi bơngai đi pă hrơ.

English: “You erected your shrine at the head of every road, and built your high place in every street. Yet you were not like a harlot, because you scorned payment.
Bahnar: Ih pơm anih kơkuh rim tơm trong, pơjing anih kơjung tơ rim anih akŭm pơđâu lăm pơlei; ih ưh kơ sĭ thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn pơm đi, yua kơ đe ưh kơ apah jên.

English: You are an adulterous wife, who takes strangers instead of her husband.
Bahnar: Ih bơih bơngai akăn pơm pơyô hăm đe, ih hưch kơ bơngai nai tơplih kơ klo ih.

English: Men make payment to all harlots, but you made your payments to all your lovers, and hired them to come to you from all around for your harlotry.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drŏ-kăn đi juăt kơ lu drŏ-nglo ăn tơmam, mă-lei ih ăn tơmam kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai ih hưch, iŏk răt lu sư năm đơ̆ng jơ̆p tơring wă kơ lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm ih.

English: You are the opposite of other women in your harlotry, because no one solicited you to be a harlot. In that you gave payment but no payment was given you, therefore you are the opposite.”
Bahnar: Ih pơm phara kơ lu drŏ-kăn đi nai lăm tơdrong ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, lu đe ưh kơ răt ih, tă tơ ih apah đe dơ̆ng tơplih kơ đe apah ih, ih pha tơplơ̆ kơ lu bơngai nai.

English: ‘Now then, O harlot, hear the word of the LORD!
Bahnar: Na ơ bơngai pơm đi, athei mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because your filthiness was poured out and your nakedness uncovered in your harlotry with your lovers, and with all your abominable idols, and because of the blood of your children which you gave to them
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Yua kơ ih tuh tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach pơdah tơdrong hang-hông 'bơ̆t ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm bơngai mă ih hưch wă, păng yua kơ ih kơkuh kơ lu rup yang kơnê̆ krưp, păng yua kơ ih pơyơ̆r pham lu kon ih kơ lu rup yang noh

English: surely, therefore, I will gather all your lovers with whom you took pleasure, all those you loved, and all those you hated; I will gather them from all around against you and will uncover your nakedness to them, that they may see all your nakedness.
Bahnar: lei na Inh gô akŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai ih hưch ih wă, noh lu bơngai ih hưch hăm lu bơngai ih areh; Inh gô akŭm lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ anih năm blah ih. Inh gô tơ'bôh ăn hang-hông ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, lu sư gô 'bôh đĭ-đăng hang-hông ih.

English: And I will judge you as women who break wedlock or shed blood are judged; I will bring blood upon you in fury and jealousy.
Bahnar: Inh gô sek tơlang phak ih thoi lu drŏ-kăn pơm pơyô kư̆ kă ưh kơ lăng klo sư păng tuh pham pơlôch đe; Inh gô tuh pham hil mĭl păng gar ih.

English: I will also give you into their hand, and they shall throw down your shrines and break down your high places. They shall also strip you of your clothes, take your beautiful jewelry, and leave you naked and bare.
Bahnar: Inh gô jao ih lăm tơpang ti lu bơngai mă ih hưch. Lu sư gô teh tơpăk anih kơjung ih păng teh tơlơ̆ lu anih ih juăt kơkuh, iŏk lê̆ tơmam ih pơguăng păng plôh yaih lê̆ hơbĕn ao ih, lê̆ ih akâu hoh.

English: “They shall also bring up an assembly against you, and they shall stone you with stones and thrust you through with their swords.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô iŏk lu kon pơlei, klơ̆m ih hăm tơmo păng koh hơjăl ih hăm đao.

English: They shall burn your houses with fire, and execute judgments on you in the sight of many women; and I will make you cease playing the harlot, and you shall no longer hire lovers.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô iŏk ŭnh soh hnam ih, phak pơmat ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu drŏ-kăn. Inh gô pơm kơ ih pă đei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă dơ̆ng păng ih ưh pă chă apah đe dơ̆ng.

English: So I will lay to rest My fury toward you, and My jealousy shall depart from you. I will be quiet, and be angry no more.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hil Inh gô ngach, tơdrong Inh gar ih ưh pă đei boih, Inh gô oei hiôk ưh pă hil dơ̆ng.

English: Because you did not remember the days of your youth, but agitated Me with all these things, surely I will also recompense your deeds on your own head,” says the Lord GOD. “And you shall not commit lewdness in addition to all your abominations.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih ưh kơ 'blŏk kơplah ih oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆, na mă pơgreh Inh tôm tơdrong, thoi noh na Inh gô tuh pơdrâu tơ kơpal kơ̆l ih, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh; hăm trŏ kơ ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm thim đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă Inh areh?

English: “Indeed everyone who quotes proverbs will use this proverb against you: ‘Like mother, like daughter!’
Bahnar: 'Nâu đe gô pơma pơđơ̆k lăm nơ̆r pơma pơđơ̆k gah ih khan: “Mĕ liơ kon lei.”

English: You are your mother’s daughter, loathing husband and children; and you are the sister of your sisters, who loathed their husbands and children; your mother was a Hittite and your father an Amorite.
Bahnar: Ih boih kon drŏ-kăn mĕ ih, bơngai hŭt tŭk lê̆ kon klo; ih jing oh kơ lu mŏ oh ih, bơngai mă hŭt tŭk lê̆ kon klo sư; mĕ ih bơngai Hêtit, 'bă ih bơngai Amôrit

English: “Your elder sister is Samaria, who dwells with her daughters to the north of you; and your younger sister, who dwells to the south of you, is Sodom and her daughters.
Bahnar: Mŏ ih Samari, oei hăm lu kon drŏ-kăn sư tơ gah yă-nơ̆m kơ ih; păng lu oh ih pơlei Sôđôm oei hơdai hăm lu kon drŏ-kăn sư tơ gah gơal kơ ih.

English: You did not walk in their ways nor act according to their abominations; but, as if that were too little, you became more corrupt than they in all your ways.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ năm kiơ̆ trong lu sư ôh hă? Ưh kơ pơm dôm lu tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆ krưp lei-lăi kơ lu sư ôh hă? Mă-lei ih pơm rai kơnê̆ hloh kơ lu sư lăm dôm trong ih năm bơih.

English: “As I live,” says the Lord GOD, “neither your sister Sodom nor her daughters have done as you and your daughters have done.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Tơpă thoi Inh mă arih ling-lang, oh drŏ-kăn ih pơlei Sôđôm, kơdih sư păng lu kon drŏ-kăn sư ưh tam pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi ih păng lu kon drŏ-kăn ih mă pơm boih.

English: Look, this was the iniquity of your sister Sodom: She and her daughter had pride, fullness of food, and abundance of idleness; neither did she strengthen the hand of the poor and needy.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong yoch oh drŏ-kăn ih Sôđôm: Sư păng lu kon drŏ-kăn sư pơang, sŏng sa phĭ jơnap, tơmam sa rơkah rơkai, mă-lei ưh kơ tơgŭm lu bơngai dơnuh hin pơmat-tat.

English: And they were haughty and committed abomination before Me; therefore I took them away as I saw fit.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơang, pơm yoch kơnê̆ krưp 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, na Inh gô pơrăm lu sư, thoi ih đei 'bôh boih.

English: “Samaria did not commit half of your sins; but you have multiplied your abominations more than they, and have justified your sisters by all the abominations which you have done.
Bahnar: Samari pơm yoch tam đei minh puăt tơdrong, yoch mă ih đei pơm; ih pơm boih tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp hloh kơ lu sư. Thoi noh ih pơm kơ mŏ oh ih bơngai nhen thoi tơpăt 'biơ̆ kơ ih, yua kơ đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng tơdrong kơnê̆ ih pơm boih.

English: You who judged your sisters, bear your own shame also, because the sins which you committed were more abominable than theirs; they are more righteous than you. Yes, be disgraced also, and bear your own shame, because you justified your sisters.
Bahnar: Ih jing pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu yua kơ ih pơm kơ đe mŏ oh ih nhen thoi lu sư tơpăt, yua kơ tơdrong yoch ih pơm kơnê̆ hloh kơ lu sư, đe lăng lu sư tơpăt hloh kơ ih. Thoi noh ih pŭ iŏk bĕ tơdrong mơlâu, yua kơ ih pơm kơ đe mŏ oh ih nhen thoi lu sư jing tơpăt hloh kơ ih.

English: “When I bring back their captives, the captives of Sodom and her daughters, and the captives of Samaria and her daughters, then I will also bring back the captives of your captivity among them
Bahnar: Inh gô ba brŏk Sôđôm hăm lu kon drŏ-kăn sư, păng Samari hăm lu kon drŏ-kăn sư ăn rơngei dơ̆ng păng ih hăm lu sư wih brŏk ăn rơngei.

English: that you may bear your own shame and be disgraced by all that you did when you comforted them.
Bahnar: Wă kơ ih pŭ iŏk tơdrong kơdơ̆ mơlâu tôm tơdrong ih hlôi pơm kơnê̆; na pơm thoi noh, ih gô pơlung lu sư ăn đe lăng mŏ oh ih nhen thoi lu sư ưh kơ yoch tih tŏ ih, bơngai tơpăt hloh kơ ih.

English: When your sisters, Sodom and her daughters, return to their former state, and Samaria and her daughters return to their former state, then you and your daughters will return to your former state.
Bahnar: Mŏ oh ih, Sôđôm hăm lu kon drŏ-kăn sư gô wih hơlơ̆k thoi adrol sơ̆; Samari hăm kon drŏ-kăn sư kư̆m gô wih thoi adrol sơ̆. Ih păng lu kon drŏ-kăn ih kư̆m gô wih hơlơ̆k thoi adrol sơ̆.

English: For your sister Sodom was not a byword in your mouth in the days of your pride
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r ih ưh pă pơma 'bơm boih gah mŏ oh ih Sôđôm kơplah ih oei đei tơdrong pơang

English: before your wickedness was uncovered. It was like the time of the reproach of the daughters of Syria and all those around her, and of the daughters of the Philistines, who despise you everywhere.
Bahnar: adrol kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ ih đe 'bôh bơih. Dang ei đei nơ̆r đe chrih kơ ih đơ̆ng lăm lu kon drŏ-kăn Êđôm hăm đĭ-đăng tơring sư, lu kon drŏ-kăn Philistin jum dăr ih, lu sư pơjăm ih tôm tơdrong.

English: You have paid for your lewdness and your abominations,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Ih athei pŭ iŏk tơdrong truh đơ̆ng ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă păng tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp ih.

English: For thus says the Lord GOD: “I will deal with you as you have done, who despised the oath by breaking the covenant.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: Inh gô pơm kơ ih kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong ih đei pơm, yua kơ ih tŭk lê̆ nơ̆r pơkă hăm hŭt lê̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh

English: “Nevertheless I will remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish an everlasting covenant with you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Inh gô 'blŏk tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă Inh đei pơgơ̆p hăm ih kơplah ih oei 'lơ̆p. Inh gô pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao khŏm khŏm ling-lang hăm ih.

English: Then you will remember your ways and be ashamed, when you receive your older and your younger sisters; for I will give them to you for daughters, but not because of My covenant with you.
Bahnar: Kơplah ih sơng iŏk lu mŏ oh ih, ih gô 'blŏk kơ trong gơlong ih năm păng ih gô mơlâu; Inh gô ăn lu sư jing lu kon drŏ-kăn ih, mă khan lu sư ưh kơ đei lăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh hăm ih.

English: And I will establish My covenant with you. Then you shall know that I am the LORD
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh hăm ih, na ih gô băt inh boih Kră Yang

English: that you may remember and be ashamed, and never open your mouth anymore because of your shame, when I provide you an atonement for all you have done,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Na ih gô 'blŏk păng mơlâu kơplah Inh đei mơnat ăn tôm tơdrong mă ih đei pơm, ih pă gơh ha 'bơ̆r pơma dơ̆ng yua kơ mơlâu, Kră Yang tih hloh khan thoi noh.”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, pose a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, athei pơpơn, pơma pơđơ̆k păng pơtih gia kơ lu adrĕch Isơrael.

English: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “A great eagle with large wings and long pinions, Full of feathers of various colors, Came to Lebanon And took from the cedar the highest branch.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan: ‘Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Đei klang tih, pơnăr să, sŏk pơnăr kơjung, sŏk hơ'bơ̆l đei sŏk dreng jơk, sem păr truh tơ char Liban. Sư kơchâu iŏk kơnhŏng 'long hơngo.

English: He cropped off its topmost young twig And carried it to a land of trade; He set it in a city of merchants.
Bahnar: Sư gơ̆ ba tơmơ̆ng 'long, chĕp ba truh tơ tơring char mơdro sa pơtăm lăm pơlei đe mơdro mơchan.

English: Then he took some of the seed of the land And planted it in a fertile field; He placed it by abundant waters And set it like a willow tree.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk adrĕch găr 'long đơ̆ng teh noh chĕp ba pơtăm tơ anih teh 'lơ̆ng; sư pơtăm 'bơ̆t teh đei đak thoi 'long hla prai.

English: And it grew and became a spreading vine of low stature; Its branches turned toward him, But its roots were under it. So it became a vine, Brought forth branches, And put forth shoots.
Bahnar: 'Long chăt kơchar, jing minh tơnơm 'long hơmu, kiĕr glĭp mă-lei kơđeh, dơng tơwih tơklă gah sem klang, mă-lei rơh sư granh sôr tơ ala; thoi noh, jing minh tơnơm hơmu, bluh hla păng chăt tơ'biĕng.

English: “But there was another great eagle with large wings and many feathers; And behold, this vine bent its roots toward him, And stretched its branches toward him, From the garden terrace where it had been planted, That he might water it.
Bahnar: Đei minh pôm sem klang tih nai, pơnăr să, sŏk lơ. Na tơm hơmu đơ̆ng lăm teh sư mă hlôi pơtăm, sôr rơh, bluh dơng tơwih tơklă gah sem klang noh wă kơ ruh đak.

English: It was planted in good soil by many waters, To bring forth branches, bear fruit, And become a majestic vine.” ’
Bahnar: Mă khan tơm 'long hơmu pơtăm tơ lăm mir teh 'lơ̆ng jê̆ đak, bluh kơchar, đei plei jing tơm hơmu gĭt.

English: “Say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Will it thrive? Will he not pull up its roots, Cut off its fruit, And leave it to wither? All of its spring leaves will wither, And no great power or many people Will be needed to pluck it up by its roots.
Bahnar: Ih khan bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Tơm 'long hơmu noh hăm gơh jing 'lơ̆ng ưh? Hăm trŏ sem klang gô buch rơh sư, choh tơmơ̆ng sư, wă kơ đĭ lu hla dơng jing kro? Ưh kơ kăl ti pran kư̆m ưh kơ kăl lơ bơngai wă buch rơh sư.

English: Behold, it is planted, Will it thrive? Will it not utterly wither when the east wind touches it? It will wither in the garden terrace where it grew.” ’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, mă khan đe hlôi pơtăm sư tơ nai, sư hăm gơh chăt 'lơ̆ng ưh? Hla sư kư̆m ưh kơ jô đĭ hă? Mưh kial đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch tơthu, sư hăm gô kro hloi 'bơ̆t teh mă đe pơtăm chăt 'lơ̆ng boih?”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Say now to the rebellious house: ‘Do you not know what these things mean?’ Tell them, ‘Indeed the king of Babylon went to Jerusalem and took its king and princes, and led them with him to Babylon.
Bahnar: “Khan bĕ kơ lu adrĕch 'maih blah plơ̆ noh: ‘Lu iĕm ưh kơ băt tơdrong noh wă khan kiơ hă?’ Khan kơ lu sư: ‘Pơtao Babilôn năm truh boih tơ Jêrusalem, rôp boih pơtao păng lu kră pơlei chông ba hăm sư tơ Babilôn.

English: And he took the king’s offspring, made a covenant with him, and put him under oath. He also took away the mighty of the land
Bahnar: Pơtao rôp minh 'nu lăm adrĕch pơtao, pơgơ̆p hăm sư, athei sư pơkă. Pơtao kư̆m rôp ba lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm tơring noh hai

English: that the kingdom might be brought low and not lift itself up, but that by keeping his covenant it might stand.
Bahnar: wă kơ dêh char âu rai tơrăn, kơdih sư ưh kơ kĕ kơ iung wei mă-lei athei wei tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm pơtao wă kơ teh đak oei oei.

English: But he rebelled against him by sending his ambassadors to Egypt, that they might give him horses and many people. Will he prosper? Will he who does such things escape? Can he break a covenant and still be delivered?
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao dêh âu blah plơ̆ pơtao, wơh athei bơngai năm tơ char Êyiptơ wă apinh aseh, linh tơblah tơgŭm. Lu bơngai pơm thoi noh hăm kĕ jei ưh? Hăm gơh klaih hlôi ưh? Pơm thoi noh, lu bơngai mă pơrăm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hăm gơh klaih ưh?

English: ‘As I live,’ says the Lord GOD, ‘surely in the place where the king dwells who made him king, whose oath he despised and whose covenant he broke—with him in the midst of Babylon he shall die.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Tơpă thoi Inh mă arih, pơtao 'nâu gô lôch tơ Babilôn lăm teh đak pơtao mă pôk sư pơm pơtao, yua kơ sư hŭt lê̆ nơ̆r pơkă păng pơrăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm pơtao Babilôn.

English: Nor will Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company do anything in the war, when they heap up a siege mound and build a wall to cut off many persons.
Bahnar: Pơtao Pharaôn hăm lu linh nuih kơtang păng lu linh lơlang ưh kơ năm tơgŭm sư kơplah đei tơdrong tơblah, kơplah lu đe bơ̆ bơnơ̆, pơm dur tăp dăr wă wang blah pơlôch lơ bơngai.

English: Since he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, and in fact gave his hand and still did all these things, he shall not escape.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih hŭt lê̆ nơ̆r pơkă, pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p âu, ih đei pơm dôm tơdrong 'nâu lei na sư ưh kơ gơh klaih.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “As I live, surely My oath which he despised, and My covenant which he broke, I will recompense on his own head.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Tơpă thoi Inh mă arih ling-lang, Inh gô tuh tơ kơpal kơ̆l lu sư nơ̆r pơkă hơlĕnh pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh.

English: I will spread My net over him, and he shall be taken in My snare. I will bring him to Babylon and try him there for the treason which he committed against Me.
Bahnar: Inh gô dăng hơnhuăl kơ sư, sư gô hrơ̆p 'bơ̆t hơnhuăl Inh; Inh gô chông lu sư tơ Babilôn, tơ noh Inh gô phak lu sư yua kơ tơdrong yoch mă sư ưh kơ chu kơ Inh.

English: All his fugitives with all his troops shall fall by the sword, and those who remain shall be scattered to every wind; and you shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu linh sư mă pran kơtang hloh gô lôch kơ đao, hơlă, mă lu bơngai oei arih gô tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ kial. Na ih gô băt kơ, Inh boih Kră Yang, đei khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will take also one of the highest branches of the high cedar and set it out. I will crop off from the topmost of its young twigs a tender one, and will plant it on a high and prominent mountain.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Inh gô iŏk kơnhŏng tơmơ̆ng 'long hơngo gô pơtăm sư. Inh gô gơ̆ iŏk tơmơ̆ng păng Inh gô pơtăm 'long noh kơpal kông kơjung.

English: On the mountain height of Israel I will plant it; and it will bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a majestic cedar. Under it will dwell birds of every sort; in the shadow of its branches they will dwell.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtăm 'long noh kơpal kông kơjung Isơrael; 'long noh bluh tơ'bla păng đei plei; jing 'long hơngo 'lơ̆ng đĭ-đăng. Lu sem gô pơm tơpu oei tơ noh, đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch đei pơnăr gô kôp tơ yơ̆p tơ'bla 'long noh.

English: And all the trees of the field shall know that I, the LORD, have brought down the high tree and exalted the low tree, dried up the green tree and made the dry tree flourish; I, the LORD, have spoken and have done it.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu 'long tơ bri brah gô băt kơ Inh boih Kră Yang, tơjur lê̆ 'long kơjung na hơtŏk lu 'long kơđeh, pơm kơ 'long hơdrih jing kro, 'long kro jing hơdrih 'lơ̆ng. Inh boih Kră Yang đei khan păng gô pơm tơdrong noh.’ ”

English: The word of the LORD came to me again, saying
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “What do you mean when you use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying: ‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, And the children’s teeth are set on edge’?
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm tơchĕng nơ̆r âu pơđơ̆k kơ teh đak Isơrael wă khan kiơ? ‘Chăl 'bă sư sa plei hơmu iŭ, chăl kon hơker hơnĕnh,’

English: “As I live,” says the Lord GOD, “you shall no longer use this proverb in Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Tơpă thoi Inh mă arih, lu iĕm ưh pă yua bơih nơ̆r pơđơ̆k âu lăm Isơrael.

English: “Behold, all souls are Mine; The soul of the father As well as the soul of the son is Mine; The soul who sins shall die.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong arih lăm Inh, tơdrong arih 'bă kư̆m thoi tơdrong arih kon oei lăm Inh ngăl na Bơngai bu pơm yoch gô lôch.

English: But if a man is just And does what is lawful and right
Bahnar: Pơtih gia bơngai bu tơpăt, pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng trŏ tơpăt

English: If he has not eaten on the mountains, Nor lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, Nor defiled his neighbor’s wife, Nor approached a woman during her impurity
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ sa 'nhĕm đe pơm yang tơ kơpal kông, ưh kơ wă lăng tơ rup yang adrĕch Isơrael. Ưh kơ pơm kư̆ kă hăm lu akăn đe, ưh kơ jê̆ lu drŏ-kăn oei 'bôh hơbĕn

English: If he has not oppressed anyone, But has restored to the debtor his pledge; Has robbed no one by violence, But has given his bread to the hungry And covered the naked with clothing
Bahnar: Ưh kơ pơjuă pơđep bu, pơdrâu tơmam kơ lu bơngai đêl iŏk hre, ưh kơ tơtông tơmam đe, ăn 'bĕng sa kơ lu bơngai pơngot, ăn ao hrŭk kơ lu bơngai koh hoh.

English: If he has not exacted usury Nor taken any increase, But has withdrawn his hand from iniquity And executed true judgment between man and man
Bahnar: Ăn kơ đe tŏk iŏk ưh kơ iŏk lơi adrol ưh kơ iŏk lơi lơ, ưh kơ mơ̆t hơdai lu bơngai pơm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, sek tơlang tơpăt lăm tơduă kon bơngai.

English: If he has walked in My statutes And kept My judgments faithfully— He is just; He shall surely live!” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Chu kiơ̆ khôi juăt păng chu răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă. Bơngai âu arih sa tơpăt, noh jing bơngai tơpăt, sư gô đei tơdrong arih, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “If he begets a son who is a robber Or a shedder of blood, Who does any of these things
Bahnar: Tơdah sư đei minh 'nu kon hơ'lơ̆p kơchu pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ đei pơlôch đe tuh pham pơm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ hăm đe.

English: And does none of those duties, But has eaten on the mountains Or defiled his neighbor’s wife
Bahnar: Mă khan 'bă sư noh ưh kơ đei pơm glăi minh tơdrong kiơ ră, mă-lei kon sư sa tơmam đe soi tơ kơpal kông păng pơm kư̆ kă hăm akăn đe

English: If he has oppressed the poor and needy, Robbed by violence, Not restored the pledge, Lifted his eyes to the idols, Or committed abomination
Bahnar: pơjuă pơđep bơngai dơnuh hin tơtông tơmam đe păng ưh kơ pơdrâu đêl tơmam đe, lăng tơ rup yang, pơm dôm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ krưp

English: If he has exacted usury Or taken increase— Shall he then live? He shall not live! If he has done any of these abominations, He shall surely die; His blood shall be upon him.
Bahnar: ăn tŏk iŏk sa lơi adrol păng iŏk lơi lơ, kon sư noh hăm gơh arih ưh? Sư ưh kơ đei arih ôh! Yua kơ sư hlôi pơm yoch dôm tơdrong kơnê̆, tơpă sư gô lôch păng pham sư gô tuh kơ kơ̆l sư.

English: “If, however, he begets a son Who sees all the sins which his father has done, And considers but does not do likewise
Bahnar: Mă-lei, tơdah bơngai mă yoch 'nâu sư đei kon drŏ-nglo dơ̆ng, kon sư 'bôh tôm tơdrong yoch 'bă sư hlôi pơm glăi, 'bôh noh sư ưh kơ pơm yoch thoi noh.

English: Who has not eaten on the mountains, Nor lifted his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, Nor defiled his neighbor’s wife
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sa 'nhĕm đe soi tơ kơpal kông, sư ưh kơ lăng tơ rup yang adrĕch Isơrael, ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ hăm akăn đe

English: Has not oppressed anyone, Nor withheld a pledge, Nor robbed by violence, But has given his bread to the hungry And covered the naked with clothing
Bahnar: Ưh kơ pơjuă pơđep đe, ưh kơ pơdrâu tơmam đe đêl hre păng ưh kơ tơtông tơmam đe, ăn tơmam sa kơ lu bơngai pơngot, ăn ao hrŭk kơ lu bơngai koh hoh

English: Who has withdrawn his hand from the poor And not received usury or increase, But has executed My judgments And walked in My statutes— He shall not die for the iniquity of his father; He shall surely live!
Bahnar: Ti ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai dơnuh, ăn kơ đe tŏk iŏk ưh kơ đei iŏk lơi adrol dah iŏk lơi lơ, Chu wei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă păng pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, sư ưh kơ lôch ôh yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ đơ̆ng 'bă sư, tơpă sư gô đei tơdrong arih.

English: “As for his father, Because he cruelly oppressed, Robbed his brother by violence, And did what is not good among his people, Behold, he shall die for his iniquity.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bă sư pơm yoch pơjuă đe, tơtông tơmam lu 'nhŏng oh sư, pơm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng lăm pơlei sư, sư gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ mă sư đei pơm.

English: “Yet you say, ‘Why should the son not bear the guilt of the father?’ Because the son has done what is lawful and right, and has kept all My statutes and observed them, he shall surely live.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei jet: “Liơ kon sư ưh kơ pŭ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bă sư? Dah đei bu pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, tơpă sư gô đei tơdrong arih.

English: The soul who sins shall die. The son shall not bear the guilt of the father, nor the father bear the guilt of the son. The righteousness of the righteous shall be upon himself, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon himself.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm yoch bơngai noh kơdih sư gô lôch, kon sư ưh kơ đei pŭ tơdrong yoch 'bă sư păng 'bă sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei pŭ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ kon sư. Tơdrong tơpăt lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô 'măn kơ lu bơngai tơpăt, tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô tơpŭ tơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ noh.

English: “But if a wicked man turns from all his sins which he has committed, keeps all My statutes, and does what is lawful and right, he shall surely live; he shall not die.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ băt tơbral đĭ-đăng tơdrong yoch sư hlôi pơm, na wei răk dôm khôi juăt Inh păng pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, tơpă sư gô đei tơdrong arih, ưh kơ lôch ôh.

English: None of the transgressions which he has committed shall be remembered against him; because of the righteousness which he has done, he shall live.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong yoch mă sư hlôi pơm ưh pă jô̆ boih; đơ̆ng tơdrong sư pơm 'lơ̆ng sư gô đei tơdrong arih.

English: Do I have any pleasure at all that the wicked should die?” says the Lord GOD, “and not that he should turn from his ways and live?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inh 'bôh lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ lôch Inh hiôk hă? Ưh kơ hiôk ôh wă kơ lu sư tơbral tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm na đei arih.

English: “But when a righteous man turns away from his righteousness and commits iniquity, and does according to all the abominations that the wicked man does, shall he live? All the righteousness which he has done shall not be remembered; because of the unfaithfulness of which he is guilty and the sin which he has committed, because of them he shall die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah bơngai tơpăt hŭt lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt sư, na sư pơm yoch kơnê̆ krưp thoi lu bơngai kơnê̆ đei pơm, Sư hăm arih ưh? Dôm tơdrong tơpăt ayơ mă sư pơm boih Inh ưh pă 'blŏk dơ̆ng, sư gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ mă sư đei pơm.

English: “Yet you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not fair.’ Hear now, O house of Israel, is it not My way which is fair, and your ways which are not fair?
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm khan: ‘Trong Kră Yang pơm ưh kơ tơpăt!’ Ơ lu adrĕch Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ! Trong Inh ưh kơ tơpăt dah trong lu iĕm ưh kơ tơpăt?

English: When a righteous man turns away from his righteousness, commits iniquity, and dies in it, it is because of the iniquity which he has done that he dies.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai tơpăt hŭt lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt, na pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, sư gô lôch, sư gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ sư hlôi pơm boih.

English: Again, when a wicked man turns away from the wickedness which he committed, and does what is lawful and right, he preserves himself alive.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ hŭt lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆, tơdrong yoch mă sư pơm boih, na pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt tơdrong trŏ, sư gô dŏng pơklaih bơhngol sư đei tơdrong arih ling-lang.

English: Because he considers and turns away from all the transgressions which he committed, he shall surely live; he shall not die.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư 'bôh păng tơbral dôm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ mă sư hlôi pơm, tơpă sư gô đei tơdrong arih păng ưh kơ đei lôch hiong.

English: Yet the house of Israel says, ‘The way of the Lord is not fair.’ O house of Israel, is it not My ways which are fair, and your ways which are not fair?
Bahnar: Adrĕch Isơrael đei khan: Trong Kră Yang ưh kơ tơpăt, Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, trong Inh ưh kơ tơpăt hă? Mă tơpă trong lu iĕm ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: “Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, every one according to his ways,” says the Lord GOD. “Repent, and turn from all your transgressions, so that iniquity will not be your ruin.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan: “Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, Inh gô sek tơlang lu iĕm, rim 'nu kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong sư đei pơm. Athei wih tơbral bĕ păng hŭt lê̆ dôm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu iĕm, wă kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ huay kơ pơgăn pơrăm lu iĕm.

English: Cast away from you all the transgressions which you have committed, and get yourselves a new heart and a new spirit. For why should you die, O house of Israel?
Bahnar: Athei hŭt lê̆ bĕ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ ataih đơ̆ng lu iĕm mă lu iĕm đei pơm boih, pơm ming bĕ kơ lu iĕm kơdih, jơhngơ̆m 'nao păng tơdrong arih 'nao, ơ adrĕch Isơrael, thoi yơ lu iĕm wă kơ lôch?

English: For I have no pleasure in the death of one who dies,” says the Lord GOD. “Therefore turn and live!”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Tơpă, Inh ưh kơ hiôk ôh kơ tơdrong lôch mă lu iĕm wă lôch, athei tơbral bĕ wă kơ đei tơdrong arih.

English: “Moreover take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel
Bahnar: Gah ih nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ kơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r Isơrael

English: and say: ‘What is your mother? A lioness: She lay down among the lions; Among the young lions she nourished her cubs.
Bahnar: păng khan: ‘Mĕ ih thoi dăm-brang akăn oei tŏk-bŏk lu dăm-brang; wei rong lu kon sư 'bĭch tŏk-bŏk lu dăm-brang kon.

English: She brought up one of her cubs, And he became a young lion; He learned to catch prey, And he devoured men.
Bahnar: Sư wei rong tơmŏm minh pôm lăm lu dăm-brang kon, noh jing dăm-brang mơlôh, pơjuăt chă rôp kon sem păng sa kon bơngai.

English: The nations also heard of him; He was trapped in their pit, And they brought him with chains to the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng teh đak kơtơ̆ng ang kơ sư, đe rôp sư, sư puh lăm sơlŭng, đe chô̆ sư hăm glang păng ba sư tơ char Êyiptơ.

English: ‘When she saw that she waited, that her hope was lost, She took another of her cubs and made him a young lion.
Bahnar: Kơplah dăm-brang akăn băt kơ sư gô đunh, pă đei hơmĕng bơih sư iŏk rong minh pôm kon plơ̆ng dơ̆ng, rong dĭng truh dăm-brang mơlôh.

English: He roved among the lions, And became a young lion; He learned to catch prey; He devoured men.
Bahnar: Sư chă yak năm hơdai hăm lu dăm-brang jing dăm-brang mơlôh, pơjuăt chă rôp kon sem păng sa bơngai.

English: He knew their desolate places, And laid waste their cities; The land with its fullness was desolated By the noise of his roaring.
Bahnar: Sư pơrăm lu pơlei kơjăp; păng pơm kơ lu pơlei lu sư jing juơ tơtŭng, teh đak păng kon pơlei oei lăm noh hli ngăl kơ nơ̆r sư ôr gơhuh.

English: Then the nations set against him from the provinces on every side, And spread their net over him; He was trapped in their pit.
Bahnar: Lu teh đak đơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ sư iung blah sư, dăng hơnhuăl kơ sư; sư hrơ̆p lăm hơnhuăl lu đe đăk.

English: They put him in a cage with chains, And brought him to the king of Babylon; They brought him in nets, That his voice should no longer be heard on the mountains of Israel.
Bahnar: Đe chô̆ sư hăm gơwŏk glang, tah sư lăm bai na năm ba sư tơ char Babilôn; chĭt sư lăm hnam bơnă na huay pă kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r sư ôr tơ kông Isơrael dơ̆ng.

English: ‘Your mother was like a vine in your bloodline, Planted by the waters, Fruitful and full of branches Because of many waters.
Bahnar: Mĕ ih thoi tơm 'long hơmu lăm pơgar, pơtăm jê̆ đak, đei dơng hla tơ'bla chăt 'lơ̆ng păng đei plei trem yua kơ pơtăm jê̆ đak.

English: She had strong branches for scepters of rulers. She towered in stature above the thick branches, And was seen in her height amid the dense foliage.
Bahnar: Đei dơng sư tih, jing pơm 'long jra pơtao. Tơm sư kơjung, đei tơ'bla hla hơmŭl lơ, đe 'bôh sư kơjung yua kơ đei dơng kơjung hloh kơ lu dơng nai.

English: But she was plucked up in fury, She was cast down to the ground, And the east wind dried her fruit. Her strong branches were broken and withered; The fire consumed them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư buch đĭ lăm năr hil mĭl păng klơ̆m lê̆ tơ teh. Kial đơ̆ng hơlĕch tơthu pơm kơ tơm sư kro, plei sư hơlŭng, đĭ dơng tih kư̆m jô kro păng ŭnh sa đĭ.

English: And now she is planted in the wilderness, In a dry and thirsty land.
Bahnar: Dang ei pơtăm sư tơ char glă lăm teh hrĕng kro ưh kơ đei đak.

English: Fire has come out from a rod of her branches And devoured her fruit, So that she has no strong branch— a scepter for ruling.’ ” This is a lamentation, and has become a lamentation.
Bahnar: Ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng tơ'bla sư sa đĭ plei noh, thoi noh na ưh pă đei dơng 'lơ̆ng ayơ oei đei, wă yua pơm 'long jra pơtao. Noh tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi, jing nơ̆r hơri nhơ̆m hmoi.’

English: It came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, that certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of the LORD, and sat before me.
Bahnar: Sơnăm tăl mă tơpơh, năr mơjĭt khei pơđăm, đei lu kră pơlei Isơrael năm krao apinh Kră Yang, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp inh.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Have you come to inquire of Me? As I live,” says the Lord GOD, “I will not be inquired of by you.” ’
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, khan bĕ kơ lu kră pơlei Isơrael: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Hăm trŏ lu iĕm năm krao apinh Inh dah ưh? Kră Yang khan: Thoi Inh mă arih, Inh ưh kơ ăn lu iĕm krao apinh Inh.

English: Will you judge them, son of man, will you judge them? Then make known to them the abominations of their fathers.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih wă sek tơlang lu sư ưh, ih wă sek tơlang lu sư hă? Athei Ăn kơ lu sư băt tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lu yă 'bok lu sư.

English: “Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “On the day when I chose Israel and raised My hand in an oath to the descendants of the house of Jacob, and made Myself known to them in the land of Egypt, I raised My hand in an oath to them, saying, ‘I am the LORD your God.’
Bahnar: Athei khan kơ lu sư: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Kơplah Inh rơih iŏk Isơrael. Inh pơkă hăm lu adrĕch adrung Jakôp, ăn kơ lu sư băt kơ Inh lăm char Êyiptơ, Inh đei yơ̆r ti Inh pơkă pơkăm hăm lu sư, thoi âu: “Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm

English: On that day I raised My hand in an oath to them, to bring them out of the land of Egypt into a land that I had searched out for them, ‘flowing with milk and honey,’ the glory of all lands.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Inh yơ̆r ti pơkă hăm lu sư, inh gô chông anhăk lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ năm tơ anih mă Inh đei chơchă ăn kơ lu sư bơih, teh đei đak toh păng đak sut lơ, noh teh ư-ang hloh kơ đĭ-đăng char.

English: Then I said to them, ‘Each of you, throw away the abominations which are before his eyes, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.’
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu sư: “Rim 'nu lu iĕm athei hŭt lê̆ rup yang kơnê̆ krưp mă măt lu iĕm 'maih lăng; 'nĕ pă pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ lu iĕm kơdih yua kơ đơ̆ng lu yang Êyiptơ! Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: But they rebelled against Me and would not obey Me. They did not all cast away the abominations which were before their eyes, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt. Then I said, ‘I will pour out My fury on them and fulfill My anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư oei blah Inh, ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Inh, ưh kơ hŭt lê̆ rup yang kơnê̆ krưp mă măt lu sư 'maih lăng; kư̆m ưh kơ hŭt lê̆ lu rup yang Êyiptơ. Yua kơ thoi noh Inh khan Inh gô tuh tơdrong Inh hil tơ lu sư, wă kơ hrăp tơdrong Inh blĕk kơ lu sư tơ lăm char Êyiptơ.

English: But I acted for My name’s sake, that it should not be profaned before the Gentiles among whom they were, in whose sight I had made Myself known to them, to bring them out of the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ anăn Inh, wă kơ anăn noh đe huay pơm pơ'mê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei nai tơ anih mă lu sư oei. 'Bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei noh Inh đei tơbăt boih lu bơngai Isơrael. Inh gô chông ba lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: “Therefore I made them go out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, chông ba lu sư truh tơ char glă.

English: And I gave them My statutes and showed them My judgments, ‘which, if a man does, he shall live by them.’
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ lu sư khôi juăt Inh păng tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư nơ̆r Inh tơtă, wă kơ bơngai bu kiơ̆ gô đei tơdrong arih.

English: Moreover I also gave them My Sabbaths, to be a sign between them and Me, that they might know that I am the LORD who sanctifies them.
Bahnar: Inh ăn boih kơ lu sư năr giĕng Sa'bat wă pơm tơdra tŏk-bŏk lu sư hăm Inh, wă kơ lu sư băt Inh boih Kră Yang pơm kơ lu sư rơgoh.

English: Yet the house of Israel rebelled against Me in the wilderness; they did not walk in My statutes; they despised My judgments, ‘which, if a man does, he shall live by them’; and they greatly defiled My Sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out My fury on them in the wilderness, to consume them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei adrĕch Isơrael blah inh lăm char glă. Lu sư ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, sơngah kơ nơ̆r inh tơtă, noh tơdrong mă bơngai bu pơm kiơ̆ gô arih; lu sư kư̆m pơm yoch 'mê̆-'mach lăm năr Sa'bat Inh dơ̆ng. Inh khan wă tuh tơdrong Inh hil mĭl tơ lu sư lăm char glă.

English: But I acted for My name’s sake, that it should not be profaned before the Gentiles, in whose sight I had brought them out.
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ anăn Inh, Inh pơm wă kơ anăn Inh đe huay kơ pơm pơ'mê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei nai, 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei mă 'bôh Inh chông tơlĕch lu sư.

English: So I also raised My hand in an oath to them in the wilderness, that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, ‘flowing with milk and honey,’ the glory of all lands
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Inh đei yơ̆r ti pơkăm pơkă hăm lu sư tơ lăm char glă thoi âu Inh ưh kơ chông ba lu sư năm tơ teh mă Inh wă ăn kơ lu sư, teh đak toh păng đak sut, noh teh ư-ang hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lăm char.

English: because they despised My judgments and did not walk in My statutes, but profaned My Sabbaths; for their heart went after their idols.
Bahnar: Inh pơm thoi noh yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r inh tơtă, ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ khôi juăt inh păng pơm yoch pơ'mê̆ lăm năr Sa'bat inh; pơm kiơ̆ kơkuh kơ rup yang lu sư.

English: Nevertheless My eye spared them from destruction. I did not make an end of them in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh lăng oei mơnat kơ lu sư, Inh ưh kơ wă pơrăm lu sư, Inh ưh wă pơlôch lu sư lăm char glă.

English: “But I said to their children in the wilderness, ‘Do not walk in the statutes of your fathers, nor observe their judgments, nor defile yourselves with their idols.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu kon sâu sư lăm char glă: “'Nĕ kơ kiơ̆ khôi juăt lu yă 'bok iĕm, 'nĕ wei răk nơ̆r lu sư tơtă păng kơdih iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơkuh kơ rup yang lu sư.

English: I am the LORD your God: Walk in My statutes, keep My judgments, and do them
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, chu kiơ̆ bĕ khôi juăt Inh, wei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă păng pơm kiơ̆ bĕ.

English: hallow My Sabbaths, and they will be a sign between Me and you, that you may know that I am the LORD your God.’
Bahnar: Wei răk bĕ lu năr Sa'bat Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, wă kơ sư jing tơdra tŏk-bŏk Inh hăm lu iĕm, wă kơ lu iĕm băt Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: “Notwithstanding, the children rebelled against Me; they did not walk in My statutes, and were not careful to observe My judgments, ‘which, if a man does, he shall live by them’; but they profaned My Sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out My fury on them and fulfill My anger against them in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu kon sâu lu sư blah Inh; ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, ưh kơ wei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă lu tơdrong mă tơdah bu pơm kiơ̆ gô arih; lu sư kư̆m pơm yoch 'mê̆-'mach lăm năr Sa'bat Inh. Thoi noh Inh khan bơih gô tuh tơdrong hil mĭl Inh tơ lu sư păng tơdrong blĕk Inh phak lu sư lăm char glă.

English: Nevertheless I withdrew My hand and acted for My name’s sake, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the Gentiles, in whose sight I had brought them out.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh dui lê̆ ti Inh, yua kơ anăn Inh, wă kơ anăn Inh đe huay kơ pơm pơ'mê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei nai, 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei mă inh chông tơlĕch lu sư.

English: Also I raised My hand in an oath to those in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the Gentiles and disperse them throughout the countries
Bahnar: Inh đei yơ̆r ti pơkăm pơkă hăm lu sư lăm char glă inh gô pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p lăm lu adrĕch adrung, tơrak 'brak tơ lăm dêh char

English: because they had not executed My judgments, but had despised My statutes, profaned My Sabbaths, and their eyes were fixed on their fathers’ idols.
Bahnar: yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă, hŭt lê̆ khôi juăt Inh, pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ năr Sa'bat Inh, păng măt lu sư 'maih lăng chu kiơ̆ kơ rup yang 'bok yă lu sư.

English: “Therefore I also gave them up to statutes that were not good, and judgments by which they could not live
Bahnar: Lei na Inh ăn kơ lu sư kiơ̆ khôi juăt ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh tơtă ưh kơ đei ba tơdrong arih.

English: and I pronounced them unclean because of their ritual gifts, in that they caused all their firstborn to pass through the fire, that I might make them desolate and that they might know that I am the LORD.” ’
Bahnar: Inh pơm kơ tơdrong lu sư soi pơyơ̆r kon kơdră lu sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đơ̆ng tơmam soi noh Inh pơm kơ lu sư hli krưp, wă kơ lu sư băt inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “Therefore, son of man, speak to the house of Israel, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “In this too your fathers have blasphemed Me, by being unfaithful to Me.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ơ kon bơngai, athei khan kơ adrĕch Isơrael thoi âu: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: 'Bok yă lu iĕm pơma blông hăm Inh, yua kơ lu sư ưh wă chu Inh.

English: When I brought them into the land concerning which I had raised My hand in an oath to give them, and they saw all the high hills and all the thick trees, there they offered their sacrifices and provoked Me with their offerings. There they also sent up their sweet aroma and poured out their drink offerings.
Bahnar: Inh chông ba lu sư mơ̆t tơ char mă Inh pơkă ăn kơ lu sư, mă-lei lăp lu sư 'bôh groi kơjung păng lu 'long đei hla rơ̆m, lu sư iŏk tơmam soi pơyơ̆r tơ noh. Lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi noh tơblĕk Inh lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soh 'bâu phu păng tơmam soi huch sa tơ noh.

English: Then I said to them, ‘What is this high place to which you go?’ So its name is called Bamah to this day.” ’
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu sư: ‘Anih kơjung noh kiơ mă lu iĕm năm tơ noh?’” Anih kơjung noh đe krao. “Bama” truh tơ dang ei.

English: Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Are you defiling yourselves in the manner of your fathers, and committing harlotry according to their abominations?
Bahnar: Thoi noh, khan bĕ kơ adrĕch Isơrael: Kră Yang khan: Lu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ trong 'bok yă lu iĕm, lu iĕm pơm pơyô kư̆ kă kiơ̆ lu rup yang kơnê̆ krưp noh hă?

English: For when you offer your gifts and make your sons pass through the fire, you defile yourselves with all your idols, even to this day. So shall I be inquired of by you, O house of Israel? As I live,” says the Lord GOD, “I will not be inquired of by you.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi, pơyơ̆r kon drŏ-nglo soh hăm ŭnh, kơdih lu iĕm pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơkuh kơ rup yang truh tơ dang ei? Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, Inh ưh kơ lê̆ lu iĕm krao apinh Inh. Kră Yang khan: Thoi Inh mă arih ling-lang, Inh ưh kơ ăn lu iĕm krao apinh Inh.

English: What you have in your mind shall never be, when you say, ‘We will be like the Gentiles, like the families in other countries, serving wood and stone.’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: Lu nhôn wă gô kơkuh kơ 'long păng tơmo, kiơ̆ thoi adrĕch adrung lu dêh char âu. Tơdrong lu iĕm tơchĕng lăm đon tơdrong noh ưh kơ đei truh ôh

English: “As I live,” says the Lord GOD, “surely with a mighty hand, with an outstretched arm, and with fury poured out, I will rule over you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Thoi Inh mă arih ling-lang, Inh gô pơgơ̆r lu iĕm hăm tơpang ti pran kơtang, Inh yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal păng tuh tơdrong hil mĭl.

English: I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries where you are scattered, with a mighty hand, with an outstretched arm, and with fury poured out.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông tơlĕch lu iĕm đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei păng akŭm lu iĕm đơ̆ng lu dêh char mă Inh ăn lu iĕm tơklah tơklang hăm tơpang ti pran kơtang Inh gô yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal păng gô tuh tơdrong hil mĭl.

English: And I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will plead My case with you face to face.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông ba lu iĕm năm tơ char glă lu kon pơlei nai, tơ noh, Inh gô sek tơlang lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp măt.

English: Just as I pleaded My case with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will plead My case with you,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Thoi Inh hlôi sek tơlang 'bok yă lu iĕm lăm char glă tơ Êyiptơ, inh kư̆m sek tơlang lu iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I will make you pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant
Bahnar: Inh gô wei lu iĕm chu kiơ̆ ala 'long jra Inh păng Inh gô chông ba lu iĕm mơ̆t lăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p.

English: I will purge the rebels from among you, and those who transgress against Me; I will bring them out of the country where they dwell, but they shall not enter the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm lu bơngai đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm, bơngai mă blah Inh; Inh kư̆m gô chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng teh đak đe mă lu sư oei, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t lăm teh đak Isơrael. Thoi noh lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “As for you, O house of Israel,” thus says the Lord GOD: “Go, serve every one of you his idols—and hereafter—if you will not obey Me; but profane My holy name no more with your gifts and your idols.
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm, ơ adrĕch Isơrael, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Rim 'nu kơ lu iĕm năm kơkuh bĕ kơ rup yang! Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, lu iĕm gô mơ̆ng kiơ̆ Inh, ưh pă pơ'mê̆ kơ anăn Inh dơ̆ng hăm tơmam soi kơkuh kơ rup yang.

English: For on My holy mountain, on the mountain height of Israel,” says the Lord GOD, “there all the house of Israel, all of them in the land, shall serve Me; there I will accept them, and there I will require your offerings and the firstfruits of your sacrifices, together with all your holy things.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Tơ kơpal kông rơgoh Inh, tơ kơpal kông Isơrael, tơ noh đĭ adrĕch Isơrael, đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư lăm dêh char gô awih awăn kơ Inh. Tơ noh Inh gô sơng iŏk lu sư; Inh gô iŏk tơmam pơyơ̆r păng tơmam pơyơ̆r plei blŭng-a, hăm tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lu sư.

English: I will accept you as a sweet aroma when I bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries where you have been scattered; and I will be hallowed in you before the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Inh gô sơng iŏk lu iĕm thoi tơmam 'bâu phu, kơplah Inh chông lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng lăm lu kon pơlei păng akŭm lu iĕm đơ̆ng char mă lu iĕm đêl oei tơklah tơklang; păng Inh gô tơ'bôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei nai.

English: Then you shall know that I am the LORD, when I bring you into the land of Israel, into the country for which I raised My hand in an oath to give to your fathers.
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm gô băt inh boih Kră Yang, kơplah Inh chông ba lu iĕm mơ̆t lăm teh đak Isơrael, lăm dêh char mă Inh đei pơkă pơkăm wă ăn kơ 'bok yă lu iĕm.

English: And there you shall remember your ways and all your doings with which you were defiled; and you shall loathe yourselves in your own sight because of all the evils that you have committed.
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu iĕm gô 'blŏk trong iĕm đêl yak bơih păng dôm tơdrong iĕm pơm pơ'mê̆ kơdih akâu; lu iĕm gô lăng krưp kơdih akâu, yua kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm đei pơm.

English: Then you shall know that I am the LORD, when I have dealt with you for My name’s sake, not according to your wicked ways nor according to your corrupt doings, O house of Israel,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, kơplah Inh yua anăn Inh sơng iŏk lu iĕm, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ dah trong răm-'băm lu iĕm pơm ôh, ơ adrĕch Isơrael, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Furthermore the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh.

English: “Son of man, set your face toward the south; preach against the south and prophesy against the forest land, the South
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, lăng bĕ muh măt tơ gah gơal, bơtho khan blah bĕ char gah gơal păng khan lê̆ adrol wă blah lu bri kơdrơ̆ng lăm char gah gơal.

English: and say to the forest of the South, ‘Hear the word of the LORD! Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I will kindle a fire in you, and it shall devour every green tree and every dry tree in you; the blazing flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north shall be scorched by it.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu bri kơdrơ̆ng gah gơal. Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu Inh gô tơkuh ŭnh soh lăm tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm, ŭnh gô sa đĭ-đăng lu 'long hơdrih păng lu 'long kro. Ŭnh khơ̆ng ưh kơ đei păt, muh măt rim 'nu lu bơngai lăm char gah gơal truh tơ char gah yă-nơ̆m ŭnh sa khôi đĭ.

English: All flesh shall see that I, the LORD, have kindled it; it shall not be quenched.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai gô băt Inh boih soh ŭnh noh, Kră Yang Tih hloh tơkuh boih ŭnh noh ưh kơ đei layơ păt.

English: Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! They say of me, ‘Does he not speak parables?’ ”
Bahnar: Na inh khan, “Ơ Kră Yang, lu sư khan gah inh. ‘Hăm trŏ 'bok noh pơma pơtih đĕch?’ ”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu

English: “Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem, preach against the holy places, and prophesy against the land of Israel
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, tơwih bĕ muh măt tơ gah Jêrusalem; athei khan na blah anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, păng khan lê̆ adrol blah teh đak Isơrael.

English: and say to the land of Israel, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Behold, I am against you, and I will draw My sword out of its sheath and cut off both righteous and wicked from you.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ teh đak Isơrael: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu, Inh năm wă phak lu iĕm. Inh gô toh đao Inh đơ̆ng hơnglop, pơrăm lu bơngai tơpăt păng lu bơngai kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm.

English: Because I will cut off both righteous and wicked from you, therefore My sword shall go out of its sheath against all flesh from south to north
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh wă pơrăm lu bơngai tơpăt păng lu bơngai kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm, na inh toh đao Inh đơ̆ng hơnglop blah lu iĕm iŏk đơ̆ng gah gơal truh tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: that all flesh may know that I, the LORD, have drawn My sword out of its sheath; it shall not return anymore.” ’
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai gô băt kơ Inh boih Kră Yang, gô toh đao đơ̆ng hơnglop păng ưh pă wơ̆t tah dơ̆ng!’

English: Sigh therefore, son of man, with a breaking heart, and sigh with bitterness before their eyes.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, gah ih ôr krao bĕ hăm jơhngơ̆m pơchah; athei ơh sơ'ngon ôr krao 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: And it shall be when they say to you, ‘Why are you sighing?’ that you shall answer, ‘Because of the news; when it comes, every heart will melt, all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint, and all knees will be weak as water. Behold, it is coming and shall be brought to pass,’ says the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư jet ih: Yua kơ kiơ ih ôr krao? Ih tơl tơwih khan: Noh yua kơ đei kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'nao truh, pơm kơ rim jơhngơ̆m gô pơchah hach, lu ti gô rơdu, jơhngơ̆m đon tơchĕng gô hơngơ̆t; gô rơdu. Tơdrong noh gô truh, nơ̆r noh gô đei tơpă, Kră Yang khan thoi noh!

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the LORD!’ Say: ‘A sword, a sword is sharpened And also polished!
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Đao, đao pat han păng iel rang.

English: Sharpened to make a dreadful slaughter, Polished to flash like lightning! Should we then make mirth? It despises the scepter of My son, As it does all wood.
Bahnar: Noh wă koh pơlôch, pat han wă koh pơlôch; iel rang thoi kơmlat, bơ̆n hăm hiôk dah ưh? Iĕm lăng pơhơi dêh kơ 'long jra pơtao, kon drŏ-nglo Inh păng lu 'long sơnguĕt sư.

English: And He has given it to be polished, That it may be handled; This sword is sharpened, and it is polished To be given into the hand of the slayer.’
Bahnar: Pla đao âu pơiel rang pơchĕp ăn 'bơ̆t ti đe. Pla đao pat han păng pơiel rang pơjao kơ bơngai mă chă pơlôch đe.

English: “Cry and wail, son of man; For it will be against My people, Against all the princes of Israel. Terrors including the sword will be against My people; Therefore strike your thigh.
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, ôr nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ yua kơ đao noh wă blah kon pơlei Inh, blah lu yŏng pơgơ̆r Isơrael, đe jao boih lu sư kơ đao hăm lu kon pơlei Inh. Thoi noh sơ'ngon, pă đei tơdrong hơmĕng, tŭr kơtơh bĕ!

English: “Because it is a testing, And what if the sword despises even the scepter? The scepter shall be no more,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Đei tơdrong pơlong lăng truh, mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm kư̆m oei lăng pơhơi kơ 'long jra teh bơtho noh, lei tơdrong răm noh ưh kơ truh hă?

English: “You therefore, son of man, prophesy, And strike your hands together. The third time let the sword do double damage. It is the sword that slays, The sword that slays the great men, That enters their private chambers.
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, gah ih, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ, tap bĕ ti ih ăn kơ đao koh 'bar dah pêng wơ̆t; đao koh pơlôch lơ bơngai, pơrăm lơ bơngai: Đao gô wang chĭt tăp tang kơ lu sư.

English: I have set the point of the sword against all their gates, That the heart may melt and many may stumble. Ah! It is made bright; It is grasped for slaughter
Bahnar: Noh pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m lu sư pơchah hach, đei lơ bơngai pơ̆k lôch, Inh đei dan boih đao wă pơlôch tơ rim 'măng jang lu sư. Ô! Đao pơm boih wă kơ pơlôch đe chơchêr thoi kơmlat; đe pơiel sư wă yua koh pơlôch.

English: “Swords at the ready! Thrust right! Set your blade! Thrust left— Wherever your edge is ordered!
Bahnar: Pat mă han bĕ koh gah 'ma, 'bet gah 'ngiĕo, kiơ̆ kơ pla đao tơwih gah yơ.

English: “I also will beat My fists together, And I will cause My fury to rest; I, the LORD, have spoken.”
Bahnar: Inh gô tap ti wă kơ pơhrăp kơ tơdrong inh hil. Inh Kră Yang, khan thoi noh.

English: The word of the LORD came to me again, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “And son of man, appoint for yourself two ways for the sword of the king of Babylon to go; both of them shall go from the same land. Make a sign; put it at the head of the road to the city.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih athei chrek 'bar tŏ trong ăn kơ đao pơtao char Babilôn wă truh, 'bar tŏ trong noh đơ̆ng minh pôm teh đak; athei chhơ̆ tơdra tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t kơ̆l trong năm mơ̆t tơ pơlei.

English: Appoint a road for the sword to go to Rabbah of the Ammonites, and to Judah, into fortified Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Athei chrek ăn trong kơ đao năm blah pơlei Rapba, bơngai Ammôn, păng minh trong năm blah dêh char Juđa truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem pơlei kơjăp.
