English: For the king of Babylon stands at the parting of the road, at the fork of the two roads, to use divination: he shakes the arrows, he consults the images, he looks at the liver.
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t trong tơklah pêng, 'bơ̆t kơ̆l 'bar pah trong wă hlang lăng. Pơtao wă gơgŭ 'brơ̆m wă hlang lăng, apinh lu rup yang wă lăng lăng klơm sem soi pơyơ̆r.

English: In his right hand is the divination for Jerusalem: to set up battering rams, to call for a slaughter, to lift the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to heap up a siege mound, and to build a wall.
Bahnar: Ti gah 'ma pơtao đei hlang lăng tơ'bôh gah pơlei Jêrusalem, athei dan tơmam tơblah wă pơrăm pơlei, nơ̆r wơh athei pơlôch ôr tơblah, dan tơmam tơblah wă pơrăm lu 'măng jang pơlei, sir sơlŭng bơ̆ man bơnơ̆ wang tăp dăr.

English: And it will be to them like a false divination in the eyes of those who have sworn oaths with them; but he will bring their iniquity to remembrance, that they may be taken.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Jêrusalem hlôi pơkă pơkăm kơjăp hăm sư, na đei tơchĕng 'bôh tơdrong hlang lăng noh tơ'bôh glăi, mă-lei pơtao đei tơ'blŏk kơ lu sư tơdrong yoch lu sư, na mă rôp phak lu sư jing bơnă.

English: “Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Because you have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your doings your sins appear—because you have come to remembrance, you shall be taken in hand.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: ‘Yua kơ lu iĕm tơ'blŏk kơ đe tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu iĕm, pơdah tơdrong yoch glăi iĕm, na đe 'bôh tơdrong yoch glăi lu iĕm đơ̆ng iĕm pơm; yua kơ lu iĕm tơ'blŏk, na đe gô rôp lu iĕm pơm bơnă.

English: ‘Now to you, O profane, wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come, whose iniquity shall end
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ pơtao Isơrael pơm kơnê̆ kư̆ kă, năr ih truh boih kơ năr tôch wă phak.

English: thus says the Lord GOD: “Remove the turban, and take off the crown; Nothing shall remain the same. Exalt the humble, and humble the exalted.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yaih bĕ nhiêu đơ̆ng kơ̆l, plôh bĕ môk pơtao, tơdrong dang ei ưh pă thoi sơ̆ boih! Bơngai kơđeh hơtŏk bĕ tơ kơjung, bơngai kơjung tơjur bĕ tơ ala.

English: Overthrown, overthrown, I will make it overthrown! It shall be no longer, Until He comes whose right it is, And I will give it to Him.” ’
Bahnar: Răm đĭ, răm đĭ, Inh gô pơrăm đĭ; tơdrong âu kư̆m ưh pă truh dơ̆ng bơih, dĭng truh tơ yŏng Tơ'ngla tơpăt hơnơ̆ng truh wă sek tơlang. Inh gô pơjao ăn kơ Sư tơdrong noh.

English: “And you, son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD concerning the Ammonites and concerning their reproach,’ and say: ‘A sword, a sword is drawn, Polished for slaughter, For consuming, for flashing
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ: Kră Yang khan thoi âu kơ adrĕch adrung Ammôn gah tơdrong lu sư che bơle kơ kon pơlei Isơrael. Athei khan kơ lu sư: Pla đao đe toh boih wă pơlôch. Đe pơiel rang thoi kơmlat.

English: While they see false visions for you, While they divine a lie to you, To bring you on the necks of the wicked, the slain Whose day has come, Whose iniquity shall end.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh hơlĕnh, hlang lăng tơdrong glăi ăn kơ lu iĕm, Đe dan đao tơ hơko lu iĕm pơm kơnê̆ krưp, lu iĕm mă năr lu sư truh boih. Truh boih kơ năr wă phak.

English: ‘Return it to its sheath. I will judge you In the place where you were created, In the land of your nativity.
Bahnar: Tah bĕ đao lăm hơnglop! Lăm anih mă pơjing ih sơ̆, lăm char mă 'bok yă ih, Inh gô sek tơlang ih.

English: I will pour out My indignation on you; I will blow against you with the fire of My wrath, And deliver you into the hands of brutal men who are skillful to destroy.
Bahnar: Inh gô tuh tơdrong hil mĭl Inh tơ ih; Inh gô soh ŭnh tơdrong Inh blĕk tơ ih păng Inh gô pơjao ih ăn kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆, juăt kơ pơrăm đe.

English: You shall be fuel for the fire; Your blood shall be in the midst of the land. You shall not be remembered, For I the LORD have spoken.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih thoi 'long ŭnh wă tơkuh, pham ih gô lĕch lăm teh, ưh pă bu 'blŏk kơ ih dơ̆ng; yua kơ Inh Kră Yang khan thoi noh.’ ”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Now, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? Yes, show her all her abominations!
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, hăm trŏ ih wă sek tơlang, sek tơlang pơlei pơlôch tuh pham noh ưh? Athei ăn kơ lu sư băt tôm yoch kơnê̆ krưp sư.

English: Then say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “The city sheds blood in her own midst, that her time may come; and she makes idols within herself to defile herself.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ sư: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Minh pôm pơlei pơm tuh pham lăm sư, Pơlei pơm lu rup yang pơ'mê̆ kơdih akâu; năr tôch sư truh bơih.

English: You have become guilty by the blood which you have shed, and have defiled yourself with the idols which you have made. You have caused your days to draw near, and have come to the end of your years; therefore I have made you a reproach to the nations, and a mockery to all countries.
Bahnar: Ih pơm yoch boih tuh pham pơlôch đe păng pơm lu rup yang pơ'mê̆ kơdih akâu. Thoi noh năr ih wă truh boih păng sơnăm ih jê̆ tôch boih. Lei na Inh pơm kơ ih mơlâu kơ lu kon pơlei đe che bơle tơ jơ̆p dêh char.

English: Those near and those far from you will mock you as infamous and full of tumult.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei jê̆ păng oei ataih gô che bơle pơjăm ih, minh pôm pơlei đe roi sa dêh tơjrông tơjrang.

English: “Look, the princes of Israel: each one has used his power to shed blood in you.
Bahnar: To, lu yŏng Pơgơ̆r Isơrael oei lăm ih, rim 'nu yua tơdrong pran kơtang kơdih pơm tuh pham pơlôch đe.

English: In you they have made light of father and mother; in your midst they have oppressed the stranger; in you they have mistreated the fatherless and the widow.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm ih đei bơngai, pơjăm mĕ 'bă; pơgŏ pơđep lu tơmoi; pơjuă lu kon mơti pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai adro.

English: You have despised My holy things and profaned My Sabbaths.
Bahnar: Ih pơjăm tơmam rơgoh Inh păng pơm yoch kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lăm năr Sa'bat Inh!

English: In you are men who slander to cause bloodshed; in you are those who eat on the mountains; in your midst they commit lewdness.
Bahnar: Lăm ih đei bơngai chă đon hơlĕnh chă pơlôch tuh pham, sa tơmam đe soi kơ yang tơ kơpal kông; arih sa pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: In you men uncover their fathers’ nakedness; in you they violate women who are set apart during their impurity.
Bahnar: Lăm ih đei bơngai 'bĭch hăm akăn 'bă sư; đei bơngai pơm kơnê̆ hăm drŏ-kăn kơplah oei 'bôh hơbĕn.

English: One commits abomination with his neighbor’s wife; another lewdly defiles his daughter-in-law; and another in you violates his sister, his father’s daughter.
Bahnar: Lăm ih đei bơngai pơm yoch ngôi kư̆ kă hăm akăn đe; lu bơngai nai pơm kư̆ kă hăm mŏ mai sư, đei mơ'nah ngôi hăm oh drŏ-kăn sư kon 'bă sư pơjing mĕ pha.

English: In you they take bribes to shed blood; you take usury and increase; you have made profit from your neighbors by extortion, and have forgotten Me,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lăm ih đei bơngai iŏk sa pơgâm wă pơm tơdrong đei tuh pham, ăn đe tŏk iŏk đei iŏk lơi adrol păng iŏk jên kon lơ dêh; ih pơjuă sa lu bơngai jê̆ ih păng ih hiơt kơ Inh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Behold, therefore, I beat My fists at the dishonest profit which you have made, and at the bloodshed which has been in your midst.
Bahnar: Inh gô tap ti hil, kơ tơdrong ih iŏk sa lơi dêh păng pơlôch lơ bơngai lăm lu iĕm.

English: Can your heart endure, or can your hands remain strong, in the days when I shall deal with you? I, the LORD, have spoken, and will do it.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m ih hăm kơjăp, ti ih hăm pran ưh lăm năr Inh sek tơlang ih? Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh hlôi pơma boih Inh gô pơm.

English: I will scatter you among the nations, disperse you throughout the countries, and remove your filthiness completely from you.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ iĕm tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ teh đak păng Inh gô săi tơraih iĕm tơ jơ̆p lăm khŭl adrĕch adrung nai păng Inh gô pơgoh lê̆ tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach đơ̆ng iĕm.

English: You shall defile yourself in the sight of the nations; then you shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Đe gô pơjăm ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu teh đak nai, kơplah noh ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: The word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to Me; they are all bronze, tin, iron, and lead, in the midst of a furnace; they have become dross from silver.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, hăm Inh adrĕch Isơrael noh jing iă đe tŭk đĭ-đăng lu sư jing kong, kem, bơsei, bơlơ̆k lăm ŭnh, jing iă hu đe tŭk.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Because you have all become dross, therefore behold, I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ lu iĕm đĭ-đăng jing iă lu kem, hu âu, Inh gô akŭm lu iĕm tơ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: As men gather silver, bronze, iron, lead, and tin into the midst of a furnace, to blow fire on it, to melt it; so I will gather you in My anger and in My fury, and I will leave you there and melt you.
Bahnar: Nhen thoi đe akŭm lu hu, kong, bơsei, bơlơ̆k, kem rŭk lăm ŭnh 'buh rơ̆ wă kơ lek thoi yơ, na lăm tơdrong hil păng tơdrong Inh mil, Inh gô akŭm lu iĕm tah lăm ŭnh 'buh rơ̆ wă kơ lek thoi noh.

English: Yes, I will gather you and blow on you with the fire of My wrath, and you shall be melted in its midst.
Bahnar: Inh gô akŭm pơpôi lu iĕm 'buh lăm ŭnh tơdrong Inh hil mĭl, na lu iĕm gô lek lăm noh.

English: As silver is melted in the midst of a furnace, so shall you be melted in its midst; then you shall know that I, the LORD, have poured out My fury on you.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi hu lek lăm ŭnh thoi yơ, na lu iĕm kư̆m gô lek lăm noh thoi noh mơ̆n, na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang mă tuh boih tơdrong Inh hil mĭl tơ lu iĕm.’ ”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, say to her: ‘You are a land that is not cleansed or rained on in the day of indignation.’
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, khan bĕ kơ teh đak. ‘E jing teh đak ưh kơ goh, ưh kơ đei 'mi tih lăm năr Inh hil’.

English: The conspiracy of her prophets in her midst is like a roaring lion tearing the prey; they have devoured people; they have taken treasure and precious things; they have made many widows in her midst.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol lăm lu iĕm đei pơgơ̆p băl nhen thoi dăm-brang grĕnh hơrum sa tơmam đêl lu sư rôp. Lu sư châu sa bơngai, tơtông iŏk lu mŭk tơmam gĭt, pơm kơ lơ bơngai drŏ-kăn jing adro po lăm pơlei.

English: Her priests have violated My law and profaned My holy things; they have not distinguished between the holy and unholy, nor have they made known the difference between the unclean and the clean; and they have hidden their eyes from My Sabbaths, so that I am profaned among them.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi pơm glăi kơ khôi juăt Inh, pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ tơmam rơgoh Inh. Lu sư ưh kơ băt lăng ayơ rơgoh, ayơ hmă, ưh kơ băt bơtho tơ'bôh ayơ 'mê̆-'mach, ayơ rơgoh. Lu sư tep măt ưh kơ kiơ̆ lu năr Sa'bat Inh, lei na pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ Inh boih lăm lu sư.

English: Her princes in her midst are like wolves tearing the prey, to shed blood, to destroy people, and to get dishonest gain.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r oei lăm lu sư nhen thoi kŏ-so kăp sa sem bri, pơm tuh pham pơlôch bơngai, wă tơgar iŏk tơmam.

English: Her prophets plastered them with untempered mortar, seeing false visions, and divining lies for them, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD,’ when the LORD had not spoken.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol lu sư ôn tơdrong pơm kơ đe pik kơ lu sư chŭr; 'bôh tơdrong 'bôh hơlĕnh păng hlang lăng hơlĕnh, lu sư khan: Kră Yang khan thoi noh. Mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ khan ôh.

English: The people of the land have used oppressions, committed robbery, and mistreated the poor and needy; and they wrongfully oppress the stranger.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei oei lăm teh đak pơjuă sa băl, tơtông tơgar iŏk, pơjuă pơđep lu bơngai dơnuh hin pơmat-tat, păng pơjuă pơđep lu bơngai tơmoi ưh pă ăn kơ lu sư đei tơdrong tơpăt.

English: So I sought for a man among them who would make a wall, and stand in the gap before Me on behalf of the land, that I should not destroy it; but I found no one.
Bahnar: Inh chă lăng minh 'nu bơngai lăm lu sư, wă man pơdơ̆ng ming dur, wă kơ tơplih kơ pơlei, lăm teh đak păng dơ̆ng chĭt bơlôh dur 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, wă kơ Inh huay kơ pơrăm teh đak lu sư; mă-lei Inh chă ưh kơ đei bu.

English: Therefore I have poured out My indignation on them; I have consumed them with the fire of My wrath; and I have recompensed their deeds on their own heads,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Na Inh tuh tơdrong hil mĭl tơ lu sư păng iŏk ŭnh Inh hil soh pơrăm lu sư; Inh gô pơm tơwih tuh tơ kơ̆l lu sư, kiơ̆ kơ trong lu sư pơm. Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: The word of the LORD came again to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, there were two women, The daughters of one mother.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, đei 'bar 'nu drŏ-kăn, đơ̆ng minh pôm mĕ. Pơjing.

English: They committed harlotry in Egypt, They committed harlotry in their youth; Their breasts were there embraced, Their virgin bosom was there pressed.
Bahnar: Bre sư pơm đi lăm char Êyiptơ, bre sư pơm đi đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p tơ noh, toh bre sư đe chơpĕt, tơ noh tơdrong hơdruh 'lơ̆ng hơnĭl bre sư đe pơhiah lê̆.

English: Their names: Oholah the elder and Oholibah her sister; They were Mine, And they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Samaria is Oholah, and Jerusalem is Oholibah.
Bahnar: Mŏ sư anăn Ôhôla păng oh sư anăn Ôhôliba. Lu sư gah Inh, đei pơjing kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn. Ôhôla noh jơ̆ pơlei Samari, păng Ôhôliba noh jơ̆ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: “Oholah played the harlot even though she was Mine; And she lusted for her lovers, the neighboring Assyrians
Bahnar: Ôhôla pơm đi kơplah mă sư oei gah Inh, sư hưch kơ pơyô sư bơngai Asiri, lu bơngai pơm linh.

English: Who were clothed in purple, Captains and rulers, All of them desirable young men, Horsemen riding on horses.
Bahnar: Hrŭk ao dreng hơdrih, yŏng pơgơ̆r linh tơdăm 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ. Linh hao aseh.

English: Thus she committed her harlotry with them, All of them choice men of Assyria; And with all for whom she lusted, With all their idols, she defiled herself.
Bahnar: Sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu bơngai noh, đĭ-đăng lu sư tơdăm 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ bơngai char Asiri; sư jao akâu sư kơdih jing 'mê̆-'mach hăm lu rup yang lu bơngai mă sư hưch wă.

English: She has never given up her harlotry brought from Egypt, For in her youth they had lain with her, Pressed her virgin bosom, And poured out their immorality upon her.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ lê̆ tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă mă sư pơtơm lu bơngai Êyiptơ, đơ̆ng sư oei 'lơ̆p đe 'bĭch hơdai hăm sư boih, đe pơm pơhiah lê̆ hơdruh hơnĭl sư păng tuh tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆ kơ sư.

English: “Therefore I have delivered her Into the hand of her lovers, Into the hand of the Assyrians, For whom she lusted.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh jao sư lăm ti lu bơngai sư hưch, noh lăm ti lu bơngai Asiri, lu bơngai mă sư hơyuh hưch dêh.

English: They uncovered her nakedness, Took away her sons and daughters, And slew her with the sword; She became a byword among women, For they had executed judgment on her.
Bahnar: Lu sư plôh lê̆ hơbĕn ao sư, rôp lu kon drŏ-kăn kon drŏ-nglo sư, na iŏk đao pơlôch sư. Đe phak pơmat sư, sư boih lăm lu drŏ-kăn mă đe roi sa.

English: “Now although her sister Oholibah saw this, she became more corrupt in her lust than she, and in her harlotry more corrupt than her sister’s harlotry.
Bahnar: Oh drŏ-kăn sư Ôhôliba 'bôh thoi noh boih na roi pơm đi kư̆ kă hloh kơ mŏ sư.

English: “She lusted for the neighboring Assyrians, Captains and rulers, Clothed most gorgeously, Horsemen riding on horses, All of them desirable young men.
Bahnar: Sư hưch kơ lu bơngai Asiri, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu yŏng linh, lu linh hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng, lu linh hao aseh, đĭ-đăng lu tơdăm 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ.

English: Then I saw that she was defiled; Both took the same way.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh sư pơm pơ'mê̆ kơdih akâu, 'bar 'nu bre mŏ oh rok kiơ̆ minh trong.

English: But she increased her harlotry; She looked at men portrayed on the wall, Images of Chaldeans portrayed in vermilion
Bahnar: Sư pơm pơyô rai hloh dơ̆ng sư 'bôh rup lu bơngai drŏ-nglo đe chhơ̆ tơ dur pơlei, rup lu yŏng pơgơ̆r char Kalđê đe chhơ̆ hăm đak 'brê

English: Girded with belts around their waists, Flowing turbans on their heads, All of them looking like captains, In the manner of the Babylonians of Chaldea, The land of their nativity.
Bahnar: tơ̆n tơlei tơ̆n tơ kơiĕng păng chô̆ che tơ kơ̆l hyôi hyai, đĭ-đăng lu sư lăng rŏ thoi yŏng linh gre aseh bơngai Babilôn, đơ̆ng char Kalđê

English: As soon as her eyes saw them, She lusted for them And sent messengers to them in Chaldea.
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'bôh lu linh noh, sư hưch dêh, athei bơngai năm truh tơ lu sư lăm char Kađê.

English: “Then the Babylonians came to her, into the bed of love, And they defiled her with their immorality; So she was defiled by them, and alienated herself from them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Babilôn truh 'bĭch hơdai sư. Pơm kơ sư jing 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ pơm đi kơnê̆ hăm lu sư, sư kư̆m pơm pơ'mê̆ akâu kơdih, bơ̆l hăl boih sư weh tơ nai.

English: She revealed her harlotry and uncovered her nakedness. Then I alienated Myself from her, As I had alienated Myself from her sister.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư pơdah ngôi kư̆ kă, tơ'bôh tơdrong koh hoh sư, na Inh achăng lê̆ sư, thoi Inh achăng lê̆ mŏ sư.

English: “Yet she multiplied her harlotry In calling to remembrance the days of her youth, When she had played the harlot in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư kư̆m rai pơm đi kơnê̆ hloh, 'blŏk kơplah sư oei adruh mơlôh pơm đi ngôi kư̆ kă lăm char Êyiptơ.

English: For she lusted for her paramours, Whose flesh is like the flesh of donkeys, And whose issue is like the issue of horses.
Bahnar: Sư hưch wă kơ lu bơngai pơm pơyô hăm sư, lu bơngai noh pơm pơyô pran nhen thoi aseh iĕ tơno, pơm đi kơnê̆ thoi aseh tơno tih.

English: Thus you called to remembrance the lewdness of your youth, When the Egyptians pressed your bosom Because of your youthful breasts.
Bahnar: Sư 'blŏk rŏ kơ oei ngôi kư̆ kă thoi kơplah sư oei adruh mơlôh lăm char Êyiptơ. Đe ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă hăm sư păng chơpĕt toh sư oei adruh mơlôh.

English: “Therefore, Oholibah, thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Behold, I will stir up your lovers against you, From whom you have alienated yourself, And I will bring them against you from every side
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ơ Ôhôliba, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Âu, Inh pơtrŭt lu bơngai mă ih hưch, lu bơngai ih weh achăng lê̆ gô blah ih, Inh gô chông ba lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ tơring năm tơ ih

English: The Babylonians, All the Chaldeans, Pekod, Shoa, Koa, All the Assyrians with them, All of them desirable young men, Governors and rulers, Captains and men of renown, All of them riding on horses.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Babilôn, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Kalđê, đơ̆ng lu pơlei Pêkôt, Soa păng Koa, păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Asiri, hơdai hăm lu sư, tơdăm 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ. Đei lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, yŏng lu linh, lu linh hao aseh, lu linh gre aseh, đĭ-đăng lu sư hao aseh.

English: And they shall come against you With chariots, wagons, and war-horses, With a horde of people. They shall array against you Buckler, shield, and helmet all around. ‘I will delegate judgment to them, And they shall judge you according to their judgments.
Bahnar: Lu sư đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m chĕp ba gre aseh tơblah, gre chơ tơmam, hăm lu linh lơ năm blah ih. Lu sư yua khêl, yơ̆l môk kơlăm năm blah ih đơ̆ng rim tơring. Inh gô pơjao ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong gơh sek tơlang păng lu sư gô sek tơlang ih kiơ̆ kơ khôi juăt lu sư.

English: I will set My jealousy against you, And they shall deal furiously with you; They shall remove your nose and your ears, And your remnant shall fall by the sword; They shall take your sons and your daughters, And your remnant shall be devoured by fire.
Bahnar: Inh gô blĕk gar hil blah ih, lu sư gô pơm kơ ih hăm tơdrong hil dêh. Lu sư gô kăt muh păng đon ih; lu bơngai oei arih gô lôch kơ đao. Lu sư gô rôp kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn ih; lu bơngai oei arih ŭnh gô sa đĭ.

English: They shall also strip you of your clothes And take away your beautiful jewelry.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô plôh hơbĕn ao ih, lu sư gô iŏk đĭ tơmam pơguăng gĭt đơ̆ng ih.

English: ‘Thus I will make you cease your lewdness and your harlotry Brought from the land of Egypt, So that you will not lift your eyes to them, Nor remember Egypt anymore.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ tơdrong ih pơm đi păng pơm pơyô kư̆ kă mă ih đei chĕp ba đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, wă kơ ih ưh pă 'maih ngơk lăng păng ưh pă 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ lu sư tơ char Êyiptơ.

English: “For thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Surely I will deliver you into the hand of those you hate, into the hand of those from whom you alienated yourself.
Bahnar: Na 'nâu Kră Yang khan: “Âu, Inh gô pơjao ih lăm ti lu bơngai mă ih areh, lăm ti lu bơngai mă jơhngơ̆m ih ơh klai.

English: They will deal hatefully with you, take away all you have worked for, and leave you naked and bare. The nakedness of your harlotry shall be uncovered, both your lewdness and your harlotry.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô iŏk tơdrong areh pơm kơ ih, tơgar iŏk đĭ dôm tơmam đơ̆ng ih jang, lê̆ ih koh hoh, đĭ tơdrong ih koh hoh, ngôi kư̆ kă gô tơ'bôh pơdah tơ 'nguaih.

English: I will do these things to you because you have gone as a harlot after the Gentiles, because you have become defiled by their idols.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh gô truh kơ ih, yua kơ ih pơm đi ngôi kư̆ kă hăm kon pơlei lăm lu dêh char. Ih pơm pơ'mê̆ kơdih akâu hăm rup yang lu sư.

English: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore I will put her cup in your hand.’
Bahnar: Ih kiơ̆ bơih trong mŏ ih; thoi noh Inh gô ăn pơnhan sư nhă lăm ti ih.”

English: “Thus says the Lord GOD: ‘You shall drink of your sister’s cup, The deep and wide one; You shall be laughed to scorn And held in derision; It contains much.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Ih gô nhă pơnhan mŏ ih; pơnhan jrŭ păng să, ih gô jing bơngai đe hiĕk che bơle păng pơjăm yua kơ pơnhan noh mong lơ.

English: You will be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, The cup of horror and desolation, The cup of your sister Samaria.
Bahnar: Ih gô suai dêh păng sơ'ngon; pơnhan mŏ ih kon pơlei Samari, jing pơnhan mă hli păng krưp dêh.

English: You shall drink and drain it, You shall break its shards, And tear at your own breasts; For I have spoken,’ Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Ih gô huch pơnhan noh dĭng hrơ̆ đĭ teh pơchah pơnhan noh dĭng hĕch hoch păng iŏk chrek toh ih. Inh Kră Yang đei khan boih, thoi noh.

English: “Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Because you have forgotten Me and cast Me behind your back, Therefore you shall bear the penalty Of your lewdness and your harlotry.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ ih hiơt kơ Inh, hŭt lê̆ Inh tơ rŏng, thoi noh ih chu pŭ tơdrong phak lăm tơdrong ih pơm đi, pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.”

English: The LORD also said to me: “Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then declare to them their abominations.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih gô sek tơlang ưh kơ Ôhôla păng Ôhôliba? Athei roi pơdah kơ lu sư băt tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lu sư.

English: For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands. They have committed adultery with their idols, and even sacrificed their sons whom they bore to Me, passing them through the fire, to devour them.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm yoch pơm pơyô kư̆ kă păng ti lu sư 'bơm pham; lu sư pơm yoch ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu rup yang; păng pơyơ̆r kon lu sư, kon mă lu sư tơpŭ ăn kơ Inh, pơm tơmam sa ăn kơ rup yang.

English: Moreover they have done this to Me: They have defiled My sanctuary on the same day and profaned My Sabbaths.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m oei đei pơm yoch tih hloh kơ noh hăm Inh lu sư pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ anih rơgoh Inh păng kư̆m pơm yoch lăm năr Sa'bat Inh.

English: For after they had slain their children for their idols, on the same day they came into My sanctuary to profane it; and indeed thus they have done in the midst of My house.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơlôch kon sư kơdih pơyơ̆r kơ rup yang; lăm năr noh lu sư kư̆m mơ̆t lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh na pơm tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach. Noh tơdrong lu sư pơm boih kơ hnam Inh!

English: “Furthermore you sent for men to come from afar, to whom a messenger was sent; and there they came. And you washed yourself for them, painted your eyes, and adorned yourself with ornaments.
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng lu sư chă krao lu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng ataih, to lu sư truh boih; yua kơ sư noh na ih hum hơrao, pik muh măt păng pơhrôp pơguăng ih kơdih.

English: You sat on a stately couch, with a table prepared before it, on which you had set My incense and My oil.
Bahnar: Ih ngôi kơpal giơng 'lơ̆ng rŏ, dan minh tŏ gơ'bang 'bơ̆t anăp đei đak pơgang 'bâu phu Inh noh.

English: The sound of a carefree multitude was with her, and Sabeans were brought from the wilderness with men of the common sort, who put bracelets on their wrists and beautiful crowns on their heads.
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r ôr jreo tơkĕch hiôk-hian đơ̆ng tơpôl bơngai lơ păng bơngai juăt kơ suai đơ̆ng char glă, hơdai hăm lu bơngai hmă. Lu sư tơ'bot kong 'bơ̆t ti lu bơngai drŏ-kăn păng pơyơ̆l môk pơtao 'lơ̆ng tơ kơpal kơ̆l.

English: Then I said concerning her who had grown old in adulteries, ‘Will they commit harlotry with her now, and she with them?’
Bahnar: Na Inh pơma 'bơm bơngai drŏ-kăn kră boih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă noh: Dang ei lu sư oei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm sư ưh?

English: Yet they went in to her, as men go in to a woman who plays the harlot; thus they went in to Oholah and Oholibah, the lewd women.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tơ anih sư nhen thoi năm tơ anih pơm đi, na lu sư năm tơ Ôhôla păng Ôhôliba 'bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: But righteous men will judge them after the manner of adulteresses, and after the manner of women who shed blood, because they are adulteresses, and blood is on their hands.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dôm lu bơngai tơpăt gô sek tơlang tơdrong lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă păng tuh pham pơlôch đe, tơpă lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă păng tuh pham pơlôch đe.”

English: “For thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Bring up an assembly against them, give them up to trouble and plunder.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Chông lơ bơngai năm pơm kơ lu sư bĕ, pơjao lu sư ăn kơ tơdrong hli păng đe plah tơgar iŏk.

English: The assembly shall stone them with stones and execute them with their swords; they shall slay their sons and their daughters, and burn their houses with fire.
Bahnar: Tơpôl lơ noh gô klơ̆m tơmo tơ lu sư păng iŏk đao 'bet lu sư, pơlôch kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư, iŏk ŭnh soh hnam lu sư.

English: Thus I will cause lewdness to cease from the land, that all women may be taught not to practice your lewdness.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă lăm teh đak âu, wă kơ đĭ-đăng drŏ-kăn gơh băt ưh pă pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă thoi lu iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: They shall repay you for your lewdness, and you shall pay for your idolatrous sins. Then you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Iĕm gô pŭ tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă iĕm; lu iĕm gô pŭ tơdrong phak yua kơ kơkuh kơ rup yang, na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Again, in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm tăl mă tơsĭn, 'năr mơjĭt khei mơjĭt, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, write down the name of the day, this very day—the king of Babylon started his siege against Jerusalem this very day.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, chih bĕ năr âu, yua kơ trŏ kơ năr âu, pơtao Babilôn wang pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And utter a parable to the rebellious house, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Put on a pot, set it on, And also pour water into it.
Bahnar: Pơma bĕ nơ̆r pơtih gia kơ lu adrĕch arăng kơ̆l noh; Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Hơtŏk bĕ gŏ păng tuh đak.

English: Gather pieces of meat in it, Every good piece, The thigh and the shoulder. Fill it with choice cuts
Bahnar: Tah 'nhĕm sĕch lăm gŏ đĭ-đăng 'nhĕm 'lơ̆ng, sĕch blu păng sĕch hơngiĕng, tah 'bĕnh kơ gŏ lu kơting 'lơ̆ng.

English: Take the choice of the flock. Also pile fuel bones under it, Make it boil well, And let the cuts simmer in it.”
Bahnar: Athei rôp iŏk sem dơrong ayơ mă 'lơ̆ng hloh lăm khŭl, dan kơting pơm 'long ŭnh ala kơ gŏ. Rơ̆ sư mă tŏ blôk kư̆m rơ̆ hơtŭk kơting lăm gŏ noh.’”

English: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Woe to the bloody city, To the pot whose scum is in it, And whose scum is not gone from it! Bring it out piece by piece, On which no lot has fallen.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Răm-'băm kơ lu pơlei đei tuh pham, pơlei noh thoi gŏ đĭ gơsang sa, gơsang ôp pă tơkloh boih! Athei iŏk minh hlak minh hlak ưh pă ngĕ kơ rơih iŏk kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: For her blood is in her midst; She set it on top of a rock; She did not pour it on the ground, To cover it with dust.
Bahnar: Pham oei đom lăm pơlei noh, yua kơ lu sư pơlôch đe tuh pham tơ kơpal tơmo blat; ưh kơ tuh lê̆ pham lăm teh wă kơ 'mui teh klơ̆p lê̆ đĭ.

English: That it may raise up fury and take vengeance, I have set her blood on top of a rock, That it may not be covered.”
Bahnar: Inh lê̆ pham tuh tơ kơpal tơmo blat wă ưh kơ đei kiơ klơ̆p, wă kơ Inh 'bôh hil mĭl păng pơm mong.

English: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Woe to the bloody city! I too will make the pyre great.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan: “Răm-'băm kơ pơlei đei tuh pham! Inh gô akŭm 'long ŭnh lơ hloh.

English: Heap on the wood, Kindle the fire; Cook the meat well, Mix in the spices, And let the cuts be burned up.
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ 'long ŭnh mă lơ wă kơ tơkuh ŭnh, pai 'nhĕm mă klĭ bluch, tah thim tơmam wă 'băt păng lê̆ ŭnh sa đĭ kơting.

English: “Then set the pot empty on the coals, That it may become hot and its bronze may burn, That its filthiness may be melted in it, That its scum may be consumed.
Bahnar: Dan bĕ gŏ hoh kơpal ŭnh ngar wă kơ gŏ blôk tŏ, wă kơ mam kong ngur păng wă kơ sang-sa goh đĭ.

English: She has grown weary with lies, And her great scum has not gone from her. Let her scum be in the fire!
Bahnar: Pih pang gleh hrat đĕch; gơsang sa hơ'bơ̆l oei ưh kơ tơkloh đĭ đơ̆ng lăm gŏ, mă dan 'buh lăm ŭnh ră!

English: In your filthiness is lewdness. Because I have cleansed you, and you were not cleansed, You will not be cleansed of your filthiness anymore, Till I have caused My fury to rest upon you.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, Inh wă ôp rơgoh ih, mă-lei ih ưh kơ wă tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach ih ôp rơgoh, lei ih ưh pă gơh ôp rơgoh bơih dĭng layơ tơdrong inh hil ngach 'mơ̆i.

English: I, the LORD, have spoken it; It shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not hold back, Nor will I spare, Nor will I relent; According to your ways And according to your deeds They will judge you,” Says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh bơih Kră Yang, đei khan dôm tơdrong noh gô truh, Inh gô pơm. Inh ưh kơ gơ̆t lê̆ ti, ưh kơ hmach, ưh kơ tơplih. Inh gô sek kiơ̆ kơ trong ih năm păng kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang ih, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Also the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, behold, I take away from you the desire of your eyes with one stroke; yet you shall neither mourn nor weep, nor shall your tears run down.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, âu, Inh wă jê̆ iŏk lê̆ tơdrong chơt hiôk đơ̆ng măt ih; mă-lei ih 'nĕ kơ ơh sơ'ngon; 'nĕ pă nhơ̆m păng 'nĕ kơ lĕch đak măt.

English: Sigh in silence, make no mourning for the dead; bind your turban on your head, and put your sandals on your feet; do not cover your lips, and do not eat man’s bread of sorrow.”
Bahnar: Hmoi bĕ, mă-lei 'nĕ kơ ôr re, 'nĕ pă hmoi ơh kơ bơngai lôch; chô̆ bĕ che tơ kơ̆l, 'bot bĕ chơkhŏ ih. 'Nĕ kơ gom 'bơ̆r ih păng 'nĕ sa 'bĕng đơ̆ng lu bơngai năm hơpong pơlung.”

English: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and at evening my wife died; and the next morning I did as I was commanded.
Bahnar: Na pơgê inh pơma hăm lu kon pơlei; truh kơsơ̆ akăn inh lôch. Pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng inh pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r khan boih kơ inh.

English: And the people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things signify to us, that you behave so?”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei khan kơ inh: “Ih ưh kơ roi tơbăt ăn kơ lu nhôn tơdrong mă ih pơm thoi noh wă khan kiơ?

English: Then I answered them, “The word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu sư: “Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: ‘Speak to the house of Israel, “Thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Behold, I will profane My sanctuary, your arrogant boast, the desire of your eyes, the delight of your soul; and your sons and daughters whom you left behind shall fall by the sword.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ adrĕch Isơrael: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Âu, Inh gô pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, noh anih kơđông kơjăp lu iĕm gơnang, tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ măt lu iĕm. Jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm 'maih wă. Kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu iĕm mă lê̆ bơih gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao.

English: And you shall do as I have done; you shall not cover your lips nor eat man’s bread of sorrow.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô pơm thoi inh hlôi pơm; lu iĕm ưh kơ gom 'bơ̆r păng 'nĕ sa 'bĕng lu bơngai năm hơpong pơlung.

English: Your turbans shall be on your heads and your sandals on your feet; you shall neither mourn nor weep, but you shall pine away in your iniquities and mourn with one another.
Bahnar: Chô̆ bĕ che tơ kơ̆l, 'bot bĕ chơkhŏ; 'nĕ pă hmoi ơh, 'nĕ pă nhơ̆m; mă-lei gô ơh sơ'ngon jing hơkĕ kơ tơdrong yoch kơdih păng lu iĕm gô sơ'ngon hơdai.

English: Thus Ezekiel is a sign to you; according to all that he has done you shall do; and when this comes, you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Êsêkiên jing tơdra kơ lu iĕm, tơdrong mă sư hlôi pơm boih, lu iĕm gô pơm thoi noh. Tơdah tơdrong 'nâu truh, kơplah noh lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘And you, son of man—will it not be in the day when I take from them their stronghold, their joy and their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that on which they set their minds, their sons and their daughters
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, lăm năr Inh gô iŏk lê̆ kơđông kơjăp lu sư, tơdrong chơt hiôk, tơdrong ư-ang, tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ măt lu sư, tơdrong jơhngơ̆m lu sư hơpơi wă hăm kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư

English: that on that day one who escapes will come to you to let you hear it with your ears?
Bahnar: lăm năr noh gô đei bơngai klaih hlôi năm roi tơbăt kơ ih.

English: On that day your mouth will be opened to him who has escaped; you shall speak and no longer be mute. Thus you will be a sign to them, and they shall know that I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Năr noh, 'bơ̆r ih gô pơih pơma hăm bơngai mă kơdâu hlôi noh, ih ưh pă kơmlo dơ̆ng; ih jing pơm tơdra kơ lu sư păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.”

English: The word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, set your face against the Ammonites, and prophesy against them.
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, tơwih bĕ muh măt gah kon pơlei Ammôn păng khan lê̆ adrol blah lu sư.

English: Say to the Ammonites, ‘Hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because you said, ‘Aha!’ against My sanctuary when it was profaned, and against the land of Israel when it was desolate, and against the house of Judah when they went into captivity
Bahnar: Athei khan kơ kon pơlei Ammôn: Athei mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang. Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ ih đei che bơle khan: “Aha!” Kơ anih rơgoh Inh kơplah đe pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ sư, kơ dêh char Isơrael kơplah sư đĭ juơ, kơ adrĕch Juđa kơplah lu sư đe rôp pơm bơnă

English: indeed, therefore, I will deliver you as a possession to the men of the East, and they shall set their encampments among you and make their dwellings among you; they shall eat your fruit, and they shall drink your milk.
Bahnar: na Inh gô pơjao ih kơ lu adrĕch adrung gah hơlĕch yua pơm tơmam sư. Lu sư gô pơm anih tơ lăm ih; păng oei tơ noh; lu sư gô phĕ sa plei 'long ih păng nhă đak toh ih.

English: And I will make Rabbah a stable for camels and Ammon a resting place for flocks. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn pơlei Raba jing tơmăn 'nhĕt ăn kơ seh lăk-đa păng đĭ-đăng pơlei lu bơngai Ammôn pơm anih lu sem dơrong oei pơdơh na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘For thus says the Lord GOD: “Because you clapped your hands, stamped your feet, and rejoiced in heart with all your disdain for the land of Israel
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ ih tap ti, kơtrơ̆m jơ̆ng, jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk 'nă hal păng pơjăm pơjuă teh đak Isơrael

English: indeed, therefore, I will stretch out My hand against you, and give you as plunder to the nations; I will cut you off from the peoples, and I will cause you to perish from the countries; I will destroy you, and you shall know that I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: na âu, Inh gô hiŏng ti phak ih, Inh gô pơjao ih kơ lu teh đak thoi tơmam đe tơtông tơgar, Inh gô puh tơweh ih đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei; inh gô pơlôch ih đơ̆ng lu teh đak. Inh gô pơrăm ih păng ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.’ ”

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because Moab and Seir say, ‘Look! The house of Judah is like all the nations,’
Bahnar: “Kră Yang khan thoi âu: ‘Môap păng Sêir đei khan: Âu lăng adrĕch Juđa kư̆m lei-lăi kơ char nai

English: therefore, behold, I will clear the territory of Moab of cities, of the cities on its frontier, the glory of the country, Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon, and Kirjathaim.
Bahnar: na, âu inh gô pơrăm char Môap păng lu pơlei lăm char lu sư dĭng truh tơ pơlei mă tuch-luch, noh pơlei Bêtjêsimôt, pơlei Baal Mêôn păng pơlei Kiriahaim.

English: To the men of the East I will give it as a possession, together with the Ammonites, that the Ammonites may not be remembered among the nations.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjao char Môap hăm lu bơngai Ammôn ăn kơ lu bơngai char gah hơlĕch iŏk yua, thoi noh lu adrĕch adrung Ammôn đe ưh pă 'blŏk boih tơ lăm lu char.

English: And I will execute judgments upon Moab, and they shall know that I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: Inh gô phak lu Môap, na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.”

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because of what Edom did against the house of Judah by taking vengeance, and has greatly offended by avenging itself on them,”
Bahnar: “Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Yua kơ kon pơlei Eđôm pơm mong blah hăm lu adrĕch Juđa păng pơm yoch kơplah pơm 'mong blah lu sư.

English: therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “I will also stretch out My hand against Edom, cut off man and beast from it, and make it desolate from Teman; Dedan shall fall by the sword.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inh gô yơ̆r ti Inh phak char Eđôm gô pơlôch đĭ bơngai păng lu sem dơrong noh; Inh gô pơm kơ char noh jing juơ đơ̆ng pơlei Thêman truh tơ pơlei Đêđan, lu sư gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao.

English: I will lay My vengeance on Edom by the hand of My people Israel, that they may do in Edom according to My anger and according to My fury; and they shall know My vengeance,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh gô yua ti kon pơlei Isơrael Inh; pơm 'mong blah char Eđôm kon pơlei noh gô pơm kơ char Êđôm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Inh hil mĭl păng Inh blĕk. Na lu sư gô băt kơ tơdrong Inh pơm 'mong, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because the Philistines dealt vengefully and took vengeance with a spiteful heart, to destroy because of the old hatred,”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Yua kơ kon pơlei Philistin pơm 'mong, pơm 'mong kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m areh ưh kơ đĭ đơ̆ng sơ̆ ki sơ̆ kach wă pơrăm char Juđa

English: therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “I will stretch out My hand against the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites and destroy the remnant of the seacoast.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh gô yơ̆r ti phak Philistin; Inh gô tơhiong đĭ bơngai Kôrêthit; păng gô pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai mă oei arih tơter đak dơsĭ.

English: I will execute great vengeance on them with furious rebukes; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I lay My vengeance upon them.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô phak pơrăm hăm tơdrong hil mĭl tih, mưh Inh pơm mong blah lu sư, na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.”

English: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm tăl mơjĭt-mônh, năr blŭng-a lăm khei, Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, ‘Aha! She is broken who was the gateway of the peoples; now she is turned over to me; I shall be filled; she is laid waste.’
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, yua kơ pơlei Tirơ pơma 'bơm gah Jêrusalem: “Ah ha! 'Măng jang lu kon pơlei pơla pơchah đĭ boih! Sư pơih ăn kơ inh boih; inh gô rai tih să, na sư răm đĭ bơih.

English: “Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to come up.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Kră Yang khan: Ơ Tirơ! Âu, Inh wă phak ih. Inh gô ăn lơ teh đak iung blah ih, nhen thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă.

English: And they shall destroy the walls of Tyre and break down her towers; I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her like the top of a rock.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơrăm dur pơlei Tirơ păng teh pơchah lê̆ hnam gak kơjung. Inh gô hơpuih kôch pơgoh lu teh đơ̆ng lăm pơlei, lê̆ sư jing kông tơmo.

English: It shall be a place for spreading nets in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken,’ says the Lord GOD; ‘it shall become plunder for the nations.
Bahnar: Sư gô jing anih đe sơ̆k hơnhuăl tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ; yua kơ Kră Yang khan: Inh khan boih sư jing tơmam lu dêh char đe blah tơgar iŏk.

English: Also her daughter villages which are in the fields shall be slain by the sword. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.’
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei sư oei tơ chŭn mir đe gô pơlôch hăm đao; păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “For thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Behold, I will bring against Tyre from the north Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses, with chariots, and with horsemen, and an army with many people.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu, Inh gô chông Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m, pơtao kơ lu pơtao, hăm lu linh, lu linh hao aseh hăm lu linh hao gre aseh lơ, năm blah pơlei Tirơ.

English: He will slay with the sword your daughter villages in the fields; he will heap up a siege mound against you, build a wall against you, and raise a defense against you.
Bahnar: Sư gô yua đao pơlôch lu kon pơlei ih tơ lăm chŭn mir, Sư gô bơ̆ bơnơ̆ ter dur păng hiŏng khêl blah ih.

English: He will direct his battering rams against your walls, and with his axes he will break down your towers.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô yua gơ'beng bơsei pơrăm dur pơlei păng yua mut teh pơchah lu hnam gak kơjung ih.

English: Because of the abundance of his horses, their dust will cover you; your walls will shake at the noise of the horsemen, the wagons, and the chariots, when he enters your gates, as men enter a city that has been breached.
Bahnar: Aseh lu sư lơ tơpă dĭng mah 'mui teh đơ̆ng jơ̆ng sư yak klơ̆p đĭ ih thoi hơmơ̆l. Lu dur pơlei ih pơpơ̆ yua kơ đơ̆ng tơtơ̆ng jơ̆ng lu linh hao aseh, lu linh gre aseh lu sư gô mơ̆t rok 'măng jang ih, nhen thoi mơ̆t lăm pơlei dur đe pơrăm đĭ bơih.

English: With the hooves of his horses he will trample all your streets; he will slay your people by the sword, and your strong pillars will fall to the ground.
Bahnar: Kơchôp jơ̆ng aseh gô pơjuă pơrăm pơlei ih; lu sư gô pơlôch kon pơlei ih hăm đao, hăm lu jrăng kơjăp ih gô prưk păk tơ teh.

English: They will plunder your riches and pillage your merchandise; they will break down your walls and destroy your pleasant houses; they will lay your stones, your timber, and your soil in the midst of the water.
Bahnar: Khŭl lu linh gô blah tơgar iŏk mŭk tơmam ih, iŏk đĭ dôm tơmam ih đei, pơrăm đĭ dur pơlei; lu sư gô pơrăm anih hnam 'lơ̆ng ih păng klơ̆m lê̆ lu tơmo, 'long păng teh ih tơ lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: I will put an end to the sound of your songs, and the sound of your harps shall be heard no more.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ nơ̆r hơri ih kơtĕch, đe ưh pă kơtơ̆ng re brŏ dung ih dơ̆ng.

English: I will make you like the top of a rock; you shall be a place for spreading nets, and you shall never be rebuilt, for I the LORD have spoken,’ says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ ih jing tơmo ih gô jing anih đe sơ̆k hơnhuăl; ưh pă đei gơh man pơdơ̆ng ming dơ̆ng; yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang hlôi khan, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Thus says the Lord GOD to Tyre: ‘Will the coastlands not shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded cry, when slaughter is made in the midst of you?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ pơlei Tirơ thoi âu: Kơtơ̆ng tơdrong ih pơchah răm lu bơngai jĭ ôr tơngưih, kơplah đe oei pơlôch tơ lăm ih, lu bŏl đak kơtơ̆ng thoi noh lu sư gô ưh kơ hli tơtơ̆ hă?

English: Then all the princes of the sea will come down from their thrones, lay aside their robes, and take off their embroidered garments; they will clothe themselves with trembling; they will sit on the ground, tremble every moment, and be astonished at you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu yŏng lăm dêh char jê̆ đak dơsĭ, gô jur đơ̆ng tang-dŏ lu sư. Plôh ao tai păng hơleh hŭt lu ao reng. Lu sư pŭ iŏk tơdrong hli tơrơ păng oei tơ ala teh tơtơ̆. Lu sư gô hli yua kơ tơdrong truh tơ ih.

English: And they will take up a lamentation for you, and say to you: “How you have perished, O one inhabited by seafaring men, O renowned city, Who was strong at sea, She and her inhabitants, Who caused their terror to be on all her inhabitants!
Bahnar: Lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi kơ ih păng khan kơ ih: Ơ pơlei mă đei ư-ang liơ ih răm đĭ, pơlei lu bơngai mă oei tơ đak dơsĭ, ih păng lu kon pơlei ih oei kơjăp mơdrŏng lăm đak dơsĭ. Ih păng đĭ-đăng bơngai tơ noh pơm kơ đe hli.

English: Now the coastlands tremble on the day of your fall; Yes, the coastlands by the sea are troubled at your departure.” ’
Bahnar: Dang ei lu bơngai oei jih đak dơsĭ hli tơrơ lăm năr ih răm pơchah păng lu bŏl lăm đak dơsĭ tơtơ̆ tơtey yua kơ ih răm rai đĭ.

English: “For thus says the Lord GOD: ‘When I make you a desolate city, like cities that are not inhabited, when I bring the deep upon you, and great waters cover you
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Mưh Inh pơm kơ ih jing juơ tơtŭng, nhen thoi pơlei ưh kơ đei bơngai oei: Mưh Inh ba anih jrŭ păng đak tih lơ̆p ih

English: then I will bring you down with those who descend into the Pit, to the people of old, and I will make you dwell in the lowest part of the earth, in places desolate from antiquity, with those who go down to the Pit, so that you may never be inhabited; and I shall establish glory in the land of the living.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Inh gô tơjur ih tơ lăm sơlŭng jrŭ hơdai hăm kon pơlei oei chăl sơ̆. Inh gô ăn kơ ih oei tơ anih jrŭ lăm teh sŭng hơdai hăm lu bơngai răm rai chăl sơ̆. Thoi noh, na kon pơlei ưh pă đei oei lăm ih dơ̆ng; ih kư̆m ưh kơ đei oei lăm teh lu bơngai arih mơ̆n.

English: I will make you a terror, and you shall be no more; though you are sought for, you will never be found again,’ says the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Inh gô chông ih tơ anih đei tơdrong pơmat-tat, hli krưp. Ih gô ưh pă đei dơ̆ng; mă đe chă ih, pă 'bôh ih dơ̆ng. Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: The word of the LORD came again to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Now, son of man, take up a lamentation for Tyre
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ kơ pơlei Tirơ.

English: and say to Tyre, ‘You who are situated at the entrance of the sea, merchant of the peoples on many coastlands, thus says the Lord GOD: “O Tyre, you have said, ‘I am perfect in beauty.’
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ pơlei Tirơ: Ih jing pơlei oei trong 'măng jang đak dơsĭ, mơdro sa hăm lơ pơlei oei lăm bŏl dơsĭ: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ Tirơ, ih đei khan: Inh 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ tôm tĕch.

English: Your borders are in the midst of the seas. Your builders have perfected your beauty.
Bahnar: Anih teh ih tơ tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ; lu bơngai mă pơdơ̆ng pơjing ih pơm kơ ih jing 'lơ̆ng hơiă.

English: They made all your planks of fir trees from Senir; They took a cedar from Lebanon to make you a mast.
Bahnar: Đe yua tơ̆r 'long hơngo hmă đơ̆ng kông sênir pơm akâu thŏng-nan ih iŏk 'long hơngo đơ̆ng Liban pơm jrăng chô̆ che thŏng-nan ih

English: Of oaks from Bashan they made your oars; The company of Ashurites have inlaid your planks With ivory from the coasts of Cyprus.
Bahnar: iŏk 'long kôih đơ̆ng char 'Basan pơm 'long huơ̆r iŏk 'long hơngo hmă đơ̆ng bŏl dơsĭ Kitim lơ̆k hơnă, lom hăm bơla rôih.

English: Fine embroidered linen from Egypt was what you spread for your sail; Blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah was what covered you.
Bahnar: Che rơmuăn đei reng đơ̆ng Êyiptơ dăng pĕng kial, thoi hla-kơ, che pơm yơ̆p noh hăm che dreng jơk hơhĭm đơ̆ng bŏl đak dơsĭ Êlisa.

English: “Inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your oarsmen; Your wise men, O Tyre, were in you; They became your pilots.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Siđôn păng Arwat bơngai hơwơ̆r kơ ih; ơ pơlei Tirơ, lu bơngai hơgei lăm ih jing bơngai gơh huơ̆r oei hăm ih.

English: Elders of Gebal and its wise men Were in you to caulk your seams; All the ships of the sea And their oarsmen were in you To market your merchandise.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gơh hơmet păng lu bơngai hơgei đơ̆ng pơlei Gebal oei hơdai ih wă hơmet ming lu thŏng-nan răm. Đĭ-đăng lu thŏng-nan păng lu bơngai huơ̆r năm tơ ih, lăm chă mơdro tơplih băl tơmam.

English: “Those from Persia, Lydia, and Libya Were in your army as men of war; They hung shield and helmet in you; They gave splendor to you.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai char Pherơsơ, bơngai char Lŭt, bơngai char Phŭt lăm khŭl, linh ih, lu sư jing linh nuih kơtang lu sư hơtol khêl păng môk tơblah 'bơ̆t tơnăr ih, lu sư ba tơdrong ư-ang kơ ih.

English: Men of Arvad with your army were on your walls all around, And the men of Gammad were in your towers; They hung their shields on your walls all around; They made your beauty perfect.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơlei Arwat hăm lu linh Hêlek oei tơ kơpal tơnăr tăp dăr lu bơngai Gamat gak rim hnam gak. Lu sư hơtol khêl jum dăr kơ tơnăr pơm kơ ih jing 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ.

English: “Tarshish was your merchant because of your many luxury goods. They gave you silver, iron, tin, and lead for your goods.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai char Tarêsi mơdro hăm ih yua kơ ih đei tôm tơmam, lu sư iŏk hu, mam, kem, bơlơ̆k tơplih iŏk tơmam ih.

English: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech were your traders. They bartered human lives and vessels of bronze for your merchandise.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai char Jawan, Tubal păng Mêsêk mơdro hăm ih, lu sư iŏk kong, iŏk lu bơngai đĭch tơplih iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng ih.

English: Those from the house of Togarmah traded for your wares with horses, steeds, and mules.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơlei Tôgama iŏk seh tơblah păng aseh iĕ iŏk tơplih tơmam đơ̆ng ih.

English: The men of Dedan were your traders; many isles were the market of your hand. They brought you ivory tusks and ebony as payment.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơlei Đêđan tĕch mơdro hăm ih, kon pơlei mă đei lơ bŏl teh lăm dơsĭ kư̆m tĕch mơdro hăm ih. Lu sư chĕp ba bơla rôih hăm 'long gơnhum tơplih tơmam ih.

English: Syria was your merchant because of the abundance of goods you made. They gave you for your wares emeralds, purple, embroidery, fine linen, corals, and rubies.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai char Siri mơdro hăm ih yua kơ ih đei mŭk tơmam lơ; lu sư iŏk tơmo jơmŏng, che rang, tơmam reng, che 'bui, che brai se, tơmo gĭt tơplih iŏk tơmam ih.

English: Judah and the land of Israel were your traders. They traded for your merchandise wheat of Minnith, millet, honey, oil, and balm.
Bahnar: Char Juđa păng teh đak Isơrael mơdro sa hăm ih; lu sư tĕch 'ba mi, 'ba tơ'bâu, 'bĕng 'ngam, đak sut, đak rơmă ôliwơ păng pơgang 'bâu phu wă tơplih iŏk tơmam ih

English: Damascus was your merchant because of the abundance of goods you made, because of your many luxury items, with the wine of Helbon and with white wool.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih pơjing đei mŭk tơmam tôm tĕch rơkah rơkai, na pơlei Đamach mơdro sa hăm ih, sư iŏk sik hơmu đơ̆ng Hêlbôn păng iŏk sŏk triu kok đơ̆ng pơlei sahar lu sư wă tơplih hăm tơmam ih.

English: Dan and Javan paid for your wares, traversing back and forth. Wrought iron, cassia, and cane were among your merchandise.
Bahnar: Bơngai Wêđan păng Jawan răt tơmam đơ̆ng Usal năm răt tơplih tơmam ih; chĕp ba đei mam, 'long hol 'long Kasa, 'long 'bâu phu.

English: Dedan was your merchant in saddlecloths for riding.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Đêđan mơdro hăm ih lu khăn pơm an aseh.

English: Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your regular merchants. They traded with you in lambs, rams, and goats.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Arap păng lu yŏng tih tơring Kêđa mơdro hăm ih păng tĕch mơdro kơ ih triu kon, triu tơno păng bơbe bram.

English: The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your merchants. They traded for your wares the choicest spices, all kinds of precious stones, and gold.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơdro đơ̆ng pơlei Sêba păng pơlei Raama mơdro hăm ih, iŏk lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng gĭt, đĭ-đăng lu tơmo gĭt păng maih tơplih iŏk tơmam ih.

English: Haran, Canneh, Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Assyria, and Chilmad were your merchants.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdro đơ̆ng lu pơlei Haran, Kannê păng Êđen, Sêba, Asur păng Kilmat bơngai mơdro sa hăm ih.

English: These were your merchants in choice items—in purple clothes, in embroidered garments, in chests of multicolored apparel, in sturdy woven cords, which were in your marketplace.
Bahnar: Lu sư mơdro hăm ih lu hơbĕn ao tơpă kăp jên, che hơhĭm, che brai dônh păng ao reng, che lơ̆k hơnă đe tanh hăm lơ đak 'brê jơk păng tơlei kŭi kơjăp.

English: “The ships of Tarshish were carriers of your merchandise. You were filled and very glorious in the midst of the seas.
Bahnar: Lu duk đơ̆ng Tarêsi chơ tơmam mơdro ăn kơ ih na ih đei lơ tơmam rơkah rơkai păng chơ trăp tơpă lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: Your oarsmen brought you into many waters, But the east wind broke you in the midst of the seas.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai huơ̆r kơ ih, ba ih lăm đak dơsĭ păng kial đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch bah pơrăm ih tơ lăm tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ.

English: “Your riches, wares, and merchandise, Your mariners and pilots, Your caulkers and merchandisers, All your men of war who are in you, And the entire company which is in your midst, Will fall into the midst of the seas on the day of your ruin.
Bahnar: Lu mŭk tơmam ih, tơmam mơdro mơchan ih bơngai huơ̆r duk, thơ̆ hơmet, bơngai mơdro, đĭ-đăng lu linh ih, hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm thŏng-nan gô hiong răm môch lăm đak dơsĭ đĭ 'bơ̆t năr tơdrong răm truh kơ ih.

English: The common-land will shake at the sound of the cry of your pilots.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng lu bơngai huơ̆r ôr krao, lu kon pơlei tơring jum dăr kơ ih hli tơtơ̆.

English: “All who handle the oar, The mariners, All the pilots of the sea Will come down from their ships and stand on the shore.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai huơ̆r duk, lu bơngai bơ̆jang, lu bơngai hơmet jur đĭ đơ̆ng duk tŏk đĭ tơ kông jih đak dơsĭ.

English: They will make their voice heard because of you; They will cry bitterly and cast dust on their heads; They will roll about in ashes
Bahnar: Lu sư gô nhơ̆m hmoi păng ơh sơ'ngon kơ ih, chup 'mui teh klă tơ kơ̆l kơdih păng tơglăng lăm tơnuh.

English: They will shave themselves completely bald because of you, Gird themselves with sackcloth, And weep for you With bitterness of heart and bitter wailing.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch, hrŭk su 'bi sơ'ngon yua kơ ih, jĭ jơhngơ̆m ơh sơ'ngon nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ol.

English: In their wailing for you They will take up a lamentation, And lament for you: ‘What city is like Tyre, Destroyed in the midst of the sea?
Bahnar: Kơplah nhơ̆m hmoi 'mêm kơeng lu sư hmoi jô̆ sơ'ngon kơ ih, hmoi thoi âu: Bu đei tơdrong truh thoi pơlei Tirơ, môch hiong biŏng lăm đak dơsĭ?

English: ‘When your wares went out by sea, You satisfied many people; You enriched the kings of the earth With your many luxury goods and your merchandise.
Bahnar: Kơplah ih chơ tơmam rok đak dơsĭ sơ̆. Ih pơm kơ lơ kon pơlei hiôk jơnap. Kơ tơmam lơ mah rơkah rơkai, ih pơm ăn mơdrŏng kơ lu pơtao lăm teh đak.

English: But you are broken by the seas in the depths of the waters; Your merchandise and the entire company will fall in your midst.
Bahnar: Dang ei hlôi răm krăm hiong lăm đak dơsĭ, mŭk drăm mơdro mơchan păng kon pơlei oei hơdai hăm ih kư̆m môch hiong hăm ih.

English: All the inhabitants of the isles will be astonished at you; Their kings will be greatly afraid, And their countenance will be troubled.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm lu bŏl đak dơsĭ, lăng hlĭch chrêu tơpă yua kơ tơdrong truh kơ ih; pơtao lu sư hli tơrơ dêh muh măt lu sư hơ'brơ̆p hơ'brăp.

English: The merchants among the peoples will hiss at you; You will become a horror, and be no more forever.’ ” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơdro mơchan hăm ih lăm teh đak, hơhôch tơhuăi ih, yua kơ ih đĭ hiong tôch krưp tơpă. Ih jing pă đei dơ̆ng hiong hlŏng hloi truh tơ ning-mônh.’ ”

English: The word of the LORD came to me again, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because your heart is lifted up, And you say, ‘I am a god, I sit in the seat of gods, In the midst of the seas,’ Yet you are a man, and not a god, Though you set your heart as the heart of a god
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, khan bĕ kơ pơtao Tirơ: Kră Yang khan thoi âu; yua kơ jơhngơ̆m ih pơang, ih khan: “Inh jing yang hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao yang lăm tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ,” mă-lei ih kon bơngai đĕch, ưh kơ sĭ yang ôh mă khan ih tơchĕng khan ih hơgei thoi yang.

English: (Behold, you are wiser than Daniel! There is no secret that can be hidden from you!
Bahnar: “Âu, ih hơgei hloh kơ Đaniel; ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ gơh ôn kơ ih!

English: With your wisdom and your understanding You have gained riches for yourself, And gathered gold and silver into your treasuries
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei hlôh wao, ih pơjing sa đei mŭk tơmam; ih kư̆m mong 'măn hu maih lăm hnam mong tơmam.

English: By your great wisdom in trade you have increased your riches, And your heart is lifted up because of your riches),”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei mơdro sa noh ih jing mơdrŏng tih thoi noh na jơhngơ̆m ih pơang yua kơ ih mơdrŏng tih.

English: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Because you have set your heart as the heart of a god
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ ih khan jơhngơ̆m đon ih hơgei thoi jơhngơ̆m đon lu yang.

English: Behold, therefore, I will bring strangers against you, The most terrible of the nations; And they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, And defile your splendor.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn lu teh đak nai năm blah ih lu kon pơlei mă pran kơtang hloh lăm lu dêh char iung blah ih; lu sư gô iŏk đao blah tơdrong hơgei păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ ih, păng pơm 'mê̆ kơ tơdrong ư-ang ih.

English: They shall throw you down into the Pit, And you shall die the death of the slain In the midst of the seas.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô tơlơ̆ ih lăm sơlŭng jrŭ păng ih gô lôch hăm tơdrong lôch krưp dêh lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: “Will you still say before him who slays you, ‘I am a god’? But you shall be a man, and not a god, In the hand of him who slays you.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai pơlôch ih, ih hăm pơ̆n pơma; “Inh âu yang?” Tơpă ih bơngai đĕch, ưh kơ sĭ yang ôh, lăm ti lu bơngai pơlôch ih.

English: You shall die the death of the uncircumcised By the hand of aliens; For I have spoken,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih gô lôch nhen thoi bơngai tam mă kăt tơdra akar. Lăm ti lu bơngai tơmoi, yua kơ Inh khan boih, Kră Yang khan.’”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, take up a lamentation for the king of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “You were the seal of perfection, Full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, nhơ̆m hmoi kơ pơtao Tirơ bĕ khan kơ sư: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ih bơngai đei tôm tơdrong gơh hơgei, 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: You were in Eden, the garden of God; Every precious stone was your covering: The sardius, topaz, and diamond, Beryl, onyx, and jasper, Sapphire, turquoise, and emerald with gold. The workmanship of your timbrels and pipes Was prepared for you on the day you were created.
Bahnar: Ih oei tơ pơgar Êđen, pơgar Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Ih pơguăng hăm tơmam tơmo gĭt thoi jơmŏng tơmo jasper, tơmo saphirê, tơmo Shơkêđô tơmo samarađô, tơmo siađô, tơmo krisôlia, tơmo borelô, tơmo tôpasiô, ih hling hrâu hăm maih dơ̆ng. Đơ̆ng năr mă đei pơjing ih đei hơmet lê̆ boih dôm tơmam noh.

English: “You were the anointed cherub who covers; I established you; You were on the holy mountain of God; You walked back and forth in the midst of fiery stones.
Bahnar: Đe tuh kơ ih đak rơmă wă pơm chêrubim gak bơwei. Inh dan ih tơ kơpal kông rơgoh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; ih yak năm tŏk-bŏk jơmŏng rang hơdah thoi ŭnh.

English: You were perfect in your ways from the day you were created, Till iniquity was found in you.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr pơjing kơ ih, trong ih yak đe ưh kơ đei wă gơh chrih dĭng tơ năr 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ truh tơ ih.

English: “By the abundance of your trading You became filled with violence within, And you sinned; Therefore I cast you as a profane thing Out of the mountain of God; And I destroyed you, O covering cherub, From the midst of the fiery stones.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng ih mơdro sa tih đei mơdrŏng ih pơm kơnê̆ păng yoch; thoi noh na, ơ chêrubim gak bơwei, Inh puh lê̆ ih đơ̆ng kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; păng pơlôch ih đơ̆ng lu jơmŏng rang hơdah thoi ŭnh.

English: “Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty; You corrupted your wisdom for the sake of your splendor; I cast you to the ground, I laid you before kings, That they might gaze at you.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m ih pơang yua kơ ih 'lơ̆ng. Tơdrong ư-ang ih pơm kơ ih hiong răm tơdrong gơh hơgei. Inh klơ̆m hŭt ih tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp lu pơtao, Inh jao ih wă ăn kơ lu sư lăng.

English: “You defiled your sanctuaries By the multitude of your iniquities, By the iniquity of your trading; Therefore I brought fire from your midst; It devoured you, And I turned you to ashes upon the earth In the sight of all who saw you.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch păng mơdro sa hơlĕnh, ih pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ anih rơgoh ih. Yua kơ thoi noh Inh gô ăn ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk ih wă soh ih păng wă pơm kơ ih jing thoi tơnuh kơpal teh 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai gô lăng.

English: All who knew you among the peoples are astonished at you; You have become a horror, And shall be no more forever.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm lu adrĕch drung băt kơ ih, gô lăng ih chrơp. Ih gô truh tơ anih tôch krưp tơpă. Ih jing pă đei dơ̆ng tơ̆p ning-mônh.’ ”

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai tơwih bĕ muh măt ih gah pơlei Siđôn, khan lê̆ adrol blah sư.

English: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon; I will be glorified in your midst; And they shall know that I am the LORD, When I execute judgments in her and am hallowed in her.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ sư: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ pơlei Siđôn, âu, Inh blah ih; Inh wă kơ đei ư-ang lăm ih. Lu sư gô băt inh boih Kră Yang, kơplah inh sek tơlang phak ih wă tơ'bôh tơdrong rơgoh Inh.

English: For I will send pestilence upon her, And blood in her streets; The wounded shall be judged in her midst By the sword against her on every side; Then they shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn tơdrong lôch hơbuh truh lăm pơlei, tuh pham lĕch sĕch huŏng jơ̆p kơ trong. Lu bơngai pơ̆k lôch tơ lăm pơlei, yua kơ đao blah lu sư đơ̆ng puăn pah; na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “And there shall no longer be a pricking brier or a painful thorn for the house of Israel from among all who are around them, who despise them. Then they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai Isơrael pă đei jơla trŏ, jơla wek đơ̆ng lăm lu teh đak oei jum dăr kơ lu sư, lu teh đak mă ngăl areh. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “When I have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and am hallowed in them in the sight of the Gentiles, then they will dwell in their own land which I gave to My servant Jacob.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Kơplah Inh akŭm lu adrĕch Isơrael brŏk đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei mă lu sư oei tơklah tơklang, Inh gô tơ'bôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh tơ lăm lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp lu teh đak. Na lu sư gô oei tơ lăm teh đak mă Inh ăn boih kơ đĭch đam Inh Jakôp.

English: And they will dwell safely there, build houses, and plant vineyards; yes, they will dwell securely, when I execute judgments on all those around them who despise them. Then they shall know that I am the LORD their God.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lu sư oei tơ noh hiôk-hian, pơm hnam pơtăm hơmu. Lu sư oei tơ noh hiôk-hian kơplah Inh sek tơlang phak lu teh đak jum dăr lu sư, lu bơngai mă areh kơ lu sư. Lu sư gô băt Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă mơjĭt, khei mơjĭt, năr mơjĭt-'bar, Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against all Egypt.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, blah bĕ Pharaôn, pơtao Êyiptơ, khan lê̆ adrol blah sư păng đĭ-đăng char Êyiptơ.

English: Speak, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I am against you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt, O great monster who lies in the midst of his rivers, Who has said, ‘My River is my own; I have made it for myself.’
Bahnar: Pơma khan kơ sư: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Ơ Pharaôn, pơtao Êyiptơ, âu Inh blah ih, ih jing sem brem tih kơnê̆ oei 'bĭch lăm đak glung. Ih khan: “Đak krong Nil noh gah Inh, đêl Inh kôch pơm sư.

English: But I will put hooks in your jaws, And cause the fish of your rivers to stick to your scales; I will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, And all the fish in your rivers will stick to your scales.
Bahnar: Inh gô wŏk kang ih păng ăn lu ka đơ̆ng lăm đak glung ih gô đom tơwŏk tơ kơchap ih. Inh gô dui hơđuh ih păng đĭ-đăng lu ka đơ̆ng lu đak glung mă đom tơwŏk tơ kơchap ih hơtŏk tơ kông.

English: I will leave you in the wilderness, You and all the fish of your rivers; You shall fall on the open field; You shall not be picked up or gathered. I have given you as food To the beasts of the field And to the birds of the heavens.
Bahnar: Inh gô klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ ih tơ char glă, Ih hăm lu ka lăm đak glung ih. Ih gô pơ̆k tơ lăm bri; pă đei bu iŏk păng ưh kơ đei bu dônh 'bŭ. Inh gô ăn ih jing tơmam sa ăn kơ sem bri ala teh păng lu sem păr tơ plĕnh.

English: “Then all the inhabitants of Egypt Shall know that I am the LORD, Because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Êyiptơ gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, ih thoi 'long jra hăm 'nhĕt gơlar kơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael.

English: When they took hold of you with the hand, You broke and tore all their shoulders; When they leaned on you, You broke and made all their backs quiver.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư rôp ih hăm ti, na ih pơchah tơgơ̆ đĭ, hiĕt hơngiĕng lu sư; lu sư gơning 'bơ̆t ih, na ih tơgơ̆ pơm kơ lu sư pơ̆k tơgơ̆ kơiĕng.

English: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I will bring a sword upon you and cut off from you man and beast.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Âu, Inh chĕp đao wă phak ih Inh gô pơlôch đĭ bơngai hăm đĭ lu sem dơrong đơ̆ng ih.

English: And the land of Egypt shall become desolate and waste; then they will know that I am the LORD, because he said, ‘The River is mine, and I have made it.’
Bahnar: Char Êyiptơ gô jing juơ rơhiăng pă đei. Păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang. Yua kơ ih khan: Krong Nil noh krang đơ̆ng đêl inh kôch pơm sư

English: Indeed, therefore, I am against you and against your rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste and desolate, from Migdol to Syene, as far as the border of Ethiopia.
Bahnar: lei na 'nâu, Inh blah ih păng lu krong ih, Inh gô pơm kơ char Êyiptơ iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Mikdôl păng pơlei Aswan truh tơ hơdral Êthiôpi jing juơ tơtŭng.

English: Neither foot of man shall pass through it nor foot of beast pass through it, and it shall be uninhabited forty years.
Bahnar: Ưh pă đei tơpang jơ̆ng bu yak rok noh, kư̆m pă đei jơ̆ng sem bri yak năm trong noh, kư̆m ưh pă đei kon pơlei oei tơ noh dơ̆ng, lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: I will make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and among the cities that are laid waste, her cities shall be desolate forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.”
Bahnar: Lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm Inh gô pơm kơ char Êyiptơ jing juơ rơhiăng lăm tŏk-bŏk lu char juơ rơhiăng păng lu pơlei sư pơchah răm tŏk-bŏk lăm pơlei mă pơchah răm Inh gô pơm kơ kon pơlei Êyiptơ tơklah tơklang tơ lăm jơ̆p kơ dêh char.

English: ‘Yet, thus says the Lord GOD: “At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were scattered.
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang khan: “Hlôi kơ puăn-jĭt sơnăm, Inh gô akŭm kon pơlei Êyiptơ dơ̆ng, đơ̆ng lăm lu kon pơlei mă lu sư tơklah tơklang oei tơ noh.

English: I will bring back the captives of Egypt and cause them to return to the land of Pathros, to the land of their origin, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông lu bơngai bơnă Êyiptơ wih păng năm ba lu sư wih tơ char Patrôs jing teh mă lu sư kơdih sơ̆ mă-lei tơ noh lu sư pơjing char pơtao pơgơ̆r iĕ.

English: It shall be the lowliest of kingdoms; it shall never again exalt itself above the nations, for I will diminish them so that they will not rule over the nations anymore.
Bahnar: Char Êyiptơ jing iĕ hloh kơ lu char nai, ưh pă gơh tơiung kơdih hloh kơ lu char nai dơ̆ng; Inh gô ăn lu sư iĕ hloh, wă kơ lu sư pă gơh pơgơ̆r lu char nai dơ̆ng.

English: No longer shall it be the confidence of the house of Israel, but will remind them of their iniquity when they turned to follow them. Then they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Char Êyiptơ ưh pă anih mă lu adrĕch Isơrael gơnang hơmĕng dơ̆ng mă-lei oei tơ'blŏk kơ lu sư tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ đêl lu sư pơm; păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: And it came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm 'bar-jĭt tơpơh, năr mă mônh khei mônh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to labor strenuously against Tyre; every head was made bald, and every shoulder rubbed raw; yet neither he nor his army received wages from Tyre, for the labor which they expended on it.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn, pơm ăn kơ lu linh sư jang gleh anat wă blah pơlei Tirơ; kơ̆l lu sư jing 'ngôch, hơngiĕng lu sư luih pơtao noh hăm lu linh sư mă khan blah pơlei Tirơ, hrat pơmat thoi noh ră kư̆m kơbĭ đei kiơ.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Surely I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; he shall take away her wealth, carry off her spoil, and remove her pillage; and that will be the wages for his army.
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang khan: Âu, Inh gô pơjao char Êyiptơ ăn kơ Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn; sư gô iŏk chĕp ba tơmam noh păng tơgar iŏk lu tơmam nai păng pơjei iŏk teh; noh boih tơmam apah kơ lu linh sư.

English: I have given him the land of Egypt for his labor, because they worked for Me,’ says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjao char Êyiptơ ăn kơ sư wă apah tơdrong pơmat gleh sư hlôi blah iŏk, yua kơ sư đei bơ̆jang kơ Inh. Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: ‘In that day I will cause the horn of the house of Israel to spring forth, and I will open your mouth to speak in their midst. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Inh gô ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael, chăt hơke jing pran thoi sem brem păng Inh gô ăn kơ ih Êsêkiên gơh pơih 'bơ̆r pơma tŏk-bŏk lu sư; na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.”

English: The word of the LORD came to me again, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Wail, ‘Woe to the day!’
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, athei khan lê̆ adrol thoi âu: Kră Yang khan: Nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ; răm tơpă năr ei kơnh!

English: For the day is near, Even the day of the LORD is near; It will be a day of clouds, the time of the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Yua kơ năr noh wă jê̆ boih, năr Kră Yang wă jê̆ boih. Năr noh năr măng mu năr noh năr đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch adrung lăm teh.

English: The sword shall come upon Egypt, And great anguish shall be in Ethiopia, When the slain fall in Egypt, And they take away her wealth, And her foundations are broken down.
Bahnar: Đe iŏk đao gô năm blah char Êyiptơ; tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon gô truh lăm char Êthiôp. Lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch gô pơ̆k lăm char Êyiptơ; lu mŭk tơmam đe gô iŏk đĭ păng hơnă anih kơjăp sư đe pơrăm đĭ.

English: “Ethiopia, Libya, Lydia, all the mingled people, Chub, and the men of the lands who are allied, shall fall with them by the sword.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Êthiôpi, bơngai Put bơngai Lut, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Arabi păng lu bơngai Libi, lu dêh char mă pơgơ̆p hăm bơngai Êyiptơ gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đơ̆ng đao.”

English: ‘Thus says the LORD: “Those who uphold Egypt shall fall, And the pride of her power shall come down. From Migdol to Syene Those within her shall fall by the sword,” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Lu bơngai mă tơgŭm Êyiptơ gô pơ̆k; jơhngơ̆m pran kơtang mă lu sư ư-ang gô huŏng. Lu sư gô pơ̆k huŏng yua kơ đao tơ noh, iŏk đơ̆ng Mikdôl truh tơ Aswan, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “They shall be desolate in the midst of the desolate countries, And her cities shall be in the midst of the cities that are laid waste.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô jing juơ rơhiăng, lăm lu char jum dăr đĭ juơ rơhiăng păng pơlei lu sư gô pơchah răm tŏk-bŏk lăm lu pơlei pơchah răm.

English: Then they will know that I am the LORD, When I have set a fire in Egypt And all her helpers are destroyed.
Bahnar: Na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, kơplah Inh ăn ŭnh sa tơ char Êyiptơ păng lu bơngai mă tơgŭm lu sư kư̆m pơchah răm.

English: On that day messengers shall go forth from Me in ships To make the careless Ethiopians afraid, And great anguish shall come upon them, As on the day of Egypt; For indeed it is coming!”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, đei lu bơngai lĕch đơ̆ng Inh tŏk duk năm roi tơhli tơdrong krưp kơ lu bơngai Êthiôpi kơplah oei hiôk-hian. Lu sư gô sơ'ngon tơtăm lăm năr răm truh tơ Êyiptơ; yua kơ năr noh jê̆ truh boih!”

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will also make a multitude of Egypt to cease By the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh gô yua tơpang ti Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, wă pơlôch khŭl kon pơlei Êyiptơ.

English: He and his people with him, the most terrible of the nations, Shall be brought to destroy the land; They shall draw their swords against Egypt, And fill the land with the slain.
Bahnar: Sư hăm lu linh sư jing kơnê̆ dêh hloh kơ lu bơngai nai lu sư, gô truh wă pơrăm teh. Lu sư gô toh đao blah Êyiptơ, teh noh gô 'bĕnh kơ bơngai mă đe pơlôch.

English: I will make the rivers dry, And sell the land into the hand of the wicked; I will make the land waste, and all that is in it, By the hand of aliens. I, the LORD, have spoken.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ đak krong hrơ̆ păng tĕch ăn teh đak kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆. Inh gô yua ti lu kon tơmoi pơm kơ teh noh hăm lu tơmam lăm noh jing răm pă đei. Inh boih Kră Yang khan nơ̆r 'nâu.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will also destroy the idols, And cause the images to cease from Noph; There shall no longer be princes from the land of Egypt; I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô pơrăm lu rup yang păng pơrăm pơđĭ pơgoh lu rup yang đơ̆ng pơlei Nôp. Lăm char Êyiptơ ưh pă đei yŏng pơgơ̆r dơ̆ng; Inh gô ăn tơdrong hli krưp kơ lu bơngai lăm char Êyiptơ.

English: I will make Pathros desolate, Set fire to Zoan, And execute judgments in No.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ tơring Phatrôs jing răm pă đei; ăn ŭnh sa tơ pơlei Sôan păng phak pơlei Thêbes.

English: I will pour My fury on Sin, the strength of Egypt; I will cut off the multitude of No
Bahnar: Inh gô tuh hil kơ pơlei Sin, pơlei mă kơjăp lăm char Êyiptơ păng pơrăm kon pơlei Thêbes

English: And set a fire in Egypt; Sin shall have great pain, No shall be split open, And Noph shall be in distress daily.
Bahnar: Inh gô soh char Êyiptơ, pơlei Sin gô jĭ tơpă pă kĕ pơmat-tat; pơlei Na gô pơrăm pơchah đĭ, pơlei Thêbes gô tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong tơblah rim năr.

English: The young men of Aven and Pi Beseth shall fall by the sword, And these cities shall go into captivity.
Bahnar: Lu kon tơdăm pơlei Heliôpolis păng pơlei Phibêsêt gô lôch răm kơ đao păng lu kon adruh gô pơm bơnă.

English: At Tehaphnehes the day shall also be darkened, When I break the yokes of Egypt there. And her arrogant strength shall cease in her; As for her, a cloud shall cover her, And her daughters shall go into captivity.
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei Tahpanhes, kơ'năr đei măng mu kơplah Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ 'long ăt char Êyiptơ; tơ noh jơhngơ̆m pran pơang lu sư gô pơrăm đĭ pă đei. Hơmơ̆l găm gô klơ̆p gom char noh, lu kon pơlei sư gô pơm bơnă.

English: Thus I will execute judgments on Egypt, Then they shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô phak char Êyiptơ păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Sơnăm mơjĭt-mônh, năr tơpơh khei mônh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and see, it has not been bandaged for healing, nor a splint put on to bind it, to make it strong enough to hold a sword.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, Inh gơ̆ lê̆ boih ti Pharaôn, pơtao Êyiptơ. Âu, sư ưh pă gơh pơ̆n ming hơmet wă kơ klaih; wă kơ pran dơ̆ng wă kơ gơh chĕp đao.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Surely I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, both the strong one and the one that was broken; and I will make the sword fall out of his hand.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu, Inh blah Pharaôn pơtao Êyiptơ gô gơ̆ lê̆ 'bar pah ti sư, đao đơ̆ng ti sư gô huŏng tơ teh.

English: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them throughout the countries.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kon pơlei Êyiptơ gô tơklah tơklang oei tơ lăm adrĕch adrung nai păng tơ lăm lu char nai.

English: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword in his hand; but I will break Pharaoh’s arms, and he will groan before him with the groanings of a mortally wounded man.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ ti pơtao Babilôn pran păng ăn đao Inh lăm ti sư; Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ ti Pharaôn, pơtao Êyiptơ na sư gô hmoi ôr 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Babilôn thoi minh 'nu bơngai rơka ôr wă jê̆ lôch.

English: Thus I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down; they shall know that I am the LORD, when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he stretches it out against the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ ti pơtao Babilôn jing pran kơtang. Mă-lei lu ti Pharaôn gô huŏng. Na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang. Inh ăn boih đao lăm ti pơtao Babilôn păng sư yơ̆r đao blah char Êyiptơ.

English: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei Êyiptơ tơklah tơklang oei tơ lăm adrĕch adrung đe, ăn lu sư chă oei jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Now it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-mônh, khei pêng, năr mă mônh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu

English: “Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his multitude: ‘Whom are you like in your greatness?
