Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai khan bĕ kơ Pharaôn pơtao Êyiptơ, păng đĭ kon pơlei sư Tơdrong tih krưp ih wă pơting hăm bu?

English: Indeed Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon, With fine branches that shaded the forest, And of high stature; And its top was among the thick boughs.
Bahnar: To, char Asiri thoi 'long hơngo lăm kông Liban, dơng tơ'bla hla hơdrih, yơ̆p să thoi bri, tơm tih kơjung, păng kơnhŏng sư kơjung truh tơ hơmơ̆l.

English: The waters made it grow; Underground waters gave it height, With their rivers running around the place where it was planted, And sent out rivulets to all the trees of the field.
Bahnar: Đak rong wă kơ sư wơ̆, đak glung tih jrŭ pơm kơ sư kơjung; lu đak ro jum dăr kơ anih đe pơtăm sư, lu chơnglah krong ro ruh rim kơ tơnơm 'long tơ bri

English: ‘Therefore its height was exalted above all the trees of the field; Its boughs were multiplied, And its branches became long because of the abundance of water, As it sent them out.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng đak ruh hơiuh na 'long wơ̆ tih kơjung hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu 'long lăm bri; dơng hla tơ'bla bluh jing, dơng tơ'bla bluh kơjung yua kơ đei đak lăm rơh sư.

English: All the birds of the heavens made their nests in its boughs; Under its branches all the beasts of the field brought forth their young; And in its shadow all great nations made their home.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch sem păr tơ plĕnh pơm tơpu tơ tơ'bla sư; lu sem bri tuh tơ ala yơ̆p sư păng đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch adrung tih kon bơngai oei lăm yơ̆p sư.

English: ‘Thus it was beautiful in greatness and in the length of its branches, Because its roots reached to abundant waters.
Bahnar: Sư jing 'lơ̆ng rŏ yua kơ tơm sư tih kơjung; păng rơh sư sôr jrŭ lăm đak.

English: The cedars in the garden of God could not hide it; The fir trees were not like its boughs, And the chestnut trees were not like its branches; No tree in the garden of God was like it in beauty.
Bahnar: Lu 'long hơngo lăm pơgar Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ gơh pơting hăm sư mă 'long hơngo hla iĕ nai kư̆m ưh kơ dang sư, ưh kơ đei 'long ayơ lăm pơgar Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng rŏ hơtŏ hăm sư.

English: I made it beautiful with a multitude of branches, So that all the trees of Eden envied it, That were in the garden of God.’
Bahnar: Inh pơm ăn kơ 'long noh jing 'lơ̆ng rŏ, đei dơng tơ'bla trưp trap. Dĭng mah đĭ-đăng 'long lăm pơgar Êđen, pơgar Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mah 'ngeng kơ sư.

English: “Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Because you have increased in height, and it set its top among the thick boughs, and its heart was lifted up in its height
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ sư tih kơjung, kơnhŏng kơjung truh tơ hơmơ̆l hăm lu dơng tơ'bla hla trưp trap, lei na jơhngơ̆m sư pơang kơ akâu sư tih kơjung

English: therefore I will deliver it into the hand of the mighty one of the nations, and he shall surely deal with it; I have driven it out for its wickedness.
Bahnar: Inh pơjao sư lăm tơpang ti bơngai yŏng pran kơtang lăm dêh char nai wă kơ bơngai noh pơm kơ sư trŏ thoi tơdrong kơnê̆ sư pơm. Inh achăng lê̆ sư boih.

English: And aliens, the most terrible of the nations, have cut it down and left it; its branches have fallen on the mountains and in all the valleys; its boughs lie broken by all the rivers of the land; and all the peoples of the earth have gone from under its shadow and left it.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơmoi đơ̆ng dêh char pơm kơnê̆ nuih pran kơtang hloh, gô kăl tơpăk lê̆ sư. Lu dơng tơ'bla sư gô huŏng tơ kông hăm tơ lăm lu thŭng; lu dơng sư tơgơ̆ huŏng tơ lăm thong, lu kon pơlei weh ataih pă ngôi yơ̆p păng achăng tŭk lê̆ sư.

English: ‘On its ruin will remain all the birds of the heavens, And all the beasts of the field will come to its branches
Bahnar: Lu sem păr gô kôp tơ tơm 'long păk noh, hăm lu sem bri gô oei tơ lăm hơmŭl hla sư noh.

English: ‘So that no trees by the waters may ever again exalt themselves for their height, nor set their tops among the thick boughs, that no tree which drinks water may ever be high enough to reach up to them. ‘For they have all been delivered to death, To the depths of the earth, Among the children of men who go down to the Pit.’
Bahnar: Thoi ei na ưh kơ đei 'long ayơ jê̆ đak mă đei chăt kơjung, dah kơnhŏng sư kơjung truh tơ hơmơ̆l păng kư̆m ưh pă đei 'long ayơ mă đei đak ruh hơiuh lơ̆m chăt tih kơjung tih hloh thoi noh yua kơ lu sư đĭ-đăng pơjao kơ tơdrong lôch, jrŭ tơ hơla teh, hơdai hăm lu bơngai yoch mă lôch jur tơ lăm sơlŭng jrŭ.

English: “Thus says the Lord GOD: ‘In the day when it went down to hell, I caused mourning. I covered the deep because of it. I restrained its rivers, and the great waters were held back. I caused Lebanon to mourn for it, and all the trees of the field wilted because of it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Lăm năr mă sư huŏng lăm anih bơngai lôch, Inh ăn kơ lu bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi, Inh klơ̆p lê̆ sơlŭng jrŭ, găn lê̆ lu glung găn lê̆ lu đak ro jăng. Inh ăn kơ kông Liban sơ'ngon yua kơ sư păng đĭ-đăng lu 'long tơ bri jô kro yua kơ sư.

English: I made the nations shake at the sound of its fall, when I cast it down to hell together with those who descend into the Pit; and all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the depths of the earth.
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung hli tơrơ kơplah kơtơ̆ng tơdrong sư pơchah răm 'bơ̆t Inh tơhuŏng sư tơ anih lôch, hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai huŏng tơ sơlŭng jrŭ! Dang ei đĭ-đăng lu 'long tơ pơgar Êđen, lu 'long 'lơ̆ng đei rơih iŏk lu 'long 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng kông Liban, đĭ-đăng lu 'long mă đei đak hơiuh lơ̆m, đĭ lu 'long noh đei tơdrong pơlung lăm hơlŭng jrŭ.

English: They also went down to hell with it, with those slain by the sword; and those who were its strong arm dwelt in its shadows among the nations.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m huŏng tơ dơnâu ŭnh hơdai hăm sư, hơdai hăm lu bơngai lôch kơ đao gưm lu bơngai tơpôl akŭm băl lăm dêh char lu sư ngôi ala yơ̆p sư.

English: ‘To which of the trees in Eden will you then be likened in glory and greatness? Yet you shall be brought down with the trees of Eden to the depths of the earth; you shall lie in the midst of the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude,’ says the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Dôm lu 'long lăm pơgar Êđen, ih nhen thoi 'long ayơ mă tih-tin 'lơ̆ng rŏ? Inh kư̆m gô tơhuŏng ih tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh hơdai hăm lu 'long lăm pơgar Êđen; ih gô 'bĭch hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra hơkar, hăm lu bơngai lôch kơ đao gưm. Noh Pharaôn păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư Kră Yang khan bơih.”

English: And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Sơnăm mơjĭt-'bar, năr minh khei mơjĭt-'bar, Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, take up a lamentation for Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say to him: ‘You are like a young lion among the nations, And you are like a monster in the seas, Bursting forth in your rivers, Troubling the waters with your feet, And fouling their rivers.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, athei nhơ̆m hmoi kơ Pharaôn pơtao Êyiptơ, khan bĕ kơ sư: ‘Ih nhen thoi dăm-brang lăm lu dêh char, ih kư̆m thoi sem brem kơnê̆ lăm đak dơsĭ, pơm kơ lu đak glung tơprah, ih wơ̆r đak hăm jơ̆ng, pơm kơ lu đak glung jing gơsŏk.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will therefore spread My net over you with a company of many people, And they will draw you up in My net.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh gô dăng hơnhuăl tơ ih, kơplah đei lu kon pơlei akŭm; lu sư gô dui ih tơ lăm hơnhuăl Inh.

English: Then I will leave you on the land; I will cast you out on the open fields, And cause to settle on you all the birds of the heavens. And with you I will fill the beasts of the whole earth.
Bahnar: Inh gô klơ̆m hŭt ih tơ teh păng hŭt lê̆ ih tơ bri na Inh gô ăn kơ lu sem păr kôp tơ ih păng lu sem bri gô sa ih phĭ hrăp.

English: I will lay your flesh on the mountains, And fill the valleys with your carcass.
Bahnar: Inh gô lê̆ sĕch ih tơ kơpal kông păng akâu ôm ih 'bŭ kơlơ̆p 'bĕnh kơ thŭng thong.

English: “I will also water the land with the flow of your blood, Even to the mountains; And the riverbeds will be full of you.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn pham ih ro 'bĕnh kơ teh, truh tơ rim kông păng lu thong đak 'bĕnh kơ akâu ih.

English: When I put out your light, I will cover the heavens, and make its stars dark; I will cover the sun with a cloud, And the moon shall not give her light.
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh pơlôch ih, Inh pĕng klơ̆p lê̆ plĕnh pơm kơ sơnglŏng măng mu. Inh gô pĕng klơ̆p lê̆ măt 'năr hăm hơmơ̆l păng măt khei kư̆m ưh kơ đei hơdah dơ̆ng.

English: All the bright lights of the heavens I will make dark over you, And bring darkness upon your land,” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu tơdrong hơdah kơpal plĕnh jing măng mu tơ ih; Inh gô ăn măng mu truh tơ lăm char ih Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: ‘I will also trouble the hearts of many peoples, when I bring your destruction among the nations, into the countries which you have not known.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m lơ kon pơlei gô rŭng răng kơplah Inh roi tơdrong wă pơrăm ih tơ lăm lu dêh char, truh tơ lu dêh char tam mă băt.

English: Yes, I will make many peoples astonished at you, and their kings shall be horribly afraid of you when I brandish My sword before them; and they shall tremble every moment, every man for his own life, in the day of your fall.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei lăng ih, chrêu kơ đon păng pơtao lu sư gô hli tơtơ̆ yua kơ ih; kơplah Inh yơ̆r đao 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư. Lăm năr mă ih pơchah răm lu sư hli tơtey, rim jơ rim 'nu tơtăm kơ tơdrong arih lu sư kơdih.”

English: ‘For thus says the Lord GOD: “The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Đao lu pơtao Babilôn gô blah ih.

English: By the swords of the mighty warriors, all of them the most terrible of the nations, I will cause your multitude to fall. “They shall plunder the pomp of Egypt, And all its multitude shall be destroyed.
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ kon pơlei ih gô pơ̆k kơ đao lu bơngai nuih pran, lu bơngai mă kơnê̆ lăm dêh char. Lu sư gô blah pơrăm tơdrong pơang char Êyiptơ păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư gô pơrăm đĭ.

English: Also I will destroy all its animals From beside its great waters; The foot of man shall muddy them no more, Nor shall the hooves of animals muddy them.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm đĭ lu sem dơrong chă sa jih đak glung ro tih, jơ̆ng kon pơlei păng jơ̆ng kơchôp lu sem bri ưh pă kôch pơm kơ đak gơsŏk dơ̆ng.

English: Then I will make their waters clear, And make their rivers run like oil,” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Inh gô ăn kơ đak hlăng hơđơ̆ng, păng glung ro thoi đak rơmă Ôliwơ, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “When I make the land of Egypt desolate, And the country is destitute of all that once filled it, When I strike all who dwell in it, Then they shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Mưh Inh ăn kơ char Êyiptơ jing juơ, hơpuih pơgoh đĭ lu tơmam sư đơ̆ng teh păng Inh teh pơlôch lu bơngai oei lăm char noh, kơplah noh lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “This is the lamentation With which they shall lament her; The daughters of the nations shall lament her; They shall lament for her, for Egypt, And for all her multitude,” Says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Âu boih tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi; lu sư gô hơri pôk. Lu kon drŏ-kăn lăm jơ̆p kơ dêh char gô hơri 'bai nhơ̆m hmoi noh, lu sư gô hơri 'bai hơri nhơ̆m hmoi kơ char Êyiptơ. Păng ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lu sư, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.”

English: It came to pass also in the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-'bar, khei mônh năr mơjĭt Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, wail over the multitude of Egypt, And cast them down to the depths of the earth, Her and the daughters of the famous nations, With those who go down to the Pit
Bahnar: “Ơ, kon bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ, kơ lu kon pơlei lơlap lăm char Êyiptơ, puh tơlơ̆ bĕ sư hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-kăn adrĕch adrung pơang huŏng tơ ala teh sŭng, hơdai hăm lu bơngai jur tơ hơlŭng jrŭ!

English: ‘Whom do you surpass in beauty? Go down, be placed with the uncircumcised.’
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư, ih 'lơ̆ng guăng hloh kơ bu? Jur bĕ năm 'bĭch hơdai hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar.

English: “They shall fall in the midst of those slain by the sword; She is delivered to the sword, Drawing her and all her multitudes.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơ̆k lôch hơdai lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch hăm đao, dui ba sư hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei lơ lu sư.

English: The strong among the mighty Shall speak to him out of the midst of hell With those who help him: ‘They have gone down, They lie with the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.’
Bahnar: Lu bơngai yŏng nuih kơtang hơdai hăm lu buăl sư đơ̆ng lăm dêh atâu sư khan: ‘Lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch hăm đao, lu sư jur boih tơ âu 'bĭch hreh tơthĕng.

English: “Assyria is there, and all her company, With their graves all around her, All of them slain, fallen by the sword.
Bahnar: Yŏng Asiri hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư oei tơ noh, bơsat lu sư jum dăr kơ sư, đĭ-đăng lu sư đe pơlôch hăm đao

English: Her graves are set in the recesses of the Pit, And her company is all around her grave, All of them slain, fallen by the sword, Who caused terror in the land of the living.
Bahnar: Bơsat lu sư lê̆ tơ lăm sơlŭng jrŭ, lu kon pơlei oei jum dăr kơ bơsat noh, đĭ-đăng lu sư noh đe pơlôch hăm đao; lu bơngai noh boih bơngai mă pơm kơ teh đak lu bơngai arih hli.

English: “There is Elam and all her multitude, All around her grave, All of them slain, fallen by the sword, Who have gone down uncircumcised to the lower parts of the earth, Who caused their terror in the land of the living; Now they bear their shame with those who go down to the Pit.
Bahnar: Elam hăm đĭ-đăng lu sư oei tơ noh, bơsat lu sư tăp dăr; đĭ-đăng lu sư pơ̆k lôch đe pơlôch hăm đao. Lu sư bơngai ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar jur lăm bơsat; lu sư bơngai mă hlôi pơm kơ lu char bơngai arih hli tơrơ. Lu sư pŭ iŏk mơlâu hơdai hăm lu bơngai jur lăm sơlŭng jrŭ.

English: They have set her bed in the midst of the slain, With all her multitude, With her graves all around it, All of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; Though their terror was caused In the land of the living, Yet they bear their shame With those who go down to the Pit; It was put in the midst of the slain.
Bahnar: Đe pơm ăn boih minh pôm giơng 'bĭch tŏk-bŏk lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng lơlap kon pơlei oei jum dăr kơ bơsat sư. Đĭ-đăng lu sư bơngai ưh kơ đei kăt tơdra akar, đe pơlôch hăm đao yua kơ lu sư pơm kơ char lu bơngai arih hli tơrơ. Lu sư pŭ iŏk mơlâu hơdai hăm lu bơngai jur lăm sơlŭng jrŭ; đe 'măn lu sư hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch.

English: “There are Meshech and Tubal and all their multitudes, With all their graves around it, All of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, Though they caused their terror in the land of the living.
Bahnar: Mesek hăm Tubal păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư oei tơ noh; bơsat lu sư oei jum dăr kơ sư. Đĭ-đăng lu sư ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar ngăl, đe pơlôch hăm đao. Lu sư đei pơm kơ char lu bơngai arih hli tơrơ.

English: They do not lie with the mighty Who are fallen of the uncircumcised, Who have gone down to hell with their weapons of war; They have laid their swords under their heads, But their iniquities will be on their bones, Because of the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ 'bĭch hơdai ôh hă hăm lu bơngai linh nuih kơtang sơ̆ mă pơ̆k lôch hơdai hăm bơngai ưh kơ đei kăt tơdra akar, lu bơngai mă jur tơ lăm sơlŭng jrŭ hơdai hăm lu tơmam tơblah păng đao tơ ala kơ̆l sư? Mă-lei tơdrong yoch lu sư gô dan tơ kơpal kơting lu sư. Lu linh nuih kơtang âu đei pơm kơ dêh char lu bơngai arih hli tơrơ

English: Yes, you shall be broken in the midst of the uncircumcised, And lie with those slain by the sword.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ih đe gô teh pơrăm ih lôch 'bĭch hơdai hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch hăm đao.

English: “There is Edom, Her kings and all her princes, Who despite their might Are laid beside those slain by the sword; They shall lie with the uncircumcised, And with those who go down to the Pit.
Bahnar: Eđôm kư̆m oei tơ noh, lu pơtao hăm đĭ-đăng lu yŏng sư, mă khan lu sư nuih kơtang ră kư̆m jô̆ hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă lôch kơ đao; lu sư 'bĭch hơdai hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, lu bơngai mă jur lăm sơlŭng jrŭ.

English: There are the princes of the north, All of them, and all the Sidonians, Who have gone down with the slain In shame at the terror which they caused by their might; They lie uncircumcised with those slain by the sword, And bear their shame with those who go down to the Pit.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu yŏng char gah yă-nơ̆m, hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei Siđôn oei tơ noh, lu sư pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu jur năm hơdai lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch, mă khan lu sư nuih kơtang pơm kơ đe hli tơrơ ră. Lu sư 'bĭch hơdai hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch hăm đao, lu bơngai mă pŭ tơdrong mơlâu jur tơ lăm sơlŭng jrŭ.

English: “Pharaoh will see them And be comforted over all his multitude, Pharaoh and all his army, Slain by the sword,” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Pharaôn gô 'bôh lu đe noh, sư gô pơlung kơdih sư, yua kơ đĭ-đăng lơ kon pơlei sư, Pharaôn păng đĭ-đăng lu linh sư, đe pơlôch boih hăm đao, Kră Yang khan.

English: “For I have caused My terror in the land of the living; And he shall be placed in the midst of the uncircumcised With those slain by the sword, Pharaoh and all his multitude,” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Mă khan Inh lê̆ sư pơm rai dêh tơhli lăm char bơngai arih, Pharaôn hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư gô tơ'bĭch hơdai hăm lu ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, hơdai hăm lu bơngai đe pơlôch hăm đao, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.”

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, speak to the children of your people, and say to them: ‘When I bring the sword upon a land, and the people of the land take a man from their territory and make him their watchman
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, pơma bĕ kơ lu kon pơlei ih khan kơ lu sư: Mưh Inh ăn đao hơlă truh tơblah minh tŏ char na lu kon pơlei lăm char noh rôp minh 'nu bơngai lăm lu sư, pôk ăn kơ sư jing minh 'nu bơngai gak

English: when he sees the sword coming upon the land, if he blows the trumpet and warns the people
Bahnar: păng tơdah sư 'bôh đao hơlă truh tơ char noh na sư hlôm keng wă tơbăt kơ kon pơlei

English: then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet and does not take warning, if the sword comes and takes him away, his blood shall be on his own head.
Bahnar: na dah bu kơtơ̆ng re keng mă-lei ưh kơ kơchăng lê̆ kơ lu đao hơlă pơlôch sư lei, pham sư gô tuh tơ kơpal kơ̆l sư

English: He heard the sound of the trumpet, but did not take warning; his blood shall be upon himself. But he who takes warning will save his life.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư kơtơ̆ng boih keng re, mă ưh kơ kơchăng, pham sư gô tuh tơ kơdih sư, mă-lei tơdah sư kơchăng, sư gô pơklaih tơdrong arih sư.

English: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet, and the people are not warned, and the sword comes and takes any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood I will require at the watchman’s hand.’
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai gak 'bôh đao hơlă truh blah mă ưh kơ hlôm keng, kon pơlei ưh kơ băt kơchăng, na đao hơlă noh blah đei minh 'nu bơngai lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư kơdih, mă-lei Inh gô tơpŭ pham noh tơ tơpang ti bơngai gak.

English: “So you, son of man: I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; therefore you shall hear a word from My mouth and warn them for Me.
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, Inh wơh ih jing bơngai gak lu bơngai Isơrael; tơdah ih kơtơ̆ng mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh. Na athei lu sư kơchăng.

English: When I say to the wicked, ‘O wicked man, you shall surely die!’ and you do not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood I will require at your hand.
Bahnar: Mưh Inh khan kơ lu bơngai yoch, Ơ bơngai yoch, tơpă iĕm gô lôch mă-lei ih ưh kơ khă ôh lu bơngai yoch athei achăng lê̆ trong sư, sư gô lôch lăm tơdrong yoch sư; mă-lei Inh gô tơpŭ kơ ih pham sư.

English: Nevertheless if you warn the wicked to turn from his way, and he does not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but you have delivered your soul.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih đei khă lu bơngai pơm yoch wă kơ sư achăng lê̆ trong sư, mă-lei sư ưh kơ lê̆ trong kơnê̆ sư, na sư lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư, lei ih arih huay kơ pŭ yoch ôh.

English: “Therefore you, O son of man, say to the house of Israel: ‘Thus you say, “If our transgressions and our sins lie upon us, and we pine away in them, how can we then live?” ’
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai khan bĕ kơ adrĕch Isơrael: “Lu iĕm khan: ‘Dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ hăm tơdrong yoch lu nhôn, kơtĭt trăp dêh tơ lu nhôn, lu nhôn wă lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch noh lei lu nhôn pơm liơ gơh đei arih.’

English: Say to them: ‘As I live,’ says the Lord GOD, ‘I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but that the wicked turn from his way and live. Turn, turn from your evil ways! For why should you die, O house of Israel?’
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư, Thoi Inh mă arih Kră Yang khan: Inh ưh kơ hiôk ôh kơ tơdrong lu bơngai yoch lôch, Inh hiôk dah sư achăng lê̆ trong tơdrong yoch sư na đei tơdrong arih; wih bĕ, wih bĕ, weh đơ̆ng trong tơdrong yoch iĕm, ơ hnam Isơrael. Yua kơ kiơ iĕm wă lôch?.

English: “Therefore you, O son of man, say to the children of your people: ‘The righteousness of the righteous man shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression; as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall because of it in the day that he turns from his wickedness; nor shall the righteous be able to live because of his righteousness in the day that he sins.’
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, khan bĕ kơ pơlei pơla ih, Tơdrong tơpăt lu bơngai tơpăt ưh kơ gơh pơklaih sư ôh lăm năr sư pơm yoch; tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai pơm yoch ưh kơ gơh tơpơ̆k sư lăm năr sư weh achăng đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch sư. Bơngai tơpăt ưh kơ đei arih yua đơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt sư lăm năr sư pơm yoch

English: When I say to the righteous that he shall surely live, but he trusts in his own righteousness and commits iniquity, none of his righteous works shall be remembered; but because of the iniquity that he has committed, he shall die.
Bahnar: Tơdah Inh khan kơ bơngai tơpăt. Tơpă ih gô arih mă-lei tơdah sư gơnang kơ tơdrong tơpăt sư kơdih na pơm yoch, Inh ưh pă đei 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ tơdrong tơpăt mă sư pơm boih, na sư gô lôch lăm tơdrong yoch sư đêl pơm.

English: Again, when I say to the wicked, ‘You shall surely die,’ if he turns from his sin and does what is lawful and right
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh mơ̆n tơdah Inh khan kơ bơngai pơm yoch, Tơpă ih gô lôch mă-lei tơdah sư achăng lê̆ tơdrong yoch na pơm tơdrong tơpăt pơm 'lơ̆ng

English: if the wicked restores the pledge, gives back what he has stolen, and walks in the statutes of life without committing iniquity, he shall surely live; he shall not die.
Bahnar: tơdah bơngai pơm yoch noh pơdrâu tơmam đêl pơkăm đơ̆ng tŏk iŏk păng pơdrâu tơmam đêl sư tơtông, arih sa kiơ̆ trong juăt arih 'lơ̆ng, ưh pă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, tơpă sư gô arih, sư ưh pă lôch dơ̆ng.

English: None of his sins which he has committed shall be remembered against him; he has done what is lawful and right; he shall surely live.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong yoch đêl sư pơm ưh pă 'blŏk dơ̆ng boih; sư pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt păng tơdrong tơpăt na sư gô arih.

English: “Yet the children of your people say, ‘The way of the Lord is not fair.’ But it is their way which is not fair!
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla ih khan: Trong Kră Yang ưh kơ tơpăt. Mă-lei tă tơ trong lu sư ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: When the righteous turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, he shall die because of it.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai tơpăt lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, sư gô lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch noh.

English: But when the wicked turns from his wickedness and does what is lawful and right, he shall live because of it.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai pơm yoch achăng lê̆ tơdrong yoch na sư pơm 'lơ̆ng kiơ̆ khôi juăt pơm tơpăt, yua kơ đơ̆ng lu tơdrong noh sư gô arih.

English: Yet you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not fair.’ O house of Israel, I will judge every one of you according to his own ways.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: ‘Trong Kră Yang ưh kơ tơpăt!’ Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, Inh gô sek tơlang lu iĕm rim 'nu kiơ̆ kơ trong lu sư kơdih.”

English: And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, that one who had escaped from Jerusalem came to me and said, “The city has been captured!”
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơđăm khei mơjĭt, sơnăm mơjĭt-'bar đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu nhôn jing bơnă đe, đei minh 'nu bơngai klaih đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem năm tơbăt kơ inh: “Pơlei Jêrusalem đe iŏk boih.”

English: Now the hand of the LORD had been upon me the evening before the man came who had escaped. And He had opened my mouth; so when he came to me in the morning, my mouth was opened, and I was no longer mute.
Bahnar: Ti Kră Yang dan kơpal inh gah kơsơ̆ adrol kơ bơngai năm roi noh truh; Sư ăn kơ inh gơh pơma dơ̆ng adrol kơ bơngai noh truh tơ inh kiơ̆ pơgê, 'bơ̆r inh gơh pơma pă kơmlo dơ̆ng.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, they who inhabit those ruins in the land of Israel are saying, ‘Abraham was only one, and he inherited the land. But we are many; the land has been given to us as a possession.’
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, lu bơngai oei lăm char Isơrael juơ tơtŭng âu đei pơma: 'Bok nhôn Abraham lăp minh 'nu sư đei iŏk char 'nâu, mă-lei lu bơ̆n bơngai lơ, sĭt bơ̆n gô iŏk teh char âu wă jang sa.

English: “Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “You eat meat with blood, you lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blood. Should you then possess the land?
Bahnar: Lei na khan bĕ kơ lu sư, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ lu iĕm sa 'nhĕm oei pham, măt lu iĕm maih lăng tơ rup yang, lu iĕm tuh pham pơlôch băl, lei lu iĕm gô iŏk char âu hă?

English: You rely on your sword, you commit abominations, and you defile one another’s wives. Should you then possess the land?” ’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơnang kơ đao hơlă iĕm, pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp, rim 'nu lu iĕm pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach hăm akăn lu rông 'bôt kơdih; na lu iĕm gô iŏk asong băl char âu hă?

English: “Say thus to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “As I live, surely those who are in the ruins shall fall by the sword, and the one who is in the open field I will give to the beasts to be devoured, and those who are in the strongholds and caves shall die of the pestilence.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư tơdrong âu: Kră Yang khan Thoi Inh mă arih, lu bơngai lăm anih răm rai gô lôch kơ đao; Lu bơngai oei lăm kơđông dah lăm hơlŭng gô lôch kơ jĭ hơbuh, lu bơngai oei lăm bri brah gô pơm tơmam sa kơ lu sem bri.

English: For I will make the land most desolate, her arrogant strength shall cease, and the mountains of Israel shall be so desolate that no one will pass through.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ char âu jing juơ tơtŭng pơchah pơchek, tơdrong pơang lu sư gô tôch; kông Isơrael jing juơ pă đei bu oei yak trong noh.

English: Then they shall know that I am the LORD, when I have made the land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed.” ’
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu sư gô băt inh boih Kră Yang, Inh boih ăn kơ char 'nâu jing pă đei, pơchah pơchek yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă lu sư đei pơm.’

English: “As for you, son of man, the children of your people are talking about you beside the walls and in the doors of the houses; and they speak to one another, everyone saying to his brother, ‘Please come and hear what the word is that comes from the LORD.’
Bahnar: Bĭ ih ơ kon bơngai, lu kon pơlei pơla, kon sâu ih, pơma roi 'bơm kơ ih tơ dur pơlei, hăm 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam, pơma dơnuh băl tơduă lu sư, rim 'nu, bĕ bơ̆n năm mơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơma kiơ.

English: So they come to you as people do, they sit before you as My people, and they hear your words, but they do not do them; for with their mouth they show much love, but their hearts pursue their own gain.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tơ ih thoi kon pơlei Inh juăt kơ năm, lu sư năm mơ̆ng nơ̆r ih thoi kon pơlei Inh; mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong noh ôh 'bơ̆r lu sư pơm khan 'mêm mơnat, jơhngơ̆m lu sư chă tơdrong đei lơi yua kơdih akâu.

English: Indeed you are to them as a very lovely song of one who has a pleasant voice and can play well on an instrument; for they hear your words, but they do not do them.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ lu sư lăng, ih thoi bơngai hơri tơdrong hưch wă hiôk, hơri tơ'nguơ̆ hơbôn, đei brŏ reh pơjuang hiôk; lu sư mơ̆ng nơ̆r ih đĕch mă-lei ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆.

English: And when this comes to pass—surely it will come—then they will know that a prophet has been among them.”
Bahnar: Mưh tơdrong 'nâu truh, gô truh tơpă, lu sư gô băt đei minh 'nu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol oei lăm lu sư.”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel, prophesy and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD to the shepherds: “Woe to the shepherds of Israel who feed themselves! Should not the shepherds feed the flocks?
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol wă blah plơ̆ lu bơngai wei triu, lu bơngai wei rong Isơrael; khan lê̆ adrol pơma kơ lu sư, athei khan lê̆ kơ bơngai wei triu: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Răm-'băm tơpă, ơ lu bơngai wei rong Isơrael, lăp hiơ̆k kơ wei rong kơdih akâu đĕch, hăm trŏ kơ lu bơngai wei triu noh wei rong khŭl triu dah kiơ?

English: You eat the fat and clothe yourselves with the wool; you slaughter the fatlings, but you do not feed the flock.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm sa 'nhĕm rơmă, hrŭk ao sŏk triu, lu iĕm 'buh sa kon triu bek, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wei rong lu triu.

English: The weak you have not strengthened, nor have you healed those who were sick, nor bound up the broken, nor brought back what was driven away, nor sought what was lost; but with force and cruelty you have ruled them.
Bahnar: Lu kon triu tơrăn, iĕm ưh kơ tơgŭm ăn kơ lu sư pran; lu triu jĭ, iĕm ưh kơ ming hơmet wă kơ klaih; lu triu rơka, iĕm ưh kơ đei hơmet lu triu mă jrok tơklah tơklang, lu iĕm ưh kơ chông brŏk lu kon triu mă jrok hiong lu iĕm ưh kơ năm chă. Lu iĕm wei rong sư hăm tơdrong pơgŏ pơđep.

English: So they were scattered because there was no shepherd; and they became food for all the beasts of the field when they were scattered.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ưh kơ đei bơngai bơwei, kon triu tơklah tơklang, lu sư tơklah tơklang jing tơmam sa lu sem bri.

English: My sheep wandered through all the mountains, and on every high hill; yes, My flock was scattered over the whole face of the earth, and no one was seeking or searching for them.”
Bahnar: Lu triu Inh tơklah jơ̆p kơ kông kŏ păng groi kơjung. Lu triu Inh tơklah tơklang jơ̆p-jang kơ lăm teh đak, ưh kơ đei bu 'moi ưh kơ đei bu chơchă.

English: ‘Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD
Bahnar: Thoi noh ơ lu bơngai wei triu, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang

English: “As I live,” says the Lord GOD, “surely because My flock became a prey, and My flock became food for every beast of the field, because there was no shepherd, nor did My shepherds search for My flock, but the shepherds fed themselves and did not feed My flock”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Thoi Inh mă arih, yua kơ ưh kơ đei bơngai wei, triu Inh jing tơmam tơgar iŏk, jing tơmam sa kơ lu sem bri brah; lu bơngai wei ưh kơ chơchă triu Inh, lu sư hăt wei kơdih akâu ưh kơ wei khŭl triu Inh.

English: therefore, O shepherds, hear the word of the LORD!
Bahnar: Na, ơ lu bơngai wei, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang!

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will require My flock at their hand; I will cause them to cease feeding the sheep, and the shepherds shall feed themselves no more; for I will deliver My flock from their mouths, that they may no longer be food for them.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh wă blah lu bơngai wei triu. Inh gô dui iŏk triu Inh đơ̆ng ti lu sư; Inh ưh pă ăn kơ lu sư wei triu Inh dơ̆ng păng lu sư ưh pă gơh 'me rong kơdih dơ̆ng; Inh dŏng iŏk triu Inh đơ̆ng lăm 'bơ̆r lu sư, wă kơ triu Inh ưh pă pơm tơmam sa kơ lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: ‘For thus says the Lord GOD: “Indeed I Myself will search for My sheep and seek them out.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Inh kơdih gô chă triu Inh păng rong bơwei lu sư.

English: As a shepherd seeks out his flock on the day he is among his scattered sheep, so will I seek out My sheep and deliver them from all the places where they were scattered on a cloudy and dark day.
Bahnar: Thoi bơngai wei triu oei hơdai triu păng jô̆ lăng khŭl triu hiong, Inh kư̆m jô̆ lăng khŭl triu Inh; Inh gô dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng rim anih mă lu sư tơklah tơklang lăm năr măng mu gueo.

English: And I will bring them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries, and will bring them to their own land; I will feed them on the mountains of Israel, in the valleys and in all the inhabited places of the country.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng lăm lu kon pơlei; Inh gô akŭm lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ teh đak păng ba lu sư tơ dêh char lu sư kơdih. Inh gô wei rong lu sư tơ kông Isơrael, jê̆ thong đak păng tơ jơ̆p kơ anih mă kon pơlei oei lăm tơring.

English: I will feed them in good pasture, and their fold shall be on the high mountains of Israel. There they shall lie down in a good fold and feed in rich pasture on the mountains of Israel.
Bahnar: Inh gô wei rong lu sư tơ anih 'nhĕt 'lơ̆p hơdrih; hơdrong lu sư oei tơ kơpal kông Isơrael, tơ noh lu sư gô 'bĭch pơdơh hiôk-hian păng sa 'nhĕt 'lơ̆p hơdrih tơ jơ̆p kơpal kông Isơrael.

English: I will feed My flock, and I will make them lie down,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh kơdih gô wei triu Inh, păng Inh kơdih gô ăn kơ lu sư drum pơdơh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I will seek what was lost and bring back what was driven away, bind up the broken and strengthen what was sick; but I will destroy the fat and the strong, and feed them in judgment.”
Bahnar: Inh gô chă lu triu tơklah, Inh gô anhăk ba lu triu jrok wih brŏk, Inh gô pơ̆n hơmet lu triu rơka păng tơgŭm triu ayơ đei jĭ jăn jing pran. Mă-lei lu triu bek, pran Inh gô pơlôch, yua kơ Inh gô wei rong lu triu inh hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: ‘And as for you, O My flock, thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I shall judge between sheep and sheep, between rams and goats.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Bĕ lu iĕm, ơ triu Inh, Inh gô sek tơlang triu tơduă triu, triu tơno păng bơbe bram.

English: Is it too little for you to have eaten up the good pasture, that you must tread down with your feet the residue of your pasture—and to have drunk of the clear waters, that you must foul the residue with your feet?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm sa 'nhĕt hơdrih 'lơ̆ng, ưh tam mah ôh hă? Na iĕm iŏk jơ̆ng pơjuă lê̆ 'nhĕt mă oei oei noh; iĕm nhă đak hlăng boih na iŏk jơ̆ng jur pơpŭk lê̆ gơsŏk đĭ lu đak mă oei oei noh.

English: And as for My flock, they eat what you have trampled with your feet, and they drink what you have fouled with your feet.”
Bahnar: Lu triu Inh sa săi 'nhĕt mă đêl lu iĕm pơjuă păng nhă nhăi đak gơsŏk mă lu iĕm pơpŭk hă?

English: ‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD to them: “Behold, I Myself will judge between the fat and the lean sheep.
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: Inh kơdih gô sek tơlang bre triu bek păng lu triu hơkĕ.

English: Because you have pushed with side and shoulder, butted all the weak ones with your horns, and scattered them abroad
Bahnar: Lu iĕm yua kơiĕng păng hơngiĕng na tŭn, iŏk hơke tơ̆m lu triu tơrăn dĭng mah lu sư jing tơklah tơklang.

English: therefore I will save My flock, and they shall no longer be a prey; and I will judge between sheep and sheep.
Bahnar: Na Inh gô pơklaih khŭl triu Inh lu sư ưh pơm tơmam sa kơ lu bơngai tơtông tơgar iŏk dơ̆ng păng Inh gô sek tơlang kơ triu hăm triu.

English: I will establish one shepherd over them, and he shall feed them—My servant David. He shall feed them and be their shepherd.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn đei minh 'nu bơngai wei rong lu sư; bơngai wei lu sư noh Đawit, đĭch đam Inh. Sư boih bơngai rong lu sư.

English: And I, the LORD, will be their God, and My servant David a prince among them; I, the LORD, have spoken.
Bahnar: Inh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, gah Đawit, đĭch đam Inh, pơm pơtao lu sư. Inh Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I will make a covenant of peace with them, and cause wild beasts to cease from the land; and they will dwell safely in the wilderness and sleep in the woods.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p hiôk-hian hăm lu sư. Inh pơpuh lu sem bri đơ̆ng teh weh tơ nai; lei wă kơ lu sư oei sa hiôk-hian tơ anih bri rơwơ̆ng.

English: I will make them and the places all around My hill a blessing; and I will cause showers to come down in their season; there shall be showers of blessing.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn dơ̆ng kơ lu sư tơring jum dăr kơ kông inh. Inh gô ăn đak 'mi trŏ kơ bơyan, đak 'mi pŭn hiôk.

English: Then the trees of the field shall yield their fruit, and the earth shall yield her increase. They shall be safe in their land; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I have broken the bands of their yoke and delivered them from the hand of those who enslaved them.
Bahnar: 'Long tơ bri brah gô đei plei, teh gô chăt jing đei plei yua. Lu sư gô oei hiôk hơđơ̆ng tơ teh đak lu sư kơdih păng băt kơ Inh boih Kră Yang, kơplah Inh gơ̆ lê̆ 'long ăt đơ̆ng lu sư, pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai rôp lu sư pơm đĭch.

English: And they shall no longer be a prey for the nations, nor shall beasts of the land devour them; but they shall dwell safely, and no one shall make them afraid.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh pă pơm tơmam sa kơ lu teh đak nai dơ̆ng; lu sem bri mă khĕnh kư̆m pă đei sa lu sư dơ̆ng, lu sư gô oei sa hiôk-hian, pă đei hli dơ̆ng.

English: I will raise up for them a garden of renown, and they shall no longer be consumed with hunger in the land, nor bear the shame of the Gentiles anymore.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjing mir đei plei 'lơ̆ng đe ư-ang nă ăn kơ lu sư, lăm tơring lu sư pă đei pơngot dơ̆ng păng lu dêh char nai pă đei pơjăm pơjuă pơm kơ lu sư mơlâu dơ̆ng.

English: Thus they shall know that I, the LORD their God, am with them, and they, the house of Israel, are My people,” says the Lord GOD.’
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu sư gô băt inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư oei hơdai hăm lu sư, păng lu sư adrĕch adrung Isơrael jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, Kră Yang khan.

English: “You are My flock, the flock of My pasture; you are men, and I am your God,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lu sư triu Inh, triu oei lăm anih 'nhĕt Inh; lu iĕm jing kon bơngai Inh păng inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, tơwih muh măt ih tơklă tơ Kông Seir păng khan lê̆ adrol blah sư.

English: and say to it, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, O Mount Seir, I am against you; I will stretch out My hand against you, And make you most desolate
Bahnar: Păng khan kơ lu sư: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ Kông Seir, inh blah Ih! Inh gô yơ̆r ti blah ih, gô pơm kơ anih ih juơ rơhiăng pă đei.

English: I shall lay your cities waste, And you shall be desolate. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ pơlei ih jing juơ, ih jing pă đei. Ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “Because you have had an ancient hatred, and have shed the blood of the children of Israel by the power of the sword at the time of their calamity, when their iniquity came to an end
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih răk rong tơdrong blĕk đơ̆ng sơ̆, na jao lu bơngai Isơrael lôch kơ đao lăm tơdrong tơblah tơblŭng, đei 'bet pơlôch lu sư lăm tơdrong phak mă hơtuch.

English: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “I will prepare you for blood, and blood shall pursue you; since you have not hated blood, therefore blood shall pursue you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan: Thoi Inh mă arih, Inh gô pơm kơ ih tuh pham pơlôch băl, pham gô druh kiơ̆ ih, yua kơ ih ưh kơ areh kơ tơdrong tuh pham, na pham gô druh kiơ̆ ih!

English: Thus I will make Mount Seir most desolate, and cut off from it the one who leaves and the one who returns.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ Kông Seir pơchah răm đĭ, pơm kơ anih noh pă đei bơngai yak wih wơ̆t rok noh.

English: And I will fill its mountains with the slain; on your hills and in your valleys and in all your ravines those who are slain by the sword shall fall.
Bahnar: Lu kông iĕm gô 'bĕnh kơ akâu bơngai lôch; tơ kơpal groi lăm thŭng lăm thong đak tă đei akâu bơngai lôch kơ đao.

English: I will make you perpetually desolate, and your cities shall be uninhabited; then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ ih jing hiong hach hlŏng hloi; lu pơlei ih ưh pă đei bơngai oei, na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang

English: “Because you have said, ‘These two nations and these two countries shall be mine, and we will possess them,’ although the LORD was there
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih khan: 'Bar adrĕch adrung 'nâu păng 'bar tŏ dêh char 'nâu gah nhôn, lu nhôn gô iŏk, mă khan Kră Yang oei tơ noh.’

English: therefore, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “I will do according to your anger and according to the envy which you showed in your hatred against them; and I will make Myself known among them when I judge you.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan: Thoi Inh mă arih, inh gô pơm kơ ih kiơ̆ tơdrong hil mĭl păng jơhngơ̆m areh mă ih pơm kơ lu sư boih, Na lu sư gô băt Inh sek tơlang ih kiơ̆ tơdrong ih pơm kơ lu sư.

English: Then you shall know that I am the LORD. I have heard all your blasphemies which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, ‘They are desolate; they are given to us to consume.’
Bahnar: Ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ih pơma pơjăm pơjuă hăm lu kông Isơrael khan: “Lu sư răm đĭ boih, lu sư gô jing tơmam sa lu bơ̆n.”

English: Thus with your mouth you have boasted against Me and multiplied your words against Me; I have heard them.”
Bahnar: Nơ̆r ih pơma pơang blah Inh; păng rai thim nơ̆r blah inh, Inh kơtơ̆ng boih!

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “The whole earth will rejoice when I make you desolate.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Đĭ-đăng kơ dêh char chơt hiôk kơplah inh pơm kơ ih jing juơ pă đei.

English: As you rejoiced because the inheritance of the house of Israel was desolate, so I will do to you; you shall be desolate, O Mount Seir, as well as all of Edom—all of it! Then they shall know that I am the LORD.” ’
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih chơt hiôk mưh mŭk tơmam adrĕch Isơrael jing juơ pă đei, na Inh kư̆m gô pơm kơ ih thoi noh. Kông Seir păng đĭ kơ Eđôm, gô jing juơ pă đei păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.’”

English: “And you, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, and say, ‘O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD!
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ gah kông kŏ Isơrael păng khan: “Ơ kông Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang!

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because the enemy has said of you, ‘Aha! The ancient heights have become our possession,’ ” ’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ lu ayăt khan gah ih. “Aha! Lu kông kơjung noh sơ̆ gah lu nhôn boih.”

English: therefore prophesy, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because they made you desolate and swallowed you up on every side, so that you became the possession of the rest of the nations, and you are taken up by the lips of talkers and slandered by the people”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh khan lê̆ adrol thoi âu: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Yua kơ lu sư pơm kơ ih jing juơ rơhiăng pă đei, blah ih đơ̆ng gah puăn pah, pơm kơ ih jing tơmam lu adrĕch adrung oei đei yua iŏk păng jing nơ̆r đe pơma roi sa, pơjăm

English: therefore, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus says the Lord GOD to the mountains, the hills, the rivers, the valleys, the desolate wastes, and the cities that have been forsaken, which became plunder and mockery to the rest of the nations all around
Bahnar: na, ơ lu kông groi Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang mơsêh mơyang: Kră Yang khan thoi âu kơ lu kông groi, lu thŭng thong păng teh dơnă, lu glung, lu anih pơchah pơchek, lu pơlei đĭ răm mă đĭ đe tơgar iŏk đe pơjăm đơ̆ng lu dêh char mă oei oei jum dăr kơ char ih noh.

English: therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I have spoken in My burning jealousy against the rest of the nations and against all Edom, who gave My land to themselves as a possession, with wholehearted joy and spiteful minds, in order to plunder its open country.” ’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Lăm tơdrong Inh hil gar tơtŏ thoi ŭnh, inh wă blah lu dêh char mă oei oei păng đĭ kơ char Eđôm, lu dêh char mă đĭ jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk pơjăm tơgar iŏk teh Inh jing tơmam sư kơdih păng tơgar iŏk lu tơmăn 'nhĕt

English: “Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel, and say to the mountains, the hills, the rivers, and the valleys, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I have spoken in My jealousy and My fury, because you have borne the shame of the nations.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ gah teh đak Isơrael; khan bĕ kơ lu kông kŏ păng lu groi, lu glung păng lu teh thŭng dơnă: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu Inh khan hăm tơdrong Inh hil gar, yua kơ lu iĕm pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu đơ̆ng lu char nai pơjăm.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “I have raised My hand in an oath that surely the nations that are around you shall bear their own shame.
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh yơ̆r ti pơkă: Lu dêh char jum dăr kơ ih tơpă lu sư gô mơlâu!

English: But you, O mountains of Israel, you shall shoot forth your branches and yield your fruit to My people Israel, for they are about to come.
Bahnar: Na gah ih, ơ kông Isơrael, ih gô bluh dơ̆ng lơ păng đei plei ăn kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael inh; yua kơ lu sư wă wih brŏk.

English: For indeed I am for you, and I will turn to you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
Bahnar: Inh gô wei-lăng ih, tơchĕng gah ih păng đe gô choh pơtăm păng rei jơmŭl ih dơ̆ng.

English: I will multiply men upon you, all the house of Israel, all of it; and the cities shall be inhabited and the ruins rebuilt.
Bahnar: Lăm char ih Inh gô ăn kon pơlei adrĕch adrung Isơrael rai lơ, tơ lu pơlei ih gô đei bơngai oei, lu anih mă đêl pơchah đe gô tơiung hơmet.

English: I will multiply upon you man and beast; and they shall increase and bear young; I will make you inhabited as in former times, and do better for you than at your beginnings. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kon bơngai păng sem dơrong lăm char ih rai lơ păng chek lar. Inh gô ăn kơ ih đei kon pơlei oei thoi adrol sơ̆ păng ăn ih mơdrŏng hloh kơ blŭng-a. Na ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Yes, I will cause men to walk on you, My people Israel; they shall take possession of you, and you shall be their inheritance; no more shall you bereave them of children.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn lu kon pơlei, noh kon pơlei Isơrael Inh gô yak kơpal teh ih; lu sư gô iŏk ih wei pơm tơmam lu sư, ih jing tơmam lu sư, Lu sư ưh pă kơ'bah lu kon sâu.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because they say to you, ‘You devour men and bereave your nation of children,’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Lu đe khan kơ ih thoi âu: Ih luăn sa bơngai pơm kơ dêh ih ưh kơ đei kon hơ'lơ̆p.

English: therefore you shall devour men no more, nor bereave your nation anymore,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Na ih ưh pă luăn sa bơngai dơ̆ng păng dêh char ih gô đei hơ'lơ̆p, Kră Yang khan.

English: “Nor will I let you hear the taunts of the nations anymore, nor bear the reproach of the peoples anymore, nor shall you cause your nation to stumble anymore,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh ưh pă ăn ih kơtơ̆ng lu nơ̆r kơnê̆ đe pơjăm pơjuă đơ̆ng lu dêh char; ih kư̆m huay pă pŭ tơdrong mơlâu dơ̆ng lu kon pơlei dơ̆ng păng ih kư̆m ưh pă ăn kơ dêh char ih, ih pơ̆k huŏng dơ̆ng, Kră Yang khan.”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh dơ̆ng

English: “Son of man, when the house of Israel dwelt in their own land, they defiled it by their own ways and deeds; to Me their way was like the uncleanness of a woman in her customary impurity.
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, kơplah adrĕch adrung Isơrael oei tơ lăm dêh char lu sư kơdih, lu adrĕch Isơrael pơm boih tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach kơ dêh char. Tơdrong mă lu sư pơm 'bơ̆t anăp Inh kư̆m kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach thoi drŏ-kăn 'bôh hơbĕn.

English: Therefore I poured out My fury on them for the blood they had shed on the land, and for their idols with which they had defiled it.
Bahnar: Na Inh tuh tơdrong hil mĭl tơ lu sư, yua kơ lu sư pơm tuh pham pơlôch đe păng yua kơ đơ̆ng lu sư kơkuh kơ rup yang pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ teh đak.

English: So I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed throughout the countries; I judged them according to their ways and their deeds.
Bahnar: Inh pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak, tơ jơ̆p kơ tơring; Inh sek tơlang boih lu sư kiơ̆ kơ trong lu sư kiơ̆ păng tơdrong lu sư đei pơm.

English: When they came to the nations, wherever they went, they profaned My holy name—when they said of them, ‘These are the people of the LORD, and yet they have gone out of His land.’
Bahnar: Tơ lăm dêh char mă lu sư oei, lu sư đei pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, đe pơma 'bơm lu sư khan: ‘Noh lu kon pơlei Kră Yang mă-lei đe puh tơweh lu sư đơ̆ng dêh char Kră Yang.

English: But I had concern for My holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations wherever they went.
Bahnar: Inh bơwei anăn rơgoh Inh anăn mă adrĕch Isơrael pơm pơ'mê̆ tơ lăm lu dêh char mă lu sư năm truh.

English: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I do not do this for your sake, O house of Israel, but for My holy name’s sake, which you have profaned among the nations wherever you went.
Bahnar: Thoi noh khan bĕ kơ adrĕch Isơrael: “Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, noh ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ lu iĕm mă Inh wă pơm noh, mă-lei yua kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh mă lu iĕm hlôi pơm pơ'mê̆ bơih tơ lăm lu dêh char mă lu iĕm năm truh.

English: And I will sanctify My great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in their midst; and the nations shall know that I am the LORD,” says the Lord GOD, “when I am hallowed in you before their eyes.
Bahnar: Inh gô hơmet ming anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh anăn mă lu iĕm pơm pơ'mê̆ boih tơ lăm lu dêh char, noh anăn Inh mă lu iĕm hlôi pơm pơ'mê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, Kră Yang khan: Thoi noh lu adrĕch adrung gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư Inh gô tơ'bôh pơdah tơdrong rơgoh 'lơ̆ng Inh lăm lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: For I will take you from among the nations, gather you out of all countries, and bring you into your own land.
Bahnar: Inh gô dui iŏk lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm lu dêh char akŭm pơpôi lu iĕm đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ teh đak, ba lu iĕm wih brŏk oei tơ char lu iĕm kơdih.

English: Then I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you shall be clean; I will cleanse you from all your filthiness and from all your idols.
Bahnar: Inh gô ruh đak rơgoh hlăng tơ lu iĕm, lu iĕm gô; rơgoh lu iĕm gô rơgoh đĭ đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach păng rơgoh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơkuh kơ rup yang lu iĕm.

English: I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit within you; I will take the heart of stone out of your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm jơhngơ̆m 'nao păng ăn yang bơhngol 'nao tơ lăm lu iĕm; Inh gô iŏk hŭt lê̆ đĭ jơhngơ̆m arăng thoi tơmo đơ̆ng akâu lu iĕm păng ăn kơ lu iĕm jơhngơ̆m rơmuăn hăm sĕch wă chu kiơ̆ Inh.

English: I will put My Spirit within you and cause you to walk in My statutes, and you will keep My judgments and do them.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn Yang Bơhngol Inh oei lăm lu iĕm, wă kơ lu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt inh, lu iĕm gô pơ'lơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ lu nơ̆r Inh tơtă.

English: Then you shall dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers; you shall be My people, and I will be your God.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô oei tơ lăm teh đak mă Inh ăn kơ yă 'bok lu iĕm, lu iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: I will deliver you from all your uncleannesses. I will call for the grain and multiply it, and bring no famine upon you.
Bahnar: Inh gô dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach; Inh gô ăn kơ 'ba mi jing 'lơ̆ng kơchar rai lơ păng ưh pă ăn kơ lu iĕm pơngot rơwĕt.

English: And I will multiply the fruit of your trees and the increase of your fields, so that you need never again bear the reproach of famine among the nations.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn plei 'long hơnik hơnam lăm mir chŭn đei rai tŏk lơ wă kơ lu iĕm huay pă mơlâu kơ char đe lăm tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt.

English: Then you will remember your evil ways and your deeds that were not good; and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight, for your iniquities and your abominations.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm gô 'blŏk kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm păng tơdrong iĕm pơm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Tơpă lu iĕm gô lăng areh krưp kơdih akâu yua kơ tơdrong yoch păng tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lu iĕm pơm.

English: Not for your sake do I do this,” says the Lord GOD, “let it be known to you. Be ashamed and confounded for your own ways, O house of Israel!”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ lu iĕm na Inh pơm thoi noh, lu iĕm athei băt nhen tơdrong noh, ơ adrĕch Isơrael, lu iĕm athei băt mơlâu kơdih!”

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “On the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will also enable you to dwell in the cities, and the ruins shall be rebuilt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Năr mă Inh ôp hơrao rơgoh tơdrong yoch lu iĕm, Inh pơm ăn kơ pơlei lu iĕm gô đei kon pơlei oei păng pơjing ming dơ̆ng lu anih mă đĭ pơchah răm.

English: The desolate land shall be tilled instead of lying desolate in the sight of all who pass by.
Bahnar: Anih lê̆ bri gô choh pơtăm dơ̆ng, ưh pă lê̆ thoi adrol sơ̆ 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai rok găn.

English: So they will say, ‘This land that was desolate has become like the garden of Eden; and the wasted, desolate, and ruined cities are now fortified and inhabited.’
Bahnar: Đe gô pơma khan: “Anih teh lê̆ bri âu dang ei jing pơgar Êđen păng lu pơlei mă đĭ pơchah pă đei noh 'nâu đei tơiung pơdơ̆ng ming đei kon pơlei oei!”

English: Then the nations which are left all around you shall know that I, the LORD, have rebuilt the ruined places and planted what was desolate. I, the LORD, have spoken it, and I will do it.”
Bahnar: Dang ei lu adrĕch adrung kon pơlei oei jum dăr kơ lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh gô hơmet ming anih mă hlôi pơrăm, choh pơtăm dơ̆ng mă anih hlôi lê̆ bri. Inh boih Kră Yang Inh khan boih Inh gô pơm.”

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I will also let the house of Israel inquire of Me to do this for them: I will increase their men like a flock.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Inh kư̆m ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael chă apinh Inh tơdrong 'nâu, ăn kơ lu sư rai lơ kơdrâ̆m thoi khŭl triu

English: Like a flock offered as holy sacrifices, like the flock at Jerusalem on its feast days, so shall the ruined cities be filled with flocks of men. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: nhen thoi triu 'măn wă pơm tơmam soi tơ Jêrusalem lăm năr giĕng tih. Mă lu pơlei đêl pơchah răm gô 'bĕnh kơ kon pơlei oei, lei na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: The hand of the LORD came upon me and brought me out in the Spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones.
Bahnar: Ti Kră Yang dan kơpal inh; Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang chông ba inh na tơoei inh tŏk-bŏk thŭng dơnă 'bĕnh kơ kơting.

English: Then He caused me to pass by them all around, and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and indeed they were very dry.
Bahnar: Sư chông inh nơnăm juang jơ̆p kơ kơting noh; 'bôh tơ lăm thŭng dơnă noh đei kơting lơ păng kro krĕnh boih.

English: And He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” So I answered, “O Lord GOD, You know.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, lu kơting âu hăm oei gơh arih dah ưh?” Inh tơl: “Ơ Kră Yang Ih đĕch băt tơdrong noh!”

English: Again He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones, and say to them, ‘O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD!
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Athei khan lê̆ adrol bĕ kơ kơting 'nâu, khan kơ lu sư: “Ơ lu kơting kro, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.”

English: Thus says the Lord GOD to these bones: “Surely I will cause breath to enter into you, and you shall live.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ lu kơting noh: “Âu, Inh ăn hơyuh kial jơhngơ̆m arih mơ̆t tơ lăm lu iĕm, na lu iĕm gô arih.”

English: I will put sinews on you and bring flesh upon you, cover you with skin and put breath in you; and you shall live. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn huan, ăn sĕch tơ lu iĕm păng lom akâu iĕm hăm akar. Inh gô ăn hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m tơ lăm iĕm, na lu iĕm gô arih; păng lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: So I prophesied as I was commanded; and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and suddenly a rattling; and the bones came together, bone to bone.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh khan lê̆ adrol thoi Kră Yang tơtă kơ inh; kơplah inh oei pơma khan lê̆ đei kơtơ̆ng jơwa re đei teh pơpơ̆; lu kơting tơ bưh băl tơduă kơting hăm kơting.

English: Indeed, as I looked, the sinews and the flesh came upon them, and the skin covered them over; but there was no breath in them.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Inh lăng 'bôh đei huan păng sĕch bluh đei akar lom kơting gah 'nguaih, mă-lei ưh kơ đei kial arih tơ lăm lu sư.

English: Also He said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, son of man, and say to the breath, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Athei khan lê̆ adrol kơ kial arih, ‘ơ kon bơngai, athei khan lê̆ adrol bĕ kơ kial arih khan: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ kial arih năm bĕ đơ̆ng puăn pah kial mơ̆t dui jơhngơ̆m bĕ tơ akâu lu bơngai lôch wă kơ lu sư arih.’”

English: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and breath came into them, and they lived, and stood upon their feet, an exceedingly great army.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh khan lê̆ adrol thoi Kră Yang tơtă kơ inh; hơyuh kial arih mơ̆t boih tơ lăm lu akâu lôch; lu sư iung arih boih păng dơ̆ng hăm jơ̆ng lu sư kơdih, jing kon bơngai lơlap lơlang thoi minh khŭl linh lơ.

English: Then He said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. They indeed say, ‘Our bones are dry, our hope is lost, and we ourselves are cut off!’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, lu kơting âu boih đĭ kơ adrĕch Isơrael. To, lu sư khan: ‘Kơting lu bơ̆n kro boih, tơdrong hơmĕng lu bơ̆n hiong đĭ boih, lu bơ̆n lôch răm đĭ boih!’

English: Therefore prophesy and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, O My people, I will open your graves and cause you to come up from your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.
Bahnar: Na, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ, khan kơ lu sư: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ kon pơlei Inh, Inh gô pơih bơsat lu iĕm, wă hơtŏk lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm bơsat păng Inh anhăk ba lu iĕm brŏk tơ teh đak Isơrael.

English: Then you shall know that I am the LORD, when I have opened your graves, O My people, and brought you up from your graves.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Inh, lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, mưh Inh pơih bơsat lu iĕm păng hơtŏk lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm bơsat.

English: I will put My Spirit in you, and you shall live, and I will place you in your own land. Then you shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken it and performed it,” says the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn Yang Bơhngol Inh kơ lu iĕm na lu iĕm gô arih; Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm brŏk tơ teh iĕm kơdih na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh khan pơkă boih, Inh gô pơm Kră Yang khan.

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “As for you, son of man, take a stick for yourself and write on it: ‘For Judah and for the children of Israel, his companions.’ Then take another stick and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel, his companions.’
Bahnar: “Ơ kon bơngai, ih athei iŏk minh pôm 'long jra păng chih tơ noh: Juđa păng adrĕch adrung Isơrael pơgơ̆p hăm sư. Athei iŏk minh pôm 'long jra nai dơ̆ng păng chih tơ noh: Jôsep, noh tơmam Êphraim hăm lu adrĕch Isơrael jing pơgơ̆p hơdai.

English: Then join them one to another for yourself into one stick, and they will become one in your hand.
Bahnar: Iŏk 'bar tŏ 'long jra noh pơm jing minh, wă kơ sư jing minh pôm 'long jra lăm ti ih.

English: “And when the children of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Will you not show us what you mean by these?’
Bahnar: Tơdah lu adrĕch adrung ih đei jet: ‘Ih ưh kơ wă tơblang ăn kơ lu nhôn băt tơdrong noh wă khan kiơ hă?’

English: say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, his companions; and I will join them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in My hand.” ’
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu Inh gô iŏk 'long jra Jôsep wă khan Êphraim hăm lu adrĕch Isơrael pơgơ̆p hăm sư păng gô akŭm tơ 'long jra Juđa jing minh pôm, na 'bar tŏ 'long jra jing minh lăm ti Inh.

English: And the sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.
Bahnar: Chĕp bĕ 'long jra mă ih chih boih noh, tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư

English: “Then say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I will take the children of Israel from among the nations, wherever they have gone, and will gather them from every side and bring them into their own land
Bahnar: păng khan bĕ kơ lu sư: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh gô chông ba adrĕch adrung Isơrael đơ̆ng lu char mă lu sư oei, Inh gô akŭm lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char chông ba lu sư wih brŏk tơ char lu sư kơdih.

English: and I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king shall be king over them all; they shall no longer be two nations, nor shall they ever be divided into two kingdoms again.
Bahnar: Inh gô akŭm lu sư jing minh adrĕch adrung lăm char noh, tơ kơpal groi kông Isơrael. Lu sư đei minh 'nu pơtao pơgơ̆r đĕch. Lu sư ưh pă đei 'bar adrĕch adrung păng ưh pă klah 'bar tŏ dêh char pơtao dơ̆ng.

English: They shall not defile themselves anymore with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will deliver them from all their dwelling places in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. Then they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh pă pơm 'mê̆ akâu kơkuh kơ rup yang, lu tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp păng dôm tơdrong yoch glăi. Inh gô dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pơ̆k huŏng, mă lu sư hlôi pơm. Inh gô ôp hơrao lu sư, lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: “David My servant shall be king over them, and they shall all have one shepherd; they shall also walk in My judgments and observe My statutes, and do them.
Bahnar: Đĭch đam Inh Đawit pơtao lu sư. Lu sư gô đei minh 'nu bơngai wei; lu sư gô năm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă; lu sư gô wei răk păng pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh.

English: Then they shall dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob My servant, where your fathers dwelt; and they shall dwell there, they, their children, and their children’s children, forever; and My servant David shall be their prince forever.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô oei arih sa lăm char mă Inh ăn kơ Jakôp đĭch đam Inh char mă 'bok yă lu sư oei sơ̆. Lu sư, kon sâu lu sư, gô oei tơ noh ling-lang; đĭch đam Inh Đawit jing pơtao lu sư hlŏng hloi.

English: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them, and it shall be an everlasting covenant with them; I will establish them and multiply them, and I will set My sanctuary in their midst forevermore.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p hiôk-hian hăm lu sư, noh pơgơ̆p ling-lang lu sư hăm Inh, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư jing rai lơ. Inh gô 'măn anih rơgoh Inh tơ lăm lu sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: My tabernacle also shall be with them; indeed I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
Bahnar: Hnam rơgoh Inh gô oei tơ lăm lu sư, Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Inh.

English: The nations also will know that I, the LORD, sanctify Israel, when My sanctuary is in their midst forevermore.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Mưh Inh 'măn anih rơgoh Inh oei tơ lăm lu sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi, lu dêh char gô băt kơ Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh boih tơplih kon pơlei Isơrael jing rơgoh.’

English: Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Son of man, set your face against Gog, of the land of Magog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal, and prophesy against him
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, tơwih muh măt ih blah Gôk dêh char Magôk pơtao lu kon pơlei Rôs, Mêsêk, Tubal, khan lê̆ adrol blah sư.

English: and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ: Kră Yang đei khan thoi âu: Ơ Gôk pơtao Rôs, Mêsêk păng Tuban, âu Inh blah ih.

English: I will turn you around, put hooks into your jaws, and lead you out, with all your army, horses, and horsemen, all splendidly clothed, a great company with bucklers and shields, all of them handling swords.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ ih wih dơ̆ng tah gơwŏk mam, 'bơ̆t kang ih, dui ba ih, hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh ih, aseh păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai hao seh, đĭ-đăng lu sư tă kơ hrŭk ao mam minh khŭl linh lơ chĕp khêl tih iĕ păng đĭ-đăng chĕp đao ngăl.

English: Persia, Ethiopia, and Libya are with them, all of them with shield and helmet
Bahnar: Lu khŭl linh Persơ, Kus păng Phut kư̆m năm hơdai hăm lu sư, đĭ-đăng chĕp khêl păng môk mam.

English: Gomer and all its troops; the house of Togarmah from the far north and all its troops—many people are with you.
Bahnar: Gômer păng đĭ-đăng lu linh sư, pơlei Tôgama oei tôch gah yă-nơ̆m hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh sư, kư̆m đei lơ kon pơlei kư̆m năm hơdai ih.

English: “Prepare yourself and be ready, you and all your companies that are gathered about you; and be a guard for them.
Bahnar: Hơmet bĕ ih hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei akŭm jum dăr ih kư̆m hơmet. Ih gô pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: After many days you will be visited. In the latter years you will come into the land of those brought back from the sword and gathered from many people on the mountains of Israel, which had long been desolate; they were brought out of the nations, and now all of them dwell safely.
Bahnar: Đei loi kơ lơ năr đunh, đe gô krao ih; lăm lu sơnăm tuch-luch ih gô năm tơ minh pôm char mă đei hlôi klaih đơ̆ng đao, akŭm băl đơ̆ng lơ adrĕch adrung; gô truh tơ kông Isơrael, anih mă pơchah jing juơ sơ̆. Kon pơlei noh đei chông ba đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei nai păng đĭ-đăng oei arih hiôk-hian.

English: You will ascend, coming like a storm, covering the land like a cloud, you and all your troops and many peoples with you.”
Bahnar: Ih gô năm tơ anăp blah nhen thoi kial hơbŭt, thoi hơmơ̆l gom lê̆ teh noh, ih păng lu linh hăm lơ adrĕch adrung kiơ̆ ih.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “On that day it shall come to pass that thoughts will arise in your mind, and you will make an evil plan
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr noh ih đei tơchĕng ih wă chă đon pơm kơnê̆.

English: You will say, ‘I will go up against a land of unwalled villages; I will go to a peaceful people, who dwell safely, all of them dwelling without walls, and having neither bars nor gates’
Bahnar: Ih khan: “Inh gô năm truh tơ tơring pơlei mă ưh kơ đei dur; inh gô blah kon pơlei mă oei arih sa hiôk-hian; đĭ-đăng lu sư oei lăm pơlei mă ưh kơ đei kơđông, ưh kơ đei kơ dur păng ưh kơ đei măng jang.

English: to take plunder and to take booty, to stretch out your hand against the waste places that are again inhabited, and against a people gathered from the nations, who have acquired livestock and goods, who dwell in the midst of the land.
Bahnar: Ih gô blah tơgar tơtông iŏk mŭk tơmam, ti ih teh pơchah lu anih mă đĭ juơ sơ̆ dang ei đei kon pơlei oei păng ih blah lu kon pơlei mă truh đơ̆ng lu char, pơlei mă đei lu sem dơrong mŭk tơmam oei lăm tŏk-bŏk tơring char noh.

English: Sheba, Dedan, the merchants of Tarshish, and all their young lions will say to you, ‘Have you come to take plunder? Have you gathered your army to take booty, to carry away silver and gold, to take away livestock and goods, to take great plunder?’ ” ’
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Sêba păng Đêdan, lu bơngai mơdro đơ̆ng Tarêsi păng đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-nglo nuih kơtang thoi dăm-brang mơlôh sư gô khan kơ ih. ‘Hăm trŏ ih truh wă blah tơgar iŏk tơmam Ih akŭm linh wă blah iŏk tơmam, iŏk hu păng maih, wă blah iŏk sem dơrong mŭk tơmam păng wă tơgar iŏk lơ mŭk drăm hă?”’

English: “Therefore, son of man, prophesy and say to Gog, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “On that day when My people Israel dwell safely, will you not know it?
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol bĕ păng tơbăt ăn kơ Gôk: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Kơplah năr noh, kon pơlei Isơrael Inh oei arih sa hiôk-hian, ih ưh kơ băt ôh hă?

English: Then you will come from your place out of the far north, you and many peoples with you, all of them riding on horses, a great company and a mighty army.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih ih oei tơ gah yă-nơ̆m ih gô năm truh, đei lơ kon pơlei kiơ̆ ih, đĭ-đăng lu sư gô hao aseh đei lơ bơngai pơgơ̆p jing minh khŭl linh nuih kơtang.

English: You will come up against My people Israel like a cloud, to cover the land. It will be in the latter days that I will bring you against My land, so that the nations may know Me, when I am hallowed in you, O Gog, before their eyes.”
Bahnar: Ơ Gôk Ih gô blah kon pơlei Isơrael Inh thoi hơmơ̆l gom teh. Lăm năr hơtuch noh Inh gô ăn kơ ih blah char Inh, wă kơ adrĕch kon bơngai băt kơ Inh, kơplah Inh pơdah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh đơ̆ng tơdrong truh tơ ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Are you he of whom I have spoken in former days by My servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied for years in those days that I would bring you against them?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Hăm trŏ kơ ih bơngai mă Inh đei roi đunh đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih Inh đei yua lu đĭch đam Inh lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol bơngai Isơrael, kơplah lăm năr noh sơ̆, đunh sơnăm bơih, lu sư đei khan lê̆ adrol thoi âu. Inh gô chông ih năm blah lu sư.

English: “And it will come to pass at the same time, when Gog comes against the land of Israel,” says the Lord GOD, “that My fury will show in My face.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, năr Gôk năm blah char Isơrael, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Tơdrong Inh hil rai dêh.

English: For in My jealousy and in the fire of My wrath I have spoken: ‘Surely in that day there shall be a great earthquake in the land of Israel
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong Inh gar, lăm tơdrong Inh hil mĭl tơpă, lăm năr noh gô đei tơdrong pơpơ̆ tih dêh truh kơ char Isơrael.

English: so that the fish of the sea, the birds of the heavens, the beasts of the field, all creeping things that creep on the earth, and all men who are on the face of the earth shall shake at My presence. The mountains shall be thrown down, the steep places shall fall, and every wall shall fall to the ground.’
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp Inh, lu ka đak dơsĭ, sem păr kơpal plĕnh, kon sem bri, đĭ lu hơdrông kơep lep-ler mơmŏ kơpal teh păng lu kon bơngai kơpal teh gô hli tơtơ̆, lu kông hơlih, lu dur tơmo gô pơchah, đĭ-đăng lu anih kơjăp gô hơlih đĭ tơ teh.

English: I will call for a sword against Gog throughout all My mountains,” says the Lord GOD. “Every man’s sword will be against his brother.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inh gô krao đao hơlă đơ̆ng rim kơ kông groi Inh blah lu sư; đao hơlă lu sư gô blah 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih.

English: And I will bring him to judgment with pestilence and bloodshed; I will rain down on him, on his troops, and on the many peoples who are with him, flooding rain, great hailstones, fire, and brimstone.
Bahnar: Inh gô phak lu sư hăm tơdrong jĭ hơpoh hăm đao hơlă 'bet pơlôch pham lĕch, Inh gô ăn 'mi hơbŭt, 'mi prĕl, ŭnh păng tơmo ngŭr tuh tơ lu sư, tơ lu kon pơlei kiơ̆ sư hăm lu linh sư.

English: Thus I will magnify Myself and sanctify Myself, and I will be known in the eyes of many nations. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.” ’
Bahnar: Na Inh gô pơm pơdah tơdrong krưp 'lơ̆ng rŏ Inh hăm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh kơ lơ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai păng lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “And you, son of man, prophesy against Gog, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I am against you, O Gog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai, khan lê̆ adrol blah Gôk, khan bĕ kơ sư: “Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ Gôk pơtao đe Rôs, Mêsêk păng Tubal, Inh blah ih.

English: and I will turn you around and lead you on, bringing you up from the far north, and bring you against the mountains of Israel.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ ih wơ̆t dơ̆ng, Inh gô chông ih lĕch năm, na ih gô tŏk năm gah yă-nơ̆m, chông ba ih tŏk blah tơ kông groi Isơrael.

English: Then I will knock the bow out of your left hand, and cause the arrows to fall out of your right hand.
Bahnar: Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ hră đơ̆ng ti 'ngiĕo ih păng tơhuŏng lê̆ 'brơ̆m đơ̆ng ti gah 'ma ih.

English: You shall fall upon the mountains of Israel, you and all your troops and the peoples who are with you; I will give you to birds of prey of every sort and to the beasts of the field to be devoured.
Bahnar: Ih păng lu linh ih, hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei mă kiơ̆ ih gô pơ̆k kơpal groi kông Isơrael. Inh gô ăn kơ lu sem păr păng lu sem bri kăp sa.

English: You shall fall on the open field; for I have spoken,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Ih gô pơ̆k lôch lăm bri, yua kơ Inh khan boih tơdrong noh, Kră Yang khan.

English: “And I will send fire on Magog and on those who live in security in the coastlands. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh soh Magôk, păng lu bơngai mă oei hiôk-hian tơ lu anih đak dơsĭ, na lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: So I will make My holy name known in the midst of My people Israel, and I will not let them profane My holy name anymore. Then the nations shall know that I am the LORD, the Holy One in Israel.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh tơbăt tơ lăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael Inh păng Inh ưh pă ăn lu sư pơma kơnê̆ kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh dơ̆ng. Kơplah noh lu adrĕch adrung gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang, Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh lăm Isơrael.

English: Surely it is coming, and it shall be done,” says the Lord GOD. “This is the day of which I have spoken.
Bahnar: Âu, tơdrong noh wă jê̆ truh sư gô truh, noh năr mă Inh đei khan boih, Kră Yang khan!

English: “Then those who dwell in the cities of Israel will go out and set on fire and burn the weapons, both the shields and bucklers, the bows and arrows, the javelins and spears; and they will make fires with them for seven years.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu kon pơlei Isơrael mă oei lăm lu pơlei gô lĕch năm iŏk soh lu tơmam tơblah yua wă tơkuh, lu khêl tih iĕ, lu hră păng 'brơ̆m, lu hơlă, tơju, lu sư yua pơm 'long ŭnh tơkuh soh lăm tơpơh sơnăm.

English: They will not take wood from the field nor cut down any from the forests, because they will make fires with the weapons; and they will plunder those who plundered them, and pillage those who pillaged them,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh pă chă 'long ŭnh tơ chŭn, ưh pă chă 'long ŭnh tơ bri, yua tơmam tơblah wă tơkuh pơm 'long ŭnh, lu sư gô tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư păng iŏk đơ̆ng lu bơngai mă iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư, Kră Yang khan.

English: “It will come to pass in that day that I will give Gog a burial place there in Israel, the valley of those who pass by east of the sea; and it will obstruct travelers, because there they will bury Gog and all his multitude. Therefore they will call it the Valley of Hamon Gog.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Inh gô ăn kơ Gôk minh anih pơm bơsat 'bŭ tơ Isơrael, lăm thŭng mă lu bơngai năm rok wih wơ̆t gah hơlĕch kơ đak dơsĭ; tơ anih 'bŭ noh găn trong lu bơngai năm wih wơ̆t. Gŏt păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kiơ̆ sư, đe gô 'bŭ tơ lăm anih noh, đe gô krao thŭng Hamon Gôk.

English: For seven months the house of Israel will be burying them, in order to cleanse the land.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh khei bơngai Isơrael 'bŭ lu sư, wă hơmet rơgoh teh.

English: Indeed all the people of the land will be burying, and they will gain renown for it on the day that I am glorified,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm char noh gô 'bŭ lu sư, na lăm minh năr ning-mônh Inh pơang lăm kon pơlei noh, năr mă Inh gô pơdah tơdrong ư-ang Inh Kră Yang khan.

English: “They will set apart men regularly employed, with the help of a search party, to pass through the land and bury those bodies remaining on the ground, in order to cleanse it. At the end of seven months they will make a search.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô wơh lu bơngai juăt kơ năm dăr trong noh gô chă hăm 'bŭ lu bơngai mă oei oei kơpal teh wă kơ hơmet rơgoh teh. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơpơh khei lu sư pơm tơm năm chơchă.

English: The search party will pass through the land; and when anyone sees a man’s bone, he shall set up a marker by it, till the buriers have buried it in the Valley of Hamon Gog.
Bahnar: Mưh lu sư chă dăr 'bôh lu kơting, 'măn lê̆ minh 'bôt, lu sư gô pơdơ̆ng minh tơmam kiơ wă tơdra dĭng truh lu bơngai 'bŭ lu kơting noh tơ lăm pŭng-lŭng thŭng Hamon Gôk.

English: The name of the city will also be Hamonah. Thus they shall cleanse the land.” ’
Bahnar: Đei minh pơlei Hamôna tơ noh. Thoi noh lu sư hơmet rơgoh teh tơ noh.

English: “And as for you, son of man, thus says the Lord GOD, ‘Speak to every sort of bird and to every beast of the field: “Assemble yourselves and come; Gather together from all sides to My sacrificial meal Which I am sacrificing for you, A great sacrificial meal on the mountains of Israel, That you may eat flesh and drink blood.
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai, Kră Yang khan: Khan bĕ kơ lu sem păr păng lu sem bri akŭm đơ̆ng puăn pah, athei năm akŭm đĭ tơ minh anih pơm phĕt mă inh đei hơmet boih kơ lu iĕm, noh anih pơm yang tih tơ kơpal kông groi Isơrael; lu iĕm gô sa 'nhĕm păng huch pham.

English: You shall eat the flesh of the mighty, Drink the blood of the princes of the earth, Of rams and lambs, Of goats and bulls, All of them fatlings of Bashan.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô sa sĕch lu bơngai nuih kơtang, huch pham lu yŏng pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh thoi sa sĕch lu triu tơno lu bơbe, rơmo, lu sem dơrong bek tơ char Basan.

English: You shall eat fat till you are full, And drink blood till you are drunk, At My sacrificial meal Which I am sacrificing for you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô sa rơmă dĭng bơ̆l, huch pham dĭng suai, đơ̆ng lu tơmam soi mă Inh đei hơmet ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: You shall be filled at My table With horses and riders, With mighty men And with all the men of war,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal gơ'bang Inh, lu iĕm gô sa phĭ lu 'nhĕm seh, lu bơngai chĕp gre aseh, lu linh nuih kơtang păng lu linh hmă, Kră Yang khan.

English: “I will set My glory among the nations; all the nations shall see My judgment which I have executed, and My hand which I have laid on them.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơ'bôh tơdrong ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ Inh tơ lăm lu dêh char; đĭ-đăng lu dêh char gô 'bôh tơdrong Inh sek tơlang đei pơm bơih păng tơpang ti Inh dan kơpal lu sư.

English: So the house of Israel shall know that I am the LORD their God from that day forward.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp, adrĕch Isơrael gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: The Gentiles shall know that the house of Israel went into captivity for their iniquity; because they were unfaithful to Me, therefore I hid My face from them. I gave them into the hand of their enemies, and they all fell by the sword.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu teh đak gô băt adrĕch Isơrael đe chông ba pơm bơnă yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư yua kơ lu sư sơngah ưh kơ chu Inh. Yua kơ thoi noh Inh ôn muh măt Inh đơ̆ng lu sư, Inh pơjao lu sư lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt, lu sư gô lôch đĭ-đăng đơ̆ng đao gưm.

English: According to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions I have dealt with them, and hidden My face from them.” ’
