Bahnar: Inh đei pơm kơ lu sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach păng tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm păng Inh ôn muh măt kơ lu sư.

English: “Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: ‘Now I will bring back the captives of Jacob, and have mercy on the whole house of Israel; and I will be jealous for My holy name
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu Inh gô ăn kơ lu adrĕch Jakôp wih brŏk; hiôk-hian păng 'mêm mơnat kơ đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch Isơrael, păng gô gar anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh.

English: after they have borne their shame, and all their unfaithfulness in which they were unfaithful to Me, when they dwelt safely in their own land and no one made them afraid.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô đei tơdrong mơlâu yua kơ đei pơm yoch hăm Inh, kơplah lu sư oei hiôk-hian lăm char noh ưh kơ đei bu tơhli lu sư.

English: When I have brought them back from the peoples and gathered them out of their enemies’ lands, and I am hallowed in them in the sight of many nations
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh chông lu sư wih brŏk đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei, pơpôi akŭm đơ̆ng teh đak lu ayăt kơ lu sư Inh yua lu sư gô tơ'bôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh 'bơ̆t anăp lơ lu dêh char.

English: then they shall know that I am the LORD their God, who sent them into captivity among the nations, but also brought them back to their land, and left none of them captive any longer.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, mă khan Inh ăn lu sư jing bơnă kơ lu dêh char, mă-lei iŏk wih lu sư tơ char lu sư kơdih, ưh kơ đei lê̆ minh 'nu bơngai bu oei tơ noh.

English: And I will not hide My face from them anymore; for I shall have poured out My Spirit on the house of Israel,’ says the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Inh ưh pă ôn muh măt Inh kơ lu sư dơ̆ng, yua kơ Inh gô ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Inh kơ adrĕch Isơrael, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.”

English: In the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was captured, on the very same day the hand of the LORD was upon me; and He took me there.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt pơđăm đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu nhôn pơm bơnă, sơnăm blŭng-a, năr mơjĭt lăm khei, noh trŏ mơjĭt-puăn sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơlei Jêrusalem đe blah iŏk, Lăm năr noh ti Kră Yang chro kơpal inh păng Kră Yang chông ba inh năm tơ noh.

English: In the visions of God He took me into the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain; on it toward the south was something like the structure of a city.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong tơ'bôh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư chông ba inh năm tơ char Isơrael păng dan inh 'bơ̆t kông kơjung, kơpal kông. Gah gơal kông noh 'bôh đei minh pôm pơlei.

English: He took me there, and behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze. He had a line of flax and a measuring rod in his hand, and he stood in the gateway.
Bahnar: Kră Yang chông ba inh năm tơ noh, inh 'bôh rup minh 'nu bơngai thoi kơthao kong. Bơngai noh chĕp minh dăng tơlei păng 'long pơtŏ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng jang.

English: And the man said to me, “Son of man, look with your eyes and hear with your ears, and fix your mind on everything I show you; for you were brought here so that I might show them to you. Declare to the house of Israel everything you see.”
Bahnar: Bơngai noh khan kơ inh: Ơ kon bơngai athei lăng mă hơlen, athei mơ̆ng mă nhen tôm tơdrong mă inh gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih yua kơ ih năm tơ âu wă kơ lăng dôm tơdrong âu. Thoi noh tôm tơdrong ih 'bôh athei roi ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael.

English: Now there was a wall all around the outside of the temple. In the man’s hand was a measuring rod six cubits long, each being a cubit and a handbreadth; and he measured the width of the wall structure, one rod; and the height, one rod.
Bahnar: To, đei dur tơ 'nguaih jum dăr kơ anih hnam akŭm. Bơngai noh chĕp 'long pơtŏ kơjung tơdrâu hơgăt minh hơđa. Lăm rim hlok kơjung hloh kơ hlok hmă minh hơđa. Bơngai noh pơtŏ hơ'bơ̆l dur minh hlok, kơjung minh hlok.

English: Then he went to the gateway which faced east; and he went up its stairs and measured the threshold of the gateway, which was one rod wide, and the other threshold was one rod wide.
Bahnar: Sư năm tơ măng jang gah hơlĕch, sư tŏk rim kơnao wă pơtŏ kơtơ̆n 'măng, wơ̆l minh hlok.

English: Each gate chamber was one rod long and one rod wide; between the gate chambers was a space of five cubits; and the threshold of the gateway by the vestibule of the inside gate was one rod.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak tor minh hlok păng wơ̆l minh hlok, dur tŏk-bŏk lăm lu anih gak să pơđăm hlok; 'măng kơdeng lăm wơ̆l să minh hlok.

English: He also measured the vestibule of the inside gate, one rod.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ kơdeng, gah lăm 'măng jang minh hlok.

English: Then he measured the vestibule of the gateway, eight cubits; and the gateposts, two cubits. The vestibule of the gate was on the inside.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơtŏ kơdeng 'măng jang đei tơhngam hơgăt păng lu jrăng tơjră 'bar hơgăt; kơdeng lăm 'măng jang tơklă gah hnam akŭm

English: In the eastern gateway were three gate chambers on one side and three on the other; the three were all the same size; also the gateposts were of the same size on this side and that side.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak 'bơ̆t 'măng jang tơ gah 'ngiĕo đei pêng tŏ anih gak păng tơ gah 'ma đei pêng. Lu anih noh lei-lăi păng lu jrăng tơ minh pah tŏ ăi lei-lăi.

English: He measured the width of the entrance to the gateway, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ trong mơ̆t tơ 'măng jang wơ̆l đei mơjĭt hơgăt păng tor 'măng jang noh mơjĭt-pêng hơgăt.

English: There was a space in front of the gate chambers, one cubit on this side and one cubit on that side; the gate chambers were six cubits on this side and six cubits on that side.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp rim anih gak đei war găn să kơjung sư minh hơgăt; păng anih gak rim pah đei tơdrâu hơgăt.

English: Then he measured the gateway from the roof of one gate chamber to the roof of the other; the width was twenty-five cubits, as door faces door.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ 'măng jang đơ̆ng pơbŭng anih gak âu, truh tơ pơbŭng anih gak pah to să 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt; lu trong mơ̆t tơklă băl.

English: He measured the gateposts, sixty cubits high, and the court all around the gateway extended to the gatepost.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ lu jrăng gah cheng đei tơdrâu-jĭt hơgăt. Puăn pah 'măng jang đei cham tăp dăr.

English: From the front of the entrance gate to the front of the vestibule of the inner gate was fifty cubits.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anăp 'măng jang iŏk đơ̆ng trong mơ̆t truh tơ tôch kơdeng lăm 'măng jang đei pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt.

English: There were beveled window frames in the gate chambers and in their intervening archways on the inside of the gateway all around, and likewise in the vestibules. There were windows all around on the inside. And on each gatepost were palm trees.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak păng lu jrăng cheng đei 'măng-'mŏk tăp dăr gah lăm kơ 'măng jang jum dăr kơ kơdeng kư̆m đei 'măng-'mŏk tơ gah lăm păng lăp dăr kơ jrăng đei chhơ̆ rup 'long gol.

English: Then he brought me into the outer court; and there were chambers and a pavement made all around the court; thirty chambers faced the pavement.
Bahnar: Sư chông ba inh năm tơ cham gah 'nguaih, tơ noh đei lăm lu anih, pơm hơnă păng tơmo jum dăr kơ cham; đei pêng-jĭt tŏ anih pơm tơklă hơnă păng tơmo.

English: The pavement was by the side of the gateways, corresponding to the length of the gateways; this was the lower pavement.
Bahnar: Hơnă pơm hăm tơmo pơm pơroh rok kiơ̆ truh tơ lu măng jang, wơ̆l sư hơtŏ kơ tor 'măng jang. Noh hơnă tơmo cham ala.

English: Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gateway to the front of the inner court exterior, one hundred cubits toward the east and the north.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ wơ̆l cham kơjung iŏk đơ̆ng anăp 'măng ala truh tơ anăp 'nguaih kơ cham lăm đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt, gah hơlĕch păng gah yă-nơ̆m lei-lăi.

English: On the outer court was also a gateway facing north, and he measured its length and its width.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ kơ tor păng wơ̆l 'măng jang mơ̆t tơ cham 'nguaih gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: Its gate chambers, three on this side and three on that side, its gateposts and its archways, had the same measurements as the first gate; its length was fifty cubits and its width twenty-five cubits.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak 'bar pah đei pêng tŏ anih, đei lu jrăng gah cheng păng kơdeng kơjung kơđeh kư̆m lei-lăi kơ 'măng jang mă minh, tor pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt păng wơ̆l sư 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt.

English: Its windows and those of its archways, and also its palm trees, had the same measurements as the gateway facing east; it was ascended by seven steps, and its archway was in front of it.
Bahnar: Lu 'măng-'mŏk, lu kơdeng, lu rup 'long gol să iĕ kư̆m lei-lăi kơ 'măng jang gah hơlĕch; đei tơpơh tŏ kơnao tŏk tơ noh păng đei kơdeng tơ anăp noh.

English: A gate of the inner court was opposite the northern gateway, just as the eastern gateway; and he measured from gateway to gateway, one hundred cubits.
Bahnar: Đei minh pôm 'măng jang mơ̆t tơ cham gah lăm, noh tơklă 'măng jang yă-nơ̆m, kư̆m thoi đei ‘măng jang gah hơlĕch. Sư pơtŏ đơ̆ng 'măng jang âu truh tơ 'măng jang to minh-hrĕng hơgăt.

English: After that he brought me toward the south, and there a gateway was facing south; and he measured its gateposts and archways according to these same measurements.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh sư chông ba inh năm tơ gah gơal. Tơ noh đei 'măng jang gah gơal. Sư pơtŏ lu jrăng 'măng jang tơ gah to, lu jrăng gah cheng păng kơdeng, să iĕ lu sư kư̆m lei-lăi thoi lu 'măng jang nai.

English: There were windows in it and in its archways all around like those windows; its length was fifty cubits and its width twenty-five cubits.
Bahnar: Lu măng jang păng kơdeng tă kơ đei 'măng-'mŏk jum dăr thoi lu 'măng-'mŏk 'măng jang gah to. Tor sư pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt wơ̆l sư 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt.

English: Seven steps led up to it, and its archway was in front of them; and it had palm trees on its gateposts, one on this side and one on that side.
Bahnar: Kung đei tơpơh hơgăt wă tŏk păng đei kơdeng 'bơ̆t anăp. Rim kơ 'măng-'mŏk đei jrăng gah cheng tă kơ đei chhơ̆ rup 'long gol.

English: There was also a gateway on the inner court, facing south; and he measured from gateway to gateway toward the south, one hundred cubits.
Bahnar: Cham gah kư̆m lăm đei 'măng gah gơal. Sư pơtŏ iŏk đơ̆ng 'măng âu truh tơ 'măng to, gah gơal minh-hrĕng hơgăt.

English: Then he brought me to the inner court through the southern gateway; he measured the southern gateway according to these same measurements.
Bahnar: Sư anhăk ba inh mơ̆t tơ cham lăm hnam akŭm gah 'măng jang gơal. Sư pơtŏ 'măng gah gơal, să iĕ kư̆m lei-lăi kơ lu 'măng jang gah to.

English: Also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements; there were windows in it and in its archways all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak lu jrăng cheng kơdeng să iĕ kư̆m lei-lăi lu adrol. 'Măng jang păng kơdeng đei 'măng-'mŏk jum dăr; tor pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt, wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt.

English: There were archways all around, twenty-five cubits long and five cubits wide.
Bahnar: Rim 'măng jang jum dăr kơ cham gam lăm đei kơdeng, tor 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt, wơ̆l pơđăm hơgăt.

English: Its archways faced the outer court, palm trees were on its gateposts, and going up to it were eight steps.
Bahnar: Kơdeng tơklă gah cham 'nguaih; đei rup 'long gol tơ lu jrăng păng kung đei tơhngam kơnao wă tŏk.

English: And he brought me into the inner court facing east; he measured the gateway according to these same measurements.
Bahnar: Sư ba inh mơ̆t tơ cham lăm gah hơlĕch; sư pơtŏ 'măng jang. 'Măng jang să iĕ sư kư̆m lei-lăi kơ lu 'măng jang adrol.

English: Also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways were according to these same measurements; and there were windows in it and in its archways all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak, lu jrăng gah cheng păng kơdeng să iĕ kư̆m lei-lăi kơ adrol. 'Măng jang hăm kơdeng đei 'măng-'mŏk jum dăr, kơjung tor pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt, wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt.

English: Its archways faced the outer court, and palm trees were on its gateposts on this side and on that side; and going up to it were eight steps.
Bahnar: Kơdeng tơklă gah cham 'nguaih; rim pah jrăng cheng, đei chhơ̆ rup 'long gol păng kung đei tơhngam kơnao wă tŏk.

English: Then he brought me to the north gateway and measured it according to these same measurements
Bahnar: Sư anhăk ba inh mơ̆t tơ 'măng jang yă-nơ̆m; sư pơtŏ 'măng jang, 'măng jang să iĕ kư̆m lei-lăi kơ lu 'măng jang nai.

English: also its gate chambers, its gateposts, and its archways. It had windows all around; its length was fifty cubits and its width twenty-five cubits.
Bahnar: Lu anih gak, lu jrăng cheng păng kơdeng kư̆m lei-lăi kơ adrol. Đei lu 'măng-'mŏk jum dăr. Kơjung tor pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt, wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hơgăt.

English: Its gateposts faced the outer court, palm trees were on its gateposts on this side and on that side, and going up to it were eight steps.
Bahnar: Kơdeng tơklă gah cham 'nguaih; rim kơ jrăng tơ rim pah đei chhơ̆ rup 'long gol păng kung đei tơhngam kơnao wă tŏk.

English: There was a chamber and its entrance by the gateposts of the gateway, where they washed the burnt offering.
Bahnar: Đei minh anih đei 'măng jih kơdeng 'măng jang, tơ noh đe ôp tơmam soi 'buh.

English: In the vestibule of the gateway were two tables on this side and two tables on that side, on which to slay the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the trespass offering.
Bahnar: Lăm kơdeng 'măng jang 'bar pah đei 'bar tŏ gơ'bang, tơ noh đe pơlôch tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch tơmam soi huai, hăm đơ̆ng pơm glăi.

English: At the outer side of the vestibule, as one goes up to the entrance of the northern gateway, were two tables; and on the other side of the vestibule of the gateway were two tables.
Bahnar: Gah 'nguaih kơ kơdeng 'bơ̆t trong mơ̆t tơ 'măng jang gah yă-nơ̆m, đei 'bar tŏ gơ'bang păng gah to tơ 'măng jang kư̆m đei 'bar tŏ gơ'bang.

English: Four tables were on this side and four tables on that side, by the side of the gateway, eight tables on which they slaughtered the sacrifices.
Bahnar: Puăn tŏ gơ'bang gah âu păng puăn tŏ gơ'bang gah to kơ 'măng jang, akŭm đĭ đei tơhngam tŏ gơ'bang đe yua wă pơlôch lu tơmam soi.

English: There were also four tables of hewn stone for the burnt offering, one cubit and a half long, one cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high; on these they laid the instruments with which they slaughtered the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei puăn tŏ gơ'bang pơm hăm tơmo blah, wă yua dan hơmet tơmam soi 'buh, tor minh hơgăt minh puăt, wơ̆l minh hơgăt minh puăt, kơjung minh hơgăt, đe dan kơpal noh lu săng wă 'bet pơlôch tơmam soi 'buh păng lu tơmam soi nai.

English: Inside were hooks, a handbreadth wide, fastened all around; and the flesh of the sacrifices was on the tables.
Bahnar: Tơ đei 'long chơgăn să sư minh hơda pơ̆ng tăp dăr gah lăm. Lu 'nhĕm tơmam soi dan kơpal gơ'bang.

English: Outside the inner gate were the chambers for the singers in the inner court, one facing south at the side of the northern gateway, and the other facing north at the side of the southern gateway.
Bahnar: Tơ cham lăm đei 'bar anih, minh gah cheng kơ 'măng jang yă-nơ̆m, tơklă tơ gah gơal păng đei minh anih dơ̆ng gah 'măng jang hơlĕch, tơklă tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: Then he said to me, “This chamber which faces south is for the priests who have charge of the temple.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Anih mă tơklă gơal âu 'măn lê̆ kơ lu 'bok soi mă wei-lăng hnam akŭm.

English: The chamber which faces north is for the priests who have charge of the altar; these are the sons of Zadok, from the sons of Levi, who come near the LORD to minister to Him.”
Bahnar: Anih mă tơklă gah yă-nơ̆m 'măn lê̆ kơ lu 'bok soi wei chơnang soi. Noh lu kon drŏ-nglo Sađŏk, lăm lu adrĕch Lêwi gơh năm jê̆ wă bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang.”

English: And he measured the court, one hundred cubits long and one hundred cubits wide, foursquare. The altar was in front of the temple.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ cham lăm, tor đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt, wơ̆l đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt, cham dơ'bŭng wơ̆l tor tŏ ăi. Chơnang soi dan 'bơ̆t anăp hnam akŭm.

English: Then he brought me to the vestibule of the temple and measured the doorposts of the vestibule, five cubits on this side and five cubits on that side; and the width of the gateway was three cubits on this side and three cubits on that side.
Bahnar: Sư anhăk ba inh mơ̆t tơ kơdeng hnam akŭm păng pơtŏ lu jrăng kơdeng, pơđăm hơgăt gah âu, pơđăm hlok gah to. 'Măng mơ̆t wơ̆l mơjĭt-puăn hơgăt păng tơnăr hơ'bơ̆l gah âu pêng hơgăt, gah to pêng hơgăt.

English: The length of the vestibule was twenty cubits, and the width eleven cubits; and by the steps which led up to it there were pillars by the doorposts, one on this side and another on that side.
Bahnar: Kơdeng tor 'bar-jĭt hơgăt păng wơ̆l mơjĭt-mônh hơgăt; đei kơnao kung tŏk, cheng lu jrăng đei 'long gơ̆ng gah âu minh, gah to minh.

English: Then he brought me into the sanctuary and measured the doorposts, six cubits wide on one side and six cubits wide on the other side—the width of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Sư anhăk ba inh tơ lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, Sư pơtŏ lu jrăng tơjră, să sư đei tơdrâu hơgăt, jrăng rim pah tŏ ăi.

English: The width of the entryway was ten cubits, and the side walls of the entrance were five cubits on this side and five cubits on the other side; and he measured its length, forty cubits, and its width, twenty cubits.
Bahnar: Wơ̆l trong mơ̆t mơjĭt hơgăt, jrăng trong mơ̆t hơ'bơ̆l pơđăm hơgăt tơ 'bar pah. Bơngai pơtŏ tor anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, đei puăn-jĭt hơgăt; păng wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt hơgăt.

English: Also he went inside and measured the doorposts, two cubits; and the entrance, six cubits high; and the width of the entrance, seven cubits.
Bahnar: Sư mơ̆t tơ lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh, pơtŏ lu jrăng 'bơ̆t trong 'măng mơ̆t 'bar hơgăt; wơ̆l 'măng mơ̆t să tơdrâu hơgăt; wơ̆l lu jrăng trong sư tơpơh hơgăt.

English: He measured the length, twenty cubits; and the width, twenty cubits, beyond the sanctuary; and he said to me, “This is the Most Holy Place.”
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ, tor anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'bar-jĭt hơgăt, wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt hơgăt păng sư khan kơ inh: “'Nâu anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh”.

English: Next, he measured the wall of the temple, six cubits. The width of each side chamber all around the temple was four cubits on every side.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ dur hnam akŭm hơ'bơ̆l tơdrâu hơgăt, wơ̆l lu anih cheng jum dăr kơ hnam akŭm, puăn hơgăt.

English: The side chambers were in three stories, one above the other, thirty chambers in each story; they rested on ledges which were for the side chambers all around, that they might be supported, but not fastened to the wall of the temple.
Bahnar: Lu anih cheng đei pêng tăl, kơpơ̆ng ala lăm minh tăl đei pêng-jĭt tŏ lăm; anih hnam noh đei jrăng tơjră kơdih, ưh kơ hơgơn tơ tơnăr hnam akŭm.

English: As one went up from story to story, the side chambers became wider all around, because their supporting ledges in the wall of the temple ascended like steps; therefore the width of the structure increased as one went up from the lowest story to the highest by way of the middle one.
Bahnar: Lu anih cheng tăp dăr kơ hnam akŭm, đơ̆ng tăl âu truh tăl kơpal; rai kơjung rai să hloh yua kơ đe pơm hnam akŭm tăl rai kơjung lăm rai să đơ̆ng tăl âu tŏk tơ tăl noh, na wơ̆l hnam akŭm kư̆m rai să mưh tăl rai kơjung. Đe năm tŏk đơ̆ng tăl kơđeh hloh wă tŏk tăl kơjung hloh rok tăl tŏk-bŏk.

English: I also saw an elevation all around the temple; it was the foundation of the side chambers, a full rod, that is, six cubits high.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh hnam akŭm đei kơdeng hloh tơ rok tơnăr đei anih tăp dăr, noh hơnă rim anih gah cheng kơdeng hloh pơtŏ đei minh hơgăt, kơjung wă đei tơdrâu hơgăt.

English: The thickness of the outer wall of the side chambers was five cubits, and so also the remaining terrace by the place of the side chambers of the temple.
Bahnar: Tơnăr 'nguaih lu anih cheng hơ'bơ̆l pơđăm hơgăt păng anih hoh tăp dăr kơ noh pơđăm hơgăt. Hơlam lu anih cheng hnam akŭm.

English: And between it and the wall chambers was a width of twenty cubits all around the temple on every side.
Bahnar: Hăm lu anih cheng jih dur cham lăm wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt hơgăt. ‘Noh jum dăr kơ hnam akŭm puăn pah.

English: The doors of the side chambers opened on the terrace, one door toward the north and another toward the south; and the width of the terrace was five cubits all around.
Bahnar: 'Măng lu anih cheng pơm 'măng tơ gah sơlam. Minh pôm 'măng tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, minh pôm 'măng tơ gah gơal; wơ̆l să noh pơđăm hơgăt jum dăr.

English: The building that faced the separating courtyard at its western end was seventy cubits wide; the wall of the building was five cubits thick all around, and its length ninety cubits.
Bahnar: Hnam tơklă cham hnam akŭm gah bơmơ̆t, wơ̆l tơpơh-jĭt hơgăt; tơnăr jum dăr hnam hơ'bơ̆l pơđăm hơgăt tor tơsĭn-jĭt hơgăt.

English: So he measured the temple, one hundred cubits long; and the separating courtyard with the building and its walls was one hundred cubits long
Bahnar: Na bơngai noh pơtŏ hnam akŭm tor minh-hrĕng hơgăt, cham hnam akŭm păng tơnăr kư̆m kơjung minh-hrĕng hơgăt.

English: also the width of the eastern face of the temple, including the separating courtyard, was one hundred cubits.
Bahnar: Wơ̆l anăp hnam păng cham gah hơlĕch kư̆m minh-hrĕng hơgăt.

English: He measured the length of the building behind it, facing the separating courtyard, with its galleries on the one side and on the other side, one hundred cubits, as well as the inner temple and the porches of the court
Bahnar: Na, sư pơtŏ tor cham tơ gah bơmơ̆t păng hnam kơdeng 'bar pah minh-hrĕng hơgăt. Gah lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơdeng tơklă cham

English: their doorposts and the beveled window frames. And the galleries all around their three stories opposite the threshold were paneled with wood from the ground to the windows—the windows were covered
Bahnar: lu kơtơ̆n 'măng, lu 'măng-'mŏk pơ̆ng dơhlông, lu kơdeng jum dăr, đei pêng pah gah anăp tơklă kơ kơtơ̆n 'măng, lăm hnam akŭm đe pơ̆ng tơ̆r 'long tăp dăr. Đơ̆ng teh truh lu 'măng-'mŏk, lu 'măng-'mŏk đe pơ̆ng lom đĭ.

English: from the space above the door, even to the inner room, as well as outside, and on every wall all around, inside and outside, by measure.
Bahnar: Kơpal trong mơ̆t, tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, tơ lăm păng tơ 'nguaih, kơpal tơnăr tăp dăr, tơ lăm hăm tơ 'nguaih kư̆m đei chhơ̆ rup.

English: And it was made with cherubim and palm trees, a palm tree between cherub and cherub. Each cherub had two faces
Bahnar: Chhơ̆ rup chêrubim hăm rup 'long gol, minh rup 'long gol tŏk-bŏk sơlam 'bar tŏ rup chêrubim; rim kơ chêrubim đei 'bar pah măt

English: so that the face of a man was toward a palm tree on one side, and the face of a young lion toward a palm tree on the other side; thus it was made throughout the temple all around.
Bahnar: măt bơngai tơwih tơ gah rup 'long gol pah âu păng măt dăm-brang tơwih gah rup 'long gol pah to jơ̆p tăp tang kơ lăm hnam akŭm đei chhơ̆ thoi noh.

English: From the floor to the space above the door, and on the wall of the sanctuary, cherubim and palm trees were carved.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng hơnă truh tơ kơpal măng, đei chhơ̆ rup chêrubim păng chhơ̆ rup 'long gol tơ jơ̆p kơ tơnăr hnam akŭm.

English: The doorposts of the temple were square, as was the front of the sanctuary; their appearance was similar.
Bahnar: Lu jrăng 'măng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh sư dơ'bŭng. Păng 'măng 'bơ̆t anăp anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh.

English: The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and its length two cubits. Its corners, its length, and its sides were of wood; and he said to me, “This is the table that is before the LORD.”
Bahnar: Chơnang soi pơm hăm 'long kơjung pêng hlok, tor 'bar hơgăt, wơ̆l 'bar hơgăt, lu mum, jơ̆ng, hơnă pơm hăm 'long. Bơngai noh khan kơ inh: “Âu, boih gơ'bang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: The temple and the sanctuary had two doors.
Bahnar: Anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh đei 'bar pah tơnang 'măng.

English: The doors had two panels apiece, two folding panels: two panels for one door and two panels for the other door.
Bahnar: Rim 'măng đei 'bar pah tơnang 'măng, noh tơnang 'măng gơh tang gah âu 'bar pah, gah to 'bar pah.

English: Cherubim and palm trees were carved on the doors of the temple just as they were carved on the walls. A wooden canopy was on the front of the vestibule outside.
Bahnar: Đe đei chhơ̆ lu rup chêrubim păng lu 'long gol tơ kơpal 'măng hnam akŭm, kư̆m thoi đei chhơ̆ tơ tơnăr. Kơpal ‘măng mơ̆t tơ kơdeng anăp gah 'nguaih đei bơbŭng pơm păng tơ̆r.

English: There were beveled window frames and palm trees on one side and on the other, on the sides of the vestibule—also on the side chambers of the temple and on the canopies.
Bahnar: Đei lu 'măng-'mŏk dơhlông păng lu rup 'long gol chhơ̆ tơ 'bar pah tơ kơpal kơ jrăng, lăm lu anih cheng hnam akŭm păng lu anih iĕ đei mơ̆n.

English: Then he brought me out into the outer court, by the way toward the north; and he brought me into the chamber which was opposite the separating courtyard, and which was opposite the building toward the north.
Bahnar: Sư chông ba inh lĕch tơ cham 'nguaih, gah yă-nơ̆m, ba inh mơ̆t tơ lăm anih tơklă hăm cham hnam akŭm păng dur gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: Facing the length, which was one hundred cubits (the width was fifty cubits), was the north door.
Bahnar: Anih hnam mă đei ‘măng mơ̆t gah yă-nơ̆m tor minh-hrĕng hơgăt, đei 'măng gah yă-nơ̆m, wơ̆l sư pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt.

English: Opposite the inner court of twenty cubits, and opposite the pavement of the outer court, was gallery against gallery in three stories.
Bahnar: Hơlam rơhơi să 'bar-jĭt hơgăt tơklă cham lăm păng, hơnă tơmo tơ cham 'nguaih, đei lu kơdeng pơtrơp băl pêng tăl.

English: In front of the chambers, toward the inside, was a walk ten cubits wide, at a distance of one cubit; and their doors faced north.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp lu anih đei trong wơ̆l mơjĭt hơgăt, tor kơjung đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt. Păng đei lu trong năm mơ̆t tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: Now the upper chambers were shorter, because the galleries took away space from them more than from the lower and middle stories of the building.
Bahnar: Lu anih tơ kơpal iĕ hloh kơ lu anih tơ ala păng lu anih tŏk-bŏk hnam, yua kơ lu kơdeng găn.

English: For they were in three stories and did not have pillars like the pillars of the courts; therefore the upper level was shortened more than the lower and middle levels from the ground up.
Bahnar: Rim anih đei pêng tăl mă-lei ưh kơ đei jrăng thoi jrăng cham yua kơ thoi noh na anih kơpal iĕ hloh kơ anih ala păng anih tŏk-bŏk.

English: And a wall which was outside ran parallel to the chambers, at the front of the chambers, toward the outer court; its length was fifty cubits.
Bahnar: Đei tơnăr gah 'nguaih pơrok kiơ̆ lu anih tơwih gah cham 'nguaih, tơklă lu anih mă să tor pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt.

English: The length of the chambers toward the outer court was fifty cubits, whereas that facing the temple was one hundred cubits.
Bahnar: Tor lu anih gah cham 'nguaih pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt, mă-lei lu anih tơklă hnam akŭm noh đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt.

English: At the lower chambers was the entrance on the east side, as one goes into them from the outer court.
Bahnar: Tơ gah hơlĕch kơ lu anih 'nâu tơ ala, gah hơlĕch đei minh trong mơ̆t, 'măn kơ lu bơngai đơ̆ng cham 'nguaih mơ̆t.

English: Also there were chambers in the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, opposite the separating courtyard and opposite the building.
Bahnar: Tơm tơnăr cham lăm hnam akŭm gah gơal, tơklă 'bơ̆t sơlam hnam akŭm đei lu anih.

English: There was a walk in front of them also, and their appearance was like the chambers which were toward the north; they were as long and as wide as the others, and all their exits and entrances were according to plan.
Bahnar: Đei minh trong năm tơ anăp lu anih noh, kư̆m thoi trong năm rim lu anih gah yă-nơ̆m; lu anih noh tor wơ̆l să lei-lăi. Đĭ-đăng lu trong lĕch trong mơ̆t tơdrong hơmet păng 'măng kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: And corresponding to the doors of the chambers that were facing south, as one enters them, there was a door in front of the walk, the way directly in front of the wall toward the east.
Bahnar: Kơ lu 'măng anih gah gơal kư̆m lei-lăi; đei minh pôm 'măng 'bơ̆t tơm trong năm wă kơ đe mơ̆t lĕch, pơrok kiơ̆ tơnăr tơklă gah hơlĕch.

English: Then he said to me, “The north chambers and the south chambers, which are opposite the separating courtyard, are the holy chambers where the priests who approach the LORD shall eat the most holy offerings. There they shall lay the most holy offerings—the grain offering, the sin offering, and the trespass offering—for the place is holy.
Bahnar: Na sư khan kơ inh: “Lu anih gah yă-nơ̆m păng anih gah gơal, tơklă hăm cham lăm noh boih anih rơgoh anih lu 'bok soi năm jê̆ Kră Yang gô sa tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh. Lu sư kư̆m dan lu tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh 'bơ̆t noh tơmam soi phe 'ba, tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng glăi, yua kơ noh anih rơgoh.

English: When the priests enter them, they shall not go out of the holy chamber into the outer court; but there they shall leave their garments in which they minister, for they are holy. They shall put on other garments; then they may approach that which is for the people.”
Bahnar: Mưh lu 'bok soi hlôi mơ̆t tơ anih rơgoh boih, lu sư ưh kơ gơh lĕch đơ̆ng anih rơgoh noh na năm tơ cham 'nguaih, mă-lei athei plôh lê̆ ao 'bok soi mă lu sư hrŭk wă soi kơ Kră Yang yua kơ lu hơbĕn ao noh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; lu sư athei iŏk hrŭk ao nai, na lu sư gơh lĕch tơ 'nguaih anih mă 'măn kơ lu kon pơlei.

English: Now when he had finished measuring the inner temple, he brought me out through the gateway that faces toward the east, and measured it all around.
Bahnar: Đang kơ pơtŏ keh lăm hnam akŭm sư anhăk ba inh lĕch trong 'măng gah hơlĕch tơ cham gah 'nguaih păng pơtŏ jum dăr cham gah 'nguaih kơ hnam akŭm.

English: He measured the east side with the measuring rod, five hundred rods by the measuring rod all around.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ gah hơlĕch hăm tơlei pơtŏ, đei pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt, kiơ̆ kơ tơlei pơtŏ.

English: He measured the north side, five hundred rods by the measuring rod all around.
Bahnar: Sư tơwih rŏng pơtŏ gah yă-nơ̆m tơlei pơtŏ lei-lăi, pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt kiơ̆ kơ tơlei pơtŏ.

English: He measured the south side, five hundred rods by the measuring rod.
Bahnar: Sư tơwih rŏng pơtŏ gah gơal lei-lăi, kư̆m pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt kiơ̆ kơ tơlei pơtŏ.

English: He came around to the west side and measured five hundred rods by the measuring rod.
Bahnar: Sư weh pơtŏ gah bơmơ̆t, đei pơđăm hơgăt kiơ̆ kơ tơlei pơtŏ.

English: He measured it on the four sides; it had a wall all around, five hundred cubits long and five hundred wide, to separate the holy areas from the common.
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư pơtŏ puăn pah jum dăr kơ cham hnam akŭm tor pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt, wơ̆l pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt; tơnăr âu plah sơlam anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng anih hmă.

English: Afterward he brought me to the gate, the gate that faces toward the east.
Bahnar: Na sư anhăk ba inh truh tơ 'măng jang gah hơlĕch.

English: And behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east. His voice was like the sound of many waters; and the earth shone with His glory.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael năm đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch đei jơwa nhen thoi đak ro tih, hơdah rang mơnhal ư-ang Kră Yang jơ̆p kơ teh.

English: It was like the appearance of the vision which I saw—like the vision which I saw when I came to destroy the city. The visions were like the vision which I saw by the River Chebar; and I fell on my face.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mă inh 'bôh nhen thoi tơdrong mă tơ'bôh kơ inh kơplah Kră Yang pơrăm pơlei. Noh kư̆m nhen thoi tơdrong tơ'bôh kơ inh 'bơ̆t jih đak krong Kêbar, na inh drap bon tơ teh.

English: And the glory of the LORD came into the temple by way of the gate which faces toward the east.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam akŭm trong 'măng jang gah hơlĕch.

English: The Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court; and behold, the glory of the LORD filled the temple.
Bahnar: Yang bơhngol hơtŏk inh păng chông ba inh mơ̆t tơ cham gah lăm; to tơdrong rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bĕnh-'bang kơ hnam akŭm.

English: Then I heard Him speaking to me from the temple, while a man stood beside me.
Bahnar: Kơplah đei bơngai noh dơ̆ng jê̆ inh, inh kơtơ̆ng đei nơ̆r pơma hăm inh đơ̆ng lăm hnam akŭm.

English: And He said to me, “Son of man, this is the place of My throne and the place of the soles of My feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel forever. No more shall the house of Israel defile My holy name, they nor their kings, by their harlotry or with the carcasses of their kings on their high places.
Bahnar: Sư pơma hăm inh khan: “Ơ kon bơngai, âu jing anih mă Inh dan tang-dŏ Inh, anih mă Inh dan jơ̆ng tơ âu Inh gô oei hơdai ling-lang hăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael. Adrĕch Isơrael ưh pă pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh dơ̆ng, lu sư dah pơtao lu sư lăm tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă lu sư păng đơ̆ng lu akâu pơtao lôch tơ anih kơjung

English: When they set their threshold by My threshold, and their doorpost by My doorpost, with a wall between them and Me, they defiled My holy name by the abominations which they committed; therefore I have consumed them in My anger.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu sư dan kơtơ̆n 'măng hnam lu sư 'bơ̆t jê̆ kơtơ̆n 'măng hnam Inh, dan jrăng 'măng hnam lu sư jê̆ jrăng 'măng hnam Inh, đei tơnăr pĕng găn sơlam Inh păng lu sư đĕch, lu sư pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach boih kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh. Kơplah lu sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp noh, lei na Inh đei pơlôch pơrăm lê̆ lu sư lăm năr Inh hil mĭl.

English: Now let them put their harlotry and the carcasses of their kings far away from Me, and I will dwell in their midst forever.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu sư athei hŭt lê̆ tơdrong pơm pơyô kư̆ kă păng akâu lu pơtao lôch ataih đơ̆ng Inh, Inh gô oei hơdai lu sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: “Son of man, describe the temple to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities; and let them measure the pattern.
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ kon bơngai athei roi tơ'bôh kơ adrĕch Isơrael băt kơ hnam akŭm âu, wă kơ lu sư mơlâu kơ tơdrong yoch mă lu sư đei pơm, wă kơ lu sư pơtŏ lăng kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong 'nâu.

English: And if they are ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the design of the temple and its arrangement, its exits and its entrances, its entire design and all its ordinances, all its forms and all its laws. Write it down in their sight, so that they may keep its whole design and all its ordinances, and perform them.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư mơlâu kơ tôm tơdrong lu sư hlôi pơm, tơ'bôh ăn bĕ kơ lu sư rup đe pơdơ̆ng hnam akŭm âu, trong lu 'măng mơ̆t 'măng lĕch, đĭ-đăng lu rup chhơ̆, đĭ-đăng tôm tơdrong juăt Sư, lu rup sư păng đĭ-đăng khôi juăt ăn kơ sư. Athei chih roi tôm tơdrong 'bơ̆t anăp măt lu sư, đĭ-đăng rup păng đĭ-đăng khôi juăt sư wă kơ lu sư wei răk păng pơm kiơ̆.

English: This is the law of the temple: The whole area surrounding the mountaintop is most holy. Behold, this is the law of the temple.
Bahnar: Âu khôi juăt gah hnam akŭm: Đĭ-đăng anih tăp dăr kơ kơpal kông, noh anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Noh boih khôi juăt hnam akŭm. Chơnang soi

English: “These are the measurements of the altar in cubits (the cubit is one cubit and a handbreadth): the base one cubit high and one cubit wide, with a rim all around its edge of one span. This is the height of the altar
Bahnar: Âu tơdrong pơtŏ chơnang soi, pơtŏ hăm tơlei pơtŏ kơjung minh hơgăt minh hơđa. Hơbong jum dăr kơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi jrŭ minh hơgăt, wơ̆l minh hơgăt, đei gor gơnăp jum dăr minh hơđa. Âu boih gah kơjung chơnang soi.

English: from the base on the ground to the lower ledge, two cubits; the width of the ledge, one cubit; from the smaller ledge to the larger ledge, four cubits; and the width of the ledge, one cubit.
Bahnar: Hơbong hơnă đơ̆ng teh truh tơ không ala 'bar hơgăt, wơ̆l minh hơgăt. Đơ̆ng không iĕ truh tơ không tih đei puăn hlok, wơ̆l să minh hơgăt.

English: The altar hearth is four cubits high, with four horns extending upward from the hearth.
Bahnar: Chơnang soi kơjung puăn hlok păng kơpal chơnang soi đei puăn tŏ hơke pơdơ̆ng.

English: The altar hearth is twelve cubits long, twelve wide, square at its four corners
Bahnar: Anih chơnang soi tor să mơjĭt-'bar hơgăt, wơ̆l mơjĭt hơgăt, dơ'bŭng đei puăn pah mum.

English: the ledge, fourteen cubits long and fourteen wide on its four sides, with a rim of half a cubit around it; its base, one cubit all around; and its steps face toward the east.”
Bahnar: Không tŏk-bŏk chơnang soi tor wơ̆l mơjĭt-puăn hlok puăn pah dơ'bŭng đei gơnăp jum dăr minh puăt hơgăt; đei hơbong jum dăr minh hơgăt, lu kơnao sư noh tơwih gah hơlĕch.

English: And He said to me, “Son of man, thus says the Lord GOD: ‘These are the ordinances for the altar on the day when it is made, for sacrificing burnt offerings on it, and for sprinkling blood on it.
Bahnar: Sư pơma hăm inh: “Ơ kon bơngai, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu boih khôi juăt gah chơnang soi mưh pơm keh yua wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơtreh pham kơpal ei.

English: You shall give a young bull for a sin offering to the priests, the Levites, who are of the seed of Zadok, who approach Me to minister to Me,’ says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Pơjao bĕ kơ 'bok soi adrĕch Lêwi lăm, adrĕch Sađôk noh, lu bơngai gô năm jê̆ wă bơ̆jang kơ Inh, minh pôm rơmo dăm bek wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: ‘You shall take some of its blood and put it on the four horns of the altar, on the four corners of the ledge, and on the rim around it; thus you shall cleanse it and make atonement for it.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk bĕ pham pik tơ puăn tŏ hơke chơnang soi, tơ puăn pah mum păng tơ gơnăp jum dăr, wă kơ ôp rơgoh chơnang soi păng huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: Then you shall also take the bull of the sin offering, and burn it in the appointed place of the temple, outside the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk rơmo dăm pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, chĕp 'buh pơkhôi tơ anih mă đei hơmet lê̆ boih kơ cham hnam akŭm tơ 'nguaih kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: On the second day you shall offer a kid of the goats without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they cleansed it with the bull.
Bahnar: Năr mă 'bar, ih athei pơyơ̆r bơbe tơno, ưh kơ đei rơka wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch chơnang soi athei ôp rơgoh kư̆m thoi pơyơ̆r rơmo dăm iŏk pham wă ôp rơgoh.

English: When you have finished cleansing it, you shall offer a young bull without blemish, and a ram from the flock without blemish.
Bahnar: Mưh đei ôp rơgoh boih chơnang soi, athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm ưh kơ đei rơka păng minh pôm triu rôp đơ̆ng lu khŭl mă ưh kơ đei rơka.

English: When you offer them before the LORD, the priests shall throw salt on them, and they will offer them up as a burnt offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Ih athei năm ba 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, lu 'bok soi prôi 'boh tơ kơpal păng pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Every day for seven days you shall prepare a goat for a sin offering; they shall also prepare a young bull and a ram from the flock, both without blemish.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr, rim năr ih athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm bơbe tơno, wă huai đơ̆ng yoch; păng kư̆m pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu tơno mă rôp đơ̆ng lu khŭl ưh kơ đei rơka.

English: Seven days they shall make atonement for the altar and purify it, and so consecrate it.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr noh, đe pơm giĕng huai đơ̆ng yoch wă ôp rơgoh chơnang soi, păng thoi noh chơnang soi jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: When these days are over it shall be, on the eighth day and thereafter, that the priests shall offer your burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar; and I will accept you,’ says the Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng năr kơ lu năr noh hlôi boih, đơ̆ng năr mă tơhngam tơ anăp, lu 'bok soi gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê lu iĕm 'bơ̆t chơnang soi noh, thoi noh Inh gô iŏk dôm tơmam soi noh, Kră Yang khan.”

English: Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary which faces toward the east, but it was shut.
Bahnar: Na sư chông ba inh năm tơ 'măng 'nguaih kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, 'măng noh gah hơlĕch; mă-lei 'măng noh đe tang lê̆ boih.

English: And the LORD said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, because the LORD God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “'Măng âu athei tang lê̆, ưh kơ gơh pơih. Păng ưh kơ đei bu gơh mơ̆t trong 'măng jang âu, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael mơ̆t boih trong 'măng jang 'nâu; thoi noh 'măng noh athei tang chĭt lê̆.

English: As for the prince, because he is the prince, he may sit in it to eat bread before the LORD; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gateway, and go out the same way.”
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao đĕch, yua kơ sư yŏng na gơh ngôi tơ noh păng sa 'bĕng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang gô mơ̆t rok trong kơdeng 'măng jang păng lĕch kư̆m trong noh.”

English: Also He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple; so I looked, and behold, the glory of the LORD filled the house of the LORD; and I fell on my face.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư chông ba inh mơ̆t 'măng gah yă-nơ̆m tơ cham gah lăm 'bơ̆t anăp hnam akŭm. Inh lăng âu bơih, tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'bĕnh jơ̆p kơ hnam akŭm Kră Yang; na inh drap kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh.

English: And the LORD said to me, “Son of man, mark well, see with your eyes and hear with your ears, all that I say to you concerning all the ordinances of the house of the LORD and all its laws. Mark well who may enter the house and all who go out from the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ơ kon bơngai athei kơchăm lăng, lăng mă pơnhen; athei pơgling đon mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong Inh bơtho khan kơ ih, gah dôm tơdrong khôi juăt Kră Yang, gah hnam akŭm; athei lăng tơ lu bơngai mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lĕch đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: “Now say to the rebellious, to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “O house of Israel, let Us have no more of all your abominations.
Bahnar: Ih khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai Isơrael mă ayăt hăm Inh: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă lu iĕm hlôi pơm noh tôm boih.

English: When you brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary to defile it—My house—and when you offered My food, the fat and the blood, then they broke My covenant because of all your abominations.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm hlôi chông ba adrĕch adrung kon pơlei tơmoi, lu bơngai mă ưh kơ kăt tơdra jơhngơ̆m, kư̆m ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar mơ̆t lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh wă pơ'mê̆ kơ hnam akŭm Inh, kơplah lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam sa kơ Inh, rơmă păng pham; lu iĕm pơm yoch glăi boih kơ nơ̆r pơkă Inh hăm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆ krưp lu iĕm.

English: And you have not kept charge of My holy things, but you have set others to keep charge of My sanctuary for you.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ hiơ̆k bơ̆jang wei tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh; lu iĕm pôk bơngai nai bơ̆jang tơdrong noh lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh tơplih kơ lu iĕm.

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary, including any foreigner who is among the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: 'Nĕ kơ ăn bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ kăt tơdra lăm jơhngơ̆m păng sĕch akar kư̆m ưh kơ kăt tơdra, mơ̆t lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, mă lu bơngai oei hơdai hăm lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael kư̆m ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t tơ noh.

English: “And the Levites who went far from Me, when Israel went astray, who strayed away from Me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.
Bahnar: Bĕ gah lu bơngai Lêwi hlôi năm ataih đơ̆ng Inh, achăng Inh kiơ̆ kơkuh kơ rup yang lu sư, kơplah lu kon pơlei Isơrael hlôi jrok trong weh ataih đơ̆ng Inh, lu sư gô pŭ tơdrong yoch kơdih.

English: Yet they shall be ministers in My sanctuary, as gatekeepers of the house and ministers of the house; they shall slay the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister to them.
Bahnar: Lu sư gơh bơ̆jang lăm anih hnam akŭm Inh, bơ̆jang wei gak 'măng jang anih hnam akŭm Inh, bơ̆jang lăm hnam akŭm. Lu sư gơh pơlôch tơmam soi 'buh păng lu tơmam soi nai ăn kơ lu kon pơlei; lu sư gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei awih awăn kơ lu sư.

English: Because they ministered to them before their idols and caused the house of Israel to fall into iniquity, therefore I have raised My hand in an oath against them,” says the Lord GOD, “that they shall bear their iniquity.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư đei tơgŭm kon pơlei bơ̆jang 'bơ̆t anăp rup yang lu sư, pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael pơ̆k huŏng pơm yoch, yua kơ tơdrong noh, Inh đei hiŏng ti phak lu sư, athei pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih, Kră Yang khan.

English: And they shall not come near Me to minister to Me as priest, nor come near any of My holy things, nor into the Most Holy Place; but they shall bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ Inh wă pơm 'bok soi 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ tơmam mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh. Mă-lei lu sư gô pŭ tơdrong mơlâu păng lu tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆ krưp mă lu sư hlôi pơm yoch.

English: Nevertheless I will make them keep charge of the temple, for all its work, and for all that has to be done in it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô pơjao kơ lu sư bơ̆jang awih awăn lăm anih hnam akŭm, đĭ-đăng lu tơdrong jang wă kơ bơ̆jang keh păng dôm tơdrong jang athei pơm tơ lăm noh.

English: “But the priests, the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who kept charge of My sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from Me, they shall come near Me to minister to Me; and they shall stand before Me to offer to Me the fat and the blood,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu 'bok soi adrĕch Lêwi, kon sâu Sađŏk, noh lu bơngai mă wei-lăng lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, kơplah kon sâu Isơrael wơ̆l jrok weh ataih đơ̆ng Inh, lu sư boih gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh wă pơyơ̆r kơ Inh rơmă păng pham, Kră Yang khan.

English: “They shall enter My sanctuary, and they shall come near My table to minister to Me, and they shall keep My charge.
Bahnar: Lu sư boih gô mơ̆t lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh lu sư boih gô năm 'bơ̆t jê̆ chơnang soi wă bơ̆jang kơ Inh; awih awăn kơ Inh.

English: And it shall be, whenever they enter the gates of the inner court, that they shall put on linen garments; no wool shall come upon them while they minister within the gates of the inner court or within the house.
Bahnar: Mưh lu sư mơ̆t tơ măng jang cham gah lăm, lu sư athei hrŭk ao che 'bui ưh kơ gơh, hrŭk ao che sŏk triu mưh wă bơ̆jang tơ cham gah lăm dah tơ lăm hnam akŭm.

English: They shall have linen turbans on their heads and linen trousers on their bodies; they shall not clothe themselves with anything that causes sweat.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơ̆n kơ̆l lu sư hăm che 'bui păng hơbĕn djăl che 'bui dang kiơ̆ kơiĕng, lu sư ưh kơ gơh hrŭk hơbĕn ao pơm bơuh.

English: When they go out to the outer court, to the outer court to the people, they shall take off their garments in which they have ministered, leave them in the holy chambers, and put on other garments; and in their holy garments they shall not sanctify the people.
Bahnar: Mưh lu sư lĕch năm tơ cham gah 'nguaih, anih mă đei kon pơlei, lu sư athei plôh lê̆ hơbĕn ao mă lu sư hrŭk bơ̆jang, lê̆ tơ lăm pôm anih rơgoh păng hrŭk ao nai, wă kơ lu sư huay kơ pơm kơ kon pơlei rơgoh 'lơ̆ng yua kơ đơ̆ng hơbĕn ao 'bok soi lu sư.

English: “They shall neither shave their heads nor let their hair grow long, but they shall keep their hair well trimmed.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch păng lê̆ sŏk kơjung, mă-lei athei yuă sŏk lăp ai.

English: No priest shall drink wine when he enters the inner court.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei 'bok soi ayơ gơh et tơdrô kơplah mơ̆t tơ cham gah lăm.

English: They shall not take as wife a widow or a divorced woman, but take virgins of the descendants of the house of Israel, or widows of priests.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh iŏk akăn adro wă pơm akăn păng ưh kơ gơh iŏk drŏ-kăn mă klo sư achăng, mă-lei gơh iŏk drŏ-kăn hơlai hle 'lơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isơrael; mă-lei dah akăn adro lu 'bok soi sư kư̆m gơh iŏk.

English: “And they shall teach My people the difference between the holy and the unholy, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô bơtho khan kơ kon pơlei băt kơ tơdrong kiơ mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Păng tơdrong kiơ mă hmă đĕch, tơdrong kiơ 'mê̆-'mach păng băt tơdrong kiơ mă rơgoh.

English: In controversy they shall stand as judges, and judge it according to My judgments. They shall keep My laws and My statutes in all My appointed meetings, and they shall hallow My Sabbaths.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei tơdrong kiơ truh tơhil pơma băl lu sư gô sek tơlang kiơ̆ thoi Inh tơtă. Lu sư gô wei răk khôi juăt păng lu tơdrong juăt lăm tôm tơdrong kơ̆m giĕng Inh păng wei năr Sa'bat jing năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: “They shall not defile themselves by coming near a dead person. Only for father or mother, for son or daughter, for brother or unmarried sister may they defile themselves.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ bơngai lôch kơnh 'bơm tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach; mă-lei 'bok soi gô 'bơm tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ đơ̆ng jê̆ mĕ 'bă sư, hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn sư, 'nhŏng oh, dah mai, oh sư tam đei klo kăn kơplah lu sư lôch.

English: After he is cleansed, they shall count seven days for him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ ôp hơrao rơgoh, 'bok soi athei gô lăm tơpơh năr dơ̆ng.

English: And on the day that he goes to the sanctuary to minister in the sanctuary, he must offer his sin offering in the inner court,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă lu 'bok soi mơ̆t lăm cham gah lăm wă bơ̆jang tơ lăm anih rơgoh, sư athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch kơdih, Kră Yang khan.

English: “It shall be, in regard to their inheritance, that I am their inheritance. You shall give them no possession in Israel, for I am their possession.
Bahnar: 'Nâu pă đei lu mŭk tơmam 'măn lê̆ kơ lu 'bok soi. Lu iĕm ưh pă klah asong mŭk tơmam kơ lu sư đơ̆ng lăm Isơrael; Inh boih jing mŭk tơmam lu sư.

English: They shall eat the grain offering, the sin offering, and the trespass offering; every dedicated thing in Israel shall be theirs.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô sa lu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe ba, tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng tơdrong glăi; tơmam kiơ pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu bơngai Isơrael noh jing tơmam lu sư.

English: The best of all firstfruits of any kind, and every sacrifice of any kind from all your sacrifices, shall be the priest’s; also you shall give to the priest the first of your ground meal, to cause a blessing to rest on your house.
Bahnar: Lu plei 'long blŭng-a 'lơ̆ng hloh lăm tôm tơmam, lăm đĭ-đăng tơmam soi mă lu sư pơyơ̆r, noh gah lu 'bok soi ngăl. Lu iĕm kư̆m pơyơ̆r ăn kơ lu 'bok soi tơpŭng bơlah blŭng-a mă 'lơ̆ng hloh; wă kơ đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk pơdơh tơ hnam lu iĕm.

English: The priests shall not eat anything, bird or beast, that died naturally or was torn by wild beasts.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi ưh kơ gơh sa sem dơrong sem bri sem păr ayơ lôch kơmăp, dah mă đơ̆ng lu tơduă châu hek

English: “Moreover, when you divide the land by lot into inheritance, you shall set apart a district for the LORD, a holy section of the land; its length shall be twenty-five thousand cubits, and the width ten thousand. It shall be holy throughout its territory all around.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm hlang lang klah asong băl teh wă jang sa, athei klah lê̆ minh pah teh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang teh noh jing teh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lăm char. Tor sư 'bar-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu hơgăt păng wơ̆l 'bar-jĭt rơbâu hơgăt; đĭ-đăng lu teh âu jing teh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Of this there shall be a square plot for the sanctuary, five hundred by five hundred rods, with fifty cubits around it for an open space.
Bahnar: Lăm teh noh, lu iĕm iŏk lê̆ dơ'bŭng tor pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt, wơ̆l pơđăm-hrĕng hơgăt lê̆ kơ pơm anih hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; jum dăr teh noh kư̆m lê̆ trong pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt.

English: So this is the district you shall measure: twenty-five thousand cubits long and ten thousand wide; in it shall be the sanctuary, the Most Holy Place.
Bahnar: Lăm teh mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh noh, lu iĕm 'măn lê̆ pha tor sư dang 'bar-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu hơgăt păng wơ̆l mơjĭt-rơbâu hơgăt wă 'măn anih hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh jing anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh.

English: It shall be a holy section of the land, belonging to the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to the LORD; it shall be a place for their houses and a holy place for the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Noh boih anih teh 'măn lê̆ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ lu 'bok soi bơngai bơ̆jang lăm anih hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, lu bơngai năm jê̆ bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang. Noh anih mă lu sư pơm hnam oei păng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: An area twenty-five thousand cubits long and ten thousand wide shall belong to the Levites, the ministers of the temple; they shall have twenty chambers as a possession.
Bahnar: Minh pah nai lăm teh noh tor 'bar-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu hơgăt wơ̆l sư mơjĭt-rơbâu hơgăt, noh 'măn lê̆ kơ lu bơngai Lêwi, lu bơngai âu awih awăn lăm anih hnam akŭm teh noh lu sư pơm pơlei oei păng jang sa.

English: “You shall appoint as the property of the city an area five thousand cubits wide and twenty-five thousand long, adjacent to the district of the holy section; it shall belong to the whole house of Israel.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t cheng jê̆ teh noh, lu iĕm gô 'măn lê̆ teh wơ̆l sư pơđăm-rơbâu hơgăt păng tor sư 'bar-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu hơgăt; 'bơ̆t cheng jê̆ teh jang sa lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei tih, noh boih teh jang sa lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: “The prince shall have a section on one side and the other of the holy district and the city’s property; and bordering on the holy district and the city’s property, extending westward on the west side and eastward on the east side, the length shall be side by side with one of the tribal portions, from the west border to the east border.
Bahnar: Teh 'măn kơ yŏng pơgơ̆r, đei 'bar pah teh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng teh pơlei tih, 'moi pơtŏ kiơ̆ kơ teh anih rơgoh păng teh pơlei tih. Tor sư gah bơmơ̆t pơrok gah bơmơ̆t, gah hơlĕch pơrok tơ gah hơlĕch, tor sư kơjung đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t, gah hơlĕch pơrok gah hơlĕch tơ 'bar hơdral char Isơrael, sư tơtil rok teh asong kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch.

English: The land shall be his possession in Israel; and My princes shall no more oppress My people, but they shall give the rest of the land to the house of Israel, according to their tribes.”
Bahnar: Noh boih teh lu yŏng pơgơ̆r jang sa lăm char Isơrael; lu yŏng pơgơ̆r ưh pă pơjuă pơđep kon pơlei Inh dơ̆ng, mă-lei lu yŏng gô ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael oei tơ teh asong Kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Enough, O princes of Israel! Remove violence and plundering, execute justice and righteousness, and stop dispossessing My people,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r Isơrael, noh tôm boih! 'Nĕ pă pơm kơnê̆ păng pơjuă pơđep; pơm bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt; 'nĕ pă pơpuh kon pơlei Inh dơ̆ng, Kră Yang khan.

English: “You shall have honest scales, an honest ephah, and an honest bath.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei iŏk 'long kŏng tơpăt “Epha” trŏ, yua “pơnhan” hơtŏ hơnơ̆ng

English: The ephah and the bath shall be of the same measure, so that the bath contains one-tenth of a homer, and the ephah one-tenth of a homer; their measure shall be according to the homer.
Bahnar: Êpha păng pơnhan athei tŏ ăi, pơnhan mong minh lăm mơjĭt hômer păng êpha kư̆m minh lăm mơjĭt homer; homer noh wă kŏng pơtŏ hơnơ̆ng kơ 'bar tŏ.

English: The shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, and fifteen shekels shall be your mina.
Bahnar: Minh sêikơl dang 'bar-jĭt gêra; 'bar-jĭt sêikơl akŭm hăm 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sêikơl păng mơjĭt-pơđăm sêikơl, đei minh Mina.

English: “This is the offering which you shall offer: you shall give one-sixth of an ephah from a homer of wheat, and one-sixth of an ephah from a homer of barley.
Bahnar: Âu boih tơmam pơyơ̆r mă lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r: Rim minh hômer 'ba mi iŏk minh lăm tơdrâu êpha păng đơ̆ng rim hômer 'ba tơ'bâu, na klah iŏk minh lăm tơdrâu êpha.

English: The ordinance concerning oil, the bath of oil, is one-tenth of a bath from a kor. A kor is a homer or ten baths, for ten baths are a homer.
Bahnar: Gah tơmam pơyơ̆r lu rơmă minh lăm mơjĭt pơnhan đơ̆ng rim kơ “Kôrơ” đak rơmă, minh kôrơ dang mơjĭt pơnhan dah minh hômer, minh kư̆m dang mơjĭt pơnhan.

English: And one lamb shall be given from a flock of two hundred, from the rich pastures of Israel. These shall be for grain offerings, burnt offerings, and peace offerings, to make atonement for them,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng khŭl triu lăm anih 'nhĕt bluh arih 'lơ̆ng Isơrael, lăm 'bar-hrĕng tŏ triu gô iŏk minh wă pơm tơmam soi hăm phe 'ba păng tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê wă huai đơ̆ng yoch kơ kon pơlei, Kră Yang khan.

English: “All the people of the land shall give this offering for the prince in Israel.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm char gô ăn tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'nâu ăn kơ yŏng pơgơ̆r Isơrael.

English: Then it shall be the prince’s part to give burnt offerings, grain offerings, and drink offerings, at the feasts, the New Moons, the Sabbaths, and at all the appointed seasons of the house of Israel. He shall prepare the sin offering, the grain offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings to make atonement for the house of Israel.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei yŏng pơgơ̆r athei hơmet lu tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi phe 'ba păng tơmam sa et sa năr kơ̆m giĕng lăm khei blŭng-a năr Sa'bat, lăm rim năr kơ̆m giĕng et sa lu bơngai Isơrael. Sư athei pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, tơmam soi phe 'ba, tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê wă huai đơ̆ng yoch ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “In the first month, on the first day of the month, you shall take a young bull without blemish and cleanse the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Năr blŭng-a lăm khei mônh, ih iŏk minh pôm rơmo dăm ưh kơ đei rơka đơ̆ng lăm khŭl wă pơm rơgoh lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the doorposts of the temple, on the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and on the gateposts of the gate of the inner court.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk pham tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch na pik tơ lu jrăng hnam akŭm, tơ puăn pah mum jơ̆ng chơnang soi păng lu jrăng 'măng jang cham gah lăm.

English: And so you shall do on the seventh day of the month for everyone who has sinned unintentionally or in ignorance. Thus you shall make atonement for the temple.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơpơh lăm khei noh, ih kư̆m athei pơm tơdrong noh kơ lu bơngai pơm yoch hơch 'bơm dah yua kơ ưh kơ hlôh; thoi noh ih gô pơm rơgoh kơ hnam akŭm.

English: “In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you shall observe the Passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mơjĭt-puăn khei mônh, lu iĕm gô 'blŏk hơdơ̆r pơm Phĕt Năm Brih lăm tơpơh năr; lăm lu năr noh sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buh pông.

English: And on that day the prince shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, yŏng pơgơ̆r gô pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm huai đơ̆ng yoch sư kơdih păng kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm char.

English: On the seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to the LORD, seven bulls and seven rams without blemish, daily for seven days, and a kid of the goats daily for a sin offering.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr phĕt, rim năr lăm tơpơh năr noh; sư gô pơyơ̆r tơpơh tŏ rơmo dăm păng tơpơh tŏ kon triu 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ đei rơka wă pơm tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang; lăm tơpơh năr, rim năr minh pôm bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: And he shall prepare a grain offering of one ephah for each bull and one ephah for each ram, together with a hin of oil for each ephah.
Bahnar: Gah tơmam soi phe 'ba, kư̆ kơ rim minh pôm rơmo dăm sư pơyơ̆r minh êpha, rim kơ minh pôm triu tơno kư̆m pơyơ̆r minh êpha, gah rơmă minh “hin” lăm rim êpha.

English: “In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, at the feast, he shall do likewise for seven days, according to the sin offering, the burnt offering, the grain offering, and the oil.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei tơpơh pơm phĕt (pơm phĕt bơsŭn) lăm tơpơh năr, sư kư̆m pơyơ̆r hơmet lei-lăi thoi noh, kơ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi phe 'ba păng đak rơmă.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “The gateway of the inner court that faces toward the east shall be shut the six working days; but on the Sabbath it shall be opened, and on the day of the New Moon it shall be opened.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: 'Măng jang cham gah lăm, tơ gah hơlĕch, athei tang chĭt lê̆ lăm tơdrâu năr oei jang, mă-lei gô pơih lăm năr phĕt Sa'bat păng lăm năr phĕt Khei 'Nao.

English: The prince shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gateway from the outside, and stand by the gatepost. The priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings. He shall worship at the threshold of the gate. Then he shall go out, but the gate shall not be shut until evening.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r gô mơ̆t trong kơdeng, gah 'măng jang noh, sư gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t jrăng 'măng jang; kơplah noh lu 'bok soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi apinh hiôk-hian, na sư gô kơkuh drap 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng jang, đơ̆ng noh gô lĕch. 'Măng jang noh ưh pă tang dĭng truh tơ kơsơ̆ măng.

English: Likewise the people of the land shall worship at the entrance to this gateway before the LORD on the Sabbaths and the New Moons.
Bahnar: Lăm phĕt năr Sa'bat păng Khei 'Nao, kon pơlei lăm char noh gô drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'bơ̆t trong mơ̆t tơ 'măng jang noh.

English: The burnt offering that the prince offers to the LORD on the Sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish
Bahnar: Lu tơmam soi 'buh mă yŏng pơgơ̆r pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang lăm năr Sa'bat noh tơdrâu tŏ triu 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ jĭ rơka păng minh tŏ bơbe 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ jĭ rơka.

English: and the grain offering shall be one ephah for a ram, and the grain offering for the lambs, as much as he wants to give, as well as a hin of oil with every ephah.
Bahnar: Gah tơmam soi phe ba pơyơ̆r hăm bơbe tơno minh êpha minh pôm; tơmam pơyơ̆r kơpung phe 'ba hơdai hăm minh pôm triu mơ̆ng kơ đei; păng gah đak rơmă minh êpha pơyơ̆r minh hin.

English: On the day of the New Moon it shall be a young bull without blemish, six lambs, and a ram; they shall be without blemish.
Bahnar: Lăm phĕt năr Khei 'Nao, sư gô pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm ưh kơ đei jĭ rơka, tơdrâu tŏ kon triu kon păng minh triu tơno ưh kơ jĭ rơka.

English: He shall prepare a grain offering of an ephah for a bull, an ephah for a ram, as much as he wants to give for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every ephah.
Bahnar: Gah tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba minh êpha hơdai hăm rơmo dăm. Minh êpha pơyơ̆r hăm triu tơno, hăm kon triu kon mơ̆ng kơ đei, gah lu tơmam pơyơ̆r phe tơpŭng wă hrâu hăm lu đak rơmă rim êpha minh hin.

English: When the prince enters, he shall go in by way of the vestibule of the gateway, and go out the same way.
Bahnar: Mưh yŏng pơgơ̆r wă mơ̆t, sư rok trong kơdeng kơ 'măng jang păng lĕch kư̆m trong noh.

English: “But when the people of the land come before the LORD on the appointed feast days, whoever enters by way of the north gate to worship shall go out by way of the south gate; and whoever enters by way of the south gate shall go out by way of the north gate. He shall not return by way of the gate through which he came, but shall go out through the opposite gate.
Bahnar: Kơplah kon pơlei char noh wă mơ̆t 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lăm năr phĕt, bơngai bu mơ̆t kơkuh năm rok trong 'măng jang gah yă-nơ̆m, gô lĕch trong 'măng jang gah gơal; bơngai bu mơ̆t trong 'măng jang gah gơal gô lĕch trong 'măng jang gah yă-nơ̆m, ưh kơ đei bu gơh lĕch tơ trong đêl mơ̆t, mă-lei athei mơ̆t tơpăt tơklă anăp.

English: The prince shall then be in their midst. When they go in, he shall go in; and when they go out, he shall go out.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei. Tơdah lu kon pơlei mơ̆t sư kư̆m mơ̆t. Tơdah lu kon pơlei lĕch sư kư̆m lĕch hơdai.

English: At the festivals and the appointed feast days the grain offering shall be an ephah for a bull, an ephah for a ram, as much as he wants to give for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every ephah.
Bahnar: Lăm lu năr phĕt păng pơm giĕng tih, tơmam pơyơ̆r phe ba hơbĭ hăm rơmo dăm, minh êpha; minh êpha hăm kon triu tơno păng lu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe ba hăm lu triu kon mơ̆ng kơ đei, hơdai hăm đak rơmă rim minh êpha minh hin.

English: “Now when the prince makes a voluntary burnt offering or voluntary peace offering to the LORD, the gate that faces toward the east shall then be opened for him; and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings as he did on the Sabbath day. Then he shall go out, and after he goes out the gate shall be shut.
Bahnar: Mưh yŏng pơgơ̆r pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, jơhngơ̆m wă kơdih, dah tơmam soi apinh hiôk-hian, jơhngơ̆m wă kơdih ăn kơ Kră Yang, măng jang gah hơlĕch đe pơih kơ sư. Sư gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi apinh hiôk-hian thoi đei pơm lăm năr Sa'bat, na sư lĕch, mưh sư lĕch hlôi boih, 'măng jang đe gô tang lê̆ dơ̆ng.

English: “You shall daily make a burnt offering to the LORD of a lamb of the first year without blemish; you shall prepare it every morning.
Bahnar: Rim năr kiơ̆ pơgê, ih athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm triu kon, minh sơnăm ưh kơ đei jĭ rơka, pơm tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And you shall prepare a grain offering with it every morning, a sixth of an ephah, and a third of a hin of oil to moisten the fine flour. This grain offering is a perpetual ordinance, to be made regularly to the LORD.
Bahnar: Rim pơgê ih athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe ‘ba hơdai hăm tơmam soi noh, minh lăm tơdrâu êpha hăm minh lăm pêng hin đak rơmă wă bơlŭ hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba, wă pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang rim năr noh tơdrong juăt ling-lang hlong hloi.

English: Thus they shall prepare the lamb, the grain offering, and the oil, as a regular burnt offering every morning.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh rim pơgê, ih gô pơyơ̆r kon triu, tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng đak rơmă wă pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r, soi 'buh ling-lang.

English: ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “If the prince gives a gift of some of his inheritance to any of his sons, it shall belong to his sons; it is their possession by inheritance.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Tơdah yŏng pơgơ̆r iŏk minh tơmam sư ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo sư kơdih, tơmam noh jing tơmam kon drŏ-nglo sư, jing mŭk tơmam sư, noh jing tơmam sư iŏk yua đơ̆ng 'bă pơsư̆ ăn.

English: But if he gives a gift of some of his inheritance to one of his servants, it shall be his until the year of liberty, after which it shall return to the prince. But his inheritance shall belong to his sons; it shall become theirs.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah 'bok yŏng iŏk minh lăm tơmam noh na ăn kơ lu đĭch đam sư, tơmam noh jing tơmam kơ đĭch đam sư truh tơ sư rơngei; tơmam noh pơdrâu kơ yŏng noh. Dôm tơmam 'bok yŏng đei noh lăp ăn kơ lu kon sâu sư đĕch gơh iŏk.

English: Moreover the prince shall not take any of the people’s inheritance by evicting them from their property; he shall provide an inheritance for his sons from his own property, so that none of My people may be scattered from his property.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r ưh kơ gơh iŏk mŭk tơmam kiơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei, dah pơgŏ tơgar iŏk mŭk tơmam lu sư; sư gô iŏk tơmam sư kơdih na ăn kơ lu kon sâu wă bơ̆jang sa, thoi noh na kon pơlei Inh ưh kơ đei bu đe gơh tơgar iŏk mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng lu sư.

English: Now he brought me through the entrance, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers of the priests which face toward the north; and there a place was situated at their extreme western end.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư chông ba inh mơ̆t rok trong 'măng jang cheng, năm truh tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh gah yă-nơ̆m wă 'măn kơ lu 'bok soi; tơ noh đei minh anih tơ tuch-luch gah bơmơ̆t.

English: And he said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offering and the sin offering, and where they shall bake the grain offering, so that they do not bring them out into the outer court to sanctify the people.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “'Nâu anih lu 'bok soi hơtŭk 'nhĕm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng glăi păng soh tơmam soi phe ba wă huay kơ anhăk ba tơ cham gah 'nguaih kơnh hli pơm kơ kon pơlei jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.”

English: Then he brought me out into the outer court and caused me to pass by the four corners of the court; and in fact, in every corner of the court there was another court.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m chông ba inh tơ cham gah 'nguaih, chông inh năm tơ puăn pah mum cham; âu inh 'bôh tơ rim mum cham đei minh hlak cham nai.

English: In the four corners of the court were enclosed courts, forty cubits long and thirty wide; all four corners were the same size.
Bahnar: Tơ rim puăn pah mum cham, đei cham iĕ, tor kơjung puăn-jĭt hơgăt wơ̆l pêng-jĭt hơgăt; đĭ-đăng puăn hlak cham tơ puăn pah mum, să iĕ tor wơ̆l lei-lăi.

English: There was a row of building stones all around in them, all around the four of them; and cooking hearths were made under the rows of stones all around.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm lu cham noh đei tơnăr gŏch jum dăr păng jum dăr jơ̆ng tơnăr đei trôm pơm tơnuh anih wă pai.

English: And he said to me, “These are the kitchens where the ministers of the temple shall boil the sacrifices of the people.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: Âu boih hnam gŏ, anih lu bơngai bơ̆jang awih awăn lăm hnam akŭm pai hơtŭk lu tơmam soi đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơyơ̆r.”

English: Then he brought me back to the door of the temple; and there was water, flowing from under the threshold of the temple toward the east, for the front of the temple faced east; the water was flowing from under the right side of the temple, south of the altar.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh, sư chông ba inh wih dơ̆ng tơ ‘măng mơ̆t tơ anih hnam akŭm; na inh 'bôh đak ro đơ̆ng ala kơtơ̆n 'măng anih hnam akŭm, ro gah hơlĕch; yua kơ anăp hnam akŭm tơ gah hơlĕch, Đak đơ̆ng ala 'măng hnam akŭm gah gơal ro năm tơ gah gơal kơ chơnang soi.

English: He brought me out by way of the north gate, and led me around on the outside to the outer gateway that faces east; and there was water, running out on the right side.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh sư chông ba inh trong 'măng gah yă-nơ̆m, lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ cham; sư ba inh năm jum dăr gah 'nguaih truh tơ 'nguaih kơ 'măng gah hơlĕch; păng to đei đak ro đơ̆ng gah gơal kơ ‘măng noh.

English: And when the man went out to the east with the line in his hand, he measured one thousand cubits, and he brought me through the waters; the water came up to my ankles.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh năm rok gah hơlĕch ti sư chĕp ba minh tơlei pơtŏ păng pơtŏ đei minh-rơbâu hơgăt, sư chông ba inh tŏk kơ đak tŏk dang kiơ̆ plei kĕnh.

English: Again he measured one thousand and brought me through the waters; the water came up to my knees. Again he measured one thousand and brought me through; the water came up to my waist.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh pơtŏ minh-rơbâu hơgăt dơ̆ng, na chông inh tŏk kơ đak, đak jrŭ dang kŭl-tăng; sư đei pơtŏ minh-rơbâu hơgăt dơ̆ng na chông ba inh tŏk kơ đak, đak jrŭ tôch kiơ̆ kơiĕng.

English: Again he measured one thousand, and it was a river that I could not cross; for the water was too deep, water in which one must swim, a river that could not be crossed.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh sư pơtŏ dơ̆ng minh-rơbâu hơgăt; tơ âu jơ̆ đak tih jing krong boih, inh ưh pă gơh tŏk boih, yua kơ đak krong tŏk; đak jrŭ athei glơi, ưh pă gơh tŏk hlôi boih.

English: He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?” Then he brought me and returned me to the bank of the river.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh sư khan kơ inh: “Ơ, kon bơngai, ih hăm 'bôh ưh? Sư chông ba inh wơ̆t 'bơ̆t đak krong.

English: When I returned, there, along the bank of the river, were very many trees on one side and the other.
Bahnar: Lăp inh wih truh 'bơ̆t đak krong boih, inh 'bôh 'bar pah kơ đak krong đei 'long lơ.

English: Then he said to me: “This water flows toward the eastern region, goes down into the valley, and enters the sea. When it reaches the sea, its waters are healed.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Đak krong âu ro tơpăt tơ gah hơlĕch, truh tơ tơring Araba, ro mơ̆t tơ đak dơsĭ, mưh ro truh tơ đak dơsĭ boih đak dơsĭ noh gô hlăng 'lơ̆ng.

English: And it shall be that every living thing that moves, wherever the rivers go, will live. There will be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters go there; for they will be healed, and everything will live wherever the river goes.
Bahnar: Đak krong ro truh tơ yơ, lu kon sem, hơdrông kơep lep-ler đei arih tơ noh. Gô đei lơ lu ka lăp đak krong ro truh tơ noh na đak gô hlăng 'lơ̆ng; đak krong 'nâu ro truh tơ yơ lu sem brem tơ noh gô arih.

English: It shall be that fishermen will stand by it from En Gedi to En Eglaim; they will be places for spreading their nets. Their fish will be of the same kinds as the fish of the Great Sea, exceedingly many.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai traih ka gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t jih krong; đơ̆ng pơlei Êngêđi truh tơ Ên Eglaim đei anih wă dăng hơnhuăl; tơ noh đei lơ ka tôm kơ adrĕch ka kư̆m thoi lăm đak Dơsĭ Tih.

English: But its swamps and marshes will not be healed; they will be given over to salt.
Bahnar: Đak lăm lu Dơnâu hlŭt tơ noh ưh pă hlăng 'ngam, mă-lei 'măn kơ pơm 'boh.

English: Along the bank of the river, on this side and that, will grow all kinds of trees used for food; their leaves will not wither, and their fruit will not fail. They will bear fruit every month, because their water flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be for food, and their leaves for medicine.”
Bahnar: Tơ tơter jih đak krong 'bar pah đe pơtăm tôm kơ lu 'long plei sa, lu hla ưh kơ hơlŭng, lu 'long đei plei hơnơ̆ng, rim khei đei pơkao plei 'lơ̆ng yua kơ đei đak ro lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm. Plei wă pơm tơmam sa păng yua wă pơm pơgang.”

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “These are the borders by which you shall divide the land as an inheritance among the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph shall have two portions.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Âu jing hơdral wă kơ lu iĕm klah asong teh jang sa kơ mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch Isơrael. Asong kơ Jôsep 'bar lăm noh.

English: You shall inherit it equally with one another; for I raised My hand in an oath to give it to your fathers, and this land shall fall to you as your inheritance.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu gô klah asong dih băl teh wă jang sa lei-lăi băl; yua kơ Inh đei pơkă boih gô ăn teh char âu kơ 'bok yă lu iĕm, na teh âu lu iĕm gô iŏk wă jang sa.

English: “This shall be the border of the land on the north: from the Great Sea, by the road to Hethlon, as one goes to Zedad
Bahnar: Âu jing hơdral teh: Gah yă-nơ̆m, đơ̆ng Đak Dơsĭ Tih, rok rong pơlei Hêtlôn truh trong năm truh tơ pơlei Sêdat

English: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim (which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath), to Hazar Hatticon (which is on the border of Hauran).
Bahnar: pơlei Hơmat, Bêrôha păng Sibraim, 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk hơdral sơlam pơlei Đamas păng Hamat, truh tơ pơlei Haser Hathikôn truh tơ hơdral Hauran.

English: Thus the boundary shall be from the Sea to Hazar Enan, the border of Damascus; and as for the north, northward, it is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.
Bahnar: Thoi noh hơdral iŏk đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ truh tơ Hasar Ênon, 'bơ̆t hơdral pơlei Đamas gah yă-nơ̆m iŏk đơ̆ng hơdral pơlei Hamat năm tơ gah yă-nơ̆m noh boih hơdral gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: “On the east side you shall mark out the border from between Hauran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel, along the Jordan, and along the eastern side of the sea. This is the east side.
Bahnar: 'Nâu gah hơlĕch iŏk đơ̆ng sơlam Hauran păng pơlei Đamas 'moi rok đak Krong Jôrđăn tŏk-bŏk pơlei Gileat păng teh đak Isơrael, lĕch tơ đak dơsĭ gah hơlĕch, tôch tơ Tamar; noh boih hơdral gah hơlĕch.

English: “The south side, toward the South, shall be from Tamar to the waters of Meribah by Kadesh, along the brook to the Great Sea. This is the south side, toward the South.
Bahnar: Gah gơal iŏk đơ̆ng Thamar truh tơ lu Đak Mêriba tơ Kades, rok Thong đak Êyiptơ, truh tơ đak Dơsĭ Tih; noh boih hơdral gah gơal.

English: “The west side shall be the Great Sea, from the southern boundary until one comes to a point opposite Hamath. This is the west side.
Bahnar: Gah bơmơ̆t, rok tơter Đak Dơsĭ Tih, noh hơdral dĭng truh tơ trong năm gah hơlĕch tơ pơlei Lebô Hamat; noh boih hơdral gah bơmơ̆t.

English: “Thus you shall divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.
Bahnar: Lei na lu iĕm klah asong băl teh âu, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl adrĕch bơngai Isơrael.

English: It shall be that you will divide it by lot as an inheritance for yourselves, and for the strangers who dwell among you and who bear children among you. They shall be to you as native-born among the children of Israel; they shall have an inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei hlang lăng klah asong teh âu wă jang sa, ăn kơ lu iĕm păng ăn kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai lu iĕm păng pơjing lu kon sâu tơ lăm lu iĕm. Lu iĕm kư̆m lăng lu sư thoi adrĕch kon sâu Isơrael. Lu sư kư̆m dai gơh đei asong teh jang sa thoi lu iĕm mă oei hơdai lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael.

English: And it shall be that in whatever tribe the stranger dwells, there you shall give him his inheritance,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơmoi oei hơdai lăm adrĕch ayơ, lu iĕm gô ăn kơ lu sư teh wă jang sa hơdai tơ lăm noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Now these are the names of the tribes: From the northern border along the road to Hethlon at the entrance of Hamath, to Hazar Enan, the border of Damascus northward, in the direction of Hamath, there shall be one section for Dan from its east to its west side
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu adrĕch: Teh asong kơ Đan đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m 'moi rok trong pơlei Hêtlôn truh tơ trong mơ̆t tơ pơlei Lêbô Hamat păng Hasar Ênon, dĭng 'bơ̆t hơdral pơlei Đamas tơ gah yă-nơ̆m tơ bưh kơ pơlei Hamat, hơdral gah gơal teh asong kơ Đan đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch truh tơ gah bơmơ̆t kơ dêh char Isơrael.

English: by the border of Dan, from the east side to the west, one section for Asher
Bahnar: 'Moi rok teh asong kơ Đan, đơ̆ng hơdral gah hơlĕch truh tơ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t, noh teh asong kơ Aser.

English: by the border of Asher, from the east side to the west, one section for Naphtali
Bahnar: 'Moi rok teh asong kơ Ase, đơ̆ng hơdral gah hơlĕch truh tơ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t, noh teh asong kơ Neptali.

English: by the border of Naphtali, from the east side to the west, one section for Manasseh
Bahnar: 'Moi rok teh asong kơ Neptali, đơ̆ng hơdral gah hơlĕch truh tơ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t, noh teh asong kơ Manase.

English: by the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west, one section for Ephraim
Bahnar: 'Moi rok teh asong kơ Manase, đơ̆ng hơdral gah hơlĕch truh tơ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t, noh teh asong kơ Êphraim.

English: by the border of Ephraim, from the east side to the west, one section for Reuben
Bahnar: 'Moi rok teh asong kơ Êphraim, đơ̆ng hơdral gah hơlĕch truh tơ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t, noh teh asong kơ Rubên.

English: by the border of Reuben, from the east side to the west, one section for Judah
Bahnar: 'Moi rok teh asong kơ Rubên, đơ̆ng hơdral gah hơlĕch truh tơ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t, noh teh asong kơ Juđa.

English: by the border of Judah, from the east side to the west, shall be the district which you shall set apart, twenty-five thousand cubits in width, and in length the same as one of the other portions, from the east side to the west, with the sanctuary in the center.
